Got this phone about five days now,did not want to make a review until i played with it a bit. I must say, if i loved this phone anymore i would have to leave my wife and marry it...well joking there a bit, lol, buy i do love it. Only reason i gave it four stars is some minor things, like the flimsy looking charger cable, looks real tiny as if it will soon break and the white headset for a black phone. My last phone was the bb 9860, got this instead as i wanted a dual sim with android and led flash and been able to work as a remote for my smart tv, so far i love it and would buy another if anything happened to it. It does take a little time to get used to and if you are impatient you may not like it at first as it has so many features and different ways of doing things. Great phone. Ok, have this phone for little over two weeks and not liking it that much again for the following reasons(good thing i did not leave my wife LOL), (1) It is not the kind of dual sim i am used to, it is dual sim STANDBY and not dual sim ACTIVE as was with the lg ks660 that i used previously. The difference is that with st/by both sims are on st/by waiting for a call, once a call is active the other sim is inactive (well not entirely), will explain. With dual sim active both sims are always active and works as if two phones are in one. This is really what i wanted. Now to explain the above, this phone tries to remedy the situation by using call forwarding (a paid service on my network)so it has an option for dual sim always on, this option attempts to enable call forwarding for both sims and if it fails (as in my case) then even if i would pay for forwarding,i can not have both sims active at once. In my case forwarding fails because both sims have group calling service on them. Most dissapointed as this is one of the primary reasons for buying this phone. (2) Phone can be a bit slow, but i am used to the ks660 LOL. (3) If i looked up a contact there is no way to use the secondary sim to call from the contact list so i have to use dial pad where the option is, this is so not good. I would give the phone a two star for the above but the other features are great (well it's android) hence the new rating of three stars. So here i go again, off to sell this phone for what i can get and once again start a lengthy search for the dual sim ACTIVE android that i need. Soooo not a happy camper.I bought the phone as new but I sent it to Venezuela where it did not work because the phone was defective. As the phone does not have warranty bring it to a technician who informed me that the phone is remanufactured. I really feel cheated.I got really excited when I get this phone, it looked cool and sleek... BUT, guess what, it was locked and the default language on this phone was some type of Polish, Russian or some weird East European Language. This made me believe that this phone was stolen by a clerk working for a Russian T-Mobile service provider or some East European National Wireless provider... anyway, I figured out to switch it back to English, to my dismay, the phone is LOCKED and can NOT work on US service providers. ... so I called my provider (T-Mobile) hoping to get help... after 30 minutes of being on-hold, the T-Mobile folks did not recognize the iemei number on the phone (it's Russian); and could not help me. They suggested that I call Samsung. 45 minutes of wait, someone sends me to an online web site where they have instructions to download a bunch of software. I follow the instruction, I plug the phone onto a USB connector, then download various files, pay $19.95 to European SIM unlocking services, then another $14.95 to make it work on US providers, then I paid $4.95 to make sure that the phone is NOT black-listed... I still can't make it work. I wasted about 8 hours on this piece of junk. I am returning it... don't make the same mistake if you are a busy person and value your time. I am highly disappointed.I could not disagree more with the previous reviewer. It sounds more to me like he sucks at the skill that typing on a phone requires, probably not patient enough or has pretty big fingers. It has been a joy for me to use for the last month of having it. I am coming from a Black berry and this has been vastly superior. The touch screen is not only very responsive but you have the built in option of just sliding your fingers from one letter to the other to type which makes if much more effortless than the typical input method and i didn't have to download an app to do taht. Its feature rich and beautiful to hold and look at. Matter of fact just about every one who has seen me with it and played around with it wants one. If you are looking for a dual sim, go no further but even if you are just looking for a single sim its def worth the buy. There is one serious down side but I would still have bought it when I think of all the others pluses - the HSPDA is only a mere 7mbps. Way way too small for a phone of this price and design. The other downers like battery capacity is pretty typical for these smartphones so I won't discredit this model for it but it's really drains too fast no matter how I try to save power. Overall a def 4 stars for me.thank you very much i love this product i recommended a 100% to everyone need a dual sim mobile ( work very well in venezuela)battery lasts roughly 35-40hrs with over 10hrs of talk time, great camera, sensitive touch screen, might need just a tad bit more processing powerThe Samsung GT-S7562L Galaxy S Duos-BK is very good, it has nothing to envy to any other Android Smartphone ... Serves completely for any operator, is unlocked, as stated in the description ... buy it for my father and conforms to the product ... thank you very much... sorry for my englishThe TouchWiz UI is, as usual, a slow and convoluted mess. Stock Android, while not as smooth an experience as iOS, is light years ahead of TouchWiz. What Samsung does to Google's baby could arguably be called abuse. And because Samsung will not allow stock Android on its devices, users are stuck waiting for them to implement TouchWiz on new versions of Android. Unfortunately, this means that the S Duos is stuck now and possibly forever, on Ice Cream Sandwich 4.0.4. Nevermind that KitKat 4.4 could run on the S Duos; because Samsung hasn't said yes, it won't happen. Is this what an open computing platform is supposed to be? It is possible, however, to install CM 10.1 on this handset. The downside to that is you lose dual-SIM functionality, this handset's distinguishing feature. Dual SIM support is not native to Android and its implementation is up to the manufacturer and Samsung (and LG, Sony, etc) aren't giving up their secrets. The hardware side of the S Duos isn't any better. The TFT screen is nicely saturated, but even at 50% brightness, blacks are washed out and gray. The TFT panel doesn't have very good viewing angles, either. The digitizer is, in my experience, extremely finicky: swipes register as taps and apps are launched without warning because the air somehow managed to trigger a tap. I could be holding the S Duos in hand with no fingers or palm within a centimeter of the screen and an app could launch. Touch input also suffers because this handset is extremely prone to lag. The single-core, 1GHz Cortex A5 CPU and Andreno 205 GPU do not perform well at all. If you expect to use only stock Samsung (not Google!) apps on this handset, you might be fine and experience little lag. Otherwise, prepare to have even the keyboard app stutter due to lag. Build quality is likewise shoddy. The phone is all plastic. That is to be expected at this segment, but where LG and Sony have similar handsets that feel like premium devices, the S Duos feels cheap. It also looks cheap. After about a month of use, the paint on the gray plastic that makes up the side of the device is white in spots. The USB port is likewise spotted. That's right, Samsung couldn't even be bothered to use colored plastic, instead opting to paint white plastic. The battery is a 1500mAh unit. If you are a heavy user of things like the stock SMS app, expect to run down the battery at around the 8-hour mark. Nevermind streaming movies over 3G or taking pictures all day. Really, don't bother taking pictures because the 2GB of onboard storage means that after the OS and Samsung's bloatware, users really only have access to less than half that amount. Even after all that complaining, I can find one other terrible thing about the S Duos: it powers down randomly. Whether in my pocket, in my hand, or on a table, sometimes the S Duos will just power down completely. It turns itself off, even when in the middle of audio playback. As soon as I am able, I will replace this piece of garbage phone. I have my eye on an LG Optimus L7 II Dual, Sony Xperia M dual, or Sony Xperia C. Needing dual-SIM support means I am effectively stuck in the midrange of Android devices, and that's fine with me. I just wish I hadn't wasted nearly $200 on this terrible phone and Samsung has definitely lost a customer in me.the reason i choose this rating it's because i order two phones samsung duos both white color and not only one of the phones came in a different color; the other phone came with the menu button loose or damaged, needless to say why i choose this rate and then i called the seller to let them know about it, they told me that i should send the phone back first and then they would refund my money, so i definitely would NOT recommend this seller under any circumstances.Regrettably, it's a cheaply made and engineered phone. No class, no taste, just cheap feel. Besides, Samsung USA does not provide support for this product. Really! Just sent it back! My daughter is using it so I cant comment on technical aspects of phoneI was very excited to get this phone, as I had been dealing with the heartbreak of a Windows 8 phone for many months. I should have paid more attention to the fact that the majority of posted reviews were out of India, and I had never even heard of this model. It doesn't seem to be used in the US much at all. The phone is slow and buggy, takes several seconds for the screen to turn on or off, and it beeps every 3 minutes while charging (I've timed it). It takes several seconds before processing anything, from sending a text message to opening Facebook. As Louis CK said, yes, we should be astonished and amazed at the fact that we can speak to somebody across the country and access data from around the world (so how dare I complain that it takes a few seconds), but when spending a good chunk of money, these issues are mostly non existent in comparable products. It will much better.I have had this phone for a few days now because I wanted to test it out before writing a review. First of all, what I wanted out of a smartphone was not a whole lot; good call quality, texting, internet (wifi), and access to my email account. Secondly, I wanted an unlocked phone that was $200 or less. So having said that, Pros: - Good size, light, and attractive - Screen is very responsive and almost too sensitive sometimes, easy to scroll and web-browse - Easy to use - Runs android - Can use two SIM cards (you do have to choose which card is active, but since I'm only using one SIM its not a problem) - It DOES work in the US (and with T-mobile) (Some people were saying it wouldn't accept T-mobile carrier and that it wouldn't work in the States; seems to be working fine) - It is unlocked - It was $160, which meant that this phone + case + screen protector + micro SD card is still cheaper than most unlocked phones. - Good camera - It was NEW - Long battery life, especially with the power saving option - The first thing the phone does is ask you what language you prefer and ENGLISH is one of those as well as many other languages (I saw a lot of complaints about it being in a foreign language) - Good phone quality, can hear everything clearly Cons: - The phone has very little memory (2GB only) so if you want to download a lot of apps, the phone will become super slow, however, you can use a micro SD card to increase memory and store photos/videos. - It is not the fastest processor, if you are switching quickly through multiple apps or web pages, it does take a second or two to load. This does not bother me that much, but if you need to use the phone for multiple things at all times, I'd consider a more powerful phone.The battery life, and front cam is very poor. skype nois I do not recomend any one to buy this productI hate everything about this phone. it hangs every second and takes long to get on..... i advise not to use itIt's working nicely. After 6+ months of use here are our findings: Pros: 1. Has all the major functions of a Samsung phone: great camera with flash, easy setup for email client, loud ringing volume. 2. Large screen with large numbers for dialing. 3. Came unlocked as advertised with no scratches, nicks or dents- was brand new in the plastic with all accessories and manual. Cons: 1. It is Dual SIM Standby NOT Dual SIM Active- we found this out the hard way when customers started complaining about not getting us, not even voice mail. The settings function by forwarding the calls of the inactive SIM to the active SIM. This may incur carrier charges for some persons. The alternative to this is to deactivate the call forwarding by going to the settings and deactivating &#34;Dual SIM always on&#34; and selecting one SIM card to act as the primary SIM while the other acts as the data SIM. This is a waste if you are using two different carriers to minimize on off-network calls (as in our case). 2. The processor is EXTREMELY slow. It freezes when you try to hang up from calls or even when searching your contact list. Don't expect it to save you when those 2 seconds count. 3. The phone automatically designates the SIM not in use as on standby. If this is not remedied, it will send calls to voicemail or will not give the caller a response. These are what we have noticed thus far. I gave it three stars (and not two) because it still functions somewhat with the two SIM cards even though it's not the way we would have liked it. BUY AT YOUR OWN RISK.Not phone I ordered. I want to return it and get my money back, or the correct phone be sent me, the S-4 is what I ordered. Thanks, GARY D. The phone itself is a solid phone, I had to get it to replace my older LG Dynamic. I wanted a phone with a larger pixel dimensions (Bigger screen) and a something faster. That is exactly what I got. Now, however, if you do not have a Sims Card, you will need to buy one. I needed to buy one because the LG Dynamic -As far as I know- does not have a place to use a Sims, and while I am on Straight Talk I had to order a Sims. The only thing that bothers me would be the fact that I have no idea if a T-moblie or AT&T Sims card will still work if I am using Straight Talk. If your phone is running slow, this is what you NEED TO DO. Uninstall all the apps that you will not use (The apps that came with the phone that are not installed on the ROM). Go over to your Google Play store and go to Settings, TURN OFF automatic updates. --Now something I would do, but you don't really have too-- Root your phone and install Titanium Backup. back up all apps that are on the phone And remove apps you will not use from the ROM...Like ChatOn. All and all, I really needed to leave a feedback message on this item because I was not really liking the mixed reviews. Also, if you plan on reading all of the reviews, and you live in the US or Canada, disregard any comment made about Venezuela. But dont buy these phones .Useful Interesting Features of Galaxy Note 2, rather than the common features.First to mention, before buying this Beast: Galaxy Note 2, i had read a lot of reviews here in Flipkart on this mobile, but Max of them were on the common features that almost everyone knows from like the: 
 
-5.5 screen 
-Quad-Core 
-2GB RAM 
-Super AMOLED capacitive Touchscreen 
-16GB Internal 
-64GB External Expandable 
-Camera: 8MP(Main), 1.9(Front) 
-NFC 
-OS: Android Jelly Bean 
-GPU: Mail-400MP 
-Stylus Pen 
 
Yes, i agree, these are the Excellent Features which other phones cannot compete easily, 
BUT, there are loads of other interesting stuffs that any TECH SAVY person will like a lot!!! 
 
After buying this Galaxy Note 2 last week, i had been trying to figure out the extra features that this beast offers in excess to the mentioned above ones. 
Some of them are as follows: 
 
-First of all, the most attractive feature that i really liked was the Motion Sensor Capabilities that this beast is offering. 
Let me note down some of them as tested by me: 
 
1) To unlock the device with motion, tap and hold a point on the screen, and then tilt the device forwards. 
2) When you pick up the device after it has been idle for some time or when the screen has turned off, it vibrates if you have missed calls or new messages. 
3) While viewing a call, a message, or contact details on the phone screen, simply pick up and hold the device to your ear to make a call to that number. 
4) Tap and hold an item on the screen, and then move the device to the left or right to move the item to another panel on the Home screen or the Applications screen in that direction. 
5) When an image is zoomed in, tap and hold a point on the screen, and then move the device in any direction to browse the image. 
6) While you are cheking mails or contacts in a page and you reach the middle or the last of the list, simply Double-tap the device to move to the top of a list of contacts or emails. 
7) While the screen is locked, tap and hold the screen, and then rotate the device to landscape orientation to launch the camera. 
8) Turn over the device(making it lie down with back-side up) to mute ringtone, pause media playback, or mute the FM radio. 
9) Shake the device to search for Bluetooth devices. 
10) Shake the device to update the list of emails or information from Yahoo News, Yahoo Finance etc. 
11) Sweep your hand sideways across the screen from right to left to capture a screenshot. 
12) Cover the screen with a palm to pause media playback. Move it away from the screen to resume. 
13) Tap and hold two points on the screen, and then tilt the device back and forth to zoom in or out. 
14) When the touch screen is turned off, move your hand across the Proximity/Light sensor to 
turn on the screen lightly and view the number of missed calls and new messages, the battery 
power level, and more. 
 
The above are the special features that this phone provides in respect to various motions. 
 
- Secondly, like the Galaxy S3, it has the Smart Stay, which enables the phone to keep the screen on as long as you are looking at it. 
When you close your eyes or move away from looking into the screen, the Phone screen will automatically turn off. 
 
- Thirdly, with the Quad-core processor and 2GB RAM, Gamers will really love this phone since some VERY HIGH RESOLUTION GAMES are just running with not a single point of lag in this phone. 
 
- Fourthly, You would luv to watch videos in this phone due to itz big screen and the very good quality videos running smoothly. 
 
- Fifthly, Music quality is really very good and descent. Radio works perfect. 
 
- Sixthly, SAR (Specific Absorption Rate) Level is relatively low(The lower the Better) for the Samsung Galaxy Note 2 in comparision to other phones: 
 
Galaxy Note 2: 0.171 W/kg 
Galaxy Note: 0.39 W/kg 
Galaxy S3:  0.342 W/kg 
Galaxy S2:  0.338 W/kg 
iPhone 4S:  0.98 W/kg 
iPhone 5:  0.951 W/kg 
HTC One X:  0.909 W/kg 
 
Apart from the above mentioned features: 
- I have not tested with the camera yet since i already have a Digital Camera. 
But as read from reviews, the camera is quite good in its capabilities, with 1.9 front camera is just great. 
 
- Also not tested with the full capability of the Stylus Pen, since it has loads of functionalities that has to be checked in details :-) 
 
So simply after examining withlots of such exciting features, it simply stands out tall in the market.Fan'tab'ulous Beast !!!.hey guys,i got my beauty 2 days back &amp; believe me i am totally in love with this gorgeous. Here are some simple things about this proposal for purchase: 
 
Behavioural: 
 
1) If you are someone earning less than 75k a month (post tax), then you will end up regretting spending money on a small device (forget capabilities), sooner or later on. I don't fall in this category. 
2) If you are a female, it'll slip from your hands often (no offense, you got smaller hands). I'm a male. 
3) If you are in the habit of taking out your phone while travelling on bike, please resist buying - it can't take a 4 foot fall on tarmac. 
4) If you are past 40, get a blackberry or iphone- this is meant for younger ones who can explore the apps world (Im 29). 
5) You cannot go back to smaller screens once you get used to this - it sucks using smaller phones after you use this beast. 
 
Usage:Buy this phone if you are in the habit of, with your existing phone, and you would be sure of continuing the following activities even after 2 months of purchase: 
 
1) Watching 1080 movies while travelling 
2) Love outdoor photography, and is aware of the fact that all mobile phones suck when it comes to indoor pictures. 
3) Use phone extensively for music 
4) Install high capacity (&gt;2GB) games like NFS 
5) Use viber and whatsapp very frequently 
6) Sync google+, gmail etc 
7) Find excitement in getting new apps and trying them out 
8) Last but not the least, want people to look at you when you hold this in your palm 
 
Let me tell you my experience: I do all the activities above: the phones great because 
 
1) Excellent, if not the best display in the industry 
2) Good connectivity (call &amp; 3G) at all times 
3) Great battery 
4) Stylus is amazing, though I didn't detail it above.

For me the bigger the better.The perfect size for EVERYTHING.The one thing a lot of people have against Samsung's Note series is its massive size. So lets just deal with that first and get it over with. 
 
Yes, the Note 2 is pretty huge by conventional smartphone standards. It fits in most pockets, but not without its presence being felt. If you aren't comfortable with that, then seriously don't waste anymore time on this page. 
 
Now, coming to the good part of the Note 2: 
 
* The massive screen with its pleasant 720p resolution makes this an excellent portable movie watcher - don't forget its any-format and any-codec support. 
 
* Typing portrait on the Note 2 is truly for the first time in touch phone history a boon. The large screen allows for a comfortable keyboard. 
 
* The monstrous 3100 mAh battery will easily last you a day even with heavy usage - and frankly, isn't that the most we expect from today's smartphones? 
 
* Again, owing to the screen - web browsing is super fun. 
 
* Samsung's customizations run pretty deep in the UI - Nature UX is pleasantly more mature than anime-ish TouchWiz UI. 
 
In conclusion, if you're looking for a tablet-ish experience with a phone-ish portability, this lovechild of those two is your next gadget!Very good phone.My primary requirement was a big screen phone, screen size just enough, about 5.8 inches. 5 star for NOTE II... Actual price is 27,500... he he... dnt play FLIPKART....Amazingly Unbelievable.I have been using this phone since past week and let me admit that the experience has been unbelievable. It is one hell of a dream gadget to own. I will not go into technical specifications as it is already there on many sites and will directly focus on user experience. Let's talk about it's size. For some it might be too big but it's 5.5&quot; Super Amoled Screen is it's USP. Display is crystal clear and viewing web pages, images and watching movies is a flawless experience. Jelly Bean makes the phone super slick, fast and there is almost no visible lag. Transition of pages is buttery smooth. Syncing of accounts is as easy as it can get, hassle free. Quality of music in earphone is awesome but for that you need to get a good quality headphone. Sound output in loudspeaker is loud and clear. Images captured by the camera is beautiful with plethora of settings and customization options.It is at par with the best out there in the market. You will hardly need your digi cam. Video Recording is equally good. Wi Fi, Blue Tooth, 3G are all amazingly fast. Chrome browser is a treat to use. I have hardly opened my laptop ever since I bought my Note II. S pen has handy productivity features and makes life quite easy. Taking notes, drawing sketches are fun. And what about battery back up? With a 5.5 &quot; super Amoled Screen you would expect battery to die soon. But surprise!!! Battery back up is mammoth. With single charge phone easily lasted for 18-20 hours while wi fi ws continuously on watching youTube, browsing net, checking mails, listening music. I don't think any phone currently in the market have such a huge battery back up. Galaxy Note II is a pure charm to use. Though it has a few cons but those are virtually negligible.You can't go wrong with this one, even today..I bought this phone about 7 months ago. I waited so long before I writing this review to make sure that no one is mislead by me. 
 
1. First question that will come to your mind is- 'Is it outdated' 
My answer is, no. Smartphone market has almost reached a saturation point where there is no further need for better configuration or displays or other features. It runs a quad core A9 processor which is sufficiently fast, has lots of RAM (2 GB) and a HD 720p display. However GPU is in fact outdated but you can still play all the games currently available. 
 
2. Some people say that most Android phones cause problems after about 6 months of usage like lags, freezes, shut downs or sluggishness. 
It's partially true. Depends on how you handle your device. I have not expected any random shutdowns in 200+ days of usage. It froze two or three times but that was due to applications and not the device itself. It slows down sometimes under heavy usage when I'm about to run out of memory but that happens rarely. 
 
Now we get to my experience with the device. 
 
1. Performance- The quad core processor does its job beautifully. Everything is way faster than my previous device. (Sony Xperia Ray) Browsing the web, zooming in or out, using maps, playing games, switching applications everything is lag free. When I compared Asphalt 8 running in my device to a Canvas 4 which is relatively newer device, it was running much smoother. 
 
2. Multitasking- This phone was built for multitasking. It has got 2 GB of RAM out of which you get about 1.75 GB. It is just about impossible to run out of memory unless you try hard to test its capabilities. 45 applications are always open and I opened 35 more that's total of 80 before I reached 90%. of total memory. 
Also, you get multi-window and pop-up play which can be useful at time. 
 
3. Display, browsing, videos- There is no pixelation and screen looks beautiful even at minimum brightness. It has got deep blacks and saturated colors which I personally prefer. 
Web browsing experience is just awesome. Page rendering is too good and everything like scrolling, zooming, switching tabs is smooth. You can switch to desktop mode to view a fully functional desktop site. If you browse web a lot or read ebooks, this device is perfect for you. Text is sharp and there is high contrast. 
Sunlight legibility is good but the display is a bit reflective. Viewing angles are great too. 
Video player supports every codec and you don't need MX player to do the job. 
 
4. Camera and battery life- Both front and rear cameras have great quality. I was surprised by the front camera, to tell the truth. I am not saying it's the best, but definitely a good one. Video recording is phenomenal and there are bunch of features and modes which I am not interested in but you might be. 
It has a chunky 3100 mAh battery which lasts two days on moderate usage while others struggle through the day. Here is a sample heavy usage pattern on a sunday- 
Unplugged at 11 AM, 100% 
Browsing and whatsapp, down to 80% by 3 PM. 
Playing moderate and heavy games in the evening. Down to 63% by 6 PM 
Texting, chatting and browsing, using S-Note, listening to music and calls at night and it's 15% by 3 AM the next day. 
Finally gave up around 1 PM the next day with screen-on time of 7 hours 15 minutes which is awesome compared to most device which give 4.5 to 5 hours. 
This is after 7 months of usage which must have affected the battery! 
 
5. Android 4.3- It runs 4.3 buttery smooth after bug fixes (which Samsung released soon enough) which shows how capable this device is. We will get 4.4 in April 2014 according to Samsung. 
 
What do you usually look for- Battery, camera, performance, looks, display, user experience. It has got it all, that too for a reasonable price of about 27-28k while current flagships are selling at 10k more, which is a lot. 
 
Downsides- 
1. No built in flash support although you can run youtube videos right in the webpage which is cool.. 
2. Can be difficult to handle sometimes but most of the times, it's fine. Fits in my almost every pocket even front pocket of my jacket. 
3. Weighs 183 grams. Most weight is due to the huge battery. 
 
4. Might not be able to run games that will be released after a year or so, smoothly. Still better than 80% of the devices. 
5. Takes about 120-150 mins to charge, but if you want great battery life, you gotta compromise. 
Verdict- 
You get all that is mentioned above plus the S pen. All features like NFC, USB On The Go which allows you to use a fully functional mouse or pen drive, S features, motion features, voice commands and so on. They are just toppings on what others give at same price. 
If you are a casual user who uses the web a lot or likes watching movies and videos, playing games, reading etc. and battery life is primary importance, this is the device for you. 
I wanted something between phones and tablets, so I went with this one and I am one hundred percent satisfied. I don't regret it one bit.Project Butter on the Note 2 - Delicious ....Just received this masterpiece yesterday. I do not want to retype the specs as most of you are already aware of it. ICS and JB were not new to me since I was using a Galaxy S prior to this and had played around with a lot of custom ICS ROMs. 
Before placing the order, I was very skeptical to get it as many told me about its humongous size. IMO, size is only relative. If you have been using phones with 3.5-4&quot; displays you will definitely find it huge. But, the size is justified with the power it packs under the hood and the monster battery that it holds. Believe me, my hands are not big and I was able to use it one handed to make calls. For everything else, you need two hands of course. I was able to fit this into my jeans pocket (without it protruding out) and ride my bike without having to worry about whats in my pocket. 
I was earlier thinking of going in for the GS3, but trust me you will never regret owning this one for a couple of thousand bucks more. 
Samsung has hit a masterstroke on this one, quietly though and it scores in every department. Thanks to the 3100mah battery, it has lasted me 23 hours (and still going) though I have completely abused it watching videos, surfing, downloading apps, exploring the S-Pen etc. 
When you buy this, ensure you buy the original flip cover as well. Trust me, this is good and protects the Note 2. 
There are however two disadvantages having this monster, one you will lose sleep big time and two, your wife will not like it for the attention it gets. 
Lastly, the service by flipkart is truly commendable. apple's software was becoming a piece of crap day by day. 
 
specifications: 
A powerful quad core processor clocked at 1.6 ghz. 
 
2 GB of ram,heavy apps are nomore an issue. 
 
super amoled hd screen for crispy and sharp resolution. 
 
8 megapixel camera, its just an above average camera.i clicked a few pictures and believe me,it was just average like 4s.shutter speed is also fast.nothing fascinating but front camera is 1.9 mp which is impressive. 
 
jelly bean os is smooth,doesn't lag,though fb app sucks on android,hoping for an update soon. 
 
battery back up is also very good. 
 
i like to play with S-pen :D 
 
jelly bean has everything i was looking for, a blocklist, antispam for sms, a better task switcher, and no more itunes. 
and UI is awesome. 
 
playing games is fun as well. 
 
the only issue with this mobile is. it isn't very mobile(if u know what i mean). its a little hard to carry around,listening calls while driving isn't easy(can be sorted out with Bluetooth headset),cant operate with one hand(not really a big issue tbh because of larger screen,its totally worth it). 
 
overall review. 
I liked it. 
 
thumbs up if this review helps.Great mobile device...so far so good :).I bought this product on 2nd Feb 2013, and I'm writing this review based only on my personal experience of 1 week of usage, and NOT based on its specifications on paper. 
 
First up, the thing that immediately caught my attention was, how beautiful the display is - its absolutely gorgeous! Full HD videos &amp; high def images look great on it! 
 
The camera is also really good. I mean, I'm not comparing it with anything (read, iPhone 5, lumia 920, etc); all I'm saying is, one can't be disappointed with the Note 2 for its camera. Besides, I found that low light photos are also very good (again, not comparing with anything); they are more than satisfactorily detailed enough, for me at least - much, much better than the 5 MP shooter on my previous phone (Motorola Defy). 
 
The phone has no lag. Be it browsing, gaming, or simply doing the basic functions - none of them showed any sign of lag. 
 
AN IMPORTANT POINT TO NOTE HERE: A friend of mine has a Galaxy SIII, and after he installed the Jelly Bean update 4.1.1, his phone was laggy. I mean, he complained about it all the time, and I checked that out personally - that phone just lagged in just about anything, sometimes less, sometimes for longer durations. When you held it in your hand, it didn't appear that this phone has a quad core CPU inside! In fact, he told me that he restarts the phone every morning, coz otherwise the laggyness becomes just too much to bare. I simply couldn't understand it - I mean, after all, Jelly Bean is supposed to abolish lag, isn't it? At least, that's what the tech gurus say. Now, one fine day, he call me up &amp; tells me, all excited, that he got the Jelly Bean 4.1.2 update on his phone that day, and he installed it, and the lag has just vanished! He says he doesn't restart his phone anymore. 
 
My Note 2 came installed with Jelly Bean 4.1.2 out of the box. But, if anybody is facing issues with the Note 2 (or, with the Galaxy S3 also, for that matter), do check if your phone is running 4.1.1 or 4.1.2 - apparently, it makes a huge difference (it did with my friend at least). 
 
Lastly, I'm gonna say to people considering this phone, or people who are confused with what phone to buy if they have a budget upwards of 30k, see what your priorities are. The questions you've got to ask yourself are, do I need a big phone (and thereby a big screen) that allows me to browse pages without zooming in (most of the time), or do I need a more pocketable phone? Do I need a device which gives flawless performance &amp; added functionalities over other phones (read, S Pen), or do I need a lighter phone which is more suited for one hand operation? There are lots of other questions you can form, but I'm sure you get the idea. I knew what I wanted, I researched for a month, I got this phone, and I am happy. As last thoughts, just in case you didn't notice, this is the most high end (1.6 GHz quad core Exynos CPU, 2 GB RAM), and the most expensive android device in the market... Cheers! :)One of the best smartphone of at least half of this decade....Products comes and settles and goes away, few makes their marks and few just fades away. No doubt every smartphone you buy today would be feeling like outdated in 6 to 12 months and that's the current trend of mobile industry! But even after this only few products manages to create history and no doubt Galaxy Note 2 is one of them. I am not going to talk about ram, processor specs, benchmarks etc. They are incredible for being future-proof for at least 1.5 years. What I want to talk about is user experience. 5.5&quot; screen makes it slapping any other device in market. Since I bought this mobile I don't remember when was the last time I switched on my laptop! Android 4.1.1 (waiting for official upgrade to 4.1.2) gives you the best OS this legend could currently have. Touch experience smoother than butter. Yes, Project Butter shows its strength! S Pen is fantastic innovation. You can use it for S Planner, S Memo, S Notes and even for quick commands, clipping etc. More S Pen apps if increases in market will make S Pen to show its full strenght. Optical Character Recognition literally fetches out 99% time correct text for whatever weird your handwriting is. It feels such a wonderful when device with amazing hardware responds with amazing software. Camera interface gives you lot of options to play with but I doubt if one has SLR he/she will never like this camera. But this device's camera is replacement for for most of point n shoot. Overall camera is not great but good with so many options, software tweaks to play with makes it powerful. Device with demon specs has to come with good fuel to support its strenght and Galaxy Note 2's battery is really good and gets you through 1.5 to 2 days of normal usage. Screen color reproduction is outstanding considering the fact the RGB matrix used with 12 subpixels. Most of my pics which shot with DSLR looks great on this device rather than on laptop! 
Lot of talks are going in market regarding 440ppi etc. Galaxy Note 2 have 275ppi but you have larger screen at the same and this means this device gives perfect combination of sharpness and visible real estate of screen which no other device in current market gives you! Afterall 275ppi depth is more than enough. Music player and sound quality is one of the greatest I have seen long time after Sony's walkman series. Softwares like Music Square are just amazing and it works - allows you to tap squares on grid according to mood and it selectes songs automatically (minimum 25 songs are needed to work this). 
Now let me talk about few cons of this device : 
1) This may not fit your pockets and hands but you will never want to hide it in your pocket! 
2) From hardware perspective battery life is good but few software glitches in Android (like running many background processes, caching unwanted applications) makes it hard to utilise battery's full potential. I believe Samsung will fix these with updates in future. Deep Sleep optimisations needs to be optimised more. If you are in poor network area battery just vaporises. 
3) Facebook integration is good but not great. Samsung should have build their own Facebook interface instead of relying on standard one. 
4) N7100 model does not support LTE. Remember this. LTE model is N7105 and I doubt is it is available in Indian market. 
5) Build quality could have been a bit better for device with 37K price. Maybe they could have used some thin steel panel instead of plastic at back. But plastic at back even looks good especially white looks great. 
 
About flipkart : Good service. Actually this time it was replacement for me as originally ordered device had display issue. Flipkart needs to improve upon their replacement speed. Afterall nobody just want to pay 37K and sit n wait for new product being available in 6 days. Yes it took 6 days to replace it which is long time. 
 
Overall this device is greatest one currently produced by Samsung and will be remembered in history for its innovation and inspiration to new generation of products. 
 
Thanks,

Idevice has retina display and premium aluminium + glass body. except that Note II has upper hand on all the areas.This phone is badass.The phone is very large compared to others but not large enough to make you look like a dork while calling. Its somewhere between a phone and a tablet, giving you the best of both worlds. 
The processor is a quad core 1.6ghz one, giving the note 2 a processing power equal to that of a pc. The screen is large, but it should easily fit in the hands of an adult. The screen is sharp as expected of a super AMOLED screen. Picture quality is great, colours are vivid and pictures are sharp. The ram is 2 gb , allowing you to perform more processes at once and reduce lag. This phones performance is equal to that of a pc. The battery life is excellent, and more than s3's. People go for the s3 more, 'cause of its size. But some fail to notice that the note 2's performance greatly overshadows s3's. 
The s pen is a great addition, giving an accurate touch experience. The phone is a bit heavy and difficult to carry around , so you have to put it in a bag, as it may not fit in the pocket, so i recommend a bluetooth headset to be used with this. 
Overall this phone is great, have not found any cons. I prefer this over s3. Pros: 
- The size. Few people have cribbed on the huge size. Honestly, it is because of the size that I (and I am sure others too) bought it. Infact, other 'smaller' mobile phones now look so out of the place. 
 
- I have sold my Galaxy Ace &amp; my Dell laptop and purchased Note 2 as a replacement of these 2 devices. And believe me, Note 2 is indeed a phablet. I have rarely felt the lack of laptop after I bought Note 2. 
 
- Touchscreen is buttery smooth. 
 
- 1.6 GHz Q core, 2 GB RAM give you all the muscle to run as many applications as you want without a glitch 
 
- S Pen is one of the greatest marvels to be used so intelligently on a digital device. Be it taking notes, drawing, reading..the S Pen handles all these so intuitively. 
 
- Samsung has excellently embedded Touchwiz with Jellybean in terms of usability and aesthetics 
 
- The intuitiveness with which features like Smart Stay, Quick Glance, Motion Alerts are devised, you may start wondering if iPhone is miles behind in terms of its so called 'intuitive' OS and design 
 
- Those who feel that the back cover is made of 'cheap' plastic, let me tell them that the 
textured back finish gives Note 2 a excellently premium look. Secondly, this very plastic body absorbs shocks &amp; falls much better that any other metal body. (My Note 2 has fallen twice already from a height of around 3 feet :-( 
 
Cons: 
- Camera could have been say 12 megapixel OR it could have been better in lowlight conditions 
 
- My Note 2 is Titanium Grey but unfortunately Samsung gives 'only' white colored charger and earphones in the box which don't really match 
 
- The original flip cover doesn't look premium enough 
 
Lastly, let me add that with a gadget so intelligent, fast and intuitive as this, there is a distinct possibility that you may start feeling if this is a Human being... :-)Note 2 - Future proof.This phone's got it all. To be honest, when I now compare my iphone 4 with this phone, I realize how much I was missing out. Screen is AMAZING, Camera is great when there's enough lighting (decent in low light but not great), S-pen is EXTREMELY useful (air view, cutting an image, print screen, many many others!) And google maps - oh google maps!!! How much love do I have for thee?? Imagine a turn by turn navigation for GOOGLE MAPS!!! The best map application on the planet just became BEASTLY!! 
 
Let me list some pros off the top of my head: 
 
-S Pen is truly amazing 
-Battery life is LONG. Easily lasts a WHOLE DAY on HEAVY USAGE. 
-Sound quality is great. 
-Extremely smooth and fast, navigating through the screens is tremendous! 
-Extremely flexible (widgets, customizable) - just beats the iphone in every aspect on OS flexibility. 
-Light for its size - whoever says this is a heavy device is a moron. This phone is as thin as the iphone 4 even though it's JAMMED with an amazing battery. 
-Androooooooooooooooiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiid!! 
-Fits in my pocket - at first I was afraid this thing will be too big; it's not. Unless you wear skinny jeans that stop the blood circulation in your legs you should be fine. 
-5.55 inch screen is just too good. Easy to read eveything, easier on the eyes, a true masterpiece! 
-Replaceable battery, Micro-SD slot!!! Add all the movies and pictures you want!!A user for one and a half years!!.I am finally writing a review after being a satisfied user for almost one and a half years. Before I got this phone I was someone who would change his phone very very often.... as often as 2-3 months. Now I realise that was because none of the phones that I used before was as good as this!! I must say that I am a very very heavy user spending hours doing something or the other with this phone, either playing, or working, sending emails, random scribbling, social networking, clicking photos, listening to music etc. Even after one and a half years this beast is still serving me well.... the battery is great, have been receivng software updates, the operating system does not hang up and it is still buttery smooth as it was when I bought it. Sure there are better phones in terms of specs that have come out since the note 2, but in terms of practical usability I still don't find the urge to upgrade it, better processors, higher res. screens, better cameras have come out. But my note 2 is still going strong and I have formed a great attachment with it!! Since now that the phone has come down to around 27-28k I would strongly recommend it to anyone within this budget. I did a lot of R &amp; D before buying this handset, and therefore, I have a great yearn to explain and remove the confusions, doubts and hesitations that I too had before buying this product. 
 
1. First, we understand that many people didn't have a good experience with Samsung phones because of the mutations and customization it has had done with their Galaxy series, but true to my experience and our understanding, we must admit, that Note is a completely different series. 
 
With quad core processor and 2 GB RAM you are not going to feel the lag. Trust me. 
 
2. This phone is not that big. It's a hype. It's one of the most beautiful thing that will look in your hand. For girls hesitating, listen, I understand, it's not made for your tiny denim pockets, my best friend(girl) holds it in her hands all day, and it gives a rich-look to her. 
 
3. Which color? I know many are going to agree and many disagree. After a lot of experimentation, you know keeping gre phone in hand, then white, then putting either phone on ears, looking in the mirror, did everything you know, white is better. 
Eventually, you are going to put a flip cover for this phone, use black. 
Now, why white, if you are using a black cover? 
Because, white look in front reflects better contrast and colors when you are working over the phone. 
 
4. Performance proves that the specs mentioned are worthy and deserving. 
 
5. Writing Note is awesome, you can do anything with it, you know. Though one thing to mention, I was crazy for this note thing, but haven't used it much. It's human nature.

I did some research from my own capability, and then made up my mind to buy GN2. From the date I put it into use, I just felt its awesome. Here are my pros and cons from this product 
 
a) Very big screen, optimum to replace my tablet. 
b) build is very good. People who cry about plasticity of Samsung products have never seen it in real. Corning Gorilla2 glasses is icing on the cake. I am using the phone without any kind of flip-cover or screen guard for very first time. 
c) Touchwiz: I use it on my Tab2 as well. I also have a Samsung Google nexus and nexus7 which have vanilla android. I agree that Google releases early software releases for last 2 devices, but it is tastless for me. I find Touchwiz makes true android customization. There are zillion of features in phone which I am yet to explore on this phone. 
d) S-Pen: Its true innovation from Samsung, and stands apart from likes of HTC, iPhone etc. Try taking quick notes. Its very convenient than typing on Google keep or some other notes app. 
 
Cons: 
a) size: I agree that phone is very big, and should be addressed as phablet. Samsung provides one hand typing keyboard which is cool at times. 
b) price: Its bit on high end. But I purchased from exchange offer. Thanks to Samsung for providing good value for my old phone :) 
c) fonts: I like to customize fonts system-wide. But I dont get such an option. I dont like big fonts used on status bar or elsewhere. I want to control my phone as per my taste. 
d) No-background: Being super-amoled, I wanted to just say NO to any background. But Android doesnt have this option(same with Google nexus) I need to download a black wall paper and apply it as background. Black looks dead beautiful on the phone. 
 
As for cry babies which keep crying in flipkart against expensive/samsung phones, go and get a life. Remember not everyone will buy your allegations against these phones. Great job Samsung! 
 
As for flipkart, my feedback, improve your logistics. You take too long time to deliver an item these days. I think you are done with customer acquisition phase, and now doing actual business. Only advantage is 5% bank offer available here. After couple of days Flipkart came up with an exchange offer for Note 2, I exchanged my 4 year old Nokia E5 for an discount of Rs 5000 less on the Note 2. It was a great offer. 
Now I had 2 phones &hellip;. Gifted my wife with the canvas 4 and kept the note 2 ;-(. 
 
While Comparing both the phones:- 
The Canvas Internet speed is much faster as compared to the Note 2 
 
The 13MP Camera and the clarity of Canvas is beyond comparison to note 2 wiz 8MP But the large screen of the Note 2 makes the photos look better. 
 
The Samsung touch screen response is better than the canvas 4 
 
Display Quality : The front screen is awesome very smooth as compared with the Micromax canvas 4 
 
Canvas 4 comes fully loaded with all accessories like Additional flip cover Screen guard which is not available with Note 2 
 
Note 2 response in wifi is great 
 
Note 2 has a bigger display size and is cumbersome while answering calls or operating with single hand even though it has a feature of one hand operation, the problem is the screen is so big that u have to use all your fingers to support the phone it is difficult to press any button. The display size of canvas is accurate and is comfortable in operation. However both the phones are large for single hand operations of people who travel a lot &hellip;. It becomes difficult to drive and operate. 
 
The Thickness of Note 2 is much lesser than the canvas and is very sleek. 
 
The Spen is not available in Canvas 4. It is a cool device and nice to use the Spen when you are lounging. And people notice and identify it&hellip; :-) 
 
You can always flaunt your note 2 as compared to a canvas 4. 
 
Comparing both the phones and using both the phones first hand given the choice I will prefer the note 2. 
 
This product is really good value for your money.Big and Beautiful Note 2.... I'm loving it.Ok i had been following Note 2 ever since its release but was unable to get my hands on it because of the price but thanks to the samsung exchange offer i have it now m/... 
 
Coming to the Phone 
Pros: 
1.Due to it's big screen many people feel it is difficult to handle but i have never had any trouble with it; leaving the rare cases now and then... and once you get used to this size it's hard to go back to smaller mobiles ( read: iphone) 
 
2.The battery is too good i easily last a day and half even after total abuse of my phone (3G, High graphic games, messaging) 
 
3.S-pen -- This is one hardware people should not miss... I always thought i would never use it but to my surprise i keep using it the more and more i get to know of it's various features. It's great fun too 
 
4.The display is good and the camera too is decent not the best in the market right now but you won't feel bad using it... though low light images may leave you disappointed. 
 
5.The external memory and replaceable battery are also good to have. 
 
Cons: 
1.The USB charger cable is very small... I hate it. 
2.The graphics processor is not the best and when you play graphic-intensive games it shows up a little 
3.I'm not a fan of Touchwiz at all the cartoonish icons and interface is not for me i prefer the stock android anyday but there are good launchers out there which can make up for itBusiness phone/Multipurpose.Okay, where do I start? I'm not certifying this phone as a 5 star simply because I bought it. 
To be fair, everyone complaining about the price of the phone and the fact that samsung will come out with a new phone etc don't get the point of this phone. This phone has very good specs. Make no mistake. 2 gigs of RAM, a very good processor which will hold it's own more or less in the face of competition from the HTC One and the SG Note 3. This phone is primarily a business phone. Push mail, presentations, doc editing, creating and viewing pdfs etc is brilliant. Thanks to the big screen and precision via the s-pen. Airview and the s-pen button are a huge bonus. I've been using this phone for quite some time now and this is my primary device on the go. I also use a google nexus 7. I never really liked Touchwiz till I used the note 2. This is one phone that touchwiz is essential for. Simply because of the way the s-pen utilities have been embedded in the software. IF you plan to flash the phone and install any other ROM, I would recommend any one of the many Touchwiz based custom ROMs available. One thing I loved about the phone is the camera. It's not a showstopper, but has some neat features like the burst mode and great quality. 
The Note 2 currently is priced at some 32k while the Note 3 is pushing 50k. Price is not a factor but at 32k, this phone is a steal. 
Also, I should mention the monster battery. I have to charge this phone up once in 2 days. I am a heavy user switching between wifi and 3g and I do use a portable charger for an hour or two but even without, this phone gives me about 18 hours of usage no sweat. 
If you're looking for a phone to use purely for gaming, this is not the phone for you, though it will perform just as well. If you're looking for a phone purely for entertainment, this might still not be the phone for you. This phone can do a bit of everything. And very well at that. It's a jack of all trades. PHONE: Used mainly as a speaker phone with note taking capabilities or multi-tasking of any other kind including the ability to view and join contacts to the current call or text a quick message based on your current call. Bluetooth enabled for privacy and hands-free with exceptional range and voice-command options. Large dialer perfect for driving or the visually impaired. 
 
TABLET: With the Quad-Core and 2GB of RAM; enhanced video playback, gaming and photo editing is smooth and full featured. The ease-of-use for web browsing and navigation is increased with the enhanced S Pen which also acts like a mouse. The keyboard is large and easy to navigate with a number of input options already pre-loaded including improved handwriting recognition.The digital Artist!.I have been a fan of samsung phones since days when C 100 was as popular as the Note lineup. I always knew they had something in their display that sets them apart and now the world acknowledges it. I have rode the Note path before and the experience of using Note 1 was something rather revolutionary and that compelled me to go for Note 2. Note 2 unlike the predecessor is not in unchartered waters and enjoys the premium of a successor to the device for which the term Phablet was coined and lives upto it. 
The 2nd edition Phablet is by no means restricted and uses the full prowess of the quad core processor and the 2 gigs of team. Many out there might also be not aware that it has a dedicated quad core graphics processor (MALI 400 MP) as well and it makes splendid use of it. I felt the need to write this review at this point because recently I noticed people getting confused between mega 6.3 and note 2 and I would like to assert that preferring note 2 over mega 6.3 should be a no brainer. Mega is no where close to what note 2 offers. The SAMOLED HD display itself should seal the deal.I have been using it for over seven months now and believe me I have never seen it hesitate. Throw at it whatever you can think of and it handles it better than what one would expect. At a point out of curiosity I ran 80 apps in parallel and it never bothered for a hick up and isn't that the true purpose of smartphone. For Media consumption you always have that big Plasma TV or should you prefer the Mega. The s pen on note 2 keeps getting better with every firmware update and now it literally recognises the ugliest of my scribblings. The JB 4.2.2 is on its way and then it can definitely be matched to S4 in terms of all the eye candy it offers. One more thing you would have noticed that the titanium grey color option is limited to note2 and that makes it look exclusive. It gives the Phablet a clinch&egrave; of its own and a sophisticated look. I am sure to use this device atleast till Note 3/4 pushes some revolutionary boundaries.Review written from S pen itselfAmazing Value for Money Product in today`s scenario.This review is totally based on Usage after a months time with the Note 2. 
 
1.This set Never hangs ( i did`nt find any force closes or lags or force restarts ) 
2.Have played HD games like Modern Combat 4, Nova 3,Asphalt 8, Dead Trigger  2(with max settings),Wild Blood, RR3, NFSMW and the game plays have been superb. 
3.Camera is good but not the best. Night shots in low light did have grains.Day shots are excellent. Video recording is also great. 
4. Android 4.3 Update has made the device even smoother than before. KitKat update scheduled around April 2014 (as per leaked reports on the web) 
5.Net surfing is a pleasure on the sharp and clear HD large Screen and there is absolutely no stutter in the stock browser ,although Chrome at times is a bit jittery but hardly noticeable unless compared to the stock browser. 
6.With the 4.3 update Touchwiz is very fluid and responsive 
7. Battery life: Now this is totally usage dependent. In my experience with the Note 2 , with about 4 hours of screen time,Voice calls around 2 hrs and some average gaming for around 30 mins or so i get a backup of 12 hours easily and data/wifi remains on. Without Data/wifi i do get around 30 plus hours . Wifi although drains the battery faster IMO. 
 
Now not all things are rosy for this Beast of a device. While playing a few graphic intensive games like Real Racing 3 or MC4 the upper back side of the phone heats up ,but since the soc is a quad core powerhouse and makes the phone run buttery smooth and fast this can be overlooked. 
 
A day after purchasing this phone , without installing any games or any other 3rd party apps and after clearing the RAM, I ran the Antutu Benchmark on this set and got an impressive score of 21385 ,for a hardware config over a year old. NenaMark 2 gave me a fps of 58. I was confused between the LG G pro and Note 2 and finally settled for this because of the most distinguishing feature ..the S Pen and the Software update to 4.3 
 
Final Opinion : Guys , although the Note 3 is out , this is still a monster of a device and can handle all your daily needs impeccably . And for those Android junkies like me if you want note 3 features just root your device and install the Tigra or the DN3 ROMs and you can enjoy all the software goodies (Air command ,Pen window ,magazine,etc) of the note 3 on your note 2. Cheers !

(Grand, Grand Quattro, Mega(very low ppi and stupid screen size))Samsung Galaxy Note II: Incredibly good and extremely useful phone..I bought Galaxy Note II about three weeks ago from Flipkart. On exchange offer with my old Nokia phone. Cash-on-delivery. Excellent service, fast delivery. Very professional. 
 
Very impressed and satisfied with the phone. The stylus-based S-pen feature is very good, which is my reason for buying the phone. I have yet to fully get used to the phone and all its features which are plenty. I could not find a detailed user manual/guide on the web which covers everything about the phone, and so, getting to know and fully getting used to the phone is taking time. As a serious business user, I feel that such a manual would have been very useful in many ways. 
 
Without the S-pen feature, I would not have chosen this phone, but would have preferred a windows 8 phone. If there were a windows 8 phone with built-in Wacom digitizer and S-pen-like facility, I would have certainly preferred it over the Galaxy Note II. 
 
Upgraded memory to a total of 80 gb - 16 gb of the phone, and 64 gb of Class 10 Sandisk MIcroSD card, also bought from Flipkart. Works very well. 
 
The back-cover of the battery compartment is incredibly delicate! Can't believe that Samsung could not give us a sturdier back for such an expensive phone. This applies also to the Samsung Flip cover which I did not buy because it replaces the existing cover with a back made of the same material - no enhanced protection. 
 
Pros: 
Excellent phone with generous amount of rich and useful features. 
Excellent display. 
Very good battery life. 
Excellent S-pen feature with Wacom digitizer. 
 
Cons: 
Poor quality back cover (battery compartment) of questionable protection value. 
No manual/user guide to cover all aspects of this feature-rich incredibly good phone.Class above Optimus G Pro.I see a lot of reviews comparing this to the Optimus G Pro. I recently purchased it from here and had to return it due to some manufacturing issues. I then purchased a Note2 instead. In my detailed testing over last week, the Note2 is a much better phablet. 
For starters, the screen is super clear and pleasing even at 5% brightness. The camera is super clear even at low light without any smudging. The in-build speakers are also very clear and loud outdoors. 
I updated the device to android 4.3 after buying it and the tablet is even smoother than before. Just remember to factory reset your device before and after the upgrade in order to avoid some bizarre battery problems being reported by folks on the web. 
The phone also feels light and comfortable to hold and use for long periods of time without even becoming warm. 
I havent even started exploring all the possibilities of the S-Pen yet but even at 3-5K more than the Optimus, this device is a good buy at least for my usage patterns. 
I dont think there are any other phablets even close to the capabilities of this device even after 1 year of introduction in the Indian market.Good Phone! For a month I read many reviews and finally bought one.Fantastic Device - Samsung Galaxy Note 2.Hi folks! 
 
Bought Note 2 about ten days ago and I think I am in a better position to write a review on it. Got this beast for 28,500 INR from a local store. Just don't understand the absurd pricing strategy of Flipkart. I am a big fan of Flipkart but the way they have priced this phone has really put me off. Anyway, if you are planning to buy this phone, please find a local store. 
 
Coming to the point now. 
 
I am sure a lot's already been talked about how fast/good this phone is and I wouldn't deep dive into it. I would however say this - It is one of the best phones at this price range. Yes, there are occasional lags/shuttering which I am sure has nothing to do with the hardware or phone. We all know Android is notoriously known for poor calibration between hardware and software. And. they are still waaaaaay behind iOS/Windows platforms when it comes to Optimization between device's hardware and operation system. Jelly Bean has definitely managed to curb these lags to a great extent but Android has still some work to do. 
 
The phone flaunts great specs on paper (quad core processor, powerful GPU, 2 GB RAM etc.) and if you wonder about the real life performance, believe me, you have come to the right place. This phone is butter smooth, fast, elegant, powerful and so much fun to use. This is by far the fastest android phone available in the market (obviously after Google Nexus 4, which I think is a sheer performer). I think I have never loved/enjoyed any of my earlier phones/devices as I have been enjoying this beautiful work by Samsung. 
 
Some of the positives are - 
 
S-Pen, I think is one of the USPs of this phone. I am in so much love with using S-Pen. You really have to use it first before you can even start appreciating this great engineering work. 
 
Camera is JUST brilliant. Pics shot at good lighting conditions would surprise me every time I use it. The quality is just WOW! Nothing great in low light conditions but having said that, it is still way better than other smart phones' camera. Excellent! 
 
Screen is one of the reasons why I did not buy any other phone. IT IS JUST AWESOME. 5.5&quot; Super AMOLED display with decent PPI of 267 is just too good for any media content. I think it is THE best mobile device available in the market when it comes to multimedia and surfing internet. 
 
1.6 Quad Core processor with 2 GB RAM allows this device to perform heavy duty tasks with so much ease. Playing HD games, watching Full HD videos/movies feels like heaven really.. 
 
Battery life is again one of the reasons this device caught my attention. I spend good number of hours surfing internet, playing games, taking few calls and still this phone gives me 24 hour battery life. Given the screen size, heavy duty processor and GPU, I think this is just amazing! 
 
Some negatives (or areas of opportunity) - 
 
Occasional lags. As I mentioned earlier, Android OS is the culprit here. The phone however has no other complaint in terms of processing speed. 
 
Little bulky! Yes, the phone would feel little heavy for initial days but it wont be any matter, as you spend few days with it. 
 
OVERALL, I am very happy with the phone and recommend to buy this phone if you are looking for a no-nonsense stuff. I rate this phone 4.5/5!Thank you samsung..!!!.This is a genuine review coz i just bought note 2 from local market 4 hours ago...!!

Go ahead and buy it before it stock out.PARADISE !!! PERIOD..Many reviews are there for this awesome colossal phone yet I thought of writing one. It is highly customisable on the software if you are a root user. I got this phone few months back. Its still a dream set though it is the flagship of 2012. First lets go through its Pros and Cons. 
PROS: 
1)Large display(5.5&quot; ) with pentile matrix having 3 subpixel per pixel(better clarity) 
2)Nice PPI(267) .Though it seems lower than the present full HD phones and also lower than HD phones with smaller screen size the SUPER AMOLED makes up for it heavily. 
3)The S pen has many features. May not be useful to some but its fun to have it. 
4)Cortex A9 @ 1.6ghz. Breezes through most games with practically no lag, Games like Real Racing 3 and Asphalt 7 runs without any hiccups. 
5)The 8 megapixel snapper at the back does great too. Capable of 1080p and also good quality low light photos.Front camera is bonus with good resolution as well. 
6)Multi-window and Smart Rotation adds to the cart as well, Though I didn't use it much , its a good show off I guess(After all you are spending so many bucks on the phone ;) ) 
7)Micro sd support upto 64 gb ! Great if you are a MUSIC and FHD videos fanatic, 
8)NFC :- Just to be future proof ! 
9)2 GB ram - Only the Note 3 betters it as of now. Enough to handle all the bloatwares associated with the TouchWiz addon from Samsung. 
10)3100 mah Battery - A big boost. At the time of its release only one of the Motorola Droids had better. 
CONS: 
1)No HDMI port. Though its not an essential , yet many would prefer to see a direct link to the FHD TV's or the UHD TV's now available. 
2)Wifi connectivity fiddles when you are more then 4-5 meters away from the router, (Can get irritating at times) 
3)Mali 400 gpu and not ADRENO 3xx series. Though this gpu is fast enough , yet it gives a trolled FPS in the AnTuTu Benchmark. Its 3d Score is significantly lower compared to other Androids using the ADRENO Gpus. 
4)No metal UNIBODY - Yes definitely its good looking but that plastic finish feels a bit off the premium level. Atleast Design could have been better . Its hard to distinguish for the common flare between a Galaxy Grand and a Galaxy Note 2 from the front. 
5)Sound is a bit low. One would prefer docks if one is soundaholic :D. 
 
Basically the PROS bury the CONS! 
 
The PHONE can be customised heavily. If one is an android root user, then he/she will be delighted with the number of custom roms available for this device. I managed to get an AnTuTu score of 21895 on my custom rom which is better than Sony Xperia Z, (a 2013 flagship phone). The phone doesn't tend to heat up too much. The S note feature is great one with people wanting to take quick notes as the App pops ups when you remove the S-Pen .(You can disable the settings too ) . The sound level is low as a mentioned before , but the in ear headphones gives a nice quality.Video playback is great too.

First to mention, before buying this Beast: Galaxy Note 2, i had read a lot of reviews here in Flipkart on this mobile, but Max of them were on the common features that almost everyone knows from like the: 
 
-5.5 screen 
-Quad-Core 
-2GB RAM 
-Super AMOLED capacitive Touchscreen 
-16GB Internal 
-64GB External Expandable 
-Camera: 8MP(Main), 1.9(Front) 
-NFC 
-OS: Android Jelly Bean 
-GPU: Mail-400MP 
-Stylus Pen 
 
Yes, i agree, these are the Excellent Features which other phones cannot compete easily, 
BUT, there are loads of other interesting stuffs that any TECH SAVY person will like a lot!!! 
 
After buying this Galaxy Note 2 last week, i had been trying to figure out the extra features that this beast offers in excess to the mentioned above ones. 
Some of them are as follows: 
 
-First of all, the most attractive feature that i really liked was the Motion Sensor Capabilities that this beast is offering. 
Let me note down some of them as tested by me: 
 
1) To unlock the device with motion, tap and hold a point on the screen, and then tilt the device forwards. 
2) When you pick up the device after it has been idle for some time or when the screen has turned off, it vibrates if you have missed calls or new messages. 
3) While viewing a call, a message, or contact details on the phone screen, simply pick up and hold the device to your ear to make a call to that number. 
4) Tap and hold an item on the screen, and then move the device to the left or right to move the item to another panel on the Home screen or the Applications screen in that direction. 
5) When an image is zoomed in, tap and hold a point on the screen, and then move the device in any direction to browse the image. 
6) While you are cheking mails or contacts in a page and you reach the middle or the last of the list, simply Double-tap the device to move to the top of a list of contacts or emails. 
7) While the screen is locked, tap and hold the screen, and then rotate the device to landscape orientation to launch the camera. 
8) Turn over the device(making it lie down with back-side up) to mute ringtone, pause media playback, or mute the FM radio. 
9) Shake the device to search for Bluetooth devices. 
10) Shake the device to update the list of emails or information from Yahoo News, Yahoo Finance etc. 
11) Sweep your hand sideways across the screen from right to left to capture a screenshot. 
12) Cover the screen with a palm to pause media playback. Move it away from the screen to resume. 
13) Tap and hold two points on the screen, and then tilt the device back and forth to zoom in or out. 
14) When the touch screen is turned off, move your hand across the Proximity/Light sensor to 
turn on the screen lightly and view the number of missed calls and new messages, the battery 
power level, and more. 
 
The above are the special features that this phone provides in respect to various motions. 
 
- Secondly, like the Galaxy S3, it has the Smart Stay, which enables the phone to keep the screen on as long as you are looking at it. 
When you close your eyes or move away from looking into the screen, the Phone screen will automatically turn off. 
 
- Thirdly, with the Quad-core processor and 2GB RAM, Gamers will really love this phone since some VERY HIGH RESOLUTION GAMES are just running with not a single point of lag in this phone. 
 
- Fourthly, You would luv to watch videos in this phone due to itz big screen and the very good quality videos running smoothly. 
 
- Fifthly, Music quality is really very good and descent. Radio works perfect. 
 
- Sixthly, SAR (Specific Absorption Rate) Level is relatively low(The lower the Better) for the Samsung Galaxy Note 2 in comparision to other phones: 
 
Galaxy Note 2: 0.171 W/kg 
Galaxy Note: 0.39 W/kg 
Galaxy S3: 0.342 W/kg 
Galaxy S2: 0.338 W/kg 
iPhone 4S: 0.98 W/kg 
iPhone 5: 0.951 W/kg 
HTC One X: 0.909 W/kg 
 
Apart from the above mentioned features: 
- I have not tested with the camera yet since i already have a Digital Camera. 
But as read from reviews, the camera is quite good in its capabilities, with 1.9 front camera is just great. 
 
- Also not tested with the full capability of the Stylus Pen, since it has loads of functionalities that has to be checked in details :-) 
 
So simply after examining withlots of such exciting features, it simply stands out tall in the market.The Best Smartphone in the market!!!.Well, there are no words to describe this monster of a Phone. It's just EPIC!!! For starters, it just does EVERYTHING. You can't ask for more in a smartphone. Note taking, S-pen, Jelly Bean, Quad Core, Super Fast, Awesome Camera, Amazing Screen, Awesome Web Browsing and Gaming, Brilliant Battery Life, you just name it and this beast has it. So in short it's just &quot;NOTABULOUS&quot;. Here are my pros and cons: 
 
---&gt; PROS: 
 
1) Amazing Screen with 5.5&quot; and Super Amoled NON-PENTILE HD Display which just throws life in everything. 
2) Quad Core CPU with Jelly Bean just gets the job done in seconds. 
3) S-pen is the best thing which just takes the experience to the next level. 
4) Amazing for watching movies and playing games. 
5) Fast Web Browsing and makes reading an ease. 
6) Good for Office as well as personal use. 
7) Absolute Mammoth Battery Life. 
 
---&gt; CONS: 
 
1) Well, it's not suitable for Small Hands and for those who don't like Big Screen Phones.

4) As it's Super Amoled, so the Whites are a little Warm, Hence the colors look a little over-saturated and won't give it a natural look. Some like it while some don't like it but overall it looks Amazing.

And despite of that, S4 mini has 42 mbps 3G speed whereas Note 2 gives 21 mbps 3G speed. So, why to buy Note 2 ?????????, buy S4 mini of the same brand SAMSUNG. 
 
Note 2 ----------------------------------------------------------------- S4 mini 
 
1.6 GHz quad core -------------------------------------------------1.7 GHz dual core 
HD display -------------------------------------------------------------qHD display 
2 GB of RAM-----------------------------------------------------------1.5 GB RAM 
21mbps HSDPA ------------------------------------------------------42mbps HSDPA 
 
Rs. 37000 ---------------------------------------------------------------Rs. 27000 
 
So, why to pay 10000 rupees extra only for 0.5 GB of RAM and 2 cores. And S4 mini has a great 3G speed ????????????

- Device is pretty snappy

- Google integration 
- Handwriting 
- Large screen 
 
What I don't like: 
- Default android phone app. This is my biggest concern. You don't get a concise view of phone logs, SMS app UI is very mediocre). All that you can see is one line when you start replying to a mail though you have such a big screen) 
 
I don't like most: 
- Power buttons on the right side of the device. You &quot;accidentally&quot; restart the device 2-3 times minimum while holding the phone. 
- Volume buttons on the left. You can hardly access them if you replace the back cover with the flip cover. 
- No mute button. Its hard to press the touch screen every time you want to mute the line.AWWWSOME SPECS AND SOLID LOOKS.... KILLER PHONE....MOST AWAITED CELL PHONE..
