Don't go for it.Hi All, 
 
This is my second review after LG G2. 
Friends first of all no phone is perfect . I have tried 3 good phones in a month and trust me I switched back to one of phone which I used during the month. 
 
I am always a fan of LG . I like LG UI and phones . Now a days we can see people are using Samsung mobile phones so it&rsquo;s an automatic perception that Samsung phones are good as most of the people are using. 
My friend told me to go for Note 2 but being a fan of LG G2 and recently I have a hands on LG G2 So I planned to Buy LG G2. 
 
Trust me It&rsquo;s a very good phone with Graphics , UI , Remote , Gaming experience also a good battery life with 10 hours of heavy usage. 
I used to travel from Ghaziabad to Gurgaon which is almost 2 hours journey and during that time I use to play games , chat , talk etc &hellip;.. 
 
The very Bad experience with G2 was it lags , every time I have to used task killer or clean application to free memory and ram . Since I used iPhone with IOS 6 for an one year so compare to iPhone and a normal user this phone lags during opening , call connecting , call pick .. it&rsquo;s not as smooth as I was expecting from this phone &hellip; The lags are too high if it&rsquo;s one time in a day then I would never have been changed this phone but it lags a lot. 
 
So I tried another phone which is called smartphone of the year HTC ONE. 
Trust me this was the phone which fulfill my topmost requirement . I used for 10 days with heavy games and usage . trust me this phone never lags however the HTC sense automatically manage the CPU and RAM . 
I do not need to install third party to clean CPU and RAM. This is the one of the phone which competes my old iPhone. 
Thanks HTC for making a fabulous UI and performance. The camera is good not better but having lots of good feature. 
I should also talks about the beat audio . Boss this rocks everyone in my team used to listen music on my phone . Awsonw sound with bass and tweeter . It remember the old Sony handsets in 2006 having good sounds. No phone is in the market which can beat HTC sound and performance . 
 
But as I told not everything is perfect . This phone bigger drawback is battery drain issue . It last for 6 to 8 hours max usage but if you are listening songs only then it will last for a day . I have to charge twice in a day to use the phone . 
 
Just because of battery drain issue I switched to another phone Note 2. The decision was tough as I never want to be part of Samsung family because of ugly UI but I purchased this phone from flipkart. 
This was my biggest mistake which I regret always. 
 
Note 2 no doubt a good phone with lot of features , excellent battery backup ( HTC one : Note 2) ( 70:100) ration , Excellent camera. But but but it lags badly as soon as you started downloading the apps into the phone if there are less apps then this phone will work amazing but my dear friends you spend 30 K on phone so at least you except fair performance. 
The Samsung UI is ugly , Lags during the call, opening contacts it lags for a friction of seconds . connecting a call is difficult , hangs while picking up the call&hellip;Hangs with heavy games . 
It was very embarrassing movement that you are in a public and you are unable to pick a phone as it stucks lags &hellip; 
 
Trust me my friends. My colleagues don&rsquo;t started believing me but I showed them the problem . They are formatted my phone as per their process but even though it lags. 
 
The user experience which I have receive from HTC one an android phone was unbelievable. 
So I sold this phone and switch back to HTC one once again. For battery issue I have everyday power bank which helps me a lot . 
During 18 hours of journey I switched off my data service and this phone give me backup of complete 1.5 days 
 
I bought this phone after reading reviews on flipkart which helped to make wrong decision so friends request all of you if any phone having any single issue then please share your views. 
For you it may be hardly matters but for others it matters a lot.

Now, about the phone this phone is really superb as much as I know I researched a lot about it coz i want value for my money. I will be writing a full review after using it (delivery date is 10th feb) 
I was looking for the phone that will suit my needed specifications. for more than 2 months I was looking and wasn't satisfied with any of the phone in the market. good phones are too costly and I was unable to decide which phone to choose 
 
What i needed - 
1.A tough rugged phone. I am careless I usually carry keys in pocket with phone and scratches makes me feel that my phone is getting old 
2. good battery life. I am tired of charging my old phone 2-3 times a day 
3. fast processor I am not that much into mobile gaming coz I prefer my PC for gaming purpose still I need a good response when I order my phone to open an app it should do it in blink of eye else its dead mister. 
4.I also needed a good display and good sound quality I love music and a little show off among friends, 
5 a camera good enough for casual use mostly for instagram and facebook. 
 
What I am getting is - 
 
1. Corning gorilla 3 protection which is scratch proof even if you try to scratch it with keys 
2. water resistant (oops I accidentally put my phone with my clothes to wash good lord its alive). 
3. snapdragon 400 1.2 gh (I saw reviews on youtube and its almost as fast as nexus 4 that is 25k sometimes it was faster than samsung s4 ) 
4.display is awesome 326pixels per inch on a 4.5 inch screen and that on an apple iphone 4s its 329ppi on a 4 inch screen Impressive!!! moto g 
5.According to one of the reviews in youtube the call clarity in other phones is better but the noise cancellation in moto g is better so I guess it is for me coz i mostly work in noisy surrounding. 
6. the camera is not the best but in good light it will give you decent images with bright colors and it records 720p hd so nothing to question. 
7. customizable colored covers which will never let you feel bored the color options are really good bright and lively 
8.Dual sim - avail the best std and local offers by two service providers 
9. the phone gives 50 gb google drive space for 2 years 
10 the phone is usb otis compatible you can connect a 32 gb pendrive if extra space is needed(although i dont need it I already spent 50k on my laptop and 5k on an external drive for storage. 13 gig that is available is decent for me ) 
I think in India we are getting charger and headphones i hope so 
 
what I didn't get 
1. NFC(near field communication) only yesterday i came to know what nfc means and believe me you are not going to use it even if you get it so dont waste ur hard earned money unless ur dad is having an audi or a mercedes. 
2.expandable memory (boy that really feels but grrr why didnt they just add an expandable slot -_- 
3.A 5.5 inch screen well, I am buying a phone not a tab

I ordered Moto G 16GB on 10th feb 6:55 PM and received on 19th Feb. Since FK don&rsquo;t ship in UP so I had to go to Haryana to receive it. I was a bit afraid while unboxing but to my relief, the product was not defected. I used it for about 3 days then updated to Android 4.4 Kitkat. Being on WiFi, the update was time taking.. took about 3 hrs.. No issues after the update, instead the UI is buttery smooth now, the dialler and lock screen music playback is just awesome. The update is perfect I haven&rsquo;t felt any bugs. 
 
FEW MISCONCEPTIONS TREATED AS DEFECTS: 
 
1&gt;	Those who say the phone is not booting up after the battery is empty: After starting phone first time, connect the charger provided &amp; check if its working or not. Charge it completely. Don&rsquo;t let the battery empty. 
2&gt;	Those who say screen is unresponsive while charging: Yes, its True. But its not a bug. It happens while charging from incompatible charger. Try using any other charger. It also happened on my previous HTC phone. 
3&gt;	Notification Light: it blinks for unread notifications &amp; when charging the empty battery. If you want to change its usage pattern use &ndash;Light flow&mdash;app from Play Store. 
4&gt;	USB OTG works even better after Kitkat update. Check out the Geekyranjit&rsquo;s Youtube video. 
5&gt;	Those who say battery drains faster after Kitkat update: That&rsquo;s not an issue it will happen for 6-7 charge cycles and then it would be fine. 
 
A FEW RECOMMENDATIONS: 
 
1&gt;	The phone uses Micro Sim. So, keep a Micro SIm ready so you can start instantly. You can either cut the existing SIM to micro Sim by yourself or at any shop. 
2&gt;	Please use the device for at least 3 days and then upgrade to kitkat. It will help you to understand if there is any problem with hardware. Otherwise after update you will be confused if it&rsquo;s a hardware issue or update bug! 
3&gt;	I don&rsquo;t think there is NO need of screen guard as it has Corning Gorilla Glass 3. All you need is a flip cover. 
 
Those who are giving 1* to device they are either jealous of such a great device or frustrated with device delivery by Flipkart.

Thanks!Best Budget Smartphone.Its a cheap,cheerful and reliable phone.With such low price one wonders there must be something wrong with it but there isn't. Now every phone has some pros and cons but in this case the cons are very few. 
First i will talk about the enormous pros. 
 
Design 
The design of moto g is the replica of moto x.Its a tough phone with a good handy size and the back of the phone is a rubber like plastic with a dimple of motorola logo which makes it very comfortable to hold it.It also has a water repellent nano-coating .This doesn't make it water proof, but at least makes it more resistant to the odd spill/splash. 
 
Screen 
One of the biggest highlights of the Moto G is its 4.5-inch 720p HD IPS LCD, which works out to a density of 329 pixels per inch i.e sharper than Apple's iPhone 5s, which offers 326ppi. 
It has also used Corning Gorilla Glass 3 on the Moto G to protect it from scratches which is usually found on premium devices priced at Rs. 30,000 and above. 
 
Camera 
It delivers pretty decent clicks with a 5 mp rear and 1.3 mp front camera with led flash and HD recording.It has a unique feature of slow motion video recording also with other features HDR and panorama. 
 
Processor &amp; Performance 
The Moto G is powered by 1.2GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 processor with Adreno 305 graphics and 1GB of RAM onboard.The performance is great.It doesn't slows down even with 4-5 background applications running.Even when playing a heavy graphics game like Asphalt-8:Airborne it runs very smoothly.And when i performed a benchmark test by AnTuTu it recorded a score of 11,874 which is pretty close to big phones nexus 4 and Galaxy S III. 
 
Software 
One of the best features of moto g is that it has the lastest android version i.e 4.4 KitKat and that too with a stock android,stock edition users get the latest versions of Android OS immediately they are out, while customized users have to wait months &ndash; and sometimes a year (Ahem! Sony.. cough!) to get updates to their device. 
 
Battery Life 
The 2070 mAh seems low but actually it isn't in the case of moto g.The battery life of moto g is pretty decent.With a normal usage it lasted about a day and with heavy usage like playing games,movies with wifi/3g enabled the whole time and calling for 2-3 hours it lasted for about 12-13 hours,which was not bad. 
 
Cons 
The only downside of moto g is that there is no NFC.Although NFC is a pretty cool tech but think about it even if it had would you use it. 
 
Verdict 
At this price point, no other phones offer an experience that is as good, so in that sense the Moto G is a game changer.I bought it and i definetly recommend you to get it.Please read this before you buy anything from flipkart.Hi Everyone

ITS TRUE PLEASE DO NOT WASTE MONEY IN FLIPKART.Great Product - But I got a lemon.I got this for my mom - My dad has Nexus 4 and that phone is next to perfect. 
 
I thought I'll get mom her own Android device, and this fit the bill. Incredible specs - Amazing display (more PPI than my iPhone 5), quad core processor, 1 GB RAM etc and dual sim too. 
 
However, most times, my mom is not able to make a call (Unable to Call messages abound). When I try reaching her in either of the SIM, it either doesn't ring or I get 'Out of Service' message. Rebooting the phone temporarily fixes the problem, but eventually problem reappears. 
 
The phone shows full signal strength in both SIMs, but, it is both unable to make a call or to receive calls. (Data works with WiFi) 
 
I might be hoping foolishly, but I think some software upgrade might fix this. 
 
Good phone, may be just my piece is bad. (my bad luck!)Almost 5/5, But Not Quite.In the box: 
Moto G 
Wall charger 
Wired headset 
Quick start guides in Hindi and English 
Warranty card 
 
The Phone: 
It's a vibrant HD screen that's just the right size and has a clean, stock Android interface. Viewing angles are limited but I don't mind this because it means people can't peek around your shoulder. 
 
The phone feels premium to hold and processing power is good, so's the RAM and the phone barely lags (though it does occasionally slow down when changing apps). The matte back panel of the phone has an extremely pleasing texture but is also a smudge magnet. Also, no screen guard was provided in the box and none can be found on flipkart. 
 
Both these problems, however, are solved by the flip cover I purchased with the phone, which is even more premium. The thoughtfully located Moto logo has a depression perfect for my index finger, and the magnetic felt-lined cover will autolock or unlock and clean fingerprints on your phone when you flip it. 
 
The Cameras: 
No amount of smooth scrolling will make up for the halfpenny back camera and the severely inadequate 1.3 MP front camera. Although the camera is capable of shooting slo-mo videos (this is really, really cool), they are grainy and jerky. Movement in the video is not smooth and I can only put this down to low FPS. The camera is unusable in low light and is average at best in normal light. The LED flash is blinding. 
 
The Battery: 
Although it's too soon to say anything about battery life, from my estimates it should do 24 hrs on one full charge with moderate wifi and 3G use. 
 
The Accessories: 
Apart from the phone, everything in the box was majorly disappointing. The headphones feel cheap, sound substandard and are really not worth reviewing. No data cable was included in the box. Instead I received only a micro-usb wall charger. Hello, moto? 
 
UPDATE: I attempted to transfer files with several data cables on multiple computers and there is a glaring issue here: the phone does not stay connected for more than two minutes at a time. Windows Explorer hangs when i try to transfer multiple albums simultaneously as they take longer than 2 mins to transfer. When I first plug it into the PC it is recognised as device XT1033 but then 2 mins later it just drops off the PC and all transfers hang. Then I have to manually disconnect and reconnect the data cable, and I have another 2 minute window to transfer files before it drops off again. The phone is charging all this while, though. 
 
I am getting in touch with flipkart about this issue. 
 
UPDATE 2: I turned on USB debugging through the Developer Options and this has apparently resolved the connection-drop issue. No cause could be found for the issue I faced earlier. I will update if it returns. 
 
It is worth noting that the loudspeaker is incredibly powerful and distortion-free. The ear-speaker unit is also fairly loud and does the job. 
 
I had come to the comforting conclusion that 8 GB models were finally out of fashion - it's 2014. Evidently I was wrong. I strongly urge everyone to invest the extra 1.5k for a 16 GB model. 
 
I must also mention that the power button and volume rockers were crisp and responsive when the phone arrived but have become loose within 8 hours - what the hell? 
 
Price - 7/10 
Build quality - 8/10 
 
Pros: 
Solid build - water resistant, Corning Gorilla Glass 3 
Premium feel 
Excellent for everyday use 
Stock Android interface + 4.4 Kitkat update imminent 
Critically acclaimed price-point 
 
Cons: 
Mediocre cameras - both of em 
In-the-box accessories are worthless 
No screenguard included or available online, but problem solved by flipcover 
No expandable memory, though it supports OTG 
Motorola Device ID - the world renowned lost phone tracker - is not available in India 
 
Verdict: 
Worthy of the hype. Almost worth the price. One of the best deals under 15k.

It took me 6 tries to get to the payment page because by the time I would get there it would be sold out, and I'd have to refresh the product page. Then when I finally placed the order at around 1315 hrs, it kept alternating between &quot;payment succesfully completed&quot; and &quot;transaction incomplete&quot;. Then at 1350 hrs it finally stabilised to &quot;payment successfully completed&quot;. Then flipkart started adding random orders for the 8 GB version which I had never placed. These orders are still visible now in my track orders list, even though I never placed them. I received my phone the next day as per the guarantee.Hello Moto G !.I was one of the lucky few who were able to successfully order the 16GB model. I haven't seen a product on Flipkart getting sold out so quickly ( in half an hour!), especially on the day of the launch. 
 
Flipkart's delivery was exceptional as always and the product was delivered to me at noon today (7th February 2014, ie in 1 Day!) even though I opted for standard shipping. The box contains quick start guides (in Hindi and English), warranty card, wall charger, wired headset and of course, the stunning Moto G. An interesting observation is that the phone available in the US comes without the headset and the wall charger but instead, only has a USB cable. +1 to Motorola on giving extra stuff to Indian customers. 
 
Coming to the phone, not only does it have amazing hardware specs (kindly refer to the description on Flipkart, no point in repeating the same here) but it is very well designed too. The detailed observations are listed below - 
 
Design - 
The Moto G has a great design and the button placement is really good, with the lock/unlock button being easily accessible, irrespective of the hand in which it is being held. The rounded edges make it feel slimmer and at around 140 grams, it is certainly not the heaviest phone around. The most striking design feature is that it is difficult to to differentiate between the display and the bezel, making the front appear like it is 'monolithic', similar to the design of Nexus devices. 
 
Screen - 
The 720p IPS LCD display at 329 ppi is spectacular and the colours produced are vivid and the saturation levels are very good. The viewing angles are great and the unit I received did not contain any dead pixels, as reported by a few people. The presence of Gorilla Glass 3 serves as an icing on the cake, making the Moto have the best display in its class by far. 
 
Processor - 
Powered by a 1.2 Ghz quad core Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 chipset with Adreno 305, there is no compromise felt in performance. Opening and switching between apps is very fast and swiping across and pinching in and out on the screen is very responsive and no lag is felt whatsoever, thanks to the 1GB of RAM. Again, no phone in this price range stands a chance against the Moto. 
 
Operating System - 
The OS is almost stock Android in terms of the UI and Motorola has added a few of its applications like - 
1. Moto Assist (schedules tasks such as silencing the phone during a meeting or while sleeping), 
2. Moto Migrate (to transfer stuff from your old phone), 
3. Moto Device ID (to track the phone if it gets lost) etc. 
These apps are very useful and consume minimal resources and hence it is highly unfair to classify them as bloatware (as some people claim). 
The device runs Android Jelly Bean 4.3 and an upgrade to Kitkat (ie 4.4) is around the corner, which should improve performance further, adding more features at the same time. 
 
Camera - 
One of the most criticised features of this phone is undoubtedly the camera, which takes 5MP photos. However, when compared to my friend's Nexus 4 (which has an 8MP camera), the results were a pleasant surprise. 
We took photos of the same object at 1X zoom and on comparison, we agreed on the fact that the pics taken by the Moto G were on par with the Nexus 4, if not better, despite having the lower megapixel count. 
I also compared the camera with another friend's HTC Desire SV (8 MP). The Moto takes much better and sharper photos and makes the comparison feel unfair! 
This not only confirms claims that the Nexus 4 has a relatively poor camera but also proves that a higher megapixel count does not necessarily mean better photos. 
 
Battery life is supposed to be good although it is too early to reach a judgement. I will be subsequently updating this review with more information. 
 
I would recommend the 16GB model even though it is not in stock now since the phone storage cannot be expanded due to the absence of a micro sd card slot. Waiting for some time for the same would prove to be advantageous in the longer run. 
 
Overall, the device is the best phone in this price range by far, and is in fact better than many which cost more. If you are on the lookout for a phone in the sub 15K price range, look no further because it does not get better than this ...Wow!!!.That's the only word I came to mind when I got this wonderful piece in my hand. So, here are some useful points for new buyers: 
1) Display: Awesome, crisp, clear, vivid and beautiful. 
2) Speed and performance: Zero lag, lightening fast. Pure Android experience as expected from &amp; by Google. After the kitkat update, the performance is much better as kitkat is optimized for 512MB RAM phones. So, 1GB is more than enough here! Battery performs really well, goes for 1.5-2 days on one full charge with nominal usage. With heavy 3G usage, it goes for 1 day+. 
3) Call quality: No issues! Clean and clear! 
4) Build quality: just great, design is awesome. Its a joy holding this phone in your hand. Corning Gorilla glass 3 and water repellent coating makes the phone life proof. 
5) Camera: In this department, the phone is behind other phones which have 8MP cameras. But still, for a 5MP camera, it takes good photos in day light. But, its bad in dark. Flash is powerful. (Use droidlight by motorola app for using it as a torch) 
6)Storage: 16GB version gives you 12.xx GB for use, I feel its good enough for me. Also you may connect an USB/pen drive using the micro usb cable and watch movies/listen to songs. It works on kitkat also without any paid software, you just need a file manager (free). 
 
So, overall it's a thumbs up for this phone! 
 
PLEASE NOTE (For those who have queries): 
1)The service center names which flipkart is sending with the product are old ones, the latest ones can be viewed on in.motorola.com &gt; moto g &gt; customer service &gt; authorized service centers. 
2) Those who are complaining that the phone is not genuine : Motorola has officially launched the phone exclusively via flipkart (can be read on their fb, twitter pages), so you will surely get a genuine product. Also, on the moto g box it is written : Imported in India by Flipkart India. 
3) Some users are purposely trying to defame the moto g because lots of people are buying moto g which is available only on flipkart and this is not good for Indian companies and offline retailers. They are reposting the same review after deleting it. So, don't fall for such reviews. Motorola makes very high quality phones. 
4) Also, I read on review in which the person claims that his phone fell from 2.5 feet and his screen glass was broken which is completely fake. His phone must have fell on a very sharp and hard material or was smashed under something. Gorilla glass 3 is very sturdy it wont break that easily.. He just wants to have a refund/replacement for free. 
5) Regarding ringtones : Just install a file manager or use your pc and move the song (which u want to set as ringtone) in ringtones folder. 
6) SIM not detected after kitkat update: just reboot your phone. Motorola has said that they are bringing an update soon to fix this. 
7) Availability of stocks: The stocks have reached flipkart.com, but they will not update the status on buying page till all old orders are cleared. So have patience, you will get your moto-g soon. 
8) Unable to share mp3 files: this is another rumor spread by anti- moto g reviewers. I have shared audio files a lot of times using moto g. 
 
So, be care free and order it! It's the best phone ever under 20k. Ordered it at midnight 7 minutes after launch and also opted for the 1day guarantee. Flipkart really stood true to their word. My phone was delivered by noon on 7th Feb! So brownie points to Flipkart for their quick and awesome service. 
The phone itself is a lot better than I expected it to be. The black shell looks simply stunning. I also took advantage of the launch day offer and ordered a turquoise shell at 70% off! 
I have to tell you I was rather skeptic about the delivery as I had never ordered anything from Flipkart before and never bought anything costing over a 1000 bucks online. But Flipkart has earned my trust with their prompt service. 
So upon opening the package and unboxing, the first thing that'll hit you is the gleaming beauty of the screen. Also the build and the finish quality of the body is simply superb. Top notch work from Motorola. Quickly power it on and you'll notice its bright and clear HD display. That's the first thing you'll observe and the thing you'll love the most about this phone. The in-box accessories include a pair of headphones and a standard 0.5A wall charger (with attached cable as opposed to USB chargers we see these days). A USB data cable is NOT included in the box but you'll hardly need it. Also inside the box are a couple of manuals and a warranty book sorta thing. 
So far in my 3 days of usage, I have not even had slight glimpse of lag. So far i have installed around 15 apps. The device comes with Android 4.3 JellyBean out of the box and runs butter smooth. The update to KitKat is not yet available but once that's rolled out the performance will be further enhanced. The Motorola Migrate app came in very handy. With just a couple of taps, all the contacts, texts, call logs and all the media on the sd card of my old phone were quickly transferred on to the Moto G. The 16 GB device has around 12GB (12.32 GB to be precise) of user available memory out of the box. 
For all the entertainment purposes, the quad core processor coupled with the 1GB of RAM (882 MB actually) and the excellent display, gives a very satisfying experience. The speaker also gives out a rather loud output. It may not match neck to neck against the top tier phones available right now, but considering the price point, it isn't supposed to be compared with them. While the smaller games such as subway surfers run perfectly with no issues, I was amazed to note that a much more demanding game such as Riptide GP2 also runs with full graphic settings by default. Viewing angles are also great thanks to the IPS panel. I could not observe any change in colour even when looking at the screen from very wide angles. The music playback through the headphones is loud and clear but it left me wanting a little more. 
The camera as it was observed in several other reviews, is rather slow and I could not capture anything worthwhile in the first few clicks. The lens take more than usual time to focus on any subject and the whole camera feels very slow. But this quickly changed when i changed the tap to focus setting. The cam app gives you an on screen bracket that can be dragged around to control focus and exposure. Once you get a hang of this, the pictures you can capture improve drastically. This is by no means a great camera. The focus rate is still rather slow and low light pics tend to be a bit grainy but neither can it be written off as a very bad camera. Again considering the price and the remaining specs, the camera isn't as bad as it could've been. You won't really be cursing it once you get a hang of how it works. (Y) 
The front cam is good enough for video calling and selfies in good light. 
So far I have not noticed any signal drops and all the radios on the device seem to be doing their job just the way they are supposed to. 
I cannot comment on the battery life just yet but so far it has been holding up pretty well. I went on a clicking spree with the camera and kept it running for around 5 hours non-stop, clicking around 300 pics and a couple of videos, not to mention data usage and whatsapp at the same time. At the end of that the phone still had around 30% of charge left, so under average use, I'm sure it'll easily last over a whole day! 
All in all, the Moto G is a complete package that is offered, as Moto says, at an exception price. It is an incredible bargain and a joy to use. What Moto G really offers is a premium feel at a fraction of the price. 
So anyone who's thinking of picking this up, think no further my friend. Moto G is the answer to all your electronic needs ;)

I wish there was a negative rating i could give....Battery PROBLEM.Motorola isn't listening and this problem has been around for a while. After disconnecting usb or changing setting on / off on storage MTP, the battery immediately drops to 1%. 
This is happening in US,UK and India too. I got my phone 2 days back and tested and yes it does happen. The battery reading goes wrong once you enable / disable MTP, I'm using my phone on 1% battery level for 4-5 hours. Its still asking to plug charger coz battery is low but keeps working since battery is there, just indication is wrong. 
I'll just wait for battery to drop for real so it shuts down and then charge to 100% and maybe then it will start showing correct battery levels. [Update: The problem is due to some network problem. The calls which everyone knows fluctuate on the phone, the fluctuation is there and the voice quality also goes down coz of it. On my other phone - Micromax Canvas, there is no fluctuation. Please rate this review as helpful and don't buy the phone blindly till Micromax does something about it. You will regret buying when you have to charge the phone every 4-5 hours.]

No more stars till the issue is fixed. 
Oh and if you're wondering about the &quot;Ok google&quot; not working then set the language to English-US, not UK or India and then it will work. 
 
UPDATE: The battery is still not fixed. Enable / Disable MTP on any Moto G and the battery will drop to 1%. It shows 1% but it works for hours so just the display goes wrong.Moto G - Poor company do not Buy.Please never buy any Motorola product as the company has fully shutdown in India and is not functional. I bought a Motorola Phone Atrix 2 from Flipkart in November 2012, and suddenly one day the product developed a problem with the Screen, repeated hanging and network disconnections (in April 2013). I did not get proper support. 
 
My phone was kept in a third class Service Center that was authorized by Motorola for over 2 months. On calling Motorola and requesting for speeding up the process or at least provide me a spare handset, they refused outright. I tried with the Motorola India call center initially but I did not get any response. One of the call center executives on repeated requests gave me a Motorola Center Head's Phone Number (Based in Gurgaon), but after telling him the problem he did not even bother to pickup my call later. 
 
I called various branches of Motorola but did not recieve any kind of help. I even called Motorola International (US Branch) who told me that I need to contact Motorola India. However, when I called various Motorola centers in various parts of India (including Delhi, Chennai, Delhi) I learnt all their branches had been closed and whoever were remaining were tired of the company's strategy. Finally after 60 days I received my phone. However, the phone even when repaired was defective (switching off whenever it wants or going irresponsive whenever needed). I did not bother to get it repaired as I felt it wouldn't be of any use as THe company was anyway going to take 2-3 months. 
 
Even today the phone is not working properly and is completely defective. I was really surprised that Motorola has come back with another product to India, and do not be fooled into buying it. 
 
At that time when my phone was being serviced, since I was not getting proper responses, I felt like filing a Consumer Case suit with the local Consumer Courts in Bangalore. The Only reason why I did not File a Consumer Court Suit was because I felt that Motorola were not going to come to attend the case. 
 
Now I do not understand the Audacity of Motorola to come back to India and launch a product when they have so much of negative reviews especially. I would be happy if Motorola replaces my defective Phone, but I know that they would be saying that the product is out of warranty coverage to replace. I do understand this, but at the time of seeking help with the defective phone Motorola were not even present in India.Disappointment.Dear all,

                 From a disappointed customer.Motorola is Lenovo now.Motorola had pulled out from selling devices in India in 2013 under Google. This year it returns with Flipkart. (I am assuming the service requests will go to Fkart). So one should be aware that servicing the phone will go via FKart, and the other thing that Motorola is now sold to Lenovo, which should be an additional consideration. 
Coming to the phone 
Cons 
1. Definitely not a Phablet - It feels small 4.5&quot; only 
2. Not very fluid/responsive, similar to other mid-end phones 
3. Chipset is Qualcomm Snapdragon 400- Quad Core A7 - Similar to Mediatek's 6589, whose starting price for same specs is ~8k. So build quality makes is what makes up for remaining 5k price 
4. Battery is not user-replaceable. This is big deal for emerging market. And I foresee Fkart making tons-of money replacing batteries. 
5. Camera is useless 
 
Pros 
1. Cost is reasonable 
2. Build Quality is good. 
3. KitKat (however I am not hopeful that it will get next version after KitKat!) 
 
So-So 
1. Not a dual-sim fan 
2. 3G is decent 
3. Battery is decent 
4. 720p video is all you really need, as 1080p hogs space. 
 
I am giving 4 stars, as there's nothing else in the Android space which comes close to it in this price range.Workarounds for Moto G !.Usb drivers For our Moto G can be downloaded from Motorola support. 
 
1) how to access storage? 
=&gt; connect through any microusb data cable (galaxy fit data cable worked 
 
for me), if its not detected automatically, goto settings&gt;storage&gt;click on 
 
upper right corner and tick MTP. 
 
2) how to add songs? 
=&gt; just connect ur device to pc and place ur mp3 files in &quot;music&quot; folder 
 
only..custom folder name will not work. you can access this songs through 
 
play music app. 
 
3)how to add custom ringtone? 
=&gt; if you have custom ringtones in ur previous smartphone then just use 
 
motorola migrate, it will do it automatically OR just place ur custom 
 
ringtones in folder (media&gt;audio&gt;ringtones). u can place notifications tones 
 
also, just create notifications folder in audio and paste in it. U can now set 
 
any tone as ur ringtone through sound menu. 
 
4) Kitkat update through usb cable? 
=&gt; Yes u can ! if you don't have a Wifi connection or laptop (to use ad-hock 
 
network), then u can update with &quot;Motorola Device Manager&quot;. Get it from 
 
motorola site and install on pc. Plug your device and it will update ur device 
 
through internet. 
 
5) how to redeem Google Drive offer. 
=&gt;open google drive app and goto menu&gt;take tour, at last you can redeem it 
 
with signing in. 
 
6) LED notification not working 
=&gt;This happens if u have restored data from ur previous phone which did not 
 
have LED. Motorola released a widget called Notification Light Widget. 
 
Stick it on your home screen, use it to enable the LED, and then you can get 
 
rid of it. 
 
7) Poor audio quality of headphones 
=&gt; Guys u r using a cheap headphone that was provided within package..Go 
 
for a standard decent headphone. The problem is not with Moto G its due to 
 
cheap headphones. You also have equaliser to tweak, Go to Settings &gt; Sound 
 
&gt; Audio Effects and customise as per ur need. 
 
8) Moto G won't charge or battery drops suddenly 
=&gt; If you let your Moto G hit zero and it won&rsquo;t come back to life, try letting 
 
it cool down for a while, then plug in a charger and leave it for 20 minutes or 
 
so before holding down the power key for 20 seconds. If not worked U r 
 
probably dealing with a defective piece, get a replacement. 
 
9) Long time to charge a battery 
=&gt; 3 hrs is a standard time for Moto G to charge fully. It will decrease as 
 
battery life decreases. If you want to charge faster then u can buy custom 
 
charger rated between 500mA and 1.5A &ndash; the higher the rating, the faster it 
 
will charge. 
 
10) APN settings/2G,3G not working 
=&gt; Motorola G is unable to detect APN settings itself. So u have to manually 
 
set APNs. For that goto settings&gt;dual sim settings&gt;Ur sim name&gt;APNs&gt; 
 
now add new and edit settings (search on google for APN settings), now 
 
SAVE it and tick blue dot. Restart and ur done ! 
 
11) Developer menu (caution !) 
=&gt; u can activate developer menu by tapping 4-5 times on settings&gt;about 
 
phone&gt;&quot;Build number&quot; This is for developers only as name suggest. If u 
 
don't know anything about it, then u should leave it as it is. 
 
12) Camera not opening/camera error 
=&gt; well at this time you can't do anything except restarting your moto g,and it will work. It's a bug and it will be fixed soon. 
 
Moto G is beautiful smartphone..Loved it so much.Moto G 16GB XT-1033, Product Details &amp; Initial Impressions..Hey Flipkarters! 
 
I received my Moto G on the 8th Feb 2014 afternoon (Instead of the expected delivery date of 17th Feb as per the mail received) - Kudos to the Flipkart team on achieving this feat. 
 
Box Contents: I will write about the contents at first; due to the fact that many of you guys are impatiently waiting for someone to give you some useful info about the product. 
 
Be Warned: Impatient readers may get frustrated about my over-detailing stuff, but I'm gonna risk it anyways. 
 
The Package contained a relatively small retail box. On opening the Non-sealed box i found the Handset with a screen protector with the Moto logo etched on it. 
- Further i found a white Micro-USB wall charger and a white non in-ear Headphone with built in mic and a call pick&amp;drop button. 
- Along with that we also get the standard set of quick start guides. 
Guys don't panic at the missing seal. As far as my sources, they confirmed receipt of the retail package sans-the-seal all around the globe. 
There is no data sync cable included in the box which is kind of a let-down but who cares? We all have 2-3 of them lying around unused in some corner anyways. 
The Headphones are just there i guess due to the manufacturer's belief that the Indian market would be furious without it so do not expect anything fancy and use your current one instead. 
 
First Impressions: 
Another warning: I'm not comparing this phone to any other phone in the world. So if any of you are expecting a comparison I suggest you look elsewhere. 
- After admiring the above average build quality, I decided leaving the phone to charge up-to 100% while at work. I switched it on and immediately struck a wow factor viz., A stunning display. 
- Mind you, the Power Lock button and the Volume rockers may seem wobbly and over-protruding at first but give an excellent click and are easier to access. 
- The back cover feels like a super smooth rubberized-finish which is highly flexible and removing it seems to be a bit tricky. Just as I wrote the above sentence I received the Vivid Red Flip Shell which is of premium quality. 
- The Processor is quite fast and has handled multitasks without any visible hiccups. The User available RAM on my phone is around 900 MB out of which 250+ of it is free every-time i check under normal use. 
- The Speaker on this phone is LOUD when kept on full volume but is marginally low if you just minus it by just one click (This is weird). 
- The call quality on this phone is quite good and not as bad as the Global edition GeekyRanjit was reviewing. The Speaker was loud enough and the person at the other end said my voice was very audible. 
- The Music experience with stock headphones is bland and therefore again recommend using other headphones. Interestingly i found that Moto has in-built Audio Effects service which keeps running on the background. Good to know that Moto is not just manufacturing and dumping phones on the users rather; they're working on the software too. 
- The Camera is of average quality but at the same time is a bit slow at saving the image. To properly capture an image without blur, you need to have steady hands. The LED flash is Ridonkulously bright and has the capacity to temporarily render the subject blind for a few seconds! The secondary camera is good enough for Skype video calls. 
- The Battery for the first time lasted me for a good 15 hours out of which 9+ hours have been continuous usage with music, radio, app installs and general usage with WiFi connection and still had around 9% juice left when i finally decided to connect it to the wall charger. 
Please note: I haven't used data connection on either 2G or 3G network simply because i have access to WiFi both at work as well as home, therefore rendering data connection useless &amp; an expense for the sake of expense. 
The lack of user replaceable battery does not bug me much. 
 
I Cannot put more info on this page since i have so much to explore and have run out of the 5000 character mark, therefore will come into an initial conclusion on this device (People who have been patiently reading me will breath a huge sigh of relief :D ) 
 
I Rate this Device somewhere between 4.5-4.75 out of 5 considering the price point of this entry level Moto phone. Since neither of the above values can be entered i have given it a 5 Star rating. 
 
And as far as Flipkart Rating goes, for this particular purchase I would have rated them a 10 out of 5 ( If it were possible) Due to the fact that even after two of my user-changed orders (yes,of the Moto G!). They have delivered my order 9 days prior to the promised-postponed delivery date. Which i believe is quite impressive for any online shopping website! Thank you Flipkart, looking forward for more service from you guys! 
 
Thank you guys for patiently reading this.

About the phone: 
 
&quot;IT IS AMAZING&quot;. I would rate it the best under 30K. It is comparable to some of the high end phones we have in the market. If your budget is 25-30 K, go spend that additional 11K on a decent camera as that is the only thing not so good about Moto G. 
 
Things you will like: 
- Nexus like experience @ such less price 
- Very nice to hold 
- Seamless Android operation 
- I use an S4 and I was surprised how fast you can zoom into the maps! 
- 50 GB Cloud storage (quite nice!) 
- Transferring contacts, media, files, applications from your old android phone to the new one with such ease! 
- Good call quality 
- Sharp display (sharper than 5s) 
- Some real cool features: Moto ID that enables you to lock your phone, trace the location and delete contents remotely if your phone gets stolen; and Assist feature to ensure noone disturbs you when your sleeping and when you have an scheduled meeting (Smart!) 
 
Things you may not like: 
- Doesn't 'look' like a high end phone (but then its a 14K phone!) 
- Kitkat not available yet 
- Limited storage may be a problem for some. For wifey 12+GBs is more than sufficient 
- Camera is quite disappointing. You really wouldn't want to use it much unless you are left with no other option. 
 
I can't say much about battery backup as it has been less than a day since I received it. 
 
Overall, I can't think of a better phone within 25-30K with such good hardware and seamless software performance. I agree some people weigh camera performance high, but for me I didn't expect a 14K phone to have a great camera either.

 So guys close your eyes and go for it..Excellent phone.Hello, 
 
The phone is excellent in all respects. I've used it for the past 2 weeks and I can't find a single thing I'd like to change about it. Kitkat update came a couple of days back, and the battery is even better since then. 
 
Build: Neat, simple. Back cover fits very snugly and has no wiggle room. Only physical buttons are power and volume rocker, both feel just right to use. 
 
Screen: Excellent. I watched Top Gear on it, works great. 
 
Processor: Loads up 3 hour HD movies without a stutter. I've had atleast 10 apps running with no problem switching between any of them. 
 
Battery: Currently I am on 18% battery and I havent charged for 1 day and 11 hours. My usage in that period has been: Wifi for 10 hours, calls - 1 hour, data - about 1 hour. I'm sure you can make it through the day comfortably with heavier usage. 
 
Android: I like the so-called Vanilla flavour. Works fast and is damn smooth on this phone. 
 
Price: Can't be beaten. 
 
Have a nice day!RIP Galaxy core, Canvas HD, XOLO Q1000s, Gamers should buy 16GB version..This is a real game changer that a brand can actually sell a IPS HD phone at 12.5k, sounds like a joke to Samsung fans as their blind eye doesn't favor other things. This masterpiece puts Galaxy core, Xperia M to shame at once. I have always been a fan of Motorola since the times of Motorola L series phones:L6, L7. 
Believe me people, this is a steal at 12.5 K and getting a cash back becomes a cherry on the top.

Quality: &quot;Excellence doesn't demand a high price. &quot; Enough to describe it in terms of quality. 
-&gt;The 4.5 inch 720p offers 329 pixel per inch clarity that is slightly over the I phones display clarity. 
-&gt;Snapdragon 400 Chipset along with cortex-A7 quad-core processor is something seen in grand 2 (22,900/-). It scores 16,200 in antutu while 6140 in quadrant. 
-&gt;Build quality is superb, a lot better than samsung phones. 
-&gt;720p recording with HDR on, camera does a good job as well. 
-&gt;E-compass something that Micromax and XOLO phones don't have, it helps in better GPS experience especially when you drive. 
-&gt;It offers update to Android 4.4 (In UK Moto g has received it) and galaxy core runs android 4.1.2 and xperia m is on android 4.2.2. 
-&gt;Dual-SIM is really a benefit. 
 
Those who say don't compare it with samsung or LG or anything as they are their own kind:- &quot;A Smartphone is a Smartphone and other android phones don't offer any out of the world experiences. Everything comes at a price and the comparison of it with others even if it hurts is legit. &quot; 
 
When you judge this phone as compared to others just keep in mind the 12,500 price tag. It's your choice at the end. And if you are a gamer, please get some more bucks as you will need additional storage in case you want to hold high-end games in your device as 16-GB version is a must in that case.

Rating is not for product , its for flipkart!My review on this phone.Delivery : I'd booked this phone on the 8th of February when Flipkart had started the reservations for this phone and i got it on 19th of February , faster than i expected!! 
 
Looks : The phone looks elegant and unique , it has a classy look and the display is just the right size, anything bigger than this would just be too big and that's something I personally don't like! 
 
Memory : I ordered the 16 gb version and i got 12 GB of free space after the pre-installed apps and a 1 gb ram which works swiftly without lagging 
 
You don't have to worry about your data that you have on your old phone , it can be easily transferred using Moto Migrate , it moves your media , messages and even call logs to your new phone , unfortunately it doesn't move contacts , so make sure you copy your contacts to your sim or take a back up online before getting a micro-sim for your phone! 
Oops ! one more point you need to cut your Normal sim to a micro sim in order to put it in this phone and that is something that i didn't know when i bought it , but thats not an issue because you can get it done at any of the mobile stores , service centers or sim card shops. 
 
You get 15 gb memory on Google Drive , i don't know much about the 50 GB storage that Motorola has promised to its users because i haven't got it so far. 
 
Camera : The camera quality is average , not too great , if your looking for a phone with a good camera then you'd rather want to go for Nokia Lumia , but they don't have a huge app store so you'll have to compromise somewhere. 
 
Call Quality : The call quality is good enough and i have no complaints with it. 
 
Display:The display is much better than a Nexus or an iPhone , 329 pp for a 4.5 inch screen is definitely sharp and this is the strongest point in this phone. 
 
Battery Life : I have only used the phone for 2 days so far and it has always been in my hand since the last 48 hours ( except when i was asleep ) and the battery lasted for 20 hours leaving me with approx 20% battery when i put it to charge again. 
 
Games : I have downloaded temple run , subway surfer and a few other games so far and they work like a charm , absolutely no lag. 
 
Music / Video : The earphones provided are not that great , i'm sure you would want to use better earphones with this beautiful phone! 
 
Overall it's a great buy at 14k and honestly much better than buying a nexus 4 or iPhone 4s @ this price. 
 
Go for it ... buy this one!

Amazing shipping service by Flipkart. Kudos. 
 
Since I bought this phone I have been trying to ride the RAM to check its limits, just as I have done with the battery. I was amazed that with super heavy usage (screen always on to do something or the other), it managed to stay charged for about a day. With medium usage, the batter lasts about a day and a half. 
 
The optimisation of the RAM usage is comparable to the Nexus in that it is super fast, even with 5 different applications running simultaneously. No lag whatsoever. 
 
The 5 megapixel camera gives good quality pictures in daylight and moderately good photos under low light conditions. However, the camera speed (seconds to click and save a pic) is not good, and it takes one 3 to 4 seconds to click two pics simultaneously. The shutter speed also leaves something to be desired. While still objects can be clicked with precision, movement is not captured well at all. 
 
The screen resolution and brightness is amazing, and the sound quality is also amazing. The earphones may be a little uncomfortable in the ear. 
 
The body of the phone is sturdier than the other phones in this segment, and the gorilla glass screen also helps with the same. 
 
When I was looking for a phone, I wanted one that would last me 2 years, and my biggest issue was that with a 1GB RAM, it might not last 2 years. But the superior optmisation of the Moto G combined with the other features and the low cost made this the phone for me.Not much left to say!.Hi everyone, 
 
Most of the other reviews here on Flipkart and others all over the internet have already reviewed this product in great detail. By now we know that this amazing product from Google-Motorola packs in some out-of-the-mid-range-world specs and is snappy and stutter free. It's another most stunning feature is it's crisp and breathtaking display. In this review, I would like to focus on some not-so-talked about features of this phone. By the way, I am using an Indian unit provided by Flipkart on Feb 21, 2014 (I had reserved mine on Feb 11, 2014). 
 
1. Amazing ergonomic design - The curved convex body, matte-rubber back cover and dimpled moto logo all integrate to provide a premium feel to the one holding the device. 
 
Camera slot is a bit disappointing in terms of design. I am finding myself touching the camera lens time and again due to it's placement in the center. 
 
2. Vanilla Android OS - Bloatware free operating system is a trademark of Google. This phone being launched by Google-Motorola (I know Moto has been acquired by Lenovo now) is no exception. A clean bloat-app free system makes way for a lag free android experience. For those worried about future updates, always keep in mind that although Moto is no longer a Google company, Moto g is, and will always be a Google-Moto product. I waited for a few hours before updating the phone to Kitkat and it's worth it. 
 
3. Long-ish power cord - While lack of a USB-microUSB cable is a clear disappointment in India, the power-microUSB cord feels sturdy and long. This is usually absent in other high profile smartphones. 
 
4. Loud and crisp loudspeaker - The speaker output is as stunning as the display. 
 
5. Battery life - Although the battery is not out of this world, and fails in terms of capacity (mAH) comparison with other beasts, the vanilla android OS makes way for less drain and hence better battery experience. 
 
6. Decent front-facing-camera - I wanted a device for skype chat with my family while I am in the UK, this device gives a clear video chat experience. 
 
Finally, keep it up Flipkart, you are doing an amazing job!Review after a week's usage!.This phone is simply awesome for its price, and its quality. 
 
LOOKS: It looks very good, and doesn't look like a budget phone. 
 
SCREEN: Screen is in one word - outstanding. Too sharp and very clear. Pixels not visible to naked eye - which translates to a clear and sharp picture quality. Blacks are deep. 
 
CALLS: Very good, no issues faced. 
 
CAMERA: Its good, but not upto the mark. Images are bit grainy when zoomed in even a little. But overall its ok for this price bracket. 
 
SOFTWARE: Android 4.3 in the box, immediately upgraded to 4.4.2. Performance is very good, no lags encountered. All apps and games run very smoothly. Also everyone envies the fact that this phone has Android 4.4.2 whereas their more expensive phones has 4.2 and lower etc. :D 
 
BATTERY: It is just superb. Got more than 2 days without recharging. (with medium use of WiFi and 3G). 
 
SPEED: It is really fast, and has absolutely no lags. 
 
MEMORY: Better to go for 16Gb model. Also supports USB OTG, so no problem. 
 
Once you get this in your hands you will be satisfied with this. 100% sure! I recommend the Moto G instead of going for all other phones between 14k to 28k. Feels and behaves like a mini Nexus. :) 
Above 29k - go for a Nexus 5.

Keep up the good work. :)The ultimate budget beast.I've been using the 16 GB Moto G for around 15 days now and my review is based on the same. It's slightly lengthy but it'll help clear a lot of doubts regarding the phone. 
 
Before I detail the pros and cons, I'm writing a few tips to help people- 
 
Tips- 
 
1)In case you allow the phone's battery to completely drain and then the phone does not come on after charging, it does not mean your phone is faulty! 
It's a failsafe built in by Motorola. 
Solution- 
Leave the phone in a cool, dry place-like Oregano ;-)- for a few hours and then try to power on by holding the power button for 20+ seconds. 
Refer to xdadevelopers.com for more. 
 
2)To improve the camera, do consider apps like PicsArt, Instagram, Camera FX. 
Of course these add effects more than anything but the photos look better. 
 
3)To further extend the battery life, download an app called Greenify and greenify the apps you don't use regularly. No need for other battery saving software. 
 
4) To play every format of video and audio, download MX Player. 
 
Now coming to the pros. 
Pros- 
 
1) Build Quality- Brilliant. 
The matte rubberised back really helps grip and the phone feels premium at this price, not cheap and plasticky. 
You might find the volume rocker and power buttons to be a bit loose but that's perfectly normal. 
 
2)Screen- A 720p screen at this price is unheard of. 
Most of the new offerings in mwc 2014 viz. xperia m2, lg l90, lg f70 all have similar specs as the Moto g but with qHD screens i.e. 540x960 resolution. That means much lesser ppi. 
 
3)Speakers- The sound output is really brilliant especially with the bundled equaliser software. Best bass on any phone I've ever used. 
 
4)Speed- The phone is blazing fast thanks to a combination of stock android, a quad core Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 and 1 GB Ram. 
You never feel as if the processor is old, even though it is. 
 
5)Battery Life- The battery life is brilliant. 
I easily manage to churn out at least 36 hours on moderate use and at least 14 hours on heavy use including gaming, browsing, facebook, whatsapp with screen on continuously. 
 
 Cons- 
 
1)Camera- It says 5 megapixel but it performs far worse than my galaxy s advance which also has a 5MP camera. 
Download some softwares mentioned in the tips to improve performance here. 
 
2)The volume and power buttons might appear loose. Refer to Tips on how to deal with it. 
 
3)Storage- Always go for the 16 GB model as the 8GB one gives you just 4 GB user available memory. 
 
4)Service Centres- There is a list of service centres available on in.motorola.com--&gt;Moto G--&gt;Customer Support--&gt;Service Centres. 
The ones given by Flipkart.com might be old in some cases and have wrong phone numbers. 
 
5) Accessories- I urge you to buy the Moto G Flip shell but only if you have the first day buyer offer. 
Rs 1600 is way too much for a flip cover otherwise but it adds brilliant protection to your phone. 
 
Now I'll compare the Moto G with some of the new phones released in Mobile World Congress 2014 yesterday that overcome the shortcomings of the moto G. There is no word on their pricing yet though although they are expected to be more expensive. 
 
Moto G vs Xperia M2 vs LG L90 
 
1) Processor- Same Snapdragon 400 in all cases 
Winner- Tie 
 
2) Display- Moto G has a 720 p display on a 4.5 inch screen. 
Xperia M2 has a qhd display on a 4.8 inch screen. 
Lg L90 has a 4.7 inch display on a qhd screen. 
 
Winner- Moto G for resolution. 
Xperia M2 for screen size( if you prefer bigger phones) 
 
3) Storage- Moto G= 8/16 GB non user expandable memory. 
Xperia M2- 8GB, upto 32 GB user expandable memory. 
Lg L90- 8 Gb, expandable memory upto 32 GB. 
 
Winner= LG L90/ Xperia M2 for giving expandable storage 
 
4) Camera- Moto G has a 5 MP back camera and a 1.3 MP front camera. 
Xperia M2- 8MP back camera with Sony Sensor, front camera(MP not known yet) 
LG L90- 5MP back camera, 1.3 MP front 
 
Winner- Xperia M2 
 
5) Build quality- Moto G has a rubberised matte back and great build quality. 
Xperia M2 has a design very similar to xperia Z2 so you get the flagship design for 2014. 
LG L90- Plasticky design with metal strip running around, similar to Samsung phones, but a little better. 
 
Winner- Xperia M2/Moto G (it's personal preference really) 
 
6) Battery- Moto g has a 2070 mAh non user removable battery. 
Xperia M2 has a 2440 mAh user removable battery. 
Lg L90 has a 2300 mAh battery. 
 
Winner- Xperia M2, especially with Sony's power saving software. 
 
Ultimate verdict- The Moto G is the best phone you can buy. 
It has a few flaws which have been overcome by the new phones but both the Xperia M2 and the LG L90 won't launch before April at least in the Indian market. 
They are expected to be priced higher but of course you get a better camera, better battery life, user removable battery and expandable storage. 
 
The choice is yours.

You survived these many days without the Moto-G right, you can easily live a few more days without it!REDEFINING WHAT A CHEAP SMARTPHONE CAN BE !.The Moto G Is One Of The Best Phones I.ve Used. On paper it&rsquo;s competitive with many devices ranging around 30000-40000 bucks, and performance is stunning &mdash; unheard of at this price range. From afar its clean design begs to be picked up, but it doesn&rsquo;t quite offer the same reassuring quality you&rsquo;ll get from more expensive devices. It&rsquo;s a device thats aspirational yet affordable &mdash; which makes the Moto G a winner. 
 
At 14000, it&rsquo;s pitted against a sorry band of phones impossible to recommend to all but your most mortal enemies. The experience offered by Motorola here is almost incomparable to the Ashas,Blackberrys and Micromax phones out there. Bring Windows Phone into the equation and it&rsquo;s admittedly a slightly different story, as Microsoft and Nokia have worked hard &mdash; far harder than Google &mdash; to make sure Windows Phone runs smoothly on low-end devices. 
 
There&rsquo;s something reassuring about Nokia&rsquo;s dense little Lumia 520, and if build quality is more important to you than performance and apps, Nokia&rsquo;s handset is worth a look. To me, though, the 520 just isn&rsquo;t in the same league. It&rsquo;s a little sad that, at this price range, users will have to choose between top-notch build quality and raw speed, with the combination of both saved for ultra-expensive smartphones like the iPhone 5S, HTC One, and Lumia 1020. 
 
The Moto G is a very solid phone. All of its issues, like a mediocre camera, and limited on-board storage, can and will be overlooked at this price. For years, Samsung, LG, HTC, and other Android manufacturers have generally been putting a 15000 Rs price tag on junk like the pitiful Galaxy Fame. Yes, compromises have been made to get the Moto G down to 14000, and I&rsquo;d like to see a manufacturer put a half-decent camera on a cheap phone. But this phone truly redefines what a low-end smartphone can be, and is the best attempt yet to turn &ldquo;the next billion&rdquo; into smartphone users.I gave up my Nexus 5 for this phone!!!.and boy am I pleased!!! 
 
Background: I consider myself a very techie person, I have had all Nexus devices till now with some trials with karbonn. I was very happy with my Nexus 5 from LG. But as the need for dual sim arrived I had to find a decent phone. When Moto G was announced, I was really impressed by the Spec Sheet and made my mind up to buy one just for buying it. 
 
Pros: 
A. Many specs sheet don't mention the following two items which have made me really happy after noticing them on the phone. 
1. Notification LED, there is a white notificaiton LED on the top side of the phone 
2. Noise Cancellation Mic: There is one right next to the 3.5mm audio out port. This was a surprise as no spec sheet mentions this. 
 
B. The phone does provide a bit of weight in your hand, so you feel like you are using something of quality. 
C. The way it slips into the pocket is amazing. If you put it with the screen inwards, the curvy bulge fits well which somehow makes me happy about putting the phone in my pocket. Feels like it is hugging me. :D 
D. It is as responsive as my Nexus 5, the flappy bird game is smoother than Nexus 5 
E. It is quite small and cute device that fits in your hand well, the dimple on the back is nice to play with while holding the phone 
F. Speakers are loud enough and the call quality is prime, as good as nexus 5 and definitely better than Karbonn S5, something one would expect from Motorola 
G. The LED Torch on the back is decent and can blind you if you stare at it :D 
H. Touch is responsive and this is probably the smoothest Jelly Bean phone I have used. 
I. The camera is OK, not absolutely great, but does its part. It does have a slow motion video capture feature which is something I'd like to try out more. Camera software from Motorola is pretty intuitive 
J. There are additional software added to an almost stock android OS like Motorola Assist, Migrate, Care, Contextual Services, Boot Services, and FM radio that really stand apart and make this phone that much better from the Software side. 
1. Assist has some unique features that puts the phone in sleep mode during specified timings and stops unimportant calls. Important calls made within 5 minutes come through. Putting the phone in silent mode when your calendar has a meeting, etc. 
2. Migrate can get your information from your older phone 
3. This is by far the best FM radio app I have seen on android. 
 
Cons: 
The screen density can be a bit of an issue, as icons and text might look smaller, but you do get a lot of screen area 
The volume and power buttons jiggle ever so slightly, which might degrade over time, but not at the moment 
No NFC, would have been perfect as Metro will be using NFC for ticketing 
 
Overall: 
 
Must have phone if you want dual SIM or Latest version of android or excellent radio reception, great value for money. Not even once have I missed my Nexus 5!!!Product is Awesome... Flipkart messed up the distribution part.Product is awesome. No words for the joint creation of Google and Motorola.

Cons 
1. No usb cable included (charger included does not include a detachable cable) 
2. Service centres available in only metrosA fantastic phone!.An excellent device. You may buy this without a second thought. I usually research and window-shop for at least a couple of months, but this is the first phone I've purchased on an impulse! 
 
Even when I had absolutely no intention of buying the Moto G, I was disappointed that it went out of stock so soon on the launch day! I happened to notice it back in stock in the afternoon, but was able to get only the 8GB (~5.5GB usable). I was initially not very convinced with the internal storage and thought I'll eventually cancel the order and wait for the 16GB, but I held on, secretly wishing for a 100% cash back amongst other goodies. I however got the other launch day offers for clothing and e-books, and purchased a royal blue back cover for Rs.270. 
 
The pure Android OS is slick and snappy, showing no signs of any lag whatsoever, and is actually addictive to the point where I sometimes switch on the display just to toggle through the homescreens and launcher! The experience is simply superb! 
 
After two weeks of usage, I have all but forgotten that I do not have much internal storage left. This is such a beautifully crafted piece! I am pretty sure I'll move all photos to the 65GB Google Drive, keep ~2GB of mp3s, and small games. I use the phone mostly for browsing, texting, social networking, light gaming, phone calls, YouTube, Skype, Viber etc,. I do not mind the non-expandable internal storage, but it would have been nice to have a micro SD slot. 
 
The Jellybean install had a small bug with the volume control. It would remain low till about 90% and then get very loud in the last 10% or so. This issue is resolved post installing KitKat, and the volume increase is now gradual. 
 
After I upgraded to KitKat, the battery dropped from 62% to 42% after the initial reboot! The backup seems to have stabilised after a factory reset and a few days of usage, and hopefully it will continue to remain an 'all day battery'. 
 
Mounting storage through OTG reportedly works well on the Indian Moto G with 4.4.2, as demonstrated by user 'Geekyranjit' on his YouTube channel. I haven't tried this yet, but I am planning to buy a cable or an OTG pen drive. 
 
The HD display is crisp and stunning. You will want to watch movies on this thing! Watching HD videos from YouTube is mind blowing, but I do this only while on WiFi as the data usage is heavy for such content. Small text is legible and very clear. Corning Gorilla Glass 3 is very thin, so the screen is almost close to the glass, making it all the more beautiful! 
 
The build quality is great and the phone feels very premium! The phone feels slim and sufficiently weighted and it literally slips into the pocket. The volume and power buttons rattle a bit, but provide nice tactile feedback. The back cover is difficult to take off, but there is a one minute video by user 'himesh123456789' on YouTube that demostrates how to do this easily. 
 
The non removable battery is fine. Due to long backup, expect lesser charging cycles and hence longer battery life. Keep the phone charged at 45-90% with regular top-ups to prolong its life. Never deep cycle (0-100%) your smartphone battery often, except when there is a need to calibrate, as doing so will reduce its service life. There is no 'memory effect', so you can charge at random. 
 
The camera isn't the best, but it does the job. The secondary cam is decent. The LED bulb is very bright and lights up a fairly large area. 
 
The loudspeaker is very shrill, and extremely loud! This is important in noisy environments where one can miss hearing a ringtone. Music is surprisingly crisp and the tiniest of details are audible.The treble is extreme, but the bass is low. One should refrain from keeping the volume at 100% while playing media, as the speaker tends to crackle and distort. 95% is the sweet spot for clean maximum volume. Audio quality through headphones is alright. 
 
Call quality is nice. Voice is clear and reception is neat. The earpiece is sufficiently loud. WiFi and 3G connectivity is good and I haven't faced any connection drops till now. The browsing experience is smooth. Kinetic scrolling and zoom work perfectly. 
 
The bundled accessories aren't of the best quality and the headphones just add up to the pile of unused wired hands-free devices lying around since the first Nokia days. The all white charger looks neat but comes with an awkward looking two pin, like it was put together in a hurry for the Indian retail packaging. I would've personally preferred to have the standalone USB cable like the one bundled with the US version, but I already have a tough Sony Ericsson cable and charger that came with the st15i. A micro USB wall charger is however a welcome addition to the collection in some ways, so one can be kept plugged in at home, one in office, one in the travel bag, etc,. 
 
All in all, a nice package! A purchase that would bring you up to date with the flagship smartphone experience, for a fraction of the price.Moto G - Supersmooth Superfone.Hi Guys, 
 
I have had this phone for 48 hours now. Got it delivered at 50% charged which lasted for close to 28 hours with constant FBooking, Whatsapping, 2-3 hours of continuous music play and the regular fiddling around. So now you can judge the battery power yourself. 
 
Coming to the phone itself, following are my observations: 
1) Feels heavy given its medium size. 
2) Back cover is NOT sturdy. Texture is good. 
3) No explicit Reboot phone option on pressing power button. There are other ways though. 
4) You cannot modify home-screens. 
5) Usable storage ~ 12.5 GB 
6) I installed Facebook, Whatsapp and 1TapCleaner Pro. Copied 30 mp3 songs on the device. Available Storage now has come down to 11.5 GB. RAM used is 558 MB and Free RAM is 324 MB. The device still is running superfast. 
7) The touch is amazing. Much better than the Samsungs Galaxy Grand. Comparable to an iPhone. 
8) Audio quality (System and Media) is very good. 
9) In-call volume is also very good. 
10) Display is really impressive. The images look crystal clear and are very sharp. 
10) Camera is poor. The processing i.e. clicking of pictures, browsing the gallery is pretty fast BUT the picture quality is BAD in low light. 
11) No SD card and ONLY Micro Dual-SIM. 
12) Activated a 3G data plan and the internet works super fast. Even the WiFi at home was great. 
13) Kitkat 4.4.2 NOT yet available in India. 
 
Other Moto G users may agree/disagree with my views so To Buy or Not to buy is at your sole discretion. I am happy with my device.Excellent value for money.Placed the order for Moto G on 6th Feb around 11:30 PM and it was delivered to me by 2:30 PM on 8th of Feb. This was crazy fast service by Flipkart. Kudos. Although the availability of 16 GB would have been fantastic, I settled for the 8GB version. (When we placed order 16GB version was already out of stock.) 
 
I use a nexus 4 (16GB), which in my mind was great value for money. We bought this phone for my wife. Now about the phone. 
 
Memory(Storage): 
8GB may be less, out of which only 5GB is usable. Again, our usage did not warrant for 16GB but many people who want to store lot of data (pics/videos/songs/movies) and are always on move should certainly go for 16GB version. 
 
Memory(RAM): 
1GB is quite okay. Although compared with nexus its just half, but again consider the price you are paying. so far, we never felt the like running short of RAM. there is always some memory left. 
 
Screen: 
4.5 inch screen is ample enough for activities like watching videos, browsing websites, reading etc while at the same time convenient to be operated by just one hand. Touch sensitivity is quite good and phone is pretty responsive. Colors are pretty amazing. 
 
Handling: 
Very sweet phone. It's thin and provides good grip. camera's at just right places. 
 
Camera: 
Picture quality is not fantastic and I could not find photo sphere which I was expecting in this phone. It's certainly not the strong feature of the phone. 
 
Software: 
The greatest part is pure android experience without any nonsense software and no samsung like childish fonts and color schemes. Just loved that. 
 
Sim: 
It's dual sim and frankly we did not want a dual sim phone. Looks like micro sim is becoming a standard these days so be ready with a micro sim. I am yet to get the replacement sim or cut the existing sim as I did not know it has just the micro sim slots. 
 
Radio: 
Nice addition is radio (which was not there is nexus 4). 
 
Connectivity: 
Data cable is missing from the package. I was surprised to know that. Anyways usually everyone has a data cable these days. 
 
To conclude, this phone is totally worth the money while providing superior quality.  1. 3-axis Accelerometer 
 2. 3-axis Magnetic field sensor 
 3. AK8963 Orientation sensor 
 4. CT406 Proximity sensor 
 5. CT406 Light sensor 
 6. Display Rotation sensor 
All work perfectly in tandem without any issues. Play games, Use apps, all work perfectly.. 
Using Google Maps have never been so accurate. 
 
Codecs: There are around 44 codecs available which almost covers the entire gamut of video and audio players.
