Sandip PatilA High-End Smartphone @ Dirt Cheap Price!.The Moto G has sparked a revolution in the Indian Market with its high end features and really affordable price! The specs of this device are stunning, keeping the price factor in mind. I mean HD display with Gorilla Glass 3 backed with a 1.2 GHz quad core Snapdragon 400 processor and an Adreno 305 GPU (450MHz) @13k....? No other company has ever dared to do this since they're only focused on earning profits. But this is Google we're talking about guys and Google is Awesome! 
 
I've used this phone for over a week now and the following points cover my experience with this device- 
1. The build quality of the phone is pretty solid and feels/looks premium. 
2. You do get Android 4.4.2 Kitkat out of the box. 
3. 12.5 GB is available contrary to the 16GB written on the box (that's expected). 
4. I've been playing some heavy games like Asphalt 8, Dead Trigger 2, Fifa 14 on FULL graphics and lemme tell you guys, there is 0 lag while playing. There's no problem even if you minimize the game and do something else for a while. None at all!! 
5. The battery lasts 1.5-2 days on normal usage (Everything excluding playing heavy games) but it obviously drains pretty quickly while playing. It's better to keep the Brightness to about 50% as the screen drinks the maximum juice. 
6. The device doesn't heat at all while charging, playing or using wifi. 
7. USB OTG works flawlessly with this device. You just need to download a file explorer (I prefer Es). You can play even 1080p videos from your pen drive. Btw its not just flash drives. You can plug in your keyboard and even your mouse! 
8. Camera isn't good at all. It's Average I'd say. Don't even think about taking low light shots with this phone. 
9. Web browsing is flawless. Standard Chrome browser works well! 
10. Surprisingly, the external speaker of this phone is pretty loud and clear! No issues with that either. 
11. No problems with call quality or messaging. 
 
Antutu Benchmark score: 17,099. It's above Galaxy S3 and close to Nexus 4 with a price that is half of those :P 
 
If you're looking for an Android Smartphone below 20k, take my word and blindly go for moto g. You won't regret it!!Moto G IS the game changer..what you need to about this device.I have used MotoG for over a week now and it's simply brilliant. Here is my review. 
Pros: 
1. Display: At 326ppi its 4.5&quot; IPS HD screen stands as tall as Apple's iphone 5s retina screen. Add Corning Gorilla Glass 3(which has only been seen on phones like Nexus and Xperia z) to that and you have yourself questioning how Motorola managed to offer it all under 15k? 
What that means:A crystal clear display with great viewing angles and no loss of colors. even under direct sun, the viewing is just fine. You can keep your car keys in the same pocket with your phone without worrying about the scratches on the screen, thanks to Gorilla Glass 3 which also makes the screen dust resistant and fairly water resistant too.Honestly, the screen IS something to talk about regarding it's price. 
 
2. Processor: 
Moto G is powered by a quad core Snapdragon. 
What that means:An ultra responsive smartphone which registers almost every touch and shows no sign of lags under its limits. Multitasking is as easy as it can be and it doesn't hang itself till death like Samsung and Micromax I won't say that this phone is a powerhouse gaming smartphone but it runs all the popular games very well and for the likes of graphic heavy &quot;Asphalt&quot; and &quot;FIFA14&quot; the running is smooth after a little bit of tweaking in the game settings. 
 
3. Platform:This Android is a KitKat! well actually it comes as a Jelly Bean out of the box but as soon as you will connect it to internet it will upgrade itself to the latest version of Android i.e KitKat or 4.4.2 which was only limited to Google flagship devices like Nexus 5 till now Moreover MotoG is pure Google as it has no skin/bloatware/sponsored apps installed on it. So Long TouchWiz! 
What that means:Better Android experience with latest version in the form of KitKat Google now is more handy and intuitive. there are no lags and the over all look and feel of OS has improved making it a more premium experience and since KitKat was designed with mid-range handsets in mind it works superbly on this device. Now without any flagship skin or bloatware, phone does run faster and feels simpler which is a good thing. 
 
4. Aesthetics:The whole look and feel of MotoG screams about the care Motorola and Google has put in this device to make it look premium and feel sturdy. When I first held it in hand I found it hard to believe that this a &quot;cheap&quot; device because it certainly doesnt feel so. Hats Off to Motorola. at 140gms it is not light but it wont feel heavy either. It will feel solid and maybe a little bit hefty but not at all cheap. Hardware is top notch with a rubberized back panel which isn't wafer like (Samsung Galaxy devices) or creaky like other cheap phones. even the power button and volume rocker are solid, sharp and shiny. There are videos on youtube which show this phone under water for upto 30 minutes and still working fine. All in all it doesn't look like a phone worth 14k but something around 22-25k and feels really nice in hand. 
 
5. Battery and speakers:2070 mAh. Good enough to run this device for a day and maybe a slight bit more than that after a little optimization. Nothing extraordinary going on here but not a downer either. Speakers are something else which impressed me and this might only be a personal opinion but they do sound loud,crisp and clear which was a surprise as I was expecting a dull and murky experience at this price but once again Motorola has delivered with a stunning piece of hardware at low cost. 
 
Cons:All is not well though with this handset and there are a few things which could have been done in a better way but would definitely mean pushing the price tag more towards 20-22K 
1. Storage:8GB/16GB And that's it! ouch! MotoG doesnt offer a memory slot for any of above mentioned versions but I think at 16GB it offers ample space for all what is needed in a phone. Not to forget 50 GB cloud storage provided by Google on Google drive for free which is welcoming but far from being a solution. It wasn't a deal-breaker for me and I think 16GB is sufficient for an avg. user. otherwise OTG cable Zindabaad! 
2. Camera Rear:5MP Front:1.2 MP HDR and slow motion video recording 
 at 5MP this phone leaves you wanting for more. it performs just fine in adequate light with an image which has nothing to be talked about. Although features like HD recording and Slow motion video recording adds to the experience but still far from a great camera. 
 
The Biggest PRO is ofcourse pricing and at 14k(16GB) this phone is almost like a revolution, shifting the balance of the market more towards mid range phones which can also deliver. 
Conclusion: For those who are looking for a no fuss, good looking, sturdy device with a great display and hardware offering latest OS available with a reliable chipset under the bonnet at and affordable price (that's pretty much what one needs anyway).Awesome Phone for 14K.Here is the review for MOTO G from my experience!!!!

Read this before you buy.Ok so, I am sure you would have read how good this phone is and the awesome value for money proposition it provides. No debating that - the phone is awesome. But how good is a phone if you cannot make a call from it? 
 
To cut long story short, the network drops regularly and the phone automatically switches to airplane mode. The SIM cards are not recognised and there is no apparent reason for this. The only way to fix this is to remove the SIM cards and put it back on and you have to keep checking your phone every 10 minutes to see if it is registered on the network or not. 
 
This has happened post the 4.4.2 update and I guess Motorola is actively working on a fix but no official communication yet (or at least I haven't come across). You can read multiple threads online on this issue. 
 
It may be fixed in 4.4.3 - but till then, I'd suggest hold on. Wait for the fix to come and then get your hands on this amazing bit of technology!Hell lot of issues.I was happy to receive the phone however the piece I received has hell hot of issues with the phone getting hanged in between, if i am using any app the screen swips from top unevenly.

Removing one more star because of this bad update.

Moto G: 
Phone is just the right size. 16GB should be adequate for me. Specs are good enough for moderate user like me. 
In box: Super cheap charger and headphones. Phone shipment screen guard has huge motorola logo on it. So you _have_ to remove it to use phone. Worrisome due to lack of screen guard availability. NO USB cable. 
 
Pure Android experience: Awesome. Install a few free apps to customize and you won't miss the TouchWizes of the world. 
4.4 update is yet to arrive in India. 
No lag. 
50GB google drive -&gt; Warning, only if you activate within first 30 days of activating phone. Do it fast! 
 
Phone as a phone: 
Awesome loud speaker phone. From the couple of calls I made, other party can hear me well. 
I was in a 2 hour audio conference, speakerphone worked brilliantly. 
Ear piece is good (didn't test much, only one call). 
Network Signal reception: I am using only SIM1, with Idea network. I think the signal is very weak compared to my older Nokia. 
Good display. 
Wifi Signal Reception: yet to test. my router is a monster and I sit next to it. So will need to do some work to test this. 
 
Phone for music: Will update after some testing. I have good headphones to test this. 
 
Phone build: Feels good. Will update after few weeks.

Overall:Stop Reading n go BUY!!.I have always been an admirer of Motorola products and have to say their reentry in the India has been a revelation. I had been waiting for the launch of the phone for weeks and managed to get my order through on the launch day itself and was I pleased. 
 
I will not discuss the specification and features as they have been covered in full detail by the other reviewers. It's been more than three weeks since using it and I am still in awe of it. The best thing about the phone is it's display. The touch screen is swift and smooth and UI is minimalist. In this price range it has no competition as the screen is bright and with the pixel density this high you can even read the pdf books without zooming in. Watching video is also a fantastic experience. 
 
The phone is tough with gorilla glass and I don't even feel the need of using a screen guard and diminish it looks. By looks and handling the phone is a thing of beauty. I am not a heavy camera user and m totally satisfied by its quality. The video recording feature is nice too and one of the coolest feature of the phone is slow motion recording. I did record some fun videos! 
 
On the software front they have not loaded the phone with unwanted crap like samsung, lg or micromax. The majority of memory (13 GB) is available to the apps of your choice rather than the pre-installed custom apps. Battery lasts long enough and the battery saving features are also nice. 
 
Now kitkat update is also available which allows you to runt Android Run Time which is going to be the foundation of the next android versions and is far more efficient. Seriously every other high end phone (Xperia Z, HTC One, S4, Note) are still far from receiving the update 
 
As usual flipkart delivery was bang on time even in such rush and I am very pleased to avail credits on clothing and ebooks also. 
 
My verdict is that this phone is going to be best phone under 20-22k for a long time until motorola decide to launch moto x at such rate :)

with an affordable price.

Tips: 
1) Charge the Mobile 24 hrs after unboxing it first time. 
 
2)Before you go for the kitkat update make sure that all ur mobile features work perfectly incase of any problems u can ask for replacement. 
 
3) to get screen shot press low volume key along with power key 
 
4) For Kitkat version OTG will work but you have to buy Rs. 212 app - Nexus Media Importer 
 
 DISPLAY : You won't get a display of this quality for this price. It is simply stunning. 
This phone has a 4.5 inch display with 720 x 1280 pixels (~326 ppi pixel density). I have compared this display with a Nexus 5 and to my wonder this 720p display felt more rich and true than the 1080p display of a 33k phone. 
 
PROCESSOR : 1.2 Ghz quad core Snapdragon 400 processor is immensely powerful. The device will feel butter smooth at all times and processing power won't bother you at any point of time. 
 
CORNING GORILLA GLASS 3 : No other phone in this price bracket comes with gorilla glass. It is scratch and shatter proof (as claimed). So you can say a premium feature in a premium phone is there in Moto G which gives you peace of mind while using it. 
 
NANO COATING : Yes your phone is waterproof though it is told as spill resistant. This is something you can't even see in a 33k Nexus 5. So you get more than what you pay. 
 
ANDROID 4.4 : You get a Kitkat version of android for this price bracket. The experience is flawless. 
 
BATTERY : The battery backup is really a strong point of this phone, when compared with any other phone of this range or any other range. I do remember Samsung grand battery was draining like anything and it can't manage to stay up till noon with extensive usage. 
 
In short this is an Truly exceptional phone of 2014. 
 
Apps gets loaded very fast, net surfing, Youtube videos, games plays excellently well, touch screen response is great, call quality is decent, battery life is good. It has good support for email and office applications. More I use it more I become addicted to it. 
 
Its one of few mobiles in market where company has engineered right features product at right value. All credit goes to Google. Go for it Value for money. Totally worth it.Forget the other options and just go Moto!.Most people wanting to buy this phone will have probably heard that it's the best budget handset and while that's true, this phone is more than that. Motorola is one of the few or in fact the only manufacturer that appreciates that tampering with stock Android only spoils the user experience. So you won't find a hyped up, poorly designed UI like TouchWiz on Samsung devices on this phone. This phone runs almost stock Android with a few Motorola improvements that actually add value rather than coming off as gimmicky features. 
 
First and foremost, the typical Indian prospective buyer will have done a lot of research and narrowed down his choices to a handful of phones in this price range and I can say with conviction that the Moto G will be better than everyone of them. Specs don't matter a lot but the Indian smartphone enthusiast is very swayed by numbers and that's what manufacturers like Micromax are notorious for advertising. No wonder they manage to sell phones that don't even run the latest version of Android. Please stay away from Micromax because they use substandard internals from lesser known companies and so the buyer is just left wondering in the end why Android lags so much on his 1.5 GHz Quad Core phone with 2 GB RAM and then blames the OS for it. Such manufacturers make Android look bad and Motorola is out to right that wrong. 
 
I've owned this phone for over a month now and I upgraded to it from my beloved Galaxy Nexus (a Nexus smartphone, mind you). Even at this point I have no regrets that I didn't pick up another Nexus smartphone. This phone is pretty much the complete package. It runs stock Android, has excellent battery life (almost Galaxy Note 2 level battery life) providing over 5 and a half hours of screen on time on a single charge, it is dual SIM, has a very very loud speaker that produces great quality sound and of course has a gorgeous display! The display is IPS LCD and so gets much brighter and produces quite natural colours. It's hands down the best display you'll see on a smartphone in this price range. The camera is the only Achilles' heel of this phone but mind you it's still pretty good and takes some great photos in good lighting conditions. Gaming fans can read other reviews since I personally don't play heavy games on my phone but casual, light games like QuizUp run without a hitch. 
 
Also the dual SIM functionality is crucial to many potential buyers as it was for me because I didn't want to carry two phones around, one personal and another for work. I'm pleased to say that the dual SIM implementation on the Moto G is simply perfect! It feels like it's baked into Android, it's that good! No SIM is ever on standby like many dumb phones and you can see and monitor data usage per SIM. You can also name each SIM card in the settings, assign them colours and so on. On making a call you are prompted to choose a SIM and you can set a particular SIM as default for some contacts. There's also a smart feature that you can enable that learns which SIM you often choose while calling a particular person and it just picks that SIM automatically instead of you having to choose. 
 
Very often it's the little things that make you happy and there are quite a few of those with the Moto G! You get an offer of 50 GB of free Google Drive space for 2 years! Then there's Motorola Migrate which happens to be the feature that made me feel instantly satisfied with the phone. Motorola Migrate is an app that helps you migrate all you contacts, photos, videos and music from your old smartphone (Android or iPhone) to your new Motorola phone. And I just can't express how delighted I was to find that my worries of having to manually migrate all my stuff from my old phone to the new one were pointless! Then if you're a fan of Android looking to have the latest and greatest of the OS i.e. KitKat 4,4,2 but can't shell out the money for a Nexus then the Moto G is you're only option right now and it runs KitKat like a boss! And finally if you, like me, have an OCD for app design then you'll be pleased to know that all of Motorola's apps adhere to the latest Android design guidelines and don't look like they're stuck in the Gingerbread era like all of Samsung's apps. 
 
All in all this has been a great purchase for me and I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone who wants to buy a great phone or a great first Android phone! If you want no regrets after making a smartphone purchase then go Moto!Moto G Review for a average indian.Well I bought 16 GB Moto G for my mother as a gift, the touch is very good and so is display , it has an internal storage of 12gb where you can load apps(yes in whole 12 gb) as well as it is used for other storage as well unlike other brands where there are two different storage: internal and phone storage. 
The sound output is satisfactory only not as good as high end mobiles. There are few bugs in the device working, but day to day working do not encounter them or rarely. battery back up is good giving a full day on full charge and does not require charge for 24 hours for an average person who plays little game, does browsing watch you tube videos on wifi for a while and has other stuff to do as well then sticking just to mobile phone. As for the processing power packed, it is yet smoothly working no lags yet, good with mid end games like temple run subway surfer similar kind of apps, i have not tried but heard that it lags if high end power hungry games are installed. you can get body covers and screen guard for this easily in market and i would suggest a back cover like silicon cover etc which protects the camera glass from getting scratched. 
All in all it is worth for its price till yet.... value for money device if your budget is upto 8,000 - 18,000 INR and looking for a phone which may last upto 2-3 years. with android phones if you expect a 5 years life then i may have to update you that a touchscreen devices remains good and active for regular use for not more than 2-3 years after which they tend to start giving problems as there is too much dust in india and indians use is a bit rough.packing high-end smartphone features,exceptionally priced.I've got my Moto G on 28 Feb from Flipkart. This is my first Android phone and also my first electronic product bought from an online store. My Moto G comes with Kitkat update. Phone is very well built with corning gorilla glass screen. I've also bought Amzer case for my phone which fits nicely. regarding camera, i never use phone camera, I love my DSLR :). My old Nokia USB data cable works gr8 with this phone :p 
 
*****For users who faced SIM related issues with Moto G 
 
*When i insert my BSNL sim (micro cut), it worked fine but when i use my Airtel sim i've faced network lost problems or &quot;sim not detected&quot; problems. After doing some research online i've found that, Moto G wont accept &quot;badly cut&quot; SIMs or &quot;old Sims&quot;. I've replaced my sim from Airtel store with new sim and carefully cut the sim myself (using a sim size template). Moto g detected the new sim without problems. Till now no network issues reported. So always use &quot;properly cut SIM's, New or original Micro Sim with Moto G. 
*******************************

dont go to other thought just go for itThe best for the price.I was one of the buyers who purchased the Moto G on the first day of it's sale here on Flipkart. I've been using this phone as my primary phone for the past one month. My impressions - 
 
a) Screen - the screen is gorgeous to say the least. It's a 720p display with a ppi which matches the latest iPhone. Do I need to say more? Only the most expensive premium handsets like HTC One have a better display. 
 
b) Battery life - this is one of the most important factors for me. I'm easily able to get about a day's worth of battery life. This is with heavy usage. So light users will easily get around 2 days. There is one issue though - around 1% battery drop per hour has been seen when the phone is on airplane mode. This is a little more than usual. Motorola is aware of this issue. 
 
c) Design aesthetics - this phone is a bit heavy. My last smartphone was Samsung Galaxy S2 which was insanely light. As compared to that, this phone is a bit heavy. If you're going to use this continuously for a long period of time, then you would need to shift it from one hand to another (which was the case with me as I spend an insanely high amount of time on Twitter). The phone itself looks very good and has a premium touch to it. I had purchased a flip cover (red colour) as it was on 80% reduction on the first day of sale. The red back does look very sexy, I must admit! 
 
d) Software - It was running Jelly bean 4.3 initially when I got the phone. Within a week, I got the update to Kitkat 4.4.2 - the Kitkat android O/S is smooth and a pleasure to use. The best android version yet, hands down. Some apps which make use of the transparent navigation bar and notification bars are a treat to the eyes (Example - Action Launcher, Muzei, QuickPic, Talon for Twitter, EvolveSMS) 
 
e) Headphones and Charger - The international version of this phone does not come with headphones or a ccharger. You just get the phone. In the indian version on sale on flipkart, we get a headphone and a charger bundled in with the phone. However, both these are of very cheap quality and I would not recommend them one bit. The headphones are an apology in front of the high quality (noice cancelling) ones provided by Samsung. The charger also often gets heated up pretty quickly and I use another micro usb charger for my daily charging (any micro usb charger will work). 
 
f) Call quality &amp; Speaker - I'm making a special mention for the speakers on the moto g, because I feel it's important to highlight the awesomeness of the speakers. It's pretty neat, loud and will leave you pretty satisfied with the experience. I usually use speakers while watch you tube videos and ocassionally during some calls. Call quality - is very good. No issues there. 
 
All in all, I think I've invested 14k in a world class product, it's an unbelivable price for a product of this premium quality.Super Phone - Very Smartphone.Amazingly, this stands the best smartphone I bought till date. 
 
The Kitkat update is smooth and really makes all the difference. Motorola has made the best VFM (value for money) phone I guess. 
 
Interface: Amazingly smooth; very simple. Has a minimalist approach. There were some shortcomings as my earlier smartphones were Samsung and with Touchwiz interface made the life easy. 
Memory and Processor: Perfect fit. I was seriously worried as Samsung Grand was offering 1.5GB RAM. But again, it was loaded with all the unnecessary Touchwiz stuff. So, probably needed more RAM. 
Camera: Again a minimalistic approach. But the picture quality is good. When using the flash, the colors may look little odd sometimes. 
Battery: Now I recharge the battery only Once a day compared to twice with my earlier mobile phones. My usage is more of phone calls, SMSs and Whatsapp and Four active email boxes. 
GPS and Google Maps Navigation are the only battery drainers. Else, it amazingly works good for a whole day. 
More on Battery: Recharging for a short time will not reset the Battery usage graphic log in the Battery Usage detail. So, a simple look at the Battery usage with '24 hours since last recharge' may not be always correct. 
 
Overall: Amazingly the Best phone I bought till date with perfect VFM. Hope this review stands good for the next 18 months; till I start looking for a new handset. :-). 
 
What I did not check: Standby time. This is the only phone I use. I cannot keep it idle in a shelf.Moto G (16 gb) Review after prolonged use.I read and saw online a lot about Moto G but I wanted to give my opinion after using it exhaustively for some time. So..I have been using Moto G (16 gb model) for more than 3 weeks now and this device delivers and up to the mark performance. I will be talking about the issues later, let me first write what I loved most about this device. 
 
1. DISPLAY: The first thing you notice when you switch on the phone is its brilliant screen. With around 329 ppi it beats the hell out of premium range of smartphones. I tried very hard to notice the pixels which infact you can on a very high brightness and looking very closley, but in normal day to day use there is no chance to distinguish any. The auto brightness works perfectly and even in bright sunlight you can see every detail on your screen. The colour reproduction is amazing and you can feel the stunning graphics while playing HD games and watching HD videos. It gives more than what you pay for in terms of screen so 5/5 for the display of moto g, its the best part of the phone. 
 
2. PERFORMANCE: The second thing you want from your phone is how fast and responsive it is and Moto G again comes out as the sure shot winner. There is absolutely no lag while flipping through apps and games. I played Asphalt 8-airborne on high settings and the performance was amazing. It runs normal applications like butter (that was the aim of project butter offcourse :D ). With android KitKat 4.4.2 the phone runs smoothly after longer use also. The switching on/off is fast and there is nice motorola animation to greet you after time you turn it on :D. This budget phone delivers performance in comparison to above 20K phones. 
 
3. BATTERY: It promises us a day long battery with mixed use but it falls little short of it. I managed to get around 15 hours with mixed use. But if you are cautiously using your phone you can get more than a days power. Even when both sim cards are active there is not much noticeable difference in discharge rate. So I am happy with the battery life as I don't do much gaming and all. 
 
4. BUILD: The build is the 3rd best thing I liked about the phone. It has a very premium and non plastic feel. The weight is perfect enough to give you a sturdy feel and the phone does not twist while applying good amount of force. The design fits perfectly and makes the one hand use easier, while the back cover assures that its not going to slip out of your hand. Thumbs up moto g :D. 
 
5. GORILLA GLASS 3: Just one thing about the glass. After constant daily (rough) use there is not a single scratch in the glass surface. I am not using any screen guard and I don't think I need any. 5/5 for the glass panel. 
 
Things which I didn't like about Moto G 
1. The call quality was not upto the mark. There is treble in the sound (may be problem with my device only). The problem happens normally at the high volume. 
 
2. I lost the phone sound once in 2 weeks. I could not hear what the other person was talking. I restarted the phone and problem was solved. 
 
3. Camera was not responding once. Restart solved the issue. 
 
4. There is a warm hue in the screen, this is noticeable only when there is a white background. Overall it does not affect the screen quality. 
 
5. There is thin gap between the edge of the glass and the frame, so with constant use, dust accumulates in that gap which is hard to clean. 
 
6. Low light pictures are not good, but in good lighting condition it takes very pretty pictures. 
 
Overall Moto G is the best device out there in terms of performance and price. Its an amazing phone and I am sure that you will not be disappointed once you start using it. If you are planning to buy anything within 25K our 14K Moto G is the BEST. Go for it Android Lovers :DAmazing Phone.This is the best Android Phone @ an exceptional Price. 
 
Call Quality: The Call Quality is great. I would rate it 9/10. Only issue i can say that there is some noise emitted occasionally when speaker phone is turned on. Great Signal Capture and Dual Sim Functionality makes this device the standout from others. I would advise others that before upgrading to Kitkat kindly check reviews of other people since there was a drop in Call Quality after upgrading to Kitkat in the international version. 
 
Display: The 4.6 inch display is one of the best i have seen so far in a smartphone. It is same as or even better than Nexus or Galaxy S4. Watching videos and surfing is like icing on the Cake. The touch is butter smooth. 
 
Sound: The sound from the Loud Speaker is amazing. Its very loud and you will get a feel of groove when you listen to music. I would suggest to purchase Poweramp Media Player from Play Store. Its the best one out there. 
 
Storage: Kindly purchase the 16 gb version if you will store a lot of videos, music files and downloading latest games since the total available space is 12.98 GB. 
 
Processor and Memory: The phone is exceptionally fast and it plays the latest games without lag. 
 
Battery: The battery life is exceptionally good. For Low to Medium Usage it will last for more than a day. 
 
Camera: The camera is average and it takes decent quality pictures. It requires some tweaking and Day Light photos come really good. 
 
OS: The phone comes with nearly stock android 4.3 Jelly Bean and can be upgraded to 4.4 Kitkat soon. Before upgrading i would advise other users to check for any issues regarding the call Quality. 
 
Some Useful Tips: 
 
1] Even if the Screen Comes with Gorilla Glass, i would suggest to purchase the Moto G Flip Cover and put a good quality screen guard on the phone. 
 
Download and Install the following apps to make your experience even better: Mx Player, Power Amp, Droid Light, Motorola Notification Light to fix LED Notification issue. Adobe Reader,Clean Master and Swift Key Keyboard. 
 
Cons: The Box does not contain USB Cable but you can use any Samsung or Nokia Data Cable which will hardly cost few Rs. Also the In ear headphones aren't good. You can use them to turn on the Radio. 
 
With some minor Cons and with exceptionally gr8 features at this price point , this phone is the best Android Smartphone in the market.

Till then enjoy with the best Google + Motorola came out with.Great product, Highly recommended, Quick delivery - in just 2 days.Hi, my company just shifted from CDMA to GSM, and I placed my order for the Moto-G 16GB variant on 22nd by credit card and received the product on 24th morning in a sturdy packaging. 
 
A slight disappointment when i opened the case and couldn't find a data cable inside. Later realized that i may not need it in the first place, and the existing micro usb cable would suffice. I had to get the sim card 25x15 mm cut into micro sim 15x12 mm at a local vendor for Rs.20, and inserted in the sim-1 slot. The phone picked up all 3G settings automatically. 
 
The Moto-G has a software called Motorola Migrate. I downloaded this on my old CDMA android 2.2 as well from play store. On playing the software on both phones it generated a QR code on MG(Moto-G) and asked the old phone camera to scan this code. The old phone did a somersault and worked overtime to scan the basic code. Once the code was read, the software asked me to keep the two phones aside for some time. After 15 minutes there was a message on the phones scolding why the software was still open. I realized that all my phone contacts, text sms, audio files, video files, photographs, pdf files, epubs, whatsapp media files, and all that can be were transferred to MG. Half the battle was already won. Just this much was enough for another colleague to immediately order a 16GB variant from flipkart. 
 
Next came the camera. The primary takes decent snaps. My main usage of the camera is to take random snaps, capture visiting card details and store in phonebook, save scribbled notes and whiteboard notes into pdf and email. Just try out camcard &amp; camscanner softwares on the MG, it'll just blow your mind. The secondary camera is great as well. My priority was to transmit a decent picture over skype, not send my photograph for a modelling assignment. 
 
Do you really feel the user available 13GB is insufficient for mobile use? I admit that additional space is good, for instance I once consumed the entire 16GB internal as well as 32GB external on my galaxy tab, but that was a different story altogether. I will not like to read books for hours or watch 3 hour movies on a 4.5 inch screen. All I would do is load the memory with a hundred apps and games. So I did just that and after loading whatsapp, camcard, facebook, mxplayer, flashlight, indianrail, adobe, bookmyshow, twitter, skype, messenger, qrdroid, utorrent, camscanner, filemanager, timesofindia, templerun2, subwaysurfer, carrom3d, minionrush, hillclimb, 360security and racingmoto I got a little tired. Still waiting for the phone to start bugging me with lags, hangs and jerks, but no luck. So I downloaded the Kitkat update, but didn&rsquo;t install it as yet(who knows? I still fear the reviews I read earlier). Finally I downloaded &ldquo;ASPHALT 8&rdquo;. This is the mother of all memory eaters, consumed 1.61 GB space on the phone, took 6 hours to download over an EVDO internet connection, and was my last shot at rejecting the MG. Sad luck, after annihilating 8GB space by migrating &amp; downloading stuff, the mother memory eater(MME) Asphalt 8 played as smooth as butter. This I totally did not expect from this piece and it made me awestruck. I finally bowed out of skepticism and placed the MG in its rightful place as a high end phone with low end price tag. 
 
Okay, for people shifting away from Samsung for whatever reasons, there could be a minor issue which could be resolved by practice. The stock email client is not Microsoft activesync, but another one similar to gmail app, which will need some getting used to. Also, couldn&rsquo;t find a pre-installed file manager, so downloaded one &ndash; no big deal actually. The earphones are really bad, no doubt about it at all, so just junk them. 
 
Wifi works brilliantly and so do Mobile hotspot &amp; Bluetooth. 
 
Battery backup &ndash; the greatest decision drivers of all time. Let me give you a contrast of usage and battery backup. Case-1, use of Wifi/3G internet continuously, downloading apps, screen medium bright, email clients and social networks continuously interacting on the web, battery lasted 9 hours. Case-2, data connection closed, screen brightness medium, phone on standby mode, battery status dropped 1% after 1 hour. Although this is not a great battery review, gave me a fair idea that the phone will last atleast a day on normal usage. Just use battery saver inbuilt function to stop useless background processes. 
Installed the downloaded kitkat update after a couple of days, the phonebook has just come alive. Guys do not fear the update, it's pretty decent. And for the sceptical ones, downloaded another memory eater &quot;Iron Man 3&quot;, and the games still play smooth as butter. 
 
Speed comparisons can be checked on youtube. Also, component benchmark test results can be viewed on fonearena. 
 
In case of a dilemma between Moto-G and Samsung Galaxy Grand Quattro or Micromax Canvas 4, choose the Moto-G blindly.just what u should know.this is a product that will simply blow your mind.

Special mention: Flipkart's exemplary Delivery and Returns serviceREAD THIS BEFORE YOU BUY!!.For those who are considering buying this phone, please keep in mind that this mobile (8GB Version, don't know about the 16GB model) doesn't come with a data cable. The charger has micro-USB at one end and the other end is a 2-pin plug - no USB here. If you already have a USB cable that connects to mobiles like I do this shouldn't be a problem. One would have expected a USB charger cable with the charger plug though - dont most of the smart phone today have that? 
 
That said, the mobile is a steal at the price it's being offered at. You can actually connect external storage like pen drives through a USB to micro-USB converter and use it an external storage just like you would on a desktop / laptop - cool, huh? The Corning Gorilla glass that is there on Moto G is something that's seen only on premium mobiles - isn't that awesome?! Runs on Android KitKat - that's the latest from the Android Stable (even though it doesnt ship with it, the OS is downloaded once you fire it up). I noticed some problems while using Chrome on KitKat - the touch recognition on the address bar is sloppy, almost always I need to try a few times before I'm able to 'refresh' a page or type a new URL. I downloaded Firefox and the experience has been much better with that, so I prefer to use Firefox over the stock browser, Chrome. 
Battery life is good and lasts for 2-3 days of intense usage, though I have not yet used it with any sim. Most of the usage now involves internet browsing via wi-fi and gaming. Tried a few games, the graphics rendering is amazing - though I noticed some heating of the back panel after prolonged gaming for somewhere around an hour. 
 
3 stars from me because FK guys wont let me post my previous review. Hope this gets through this time.A winner for sure!!.Reserved this phone on 08 Feb 14 and was informed about a delivery time ranging between 10 and 20 days, however received the phone on 14 Feb 14. Gud show Flipkart. 
 
The pictures of the phone posted online don't do justice to the phone. It is a rugged premium looking phone which just oozes quality. Many samsung phones boast the specifications but don't measure up in terms of performance, this phone walks the talk all the way. I loaded the phone with 14 apps simultaneously and tried queuing more than 200 songs for transfer via bluetooth and motorola migrate for transfer of contacts from my old Iphone 3GS. Moto G didnt blink. It even staggered the transfer of contacts and the songs efficiently and the apps never displayed any lag. 
 
The camera has been a sore point for many people but let me clarify, the daylight photos are very good and so is the HD video capture. Photos in low light are pretty much average but that is the case with even dedicated digital cameras. The front camera serves its purpose and frankly at this price, thats more than what one should expect. Finding faults with the camera is nothing but nitpicking and a banal attempt at projecting oneself as a connoisseur of technology. 
 
The battery lasted an entire day and a half if used the way a normal person would use a phone on a day to day basis. The usage I mention involves, 4 hours(approx) of 3G usage, 2 hrs of games like temple run 2 and Asphalt 8, an hours worth of document editing and normal call usage of about 2 hours.

Awesome price, Awesome performance, and Awesome delivery by flipkartDon&rsquo;t worry about unexpansive memory in Moto G.Use OTG or USB &lsquo;On The Go&rsquo; connector to connect your Moto G with USB drives and SD card readers to expand your Moto G memory. You can buy an OTG cable from Flipkart for around Rs.150/- only in this link 
 
http://www.flipkart.com/search?q=usb+otg+cable&amp;as=off&amp;as-show=on&amp;otracker=start?affid=netizen4a 
 
Having OTG support on Moto G is great, as it has no SD card slot and limited on-board storage. In this case a USB thumb drive can be connected to your Moto G (via a special OTG cable) allowing you to browse the thumb drive and move files to and from your phone (you may also need to download file manager app). In addition to thumb drives you can also connect to SD card readers, cameras, and even external hard-drives. 
Moving files and adding storage aren&rsquo;t the only way OTG can be used, you can even connect a mouse or keyboard to your device allowing you to be more productive on the go.Awesome Product.This is not review of the product. For reviews, we can always trust on experts' reviews on tech websites (and experts have rated this device excellent). The 5 star is for my liking of the phone. 
 
And finally a request to all those people who are rating 1-star for FK service. Guys, you are simply reducing the average rating of this smartphone by doing so, it doesn't affect flipkart's service. If you really want to share your unhappy experiences, write about it, but not with a 1-star rating to the smartphone. 
 
And then come back to write a review after owning the phone. That will give a true picture for other future customers.All day battery might not be true.I've read reviews about Moto G on various tech-blogs like Anandtech, Engadget etc., and found that results of battery performance came out good for the SINGLE SIM version that is being sold in the US. 
 
This might not be the same for the dual SIM version that is being sold on Flipkart and India. When you intend to use two SIM cards the battery performance will be affected substantially. If US version scores 24 hours with Single SIM then Dual Sim Version will be little more than 16 hours (only 70% of original US version at best conditions) (considering you will have 2G/3G enabled on one SIM at minimum). 
 
Note that specs of both US and Indian version remain the same except for the Dual SIM version. No change in battery or processor etc. 
 
I will advise potential buyers to wait for reviews from tech bloggers and then decide about buying this. This is applicable for me as well. Package: Phone with charger(no usb cable) and ear phones 
 
Moto G vs other phones: 
Pros: Display, Sound, Speed, HD Display, LED notification, Battery 
Cons: Weight,removal of battery cover, no data cable 
 
Those who can afford to miss many features can buy this phone. 
Those who want feature rich phone opt out. 
 
Don't believe the phone is very much affordable ... google has not spent time, money and efforts for customization of Android hence is able to sell at low price. Since others spent time, money and efforts on customization of Android they sell at little higher price. 
 
So, it is upto you to decide whether you need vanilla or not! 
 
Strange is accessories(charger cable, ear phones) comes in odd white colour while the phone being black! 
 
Surprising news is Moto G 8GB version supports USB OTG supporting Pen Drive, Key Board and Mouse. But Moto G 16GB does not! I have tested this on both the phones! Both the phones have latest version of KitKat. 
 
Another surprising news is after the update network signal considerably drops and calls getting terminated. Mine's coming on monday!No phone comes close to this one in terms of Value for money.Best features of this phone - 
1. 4.5 inch HD display (720p) 
2. Corning Gorilla Glass 3 (Scratch proof) 
3. Water repellent coating (means no finger prints on the screen) 
4. Good Battery life than most similar phones 
5. Quad core Snapdragon processor (Others mobiles in mid-segment use mediatek processor) 
6. High quality &amp; premium look - feel (almost Similar to premium phone - Moto X) 
7. Dual Sim 
8. Guaranteed Android upgrade to 4.4 - KitKat 
9. external speaker is very loud and clear 
 
Some downsides of this phone - 
1. Camera is average quality (AutoFocusing is a little problem) 
2. Earphone should had been &quot;in ear&quot; type for noise isolation 
 
But I purchased this phone because no other phone even upto Rs 20000 ever came close to all the features this phone offered. 
BEST BUY at 12.5kMoto G does not power on.I got a new MOTO G today from flipkart from Delhivery.... the experience of getting it from ekart was awesome.... Delhivery was not that cool.... 
 
Well opened it in the night and the phone simply doesn't turn on. the charging LED shows up intermittently but I haven't seen the screen yet. Anybody else facing this issue...Best phone at the price range..Motorola has done a remarkable task in bringing out this exceptional phone at this exceptional price. 
Pros: 
1. A Snapdragon chipset. Motorola didn't cut off on the SoC while lowering the budget unlike Samsung and LG who use MediaTek chipsets. And also Moto G sports a newer Snapdragon 400 quad-core CPU with an Adreno 305 GPU which is brilliant for gaming and multitasking with 1 GB of RAM. Specs doesn't matter when it comes to real life and Moto G is an example. Samsung Galaxy Grand Quattro also has an quad core CPU which is also 1.2GHz but a MediaTek chipset which clearly shows its capabilities. The Quattro doesn't support Asphalt 8 just because the processor can't handle it even though the clocking speed is similar to the Moto G. 
2. Beautiful display. Moto G has 4.5&quot; 720p LCD display. No other phone offers such a high resolution display packed with awesome specs. This display is perfect for HD content and gaming. This display is bigger than current gen iPhone 5S/5C/5 at 4&quot; and also has a high resolution with much higher ppi. iPhone doesn't even have a 720p display. Retina display is just trademark luring customers to buy it. 
3. Camera. Moto G sports a 5MP camera. 5MP may sound small but it doesn't determine the quality. The hardware is capable of HDR photos and slow motion videos. So if you think having a 8MP or higher camera is better, then you're wrong. 
4. Software. Moto G being a Google company (now sold to Lenovo) runs near stock Android. I prefer stock UI more than any other. There are a few add-ons by Motorola which I don't consider as bloatware. The device comes out of the box with Android 4.3 Jellybean with a definite update to Android 4.4 KitKat. The single SIM variant already has received the OTA to KitKat being one of the first non-Nexus device to get Android 4.4. 
5. Storage. Good thing is that the starting model comes with 8 GB internal storage. Bad thing is no SD card. Although the apps you install get loaded on the internal storage so buying a phone with SD card support but less internal storage is not logical. But SD card is necessary considering media storage. So buying the 16GB variant is a better option. 
6. Connecitvity. Bluetooth 4.0 and latest stuff is all there. No NFC though 
 
Cons: 
1. No NFC. Which is not really a bad thing because its application is currently limited and really of much use. At this price range Sony Xperia M has NFC but misses out other features which are there in the Moto G so it's not bad thing considering Motorola had to cut down something for the price you are paying. 
2. No SD card support. So going with the 16 GB variant is a better option for media storage. 
 
In short, this is the perfect device for anyone who is on a budget.A Great Deal Indeed!.I got this phone delivered by flipkart today which is less than three days from the day i placed order.. service is as great as expected from flipkart.. i am a regular buyer so i have to say flipkart's packing and products are excellent and i would trust this site anytime.. now product review.. 
i have to say Motorola is Back in business! Motorola and Google just made a perfect Budget phone.. the 720p screen is stunning.. text and pictures looks crystal clear.. overall phone's weight or size isnt big enough for a 4.5&quot; phone.. however it is big enough for most of the work and anyone can handle it perfectly... curved design lets you touch the whole screen and gives access to use it with only one hand.. 1.2 Ghz Quad-core processor is fast enough to run games and apps without any lag.. i haven't experienced any lag yet.. and its a blazing fast phone.. you will have no issues with its speed i m sure..you will get 5GB of user memory when buying an 8GB model..also in front of the phone there are no switches so when you click the lock button on the side android buttons (Back,Home,Task) comes on the bottom of the screen.. you have to remove the back cover to access sims which uses micro-sims.. camera quality is good and there is panorama and slo-mo option which both runs great for the price you are paying also the flash is fantastic.. android version provided is 4.3 but i know that kitkat will soon be available in india.. because verizon version of moto g already got the update of android 4.4.. so it is one of the first device to get this update.. i m most impressed from the Google Now service.. which works batter then Siri on my ipad.. infact unlike Siri it detects perfectly everytime... widgets,gestures and customization is great, too.. Sound quality is as good as any nokia phones.. it looks elegant with simple glass design which make it look like a perfect black glass Brick when screen is off.. i can certainly say this is way batter then buying any cheap Chinese phones.. google made this phone without compromising on things that are needed.. like it has an awesome display but only get a 5 mp camera.. if google made it the other way like its competition for example take samsung mega.. it has 8mp camera but its screen is a disgrace.. so google made a right decision on cutting the cost at the right things.. i would say this phone doesnt look cheap and worth everything you pay.. and gives you even more then you ever expect from a phone this cheap... i would say just trust the name of Google and buy it if you are going to buy any phone in less then 15K price range..Five Star for sure.. HELLO MOTO :)Problems with Moto G n its awesomeness included..The phone is simply awesome, i liked everything about it so here are somethings that i couldnt know before. 
1.when u upgrade to kitkat there are lots of glitches observed(1 per day) but vanishes within a second or 2 so not a big deal for the price range n android version. 
2.video player's controls are not easy, u cant lock screen while playing video to disable touch errors only. the whole screen shuts off when u lock it. 
3.the space 5.2gb is less so go for 16gb phone. 
4.moto assist has only 2 options:sleep or meetings, if it had one more like school/work n auto silents ur phone in that time it would be great 
 
now awesome things no one told u about: 
1.the headphone jack fits into it so strongly that even if it begins to fall u can save it from touching ground if u can hold the earphones. it saved my phone from breaking twice. 
2.camera controls are amazing. 
3.brightness n clarity, sound speakers, design n build quality are great. 
 
if u are unable to afford high range phones, then this phone is best for you, everything it has is more than what you pay for so go for it!A true low cost &quot;smart&quot;phone for the masses by Google..Yes , like my title says this is a low cast , low profit smart phone by Motorola , a former Google brand ( now in hands of an already losing player in the field , Lenevo ). Well , Google is a smart player and they proved it with their strategic cost and quality of the Nexus series. Acquisition of Motorola was done to release some great feature packed , low to medium budget smart phones while the higher end devices would come from Nexus line as it was a risk in its own way to launch high end phones manufactured by their own unit already , plus Motorola was acquired mainly for their licenses , patents , etc which were a deal for the money plus it gave Google the opportunity to kick off some phones of their own. The moto g and moto x were the results. While the Moto X was just like other phones in its range , the Flagship deal , the Moto G was the real deal. Priced at $179 only for the 8GB version , it packed a Snapdragon 400 Quad Core CPU with the Adreno 305 and 1GB RAM plus other features like a clear , crisp camera , etc it coated Google , a hefty $123 , just for the parts , say another $8-15 for assembly meaning it costed $135around for the device , another $10 for charger , headphone , useless guides and packaging , therefore it came for a total of $145 meaning left we're left with 34$ excluding taxes , shipping and handling chargers , not so profitable then right ? 
Even for India , the rate is $200 , but remember , they have to ship it here , go through customs , etc right ? $21 extra is justified to me then. 
Now let's take another to manufacturer like Samsung , who probably weren't going to make such a device in the first place as it wouldnt have qualified for their 30$+ profit policy. Same for all others except some unknown names. But yeah , bitter truth is all your so called trusted but actually cheap brands like Samsung , HTC , and even Sony , etc. 
They were going to make it cost 250$ if it was to be built by them. 
So I request you guys to support Google in the case , and be assured that if you buy this amazing VFM smartphone , excpet for a meagre 5-8% , all you paid is for the device that will be in your hands. 
I for the first time have to say , I salute to Google , Motorola and Flipkart to plan ,make and bring this smartphone to the masses in India. As a tech geek , I can see a bright future for Google here if they carry on doing this. 
 
Why I got the phone - I have been using the Xperia S ( after using the iPhone 4S for 6 months in the middle ) for one and half year now and felt it was time to step up. I brought the Nexus 7 in December , so I had a low budget this time. I really felt as if I was going to end on some Micromax , Karbonn crap with those cheap MediaTek Chips. The cheapest Snapdragon 400 Android phone I could find was above 18K. But my budget was just 12-13K. Then I heard that the moto g was coming here. Took my time , decided and bought it as it was my only hope and since it was from Google. 
 
Phone review - 
Well all I can say about the phone is that its awsome. Its playing every game I throw at it with ease like DT 2 , Riptide GP2 , Injustice GODS AMONG US ,etc. 
Plus the 329ppi display makes everything look clear like games , photos , videos , etc. 
The feel of the phone is great as well. It looks just great with my Nexus 7 and matches it as well. The back camera is really great for taking pics and front for some selfies and video calling as well. 
Its from Google so its got the Google advantages like quicker updates , stock Android UI , free 50GB of Drop box storage for 2 year. 
The speakers are good for listening music and gaming as well. 
The battery lasts a day on 10 hr's of WiFi , 1-2 hrs of hardcore gaming , some surfing for half and hour with 10% battery remaining. The battery charges in 3-4 hrs on stock charger. But I'd recommend a 2.1A charger like the Sony CPAD2. It charges the phone in around 1 and half hour. 
The voice quality of the phone is good as well. Unlike average dual Sim phones this one does the switching nicely. Plus being dual Sim phone is a huge plus , right ? 
So, I can say that its the best phone in the range in all aspects and better than the Xperia S and iPhone 4S in almost all aspects.Will tell you thinngs that actually help you..This are the reasons why Moto G worked for me.... 
1. Outdoor visibility - Its Display is such a relief after using Note2, S3,Xperia ION, Ta620,Lumia 720... they all had issues viewing outdoors but not the Moto G. 
2. Display quality and Colour reproduction - Trust me boss you have to see it to believe it. the most sharpest display ever i have seen after the iphones. Bright and accurate colours the display just pops giving you high end results. Well done Moto. 
3. Battery life - Single Sim + 3G net + whole day whatsapp and fb + moderate gaming and music... all this and still a 12 to 13 hrs of battery life from a 2070mah battery. Can't ask for more. 
4. Touch and Smoothness - 1 week since i have used this phone till now not a single time did i experience any hang. The touch screen responded always on the very 1st tym i touched it. Being a stock vanilla android version it really helps the smooth functioning of this device just makes samsung , mmx and xolo cry. 
5. Price point - I would have happily paid 16 to 18k for Moto G after what i have experienced its just offering you so much for so less. 
 
Now things you might want to be clearified before you buy it... 
1. 5mp camera - Its a 5mp camera thats much much better then the mmxsamsung lg 8mp camera offered currently but in day light only. 
2. No expandable mem.card slot - So go for 16gb version. 
3. Your only source for its accessories currently is flipkart nothing out there in market. 
 
thats it for all tech specs refer google...!!best in 10 - 15k range.flipkart is wonderful. received this product before the scheduled delivery date. 
 
finishing absolutely stunning. display looks rich. no lag in multi-tasking. if you are a gamer prefer a 16GB version. 8GB only gives you 5.5GB available space, and certain games are even above 1Gb. UI is best, stock andriod experience. and also high pixel density make reading ebooks great. 
Call quality is average. not a big problem. 
the only negative point is Camera. If you are someone who loves photos a lot then better check other mobile camera reviews in same price range. Moto G gives you satisfying images in good light, but in darkness its a bit problem. kitkat update is said to fix some camera issues, need to wait and see how far it can help in this. If motorola had shown a little more care on camera, no other so called innovative brands could even compete with moto G

Feb15 KITKAT update release!! 
 
guys I updated my Moto G to KITKAT and it now supports OTG feature ( can access pendrive through otg cable) , reduces usage of ram. bit change in icons also. No need of any backup of data for update.Buying this phone is one of the most prudent choices I have made.Unlike most people before me who used the reviews to vent their anger on the issues with service, rather than talk about the Phone, I chose to wait till I actually used this product. 
 
I've been using this new phone for 2 days now, and I'm going to tell you about why I feel I made the best choice in opting for it. 
 
Here are features I discovered on this phone that amazed me (I assume that you, like I did, currently use a cheaper phone or a phone without these features) : 
1) It's fast and responsive. You can easily notice the phone is like a wand which responds to your gestures with ease. 
2) When you first start your phone, you're asked for your Google/gmail id and suddenly the phone automatically integrates all your stuff and usage patterns from any google site or product you have used before 
3) You don't need to type in messages. The Swype feature allows you to glide your finger over the letters in a word and &quot;very accurately&quot; guesses the word you wish to type 
4) You don't even need the above feature. The phone has an inbuilt option wherein you can type USING YOUR VOICE. Just speak out your message and it accurately types whatever you're saying. I'm impressed by the how well it picks up my &quot;Indian accent&quot; 
5) The phone has inbuilt Google Voice Assist. Click the google search box on the homescreen and say a search query such as &quot;Distance Bangalore to Mumbai&quot;. The phone &quot;TALKS BACK&quot; to you. It tells you the distance and shows a map result with directions. 
5) Even without internet, you can use the voice assist to dial a number in your contacts. For example, I clicked on the Google search box(without net) and said &quot;Call Prashant&quot;. It read my command, showed me the contact detail and asked &quot;Mobile or Home&quot; (The contact had 2 numbers). I replied &quot;Mobile&quot; and it made a call. Love this feature 
6) The phone multitasks with ease and there are a lot of great Android apps for all your needs. 
7) The Indian edition of the phone comes with a wall charger, but misses out on USB cable. But it looks unnecessary as everything you need can be transferred to and from this phone using the net and with Google help. So don't worry about it. 
 
If you already have a more expensive phone with all these features, then don't bother. But if you're like me who's looking for the latest and best features of technology in a Rs12,500 phone then don't think twice. Buy it! 
 
Hope you find my review useful :)DO NOT UPDATE TO KITKAN.I am writing this review to warn everyone that Kit-Kat update should not be done 
as there are many bugs in Kit-Kat write now.. 
some of the major bugs you can face are as follows 
 
1. lose mobile signal 
2. display 'No Sim' icons, 
3. fall into Aeroplane mode (while not displaying Aeroplane Icon status) 
4. Mobile signal can often be recovered by swapping into and out of Aeroplane mode. 
5. Pop-up errors about being in Aeroplane mode while attempting to make calls during signal problems. 
6. Aeroplane mode observed in about phone status (while no aeroplane mode shown on icons) 
7.Popup errors - the process &quot;com.android.phone&quot; has stopped 
 
Right now 
Moto G gets a minor firmware update only in Europe,that brings back OTG, fixes mobile network issues 
Motorola has started rolling out a minor Android KitKat update for the single SIM variant of the Moto G in Europe. This update brings back the USB on-the-go (OTG) support for the users with USB drivers and also fixes mobile network loss for some users. 
 
The over-the-air (OTA) update is about 7.2 MB and the version of the update is 176.44.1.en.GB for the UK variant. The build is dated February 6th, 2014. 
this is not aired in india...

Motorola has resurrected in india with a BANG from a brief slumber.Some things you would not find in other reviews.Amazing phone... Flipkart delivered it in 3 days flat - ordered it on 24th feb recieved on 27 th. 
1. Good Build quality, Powerful speakers and good music quality, FM Radio. 
2. Very Smooth Operation, Pure Android, good additional features from google. 
3. Gorilla Glass, Water resistant , durable. 
4. Battery life is also good - need to keep the right settings and battery will last. 
5. No heating. 
6. many said camera is bad... but i feel Camera is good enough, Not the best but not bad. 
images were bright and good clarity when viewed on laptop. 
7. Many gave feedback that screen is not so good like amoled, but after i bought i realised that it is bright and clear, also good resolution (ppi) - Very nice 
Screen is 4.5 inch - if you need a Phablet experience id recommend to go for bigger screen phones, but this phone is very handy and good enough screen for me. 
 
8. Ram is 1 GB - this is good enough for regular operations like browsing internet with many tabs open and some basic multitasking ( i tried around 15 apps simultaneously and phone performed well - without lag ), But haven't tried the real heavy loading like games yet. I feel if you are a heavy gamer - go for more ram phones. but if you are not interested in games - this is good enough. 
9. Noticed that the phone lagged a it while i connected charger and multitasked at the same time, but this shouldn't be much of a problem. 
10. The Phone benchmark ratings are much higher than phones of this price range. 
11. KITKAT 4.4 update works really well, google Now feature is just awesome. 
12. Supports Pen Drive connection to mobile, but after updating KitKat, you would need to download additional software like Total Commander / Nexus Media importer to enable this feature - So the lack of SD card support is compensated. But I would prefer the 16 GB version over 8 GB as only 13 GB is available for use and Apps will require heavy memory. 
11. Max SAR is a bit high but within limits - but default SAR under normal conditions should be low. 
12. Overall its a Showstealer for this price. !! :) 
 
Conclusion: 
If you are planning to buy a phone under 20 K (as on March 2014) go for Moto G blindly. (Worth the money) 
But for a Gaming phone above 20 K - id go for Nexus 5. 
I also considered Huawei Ascend g700 / Intex Octa - but not so sure about the brand. 
Need to wait and see if a good phone under 18 K and 2 GB ram would be released in India.The best phone for the price...!.I bought this in afternoon on 6th with in-a-day guarantee, the delivery was delayed....got it on 8th (Flipkart - I am yet to get a refund). 
But boy was it worth it. The moment you lay your eyes on this black beauty, you'll fall in love with it.The phone just looks just beautiful. And very different from the typical samsung stuff that every tom dick and harry have. The beauty is more than skin deep too. It's a sturdy phone. it feels like it can handle a bit of rough use. Although the back feels smooth and good looking, I think it will get scratched easily. It definitely not the lightest,slimmest smartphone, but tolerable. 
 
On the tech front the phone works smoothly without any glitches at all. Setup was super simple. The qualcomm quad core chip works nicely. No lags experienced till now. No heating issues. Not ultra fast, but well above average. 
Lot of free space (about 12.5 GB). 
Screen is again a beauty. High pixel density means all pictures/text look crispy clear. Brightness is also more than adequate. 
Battery life life will get you through the day on normal use. And by normal I mean switching 3g off when not needed. Keeping internet always on can take a toll on the battery. Adjusting brightness to a lower setting however does a major difference to the battery life. 
Camera is nothing much to write about. Average. But doesn't affect me. Works nicely outdoors, but in indoor lighting it just suffers. Front cam is strictly ok for skype. 
 
Software wise - the device is running almost pure 4.3 Jellybean, hopefully it'll get 4.4 KitKat soon. No problems there. 
What bugs me is I can find no way of adjusting the App drawer in a custom order. I know there are homescreens for that (just 5), but please I should be allowed to adjust the app drawer the way I want (its alphabetical by default). 
I wish I would have been able to sync my facebook contacts with google ones with profile pictures, but seems that due to a feud between google and FB, I won't get to that unless I install a third party app. But these are small glitches and I can tolerate them. Other than that software works flawlessly. Motorola did a great job keeping useless apps away. And whatever apps they have are useful (viz. Moto Assist, Migrate, Device ID). And you get 50 GB free on existing google drive account in addition to 15GB free to a total of 65 GB. Cool. More photo backups for me !! 
 
I got a back cover (Royal Blue) for my phone as they were selling for 70% off, unfortunately it doesn't look as good as it looks on screen. Turquoise would probably be a better choice. But these covers are even more sturdy than the original black one, and can definitely handle scratches in a much better way. They almost feel scratch-proof. 
 
And BEWARE this thing doesn't come with a micro USB data cable as you would think. I opened the box to find a charger and i thought they were the type with a usb port at the end. but I was wrong. the wire goes straight into the wall unit. So in short you get a charger only NOT a charger/USB cable combo. get your own one. I haven't tried the earphones yet, but anyways they are old type hard full size earphones and look cheap. I would have much rather have a USB cable instead of this. 
 
But even after overcoming these small cons, I think this phone is just too good for this price to even care about them. If you are in the market for a phone that is fast,inexpensive, looks good, feels good, feels different from the tons of samsungs out there (No offense, I love this company, all appliances at my house are samsung and are good. My previous phone was a samsung. Been using that for 4-5 years, never failed me. But the identicalness of smartphones in samsung is not for me) and you can sacrifice a bit of camera performance then THIS PHONE IS FOR YOU, PERIOD.Best phone in price range so for.I found this is the best phone, I have used so for, I have experienced HTC, Samsung, and Nokia 
 
Processor and RAM. Both are absolutely fine. I don&rsquo;t feel any problem. All programs open quickly and respond fast. 300 MB RAM is always free. 1080p HD video plays smoothly in SW decoder mode in MX Player. 12 GB internal memory is available for use in my 16 GB version. Update to KITKAT is fine and have not resulted in any bug. 
Display: Color OK but not vibrant as you will see in high end Samsung phone, but resolution, and contrast is great. Screen response is very fast. Screen feels smooth. At 100% brightness the display is visible in sunlight. I will give 9.5/10 for screen display. I reduce 0.5 only for less vibrant color compare to samsung. But it is equal to Sony Xperia. 
 
Wifi: It connects immediately, there is no dead syndrome, It means there will be no loss of signal wherever you hold the phone. It will work in a good range. 10/10 
Call quality: I say it is perfect, if you have any problem it will definitely related with the network. Phone volume is great. 10/10 
 
Mobile network: Network works fine. Both SIM shows good range of the signal. The only problem people have noted, we cannot force it to use only 3G network. But it can be solved by dialing *#*#4636#*#* and then selecting WCDMA only. The other good thing is that there is an option in the phone by which you can receive call on second SIM, when first SIM is using DATA. This feature is not available in many phone, and if it is there, it reduces data speed. But in this it works absolutely fine. You can also activate easily mutual call forward. 10/10 
 
Speaker: The external speaker is sensibly louder and clear. 10/10 
Camera: Many people say the camera is not good but as far as you speak about camera in mobile, I will say it is great in this phone. People usually compare mobile camera picture with actual camera which is wrong. I give 10/10 for the camera, but the software for the camera has very simple as there is no option to change image/video quality and resolution, no manual selection of white balance, no geo tagging, no metering change. In other words, just there is one click to capture image or start recording besides there is no control. 
 
GPS: It is great, take 30 Seconds to find the position in outdoor, clear sky condition. I checked navigation in google navigator and Sygic. Positions are absolutely correct. 10/10 
Battery: Great, charge time 0-100% 4 hours using its charger. Discharge rate : 5 hours for video play, 24 hours for moderate mixed usage, 4 days for standby both SIM and Wifi on. 
 
Body, weight, control buttons every thing is perfect. 
 
Accessory: headphone is average quality, charger is great quality, NO USB cable, but one can buy in 50 Rs.Redefines a mid-segment device.Having used my Moto G for over a week now, I can say without a second thought that this has been one of my best investments so far. Without any further ado lets jump into the features I love the most about this device 
 
1.Brilliant display which takes your attention as soon as you switch ON your device. After Kitkat update you get a transparent notification and navigation bar which further enhances the beauty. 
2.For those of you buying now, you would get Kitkat update as soon as you switch on your phone. The update was released on 14th Feb. It seems Motorola wanted to give us a Valentine's Day gift and it was sweet. 
3.Operation is pretty smooth. You get 300-340 MB of free ram even after installing quite a few apps. I must add here that usable storage on the 16 gig version is 12.92GB. So choose your version wisely. 
4.All the games I tested work excellently. There are minimal(if any) frame drops during gameplay. In-game loading time is fast. 
5.USB OTG works well on stock without requiring any external app or root. Both reading and writing to the USB works after the Kitkat update. 
 
I get a battery life of 1 day and 4-5 hours with 3-3.5 hours of screen-time and Wi-fi kept on for the entire duration. While this is not bad per se, I have seen users report much more than that. I am still trying to up the battery life of my device. Can't think of any striking con now. 
 
On a whole, it's just an amazing device and if you're on the edge, just go ahead and buy it before the stocks run out yet again.Good Phone but some problems.There are a ton of reviews on this site so i am just going to state a few things i personally observed about this phone. 
 
Pros - 
 
1. The Battery. In general i managed to get an average of around 16 hours of battery life with heavy use. Which is good, considering the 2070 mAh battery on the inside.. 
 
2. The Processing Power - With the combination of the snapdragon 400 and near stock android, it flies through almost all applications, given some games do tend to lag a bit. (GTA: VC, GTA:SA - major lag) 
 
3. The Display - This is by far the best part about this device. It has a really bright and true to life display. Colours seem natural and the 326 ppi density makes watching a movie in 1080p really an enjoyable experience. (Its a matter of personal opinion on the size for watching a movie though. Personally, I prefer the 4.5 inch display as a on the go device for multimedia.) 
Ps. 1080p works at 30fps only with mp4 format, Other formats do play but tend to have lag. 
 
4. Speakers - The speakers are really quite amazing on this phone. They are really loud and clear. (Slight distortion at maximum volume though) 
 
5. Overall Build - This does not feel like a device that you would get for 14k. It definitely feels like its worth a lot more the way that it is designed and the materials used. 
 
Cons - 
 
1. Bugs with KitKat build 
 
2. Camera - The camera is quite decent with good amount of detail in well lit areas but horrible low light shots. Flash does help but the flash saturation in the photos is way beyond a decent level. 
 
3. Storage - I was really hoping for a bigger storage option. The 16 gb version that i had picked up is already filled up. Most of it though due to the sheer number of applications that are installed and the data files that they generate. 
 
Lastly, I have to mention this for the sake of anyone who is buying this phone. I like a few others who have purchased this phone (not just flipkart) have run into the same issue. A damaged version of the display panel. A few dead pixels, slight backlit bleeding and a dead backlit led. Make sure that if you do purchase this phone that you do check for these particular defects.Fanastic Phone, fanastic service and what LUCK !!!.Firstly about the launch - Got up on the morning of 6th Feb wanted to get the phone for my Wife's birthday on 9th Feb (Sunday).
