Good Luck Flipkart and Motorola Welcome Back!Why Another Review?.There has been a lot of hype created by Moto G over the last few months. The launch in India was met with enthusiasm and fervor. And the device lives up to all the expectations. 
 
I have been using the phone for almost a week now. The UI is smooth and i haven't faced a lag. The touch screen is responsive. The display quality is excellent - colors are crisp and vibrant. 12GB+ is available on board, which should suffice for most users. Android KitKat update is promised. Google Drive gives you additional 50GB space for 2 years, which can be used to store ur documents and music collection in case you find shortage of space. Battery life is excellent - with moderate use I am able to pull off 2 days of use. 
 
I don't believe in quad cores, rams, benchmarks and other stuff. So won't comment. 
 
Why should you get it? 
Because other phones in this price range are crap!! Yes, they are. 
 
Motorola has been a brand of repute in the US for quite some time. Using the phone makes me feel that it will last for quite some time. And last well. That's what eventually matters. Not Antutu scores. 
 
Get a MotoG. I am sure you will love the phone. Enjoy!!Moto G Detailed Review.ordered a 16 GB Moto G through flipkart with one day delivery guarantee, got it in 5 days! (Though some of my friends got it the next day with normal delivery option). But, finally it costed me Rs. 13,999 only! 
secure packaging (thanks to WS Retail) with bubble packed carton! 
 
was pre upgraded to Android 4.4.2 Kitkat! pre loaded with almost no bloatwares. The only two inbuilt apps from the Motorola were Motorola Migrate and Moto Assist (Assist being very useful instead) 
 
The power and volume rockers feel slightly cheap: the only disappointing thing about the built, but it will not make a issue with normal use. Its much better than boring identical Samsung phones design though! 
 
The best feature about the phone is its brilliant high density 4.5 inch IPS Display with a resolution of 720 x 1280 pixels (329 ppi pixel density). It has awesome color reproduction and enough brightness even with the least brightness set. Notably, the Moto G's screen is a bit sharper than Apple's iPhone 5s, which offers 326 ppi. The phone uses the default boring stock UI which I overridden with Google Now Kitkat Launcher which is featured in Nexus Phones. This made the phone UI interesting with Google now cards on the left most home screen and the awesome &quot;OK Google&quot; hot word detection! 
My friend ordered a Moto G recently and his display was slightly yellowish as compared to my clear white display. I searched for this issue on internet and lots of posts were flooded with the problem. I guess it might be due to different different components assembly from different OEMs. But his display was also looking brilliant and he is using it without an issue as of now! 
 
The phone is buttery smooth with its Quad-core 1.2 GHz Qualcomm MSM8226 Snapdragon 400 on a Cortex-A7 chipset with an Adreno 305 GPU. Big games and tasks are good to go. The 1 GB RAM also makes the phone much used multi tasking capability easier. I had tried almost all the larger games including Asphalt 8, Real Racing and Injustice and the performance was awesome without an issue. 
The 16 GB of the device is nearly 12 GB usable with no expandable memory card slot! The biggest drawback of the phone along with the non removable battery! The back cover is open able only for inserting the two micro SIM cards and for customizing the colorful back panels! 
 
I felt an average speech quality during calls through its earpiece with no call drop issues. During the Line video chat to another Moto G the 720p enabled front camera worked well with nice clarity(both ways)! The loud speaker of the phone is much much loud and above average but only gives Mono audio output. 
The Wi-Fi and mobile data works average as compared to other devices in this class. It didn't disappoint me yet! My local media streaming was working well. But I felt a slight laginess on my Wi-Fi connection during Youtube HD streaming as my other devices were buffering quicker simultaneously! 
Rest of the cloud features and syncing were normal and performed without and issue. 
 
The phone sports a 5 mega pixel auto focus camera with a new Motorola camera interface. The camera performs well in terms of autofocus and any novice can use camera with an ease but, it is very low on megapixels. Altough, I never felt cheated for the camera. The back and front camera both are capable of shooting 720p videos. The slow movie capture is also present identical to the iPhone 5s SlowMo! With the latest camera update the volume rockers can be used as dedicated camera shutter buttons although a long press didn&rsquo;t set the focus instead took many multiple shutter shots! The flash is very bright and it is placed in-between the camera and Motorola logo dimple. The camera is good for Instagramming and other social outdoor bright light shots! 
The phone supports a non removable 2070 mAh battery with Motorola claiming with 24 hours mix usage. I used the phone with all the mixed features and was able to use the phone whole day with average call, Wi-Fi usage, tweeting, Facebooking, Instagramming, Youtube and texting. With heavy usage it can run upto 16 hours on a single charge. Although the charging time is larger as Motorola provided charger is has low current output. But it can be charged faster with other USB sockets including PC USB ports. But for this, you have to get an extra data syncing wire as the wire was not included in the box! Despite many rumours on 4.4.2 The OTG storage with a 16 GB USB flash drive worked fine without any issue on my device as I used the Cyanogenmod built File manager. Other popular file managers can also be used for an issue less working of OTG cable. So, the folks worrying about expandable storage should not be worried about the 12 GB inbuilt space.Rs. 13999? It's totally worth it.I received this phone today and man does it look gorgeous. One of the best Android phones in the market at this price point. 
 
I have been using this phone for about a day and have some things to tell. 
 
Staring with the good things. 
 
1) It has a beautiful LCD panel. It's an above average, 720p IPS panel with 329 ppi and great viewing angles. The iPhone has 326 ppi. 
2) The phone fits in the hand and doesn't feel its going to fall off. It has a good rubber grip on the back unless you change the back cover. 
3) The glass on the screen is one of the best I've seen. It doesn't attract finger prints that much. It's way better than what's on my iPad 2 which is a finger print magnet. 
4) It's a phone so the call quality should be great and it is! And it has astonishingly very good quality mics. 
5) The loudspeaker is actually loud, perfect for multiple people to listen to. 
6) It's a freaking dual SIM! 
 
Now for some mediocre things 
 
1) The camera is of average quality. It's OK for this price point. 
2) The OS doesn't feel sluggish but it's hardware is definitely not designed for heavy multitasking. 
 
And finally the ugly things. 
 
1) Maan does this thing get hot and by hot I don't mean burning hot. The temperature is very uncomfortable when the phone is on your ear. I have observed that when the WiFi is switched on it and you are making a phone call, it gets warm. 
2) The accessories are just plain stupid and by accessories I mean the earphones. They are so uncomfortable. My earlobes start paining after five minutes of wearing them and don't talk about sound quality, it's just horrible. Please for God's sake, don't use those horrid things. Buy a new set and keep your ears happy. 
 
So there you have it. Hope this helps other potential buyers. I placed a COD order on 22nd and got it delivered by 26th as promised by 
 
Flipkart. This is also my first mobile purchase through online after seeing many reviews and promise from Flipkart. So i am rating Flipkart 5/5. :) 
 
I noticted some people telling that they got a faulty mobile or late delivery service or product not upto the mark. Clearly we need to understand that flipkart is just like a service,which connects sellers and buyers. If the product is delayed,then it must be because of either the delay of seller or other natural circumstances(may be). So flipkart does'n play much role in this. If they get the product then they deliver it very soon. And another important thing is that,this was a product which was in very high demand,so no one is to be blamed for late delivery. 
 
Regarding the product,if you have used high expensive mobiles like iphone,note etc, then you will find some features left out in this mobile. But you should understand that this mobile has covered many features in this price.Some peoples have been reporting issues with their mobile,i too had very little software issues,but it happens when a product is just 
released and in my opinion you should also have little luck to get a good one because you are ordering through online and not by checking the product twice or thrice in a shop.Every issues can be fixed,all we need to do is to be calm and to approach right person to solve issues. 
 
Problem i faced with this mobile: 
I didn get much hardware problem.Both the slim slots were working fine and only then i used scratch guard.The real problem was, i couldn update the OS with my mobile data network.Since i dont have wifi,my only option was through mobile data.I contacted motorola customer care 2times,and 2answers was given by different persons. One told like we could update system update only with wifi,and other one said we can update by mobile data/wifi but he doesn know the real problem which i was facing and he told me to take my mobile to a service center.But i wish to find the solution on my own.I realised like i got my sim in my native and this sim works as a roaming in the city which i work.I guessed this was a problem,and today i found that i was correct. 
 
Yes, THE SIM WHICH IS IN ROAMING WILL NOT ALLOW YOU TO DO SYSTEM UPDATES.:) 
 
Even though it will take data from your mobile data network,it will ask you to turn on WIFI(dont know why :D).After updating i did'n get any errors like camera errors,sim not detecting etc.I guess i am lucky since most are facing these problems after updating their OS. 
If you have a roaming sim and if you need to update,you can use a friends mobile(if he has mobile hotspot option) to be a wifi-hotspot and you can access internet through his mobile.(his device will be acting as a wifi connection,so you can choose his device name in wifi and can access it) :) 
 
Pros: 
*Looks great in hand and placed in a table. 
*Boot time is very fast. 
*Charge stands for 1 1/2 days for me for normal use,if played games and accessing internet it stands from 12-24hours. 
*Loud speaker. 
*HD Recording. 
*Touch screen is very good.(recommend to use matte finish screen guards) 
 
Cons: 
*Headset is just OK,but the clarity and sound is very good 
*Camera is good not best but unlike other mobiles telling that it has 12mp and only has 8 or 10mp,this mobile stands for its mentioned specs. 
*Dont know why i had to turn on wifi even if i am updating through a mobile data network(yet to be inspected). 
*Getting ringtone in the phone even if i am connected to a headset(thats also fine). 
*Didn get a usb cable and back cover.(came around 700 extra for me to buy those). 
 
Finally,i recommend this product to people who have just started to buy tough phones,and for people who is looking for a classy low budget phones. 
Not suitable for people who have already using iphones or high expensive mobiles,you will keep finding something is missing with this mobile :)

My previous phone was a Galaxy Nexus - one of the best Nexus lines made still date so I am not the kind that's easily placed. This phone was replacing that one. 
 
Pros: 
 - Very good build qualtity. The back cover feels great Doesn't seem like &quot;cheap plastic&quot; at all. Gives you a great &quot;premium phone&quot; feel. Does feel a little heavy though. 
 - Brilliant display. Did not expect the colors to pop like they do with the resolution mentioned in the specs. 
 - Really really fast. Absolutely no lag while browsing through menu items. Launcher loads fast even with several apps open. Again, didn't expect it with just a 1 GB ram. 
 -Very receptive captive touch. Much better than my gnex. 
 - Speaker is loud enough. I could hear a simple ring tone even in loud traffic. 
 - Crystal clear call quality. No problem. As good as my old gnex or even my wife's iPhone 4S 
 - My fully charged battery lasted me about 9 hrs with 2 SIMs in and 3G on. But isn't fair to compare battery because I was monkeying with the phone a lot and since the battery had 0 discharge cycles. It takes atleast 8-10 discharge cycles before a battery can function optimally. 
 
Cons: 
 There aren't many at all. I will need to split hair to find any at all. 
 - Getting off the back cover can be a pain. You need to kind of slide your finger nail under the cover through the micro USB port and pry it open. But since the battery is not user-replaceable and we wouldn't be changing sims on a daily basis - most of us can live with that. 
 - No expandable storage via external SD card. Again, almost every premium phone these days comes with only inbuilt storage so can't really complain. And hey. for the money I paid - i really can't! 
 - No user replaceable battery - again same as above. All premium phones are the same these days 
 
All in all.. terrific phone at an unbelievable price. Super service from Flipkart.best experience under 20k.Hi, 
 
I have been using Moto G for last 3-4 days, and I must say the experience is overwhelming. 
Before Moto, I was using Galaxy Ace (Gingerbread) and was about to switch to windows phone due issues like lagging, app compatibility etc. But I think I made 100% right choice by opting Moto G. The user interface is awesome, smooth and visually soothing. I have not experienced any lag. The only down thing is camera. I have bought 16gb model, abt 12.xx gb were free, now after loading most of apps (Whatsapp, FB, twitter, skype and lot other) abt 11 GB is still free. 
 
I suggest look at no other phone under 20k, if camera you are willing to compromise on camera. 
 
Mobile came with Android 4.3, as soon as I turned wifi on, I received update 4.4.2 (Kitkat, abt 280MB). 
 
Battery life so far has been good, I get aroung 20 hrs battery life with 3G. (mobile data on for 8 hrs, rest hrs on wifi, surfing, some light gaming, using whatsapp, twitter, fb through out) 
 
P.S. Batter is Lithium, so no need to initial charge it for 16-20 hrs, do normal charging, don't let battery drain to 0%. When you see battery is down to 5-15%, you can start charging. 
 
I hope this review is helpful. 
 
Cheers,

Excellent service by Flipkart as always!!!!MOtO G : Objective, unbiased and To the point expert review.I have been using two MOtO g mobiles for a month now. I thought posting my detailed experience about really important things which i haven't read in any reviews might help some of you guys. I will try to be objective and to the point. 
 
1. SCREEN: Its great! nice resolution with larger dpi. big enough, you don't want a phone larger than this for daily use. 
 
2. UI: software is awesome. out of the box android. there is not much visible difference between jellybean and kitkat. They say there are performance upgrades. But Moto g performs every task in a blink with both versions, Its buttery smooth. Google now is great, its like moto g is not your phone but a SLAVE. :) Internet is very fast for browsing. 
 google apps are great. 
 
3. STORAGE: You will want a 16gb as soon as you get your hands on this mobile. so possibly go for 16gb version. 
 
4. BUILD: build quality is awesome. Moto g feels rich, it has got sexy figure and looks with great material. 
 
5. Battery: 2070mah, 
it looks less by digits when compared to some lenevos. But trust me this battery even with such a big screen &amp; greater resolution still outperforms many giants in mobile world. 
I have been tracking battery performance with screenshots of details. Below are the findings. 
 
a. With continuous 3G mobile data ON, it will last for not more than 15 hours. Screen on time considered about 4 hours. Many people will post images of 2-3 days or more back up (with very less screen on time, and wifi) but trust me if you are using internet you will consume more screen time. (more back up is expected if screen ON time is less) Here you will feel cheated as motorola promises back of at least 24 hours. But still it is far better than other phones. 
 
b. Using wifi for internet will save a lot of battery and moto g will last for more hours. but many of us use mobile data connection, So we get less back up. 
 
c. gaming reduces the back up considerably 
 
d. Upgrade to kitkat reduces the back up. battery drains very fast. Experts say this is common and observed after upgrading to kitkat, Battery will shift to give original back up after few days. Personally i wont upgrade, its not much difference otherwise. 
 
e. Music through headset consumes very less battery. :) 
 
f. i will suggest not to use charger other than provided. 
 
g. after overnight charge. I got it alive for 6AM-10PM. for normal mixed usage. 
 
h. With single sim only and wifi on for all day, After 12 hours i still have 70% left. i wonder if using single sim betters the output.. 
 
6. Accessories: Charger is great, headphone are cheap. no data cable. 
 
7. Price for money factor: YES. you will feel its much more worth than you paid for. It slaps right in the face of every mobile in its price segment and even expensive phones upto 20K. 
 
8. Glitches and bugs 
a. Observed no voice on call connect at once. restarting solved it. 
b. Observed Blurry menu and icons twice. restarting solved it. 
c. Observed lost menu/ blank screen once. restarting solved it. 
d. Observed Lost signal at times. recaptures the signal in minute or two. 
 
9. Others and Shortcomings: 
CAMERA: if you want a good cam go for a digicam, this is a mobile phone. :P 
camera is good for occasional and light usage. Very good in daylight. Poor indoor performance. Other features: you can snap while recording a vdo, burst photo shoot, HDR 
CALL Quality: just OK, not great. 
Music: its Nice and gives good o/p for average people. Music lovers might want more. 
 
Go for Moto g if you want Google at your service with lightening speed and smoothness. 
If you want a music/camera phone, this is not you should go for.

GO FOR ITPhone Review after a week's use...Hello Everyone, 
   I ordered a MotoG 16GB on 2nd March(Midnight) and received on 4th March. As usual, Flipkart is best at its delivery if we provide a proper delivery address. 
Coming to performance of the phone, This is my review after using few other smart phones for past 5 years and using this MotoG for a week... 
1)Battery: 
While I play games for around 3-4 hrs, optimize display brightness and keep my wi-fi/3G always on (sync only when necessary)., battery comes comes down to 10% after 24 hrs (appx). Without playing games, it comes more than 30hrs. Is there any other smartphone that provides a better battery backup in this segment?.. 
2)Performance: 
-&gt; I play Real Racing 3, Asphalt and few other games that contain good graphics, and there is absolutely no lag. Touch is very smooth and I feel like apps floating. 
-&gt;Detects Wi-Fi network quickly as soon as we enter into the network area. 
-&gt;GPS and mobile Signal strength are very good. I used a same SIM in my Samsung Galaxy SL and Moto G, and the signal strength is pretty good in Moto G compared to Smasung. 
3)Others: 
-&gt;Phone is very handy and it is easy to operate with single hand. My thumb reaches any corner of the screen while I keep it in my palm. 
-&gt;Inbuilt apps like Moto Assist and Moto Migrate are very helpful. 
-&gt;Speaker is loud enough for ringtone as well as music and videos. 
-&gt;Camera quality is good enough, there may be little glitch under low light conditions but for a phone at this price I'm pretty happy with its quality. Moreover there is an inbuilt flash available for low light conditions. 
-&gt;Build quality of the phone is very good and due to its curve design and matty back panel, it fits perfectly in our palm with a good touch feel... :) 
Cons: 
-&gt;Regarding phone, no complaints as of now.. 
-&gt;No data cable and bad earphones are the only drawbacks.

MotoRolla......Go to hellGood phone but still has some issues.Since Flipkart ran out of 16G stocks soon after launch, I settled down on 8GB model as soon as this was available again on Flipkart. The handset feels solid. It is not among the most attractive designs though. Screen resolution and feel is excellent. Colours, brightness, viewing angles and reflections are acceptable. No complaints in that department, although occasionally screen touch needs multiple retires when browsing (no heavy duty apps in background). 
 
Connecting to my Wi-Fi AP with WPA was smooth. However, even when the phone shows full/good Wi-Fi signal strength, close to the AP, most apps (e.g. youtube, google play, email) frequently complain about the lost connectivity (I have uncongested 2 Mbps Ethernet broadband, and even switched off other devices to ensure the entire bandwidth is available for this phone). 
 
USB OTG initially worked only in read-only mode. The phone showed about 5.2 GB available for user. FM player requires the earphones (antenna wire) to be plugged in, and receiver displays RDS text on preferred stations (*ed). 
 
On Saturday, I upgraded to Android 4.4.2. Upgrade was smooth, it did consume significant storage, but I think it was expected. Even after the upgrade, the Wi-fi intermittent drop issue persists, and Moto helpdesk so far has been of no use. 
 
I also noticed another issue - playing video files other than ones recorded by its own camera. Tried 720p x264 with AC-3 Audio, doesnt play audio and video aborts after playing for a few seconds. Disappointment. Tried multiple files with similar resolution and the result is the same. MP3 plays well, sound is crisp and clear. Tried the stock player, as well as ES File manager. FLAC files also sound well, although the FLAC native player (Google) has to stay in foreground, and cant open any other app when FLAC audio is playing. Strange. 
 
One pleasant surprise - after the OS upgrade, the read-only OTG enabled full Read-Write.Speed is slow. I am using 32GB flash drive. The naming convention changed to be more friendly after upgrade. I found some less frequently performed tasks (e.g. editing phonebook) has become more difficult with the upgrade. The Camera shutter lag also increased after the upgrade (I guess due to increased processing on focus etc). I like the cellular signal strength bars changing color to orange when roaming, and t he white blinking LED to notify messages. 
 
Setting up Yahoo and Exchange accounts through the provided mail client was smooth, and interface is great. However, the phone doesnt recognize my outlook account. Always says password incorrect. Tried everything including changing password etc. works through browser but not through stock mail client. 
 
Phone battery lasts much longer, better than I expected (I compared to my other Samsung phone with similar 2000mAh with 4&quot; screen, with similar usage). Wish Flipkart had the flip covers available in stock, and wish it honoured the 1st day launch offer. I still could not get hold of the cover. Are you listening FlipKart?Worth the Wait!! :).I have been following the Moto G evolution for a long while and was eager to get my hands on one ASAP. Overjoyed when the G was unveiled on flipkart, sad when the 16GB version sold out, couldn't wait and ordered the 8GB version. And, absolutely loving my new kick-ass Moto G. 
 
Flipkart's service was as always, impeccable. They delivered a day earlier than projected and the delivery came in a nice little package. I've enjoying my phone for the last two days now, and wow, it works like a dream. I decided to go bare-naked with this one, no screen protector or cover of any sort- don't wanna tarnish that awesome, unbelievably vibrant screen and have been enjoying a zero-lag, fully spectacular performance. Psst- All that hype about the Moto G is truly worth it!! 
 
Only thing that you might have to be careful about is that with the 8GB model, you are only getting about 5GB of actual storage. The rest is eaten away by the system. If you a looking to stock your phone like an Eskimo's fridge, look for the 16GB version. 
 
And have fun! Thanks flipkart for being you. Never change.Why this an Exceptional Phone at Exceptional Price...?.I will give you 10 reasons... 
 
1) DISPLAY : You won't get a display of this quality for this price. It is simply stunning. 
I will say why. This phone has a 4.5 inch display with 720 x 1280 pixels (~326 ppi pixel density). Human eye is not able to differentiate any detailing above 300 ppi. So this the best that you can see with your eyes (even if you look at a phone with 450 ppi) . I have compared this display with a Nexus 5 and to my wonder this 720p display felt more rich and true than the 1080p display of a 33k phone. This is no exaggeration but the truth. The display stood par with the Note 3 display (only the video quality in the screen is discussed here) 
 
2) PROCESSOR : 1.2 Ghz quad core Snapdragon 400 processor is immensely powerful. The device will feel butter smooth at all times and processing power won't bother you at any point of time. Switching between apps, gaming, 1080p video playback everything is handled exceptionally well. 
 
3)GPU : They are giving you a phone at this price with a GPU, that itself is something great. Adreno 305 is the GPU. So far it handled Asphat 8, GT Racing and few high end graphics demanding games very well without any frame skip or lag or delay. The game play is super smooth. 1080p video playback was way better in this phone than many phones which were priced at 20k. 
 
4) CORNING GORILLA GLASS 3 : No other phone in this price bracket comes with gorilla glass. It is scratch and shatter proof (as claimed). So you can say a premium feature in a premium phone is there in Moto G which gives you peace of mind while using it. 
 
5) NANO COATING : Yes your phone is waterproof though it is told as spill resistant. This is something you can't even see in a 33k Nexus 5. So you get more than what you pay. 
 
6)ANDROID 4.4 : You get a Kitkat version of android for this price bracket. The experience is flawless. But thd Kitkat update i would say is 95% complete , 5% is still jellybean (like icons, apps wiget separation in menu, long press menu in home screen etc) 
 
7) DECENT FRONT CAM : The 1.3 MP front cam is pretty good and it serves your purpose of video calls fairly well. Many phones in this price range to around 20k has 0.3MP front cam, so again here you get more than what you pay. Back cam is also decent and i won't say it is totally bad. Touch focus and HDR mode and good light gives you good results. Low light performance is poor. 
 
8)BATTERY : I don't know how this phone with 4.5 inch display and quad core processor is able to stay the whole day with a 2070 mAh battery, but it does manage to do that. The battery backup is really a strong point of this phone, when compared with any other phone of this range or any other range. I do remember Samsung S4 mini battery was draining like anything and it can't manage to stay up till noon with extensive usage. 
 
9) OTG : The phone supports usb 2.0 devices with an OTG cable. I tried a pendrive and Playstation joystick and both were supported. And sadly Nexus 5 failed here too. 
 
10) MISCELLANEOUS : The phone feels sturdy in hand, built quality is way beyond exceptional, phone looks really cool and very similar to the flagship phone Moto X, replaceable back covers which suits your taste and looks trendy, decent loudspeaker, 3.5mm headphone out is good, call quality good, Custom ROM for many more Android versions expected as there was for Motorola defy(support from Froyo to KitKat), if so this phone can stay very alive for next 2 years or beyond. 
 
In short this is an MVFM phone (More Value For Money)Very poor service from Motorola India.I purchased Moto G 16GB for my wife a month ago. After 15 days the screen (display) accidentally cracked. I took the set to the Motorola authorised service center- Reddington India limited in Jaipur. I was told the broken display is not covered in warranty (which is OK and I was willing to pay), but they cannot replace the display as they have not got parts from Motorola India. I spoke to the regional head of Motorola, who assured me that the parts would reach Jaipur in 2-3 days and that he will inform me. I kept waiting- no call, and no parts in service center either. I also contacted Motorola India through email- but they had no answers. For last 15 days I am constantly trying to get the set repaired, but to no avail. 
So, effectively we have not been able to use the set for last 15 days (and would not be able to use it for I do not know how long). I think it is highly inappropriate to launch any product without service provisions. Instead of creating so much hype and advertising, Motorola India should first strenghthen their services and ensure availability of parts.

Camera: 
Moto G sports a 5MP rear and a 1.3MP front facing camera. The front facing camera is great! But at low light camera feels terrible 
 
Call quality: 
The call quality on the Moto G isn&rsquo;t all that great compared to the other phones. Though you shouldn&rsquo;t dwell on as it isn&rsquo;t such a big problem. Bottom line is that the call quality is average at the best, and I had network trouble connecting call to my Moto g 
 
Box Accessories: 
The accessories like headphones and charger comes with Moto g is poor. Charger tends to heat up quickly and add to that it doesn&rsquo;t have any data cables. 
 
Battery: 
My phone which is an 8 GB variant lasted for only 12 hours on an average use 
 
Memory Expansion: 
The Moto G is available in 8GB and 16GB. So if you like to store all your music, videos and large games on your phone this could create a problem since there isn&rsquo;t a micro sd card slot available.

As i read reviews for this phone I realized that this phone is way more than that. Its build quality is great, screen resolution is superb( 
326 ppi), phone is sturdy does not feel flimsy, the processor is great and Whatsapp, facebook, twitter, gmail, and Hayday (all are App Names ) run extremely smooth, the screen is just right could have been more but that's just coz i was a Note user.(:D) . The software is just too good, it is smoother than any budget phone out there and faster than any budget phone out there. Google and Motorola have given you just the things you need no frills. 
I previously used two phones for two numbers but this phone solved the issue with dual sim, and works flawlessly. 
Couple of things prospective buyers should keep in mind 
1.) Its under 15000 so do not expect it do have a kicker Camera, camera is ok and only for personal pics and not for photography experts 
2.) It is not and does not market itself to be a gaming machine , though it plays games like real racing 3 and other such games flawlessly but lags if played for long duration 
3.) It is non expandable memory , i bought the 8gb one and gave me 5.2 GB of storage, so one has to be judicious in the songs and videos you put on the device

I personally use a Canvas Magnus A117 which is a very good comparable to the Moto G in terms of specs and price, except that it doesn't have a brand name behind it. 
 
A few places where moto-G screwed up: 
1) Started lagging on day 1 when we installed 5+ apps simultaneously. Doesn't lag on regular use though, but screws up on parallel processing. 
2) When you let the battery drain completely, you have to remove the sim to charge the phone again. If you don't, it doesn't charge ! This is a reported issue, it happens with a particular type of sim apparently, and Moto G team claims that they are experimenting with some new technology on charging. Whatever it is, its no fun for the user. 
 
I would suggest you guys to go with the Micromax Magnus, for the following reasons, 
1) Its a LOT FASTER 
2) It's half the width, half the weight of Moto G ( the white version of magnus is a little more bulky, still way better than Moto G) 
3) Bigger screen (this could be subjective)

And since its google, you can get the updates easily and quickly. No need to wait. 
You also get 50 GB of google drive. 
 
The only cons with this phone are maybe its camera(its only 5 MP) and its lack of adding an external card. But come on, at this price those really don't matter. 
 
When you compare this with Micromax Canvas HD (I own one) the only difference is that the canvas boasts a better camera and it has an external memory card slot. But it still runs android 4.1.2 and its internal is just 1 GB (its actually 300 MB if you include all the pre-installed apps. But yeah you can move apps to the external, still you cannot really have a lot of apps) and you cannot rely on Micromax phones. (especially this one. The scrren suddenly stop responding 1 day after 3 months of use and it took me a whole month to get it fixed. Micromax service is pathetic.) 
 
So yeah, if you're looking for a budget everyday-use phone which has everything (almost),

Good things: Awesome screen, very fast loading of apps and websites, instant screen response, good voice enabled search and interaction, upgradable to 4.4 kit kat, above average battery life - (1.5 days browse, media, voice, full time wifi), 
 
Can Improve: Weight - at 140g its not heavy but anything less is preferred, Battery - It cannot be removed by users, so if anything goes wrong, its a trip to service center which could be painful. 
 
Ugly side: Camera: If you are the type who clicks a lot of pics and expect average or above shots then stay away from this phone. Pics are not sharp, require a lot of light and any motion of hand or object gives a blurry shot. Storage: No expandable storage - That's a bump!

(Please read thru completely before you start firing the 'HOW CAN U COMPARE NEXUS 5 WITH THIS' gun). 
 
Facts - 
1. Right now only Nexus phones and Moto G has Kitkat. - latest Android.And yea I show off a lot with this ALONE! 
 
2. I am getting a battery life of 48 hours!! (Post Kitkat, normal usage, high on video streaming and FB. Less on whatsapp and no gaming). But I also make sure I dont keep wi-fi or mobile network ON if i am not using. So adjust according to your usage. 
 
3. I can use it with one hand alone which is a great plus! 
 
4. LOVE the matt finished rubberized back cover. What a form-factor and grip. I got the black one.

Just go for it.A POCKET FRIENDLY POWERHOUSE.I have been using ONLY Motorola phones since 2005. Starting with L6, I have used Razor V3i, ROKR E6, ROKR E8, Motorola CHARM, DEFY, DEFY+, DEFY mini. And now I have Moto G with me. Before I tell you anything else about Motorola or this specific phone in particular, let me say one thing, &quot;This phone is a pocket friendly POWER HOUSE. Its a beast!&quot; I have thrown several heavy apps at it (some alone, some simultaneously), and this phone hasnt disappointed me yet (I got it on its launch). Its a wonderful phone with a powerful processor, sharp display and LOOOONNGG battery life that would put Arnab Goswami's passionate rantings to shame. With its 'rubber like' finish on the curvy back, I must say this is one beautiful phone. It stands out when I put it on the table with other phones. So if you are looking for a budget friendly phone with good specs, I would say GET THIS ONE NOW! 
 
However, this phone isnt perfect! 
 
The camera is too noisy. There are clear visible grains in all the pictures. Even the pictures taken in broad daylight are noisy. However, the auto focus on this phone is terrific. You just move the crosshairs with your fingers ANWHERE on the screen and it will adjust the exposer and focus on its own. But this intelligent focus is of no use because all the pictures are grainy. So yes, the camera is BAD! Phone is good, but the camera is BAD !! 
 
So if you are a photography enthusiast who keeps taking pictures with your phone all the time, you will be disappointed with this phone. But if you want a good phone with great specs and power packed performance, I would say, GO FOR IT! 
 
This phone comes with stock android; which means you dont get all those useless softwares/apps installed on it (like many other brands do), and so your phone eats less of your storage space. Besides, Motorola is frequently churning out some wonderful updates for this phone. So make sure you keep your phone updated. 
 
In the end, I would again say, that besides a shoddy camera this is an amazing phone for its price. Its totally value for money and looks devilishly good in your hands. Also, there are lots of back covers and panels available for this phone that you can put on. 
 
Hope this review helped. 
 
Have a nice day!

Now suppose I am reading a book and want to move to last page then I will scroll the book that time with one scroll attempt in Galaxy I could see many pages moved from top to bottom but to get the same result in Moto G I need to do scroll twice or thrice. 
 
I feel because of this issue you may not get premium feeling of having such a powerful and wonderful device in your hand.

It has buttery smooth touch screen, nice color display and very ergonomic design. I bought this phone a month ago and was quite happy with its overall performances but i lost this phone a week ago :( 
 
Cons: 
1. Best value for money, if you are planning to buy a phone with budget below 20k you can blindly buy this beauty 
2. Dual sim, its dual sim functionality is quite handy. You can specify which sim can be used for data/messaging/calling ( comes handy and you can go for best 3g offers in given areas) 
3. Battery performance is quite good, it will last a day with 2-3 hrs gaming normal calling with data on 24hrs. 
4. Design, it fits perfectly in you hand nor too big to handle or nor to small to watch/play video 
5. Speaker sound quality is good, its loud enough to fill you room 
6. Best gaming experience, i have played temple run, Dead trigger 2, hungry shark, thor, and crazy bike with buttery smooth without any lag( if you have opened multiple apps you might feel some lag but better to close the app which you are not using for better performance) 
7. Camera, you can get decent quality pictures with given 5 MP camera, good enough to upload on fb or instagram. 
 
Again friends this is the best in this price range one can ever get.

1. Call used to drop automatically 
2 Sometimes network was available on both sim but i was unable to make calls ( frequency once in a 2-3 days or a week, not very often but yes its there) 
3. mobile data doesn't starts automatically on if i switched off and on it( it use to happens on other android device, to resolve this you can turn on/off aeroplane mode and if its not working restart) 
 
But again these are some minor glitches which soon will be resolved by moto, i was quite satisfied with this beauty and it does not feel cheap.

The phone is excellent considering its price.Rather than write a long review,i'll address some common doubts regarding the phone. 
 
-The unit i got had an import date of Feb 14, it came with android kitkat 4.4.2 out of the box 
 
-As the unit came with kitkat, none of the problems faced by people who did the OTA update from jellybean was present,for eg: The notification light works perfectly and the usb OTG works flawlessly.Good reception on both SIM cards too 
 
-Use a file manager app to access the files with usb OTG 
 
-You'll find the volume and power buttons to be a bit wobbly,but doesnt affect functionality. 
 
-Slow motion video works good 
- The few bundled motorola system apps like Camera,Gallery,MotoMigrate,Assist etc will get continous updates via play store 
 
Use the motorola lost phone feature during setup to lock and wipe your device in case its stolen

I have been using the phone for about 2 weeks now and here`s an honest review. 
 
1. The first impression u`ll get would be the build quality. Yaa its heavier than other phones but u`ll feel the robustness of the phone when u hold.The back panel has a rubber coating which helps in gripping the phone quite efficiently.The speakers are accurately placed so no problem with that.

5. The call quality- I would say that I was bit dissapointed becoz the experience could have been better. Initially I thought that it was my device problem but when I saw the same quality in my friends` Moto G too I understood that the voice quality is notwhat I expected. 
 
6. Battery life is exceptional.I have been getting a day and a half on normal usage which includes Wifi ON, 30mins of music., 1hr of call, 1hr of HD gaming with live wallpaper

My battery gets drained very fast. Need to charge on a daily twice basis. Here is the battery usage statistics: 
 
50% Consumed by Display 
12% Call Stand by 
10% Game - Played for 30 minutes.... 
 
I religiously try to switch off Wi-Fi, Data Roaming and avoid playing games. My philosophy is &quot;Communication First&quot; . However battery discharge seems to be an issues. 
 
Probably cell phone companies should thinking of having two batteries. 1 for communication and other for everything else. That way, when we need to phone a speak we are not deprived for communicating.

----------------------- Feb 15th Review ---------------------- 
I lost my Xperia C a week back. It was disappointing to loose such a nice phone within six months of buying it. Nevertheless I went to Moto G. The reason I chose this phone was it was Google's first phone since the acquired Motorola Mobility. And I am sure they would have put a lot of effort in making this a great piece of technological device. 
 
It arrived on Friday. The first charge of the battery lasted no more than 6 hours. But I subsequently charged it again on Saturday morning and it charged completely in 3 hours. It is Sunday evening 10:00 PM and I still have 24% battery. Of course, I am not a gamer as such. I use it for plain speaking, internet connectivity to check office emails, and reading news apps like Flipboard. 
 
Pros: 
Boots very fast. 
4.5&quot; Gorilla Glass is just awesome. 
The videos come out classy. 
50GB cloud space enough to store your contacts, important documents etc over the cloud and need not be worried. 
Light weight and elegant Black colour. 
Speed and touch sensitivity is just great. 
 
Cons: 
With 4.5&quot; keys look little smaller for my think fingers. But had never felt my finger went to a wrong letter or something like. 
No expandable memory, so I need to be very careful with what I download and store. 
 
Not tested yet: 
Audio quality, MAPS, 2G Connectivity 
 
I shall write a review again after 2 weeks to let other people know how has been the performance.Best phone under 20k.I got my phone within one day after ordering even without the in-a-day guarentee. Kudos to Flipkart for such fast delivery. 
 
The box in which the phone came in was a little smaller than I expected but I guess the manufacturers had to cut costs somehow. The box doesn't matter anyway so it is negligible. Apart from the phone, the box also came with earphones(very basic as expected), charger and warranty card and instructions. 
 
Now coming to the phone, I will review the phone on a point by point basis: 
 
*Screen: The screen is the best in class. No other phone(foreign brands) offer a 720p HD screen in a below 20k phone. The display is crisp and sharp and watching videos and reading books is a pleasure on it. It comes with Corning Gorilla Glass 3 so you do not need to buy a screen guard. The glass is strong and scratch proof. Brightness is also quite good and I use it on lowest brightness most of the time. 
 
Operating System: Android 4.4.2 KitKat is, in my opinion, the best mobile OS in the world. The user interface is simply beautiful and contains tons of features including Google Now. Google Now is a software which displays information which is important to you on the screen. Information such as Cricket teams and their match schedule, traffic situation on the way to office, technology news and reviews, etc are all displayed in on screen. Google Now monitors your searches on the net and your usage to understand you and display information which you might be interested in. It is a very useful feature. 
 
Performance: The Moto G comes with a Snapdragon 400 chipset and a quad core processor making the performance quite snappy. The phone handles heavy games without lag and switches between apps with seemingly no effort at all. The performance on this phone is surprisingly better than on my Nexus 7. The phone can handle anything you throw at it with just 1GB of RAM. Google must have really optimized the software and hardware allowing the phone to perform so well. 
 
Camera: The camera is pretty decent and, at this price point, I cannot complain. The camera may not be leaps ahead of others at this price range but it does have several features that only high end phones currently have. The Moto G Camera comes with features like Panorama, Slow Motion Video, HDR and Simultaneous HD video and photo recording(pretty good). This makes the camera on the Moto G far more desirable than any other phone below 20k. 
 
Look and Feel: The Moto G is a good sized phone and only slightly smaller than flagship phones like the Galaxy S4. It is comfortable to hold and does not feel heavy at all. The back part is soft but comfortable enough to hold the phone. The phone is quite easy to handle and I haven't dropped it even once. The phone looks good(I'd say it looks better than any Samsung phone) so you can feel proud showing it off to your friends. 
 
Extra features: Although the OS is mostly stock Android, Motorola has provided a few pre-installed apps which are quite useful. There are: 
 
1. Motorola Migrate: This app allows you to transfer messages, call records, photos, videos, contacts, etc from any android/apple device to your new phone. Its very convenient and saves a lot of time and effort in transferring and is simple to use. 
2.Motorola Assist: This app can automatically place the phone in silent mode when you are sleeping(you have to set the timings when you sleep). It also checks your calender for any meetings and places the phone in silent mode during these meetings. It also sends an automatic message reply if a person gives a missed call during the meeting. Note that only favourite contacts will receive the message. 
 
Overall I would recommend this phone to anyone looking to buy a good phone below 20k. This phone provides everything you need or want in a smartphone(great performance, fantastic screen, useful camera, low price and the latest software). Read on...Alright, there are numerous reviews on this phone. some are on the phone, some are on Flipkart service and some are even on fellow reviewers :). I would like to add my views, so that it might help someone out there in making a decision. 
 
For a record, I was an iPhone user all this time - was having an iPhone 4S and you probably can imagine the level of quality that I would have been expecting in my next phone when I have decided to switch. From my opinion, here are the pointers about the phone 
 
&gt; Premium build quality - (9/10) 
For a phone of this price, the build is so premium that you won't find the plastic feeling when you are holding it, no cranking sound when you hold it tight. Rubbery back cover, solid volume and power buttons and above all Gorilla glass makes it a perfect construct. However, one star down for designing the loud speaker in the back side and the ringer volume goes down when you place it in a flat surface, even worse in a mattress or a sofa. 
 
&gt; Excellent display and color reproduction (10/10) 
Once again, please don't compare it with the HTC one Max or an iPhone, just bearing in mind that we have spent hardly 1/3rd of the money of those phones. The display just flashes away true brightness, very good viewing angles and good pixel densities. What more you can ask for. However, try using good video players like MX Player to play true HD videos - today I tried with VLC beta and Android Video player, the video struggled to play. Perhaps the settings, but I ain't interested in fiddling with them, when my MX player played it quite smoothly. 
 
&gt; Very good Camera and good Video(7/10) 
Ok, there are lot of critism of camera of this devide. We got to remmeber that we are living in the age of 40Megapixel mobile cameras and people have very high expectation of everything. So it does justice for what a 5 Megapixel cam should do, infact one step ahead of it. Video is bit grainy, but for a device of 5MP, I will say its just awesome. 
 
&gt; Battery backup: (8/10): 
So this point varies from user to user depending on their settings, usage and a little on their atmosphere of usage as well (hot environment kills the performance). With Heavy 3G/Wi-Fi usage and 3 hours of calling, and lot of whatsapp and FB, the battery lasted for 14 hours and drained from 100% to 25%. I would again call it as a very good battery back up. 
 
&gt; Overall performace (9/10): 
I ain't a gamer. but have loaded the phone with all my needed apps and the phone multitasks with them with ease. So giving them all star except one, which could be filled by a gamer. 
 
Albeit there are a lot of other aspects to review, I am pointing out the key aspects which are main deciding factors to buy a phone. 
 
Last but not least, Flipkart service was so professional and they deliver what they promised(with some minor exceptions that I have heard of). When the claimed shipping time is 10-20 days, I don't understand why people vent out their frustration in the review column in just 5-10 days of ordering the phone. I think the excitement works in just the opposite way now, maybe something that Motorola has to address by expanding their selling channels. 
 
Thanks for reading my views and all the best for your new phone!Moto G a definite killer..Extremely a killer fone for the price. 
I got it 2 days before assured date of delivery. 
For this price you CANNOT get a better phone. 
More than what you get in this phone, what you do not get here would be more relevant. 
1. Camera is good only in full bright light and really bad in low light conditions. 
2. Memory is 1GB RAM and 8/16 GB non-expandable. So You cannot afford to have all your fotos, music etc redundantly. 
3. Speaker phone is not that great, so if you are avid user of speaker fone, think twice. 
4. Batteries are fixed, so if you have habit of installing all crap apps and your phone hangs frequently. Be careful with fixed battery phones, when your phone hangs you may not be able to restart by removing the batteries and must just wait patiently. 
 
Apart from above, 
1. Battery lasts for whole day &amp; more for avg talk time, avg wifi use (for mails &amp; messages ) not for streaming and heavy downloads. 
2. Theres an option to enable and disable the SIM you wish to use for data transfer &amp; you can set limit for the same. So you get warning if you cross the limit. You can use 2G or 3G connection optionally. This is great when you have limited 3G plan and unlimited 2G plan. 
3. 4.3 Kitkat upgrade is immediately available and UI changes are very good. 
4. Display quality is extremely good. 
5. default availability of sending SMS when you cut call is extremely useful and intutive. 
6. I'm from Trichy, a Tier 2 city in Tamilnadu. I was wondering, how will my servicing of Phone be taken care. Surprisingly, I was sent with the bill, an address of local service point in Trichy. I hardly doubt about the need for such a service point, for the phone seems to be very good. 
7. Clean Master is one incredible free app which will be very helpful for making RAM free, with least effort. 
 
I'm not a gamer so I cant say much about speed and response. When I get back to home at night after 10 hours job and 2.5 hours travel, it still shows 20 % battery remaining... Make sure to charge at night for at least 2 hours... Pros: 
1. Superfast. Almost as comparable to Nexus 5 (I have compared them side by side physically). This is the result of less customization on the OS by Google and a decent processor 
2.OS: They provide a pure version of android without any stupid add-ons like Samsung or Sony. 
3. Audio: Brilliant audio quality, which surprised me the most. Coupled with Poweramp this baby can match up with likes of Sony. Speakers are awesome as well. I haven't tried the in house Headphones as I was happy with my Sony headphones with this. 
4. Graphics: The screen is hi-res and it can play HD videos as well owing to the processor. 
5. Size: Very handy. Fits in your hands well enough, unlike those huge-over-the-top Samsung smartphones. 
6. Dual Sim: Not much of a consequence to me. But may be a good pointers for some. 
 
Cons: 
1. Camera: 5MP which is not acceptable to a lot of buyers. If you are looking for a good camera at this price I suggest Lumia. But 'twas never a bother for me :-) 
2. No NFC. Depends on users. I doubt most people in India ever use this. 
3. Service centers: Haven't checked on this, but it seems the service centers for Motorola are a lot less compared to Samsung or Nokia. 
 
Heads up for potential buyers: 
a. You don't get a data cable with this package. But if you have an older data cable this won't be of a concern. 
b. Usable memory is only 12 GB. Please check this based on your requirements as memory in not expandable.

GO BUY IT!!!Incredible phone at an incredible price!.This phone is going to disrupt the smartphone market. It's bringing the heat to the flagship devices with it amazing value for money. In the race between hardware manufacturers obsession with raw power and software industry's focus on optimization, the moto G hits a sweet spot. Running on latest Kitkat version 4.4.2 means that the performance is smooth with no lag at all. Motorola doesn't bloat it's phone with skins like samsung and HTC, therefore providing a coherent lag-free experience. The quad-core processor with 1 GB RAM means that it has enough power to perform any task thrown at it.The speaker on this phone is amazing, I mean really amazing. You can easily hear a sound even on a crowded place. The battery life is great, can easily last 2 days of moderate-heavy use...it beats the flagships hands down in battery life department, except the LG G2 of course. The screen is 720p HD housed in 4.5 inch, which makes it's ppi(density) higher than the much touted retina display of iphones. Not only in terms of pixels, but the screen is bright, vibrant and well caliberated that provides a really pleasant experience. The call quality is also good. 
 
The moto G also hits the sweet spot in terms on design. It isn't too big, neither too small. It has a soft touch curved back which makes it easy to hold the phone. The back however takes smudges easily. It is not an issue for me since it's user replaceable and I'd everyone use a case anyways. 
 
The camera is probably it's weak point. 5MP is okay for me, but the sensor itself isn't great. It'll take good pictures outdoor in good lighting conditions, but in a darker environment the image quality is below average. The volume button (of my handset) was a little wobbly. However, these are minor complaints. 
 
Looking at the phone, I am hard-pressed to find areas where Motorola compromised to reach this price point. The build quality, screen, speakers, battery life everything is top notch. And most of all, the phone feels good in hand. It doesn't provide the feel of a cheaply made phone, something that even Samsung Galaxy S4 can't shake off. 
 
While the phone may not beat the higher segment phones in individual areas, it provides an overall experience that rivals, if not beat even the flagship phones. It even has a dual-sim capability and a freaking FM radio, take that! 
 
For those looking for phone within 15K, this is hands down the best device. For those looking at a phone in 20-25 category, this again is the best device. 
 
I am absolutely satisfied with the handset and wish motorola all the best, keep providing value for money and the Indian customers will reward you! 
 
One more thing I'd like to add. As I said earlier, motorola doesn't adds it's own skin on top of Android. This has several advantages. 1) It doesn't bloat the phone. Meaning that the performance will remain good even with lower specs. 2) The overall design consistency of android is maintained. I can't begin to explain how bad the Samsung touchwiz is. 3) The same android version will provide more free space. The S4 had only around 8 GB of free space in a 16GB phone. 4) It becomes faster to update to the latest android version since Motorola doesn't have to add much to the OS.awesome phone moto g.This mobile is really very good, google shipped with kitkat google android. 1. Got the Kit-kat update on 15-02-2014. It seems though server is very slow. Took more than 24 hours to download 237MB of update. As read earlier, new dialler UI. No other apparent UI changes. Should see what it does to other things. 
 
2. The battery is draining too fast. In battery status its apparently showing &gt;50% utilized by screen. May be becoz of high resolution. When I contacted Motorola help center, the guy gave me a weird suggestion, to charge the battery once for 4-5 hours so it gets heated up. From than normal charging, this would help in sustaining battery more it seems. Should check out on that!!!! Stats: from full recharge to 50% in 12 hours. That is pretty ok ok considering my previous low battery phone which would give double than this, with the same use Wifi on, taking few calls, etc. 
 
Hoping to see the battery performance improves, as new handsets go on a spree of background synchronization and stuff. 
 
3. There is no option to send contacts directly through message. Its quiet annoying sometimes. Even though watsapp will come to rescue, if not you have to type it manually. Again this absence of feature confirmed by Motorola help center. 
 
4. Call clarity with one of the SIM ports is bad. Voice is continuously breaking. Din't change when I replaced Airtel sim with Docomo. While call quality was good with port 2. May be some hardware hitch with my set. But unexpected. 
 
5.Has Google Now and few interesting stuff, which I lacked on my old phone. So atleast getting some new experience with this. 
 
Overall, I would say neither very happy or sad. 5. Battery Non-removable (not a problem-mine last xperia battery still running from last 2.5 years) (and after such duration we definitely jump on next latest phone model) (and for water resistance property in-build sealed battery is requirement)

9. Camera quality is above average &amp; more than enough for online social snaps. (do you except SLR type quality from this size sensor)

 CAMERA is quite good the auto exposure and auto focus is damn speed and its focusing on any object with in milli seconds... vedio recoding is in720 p also good for a 5 MP mobile. it is provided with led flash which is very good. 
 INTERNAL memory is 16 gig out of which u will get around 12.5 gig.. which is pretty sufficient for an medium use of mobile... there is also the support of USB HOST i.e USB OTG support which allows the user to connect a pendrive usin a OTG cable available in the market around 100/- the writing and readings speeds are pretty good ...not disappointing..

the in box earphones quality is good but the speakers are with big dia.. many of the people can't fix them in their ears even i'm suffering from pain becoz of the earphones . the earphones are NOT bud type..they are ON EAR PHONES.

NOTE: I DIDN'T RECEIVE ANY KIND OF FUNDS FROM FLIPKART TO WRITE THIS REVIEW :PPremium Handset in this bracket!.Pros: 
 
Premium Look (Didn't expect it when I looked at the pics online but when you hold it, It sure does feel like the premium phones, even Samsung top tier phones have that cheap plastic feeling but not this.) 
 
16 Gig Storage (seems restricted at first but trust me, there is enough space for all apps and games you could possibly want.) Also the 50 Gig storage in Drive is a bonus. 
 
Speaker - Loud enough to garner attention from people around you (lol) 
 
Battery easily lasts over a day for regular user (fb/Whatsapp/occassional gaming with Wifi/3G) 
 
Headphone - Excellent quality, not in-ear headphones but they place inside the ear quite easily and don't cause a lot of difficulty 
 
Fast - Butter smooth with the KitKat update (comes pre-installed now) 
 
Cons: Hardly anything significant 
 
Back-cover gets smudgy so better to use a flip case. 
 
Battery charger gets heated up (doesn't affect charging though) 
 
Camera - This is where it takes a hit imo, the output is not great when the natural light is less. Even with enough artificial lights the output is grainy. It is sufficient in daylight. If camera is your top priority in a phone, there isn't a lot to talk about with this phone. Although for casual purpose it serves its purpose, the single LED flash is powerful. 
 
No USB wire to connect to PC (but it seems international version didn't have the charger and ear-phones, so we Indians are probably better off lol). 
 
All in all, the phone is definitely worth all the hype its getting. I'd even pay 20k for it. 
 
4.5/5A brilliant phone ... at a fantastic price!.It's always hard to write a review for a product on which so much has already been written about. 
 
Every once in a while, a manufacturer surpasses all your expectations from a product, and leaves you with absolutely no reason NOT to buy that product. 
 
In my view, the brilliant Moto-G from Motorola is one such remarkable product. It defies the conventional logic of a cheap phone being actually &quot;cheap&quot;, by delivering a high-quality product at a remarkable price. 
 
Yes, the spec-geeks can crib about the &quot;only&quot; 1GB of RAM, and &quot;mediocre&quot; camera performance. But if you are going to judge the Moto-G by the specs that it offers, then you are missing the point completely. 
 
The Moto-G isn't about what it &quot;DOESN'T&quot; have. It is about what it &quot;DOES&quot; have ... at this price. An honest, good-quality, value-for-money phone; that will deliver all that few phones at this price-point will, and more ... 
 
After the Nexus 4, very few products have packed this much quality into this low a price-point. 
 
I didn't need another phone, but I still went ahead and bought one, just as a gesture of my appreciation to Motorola &amp; Google for coming out with such a thoughtful product for us &quot;common&quot; people who work hard for a living; and would like to see our money spent well ... 
 
My recommendation to anyone who is looking at buying a mid-range phone that delivers more than it promises! For anyone who wants more &quot;frills&quot;, there is always the Moto-X ...Thanks Flipkart, Motorola and Google !!!.First of all, I am neither tech-savvy nor do i go for the latest fads. But, ever since, i read about nexus 5, was planning to buy (at US launch price). Was disappointed to see the Indian price being so high compared to US price. 
 
Then i read about Moto G. Everything i read made me believe this is the closest to the best high end smartphones. Was sure if the Indian launch price was below 15k, it would be a roaring success and i would buy the same. 
 
Though the wait was agonizing for all of us (i cant imagine the disappointment for others when i myself was waiting impatiently even though am not so much into latest things craze), it was good to see that neither Flipkart nor Motorola were greedy to have the launch price higher. This is the right price to break the barriers for the COMMON MAN to have a great SMARTPHONE.

Moto-G is really a powerful device.A remarkable experience overall..!!.Ordered this phone and the order was confirmed on the launch day. 
The phone itself was delivered on 8th February (morning), as dependable a service as you can get, ever. 
 
The phone itself is great. I don't think it needs any more reviews and benchmark scores than the ones already posted. 
 
Feels balanced in your hand, never slippery. Hardware buttons do the job. Dual radios for calling work flawlessly. And the screen res is the icing on the cake. 
 
The camera, though low on specifications, is always a delight when used in average/well-lit conditions. Camera-phones and low light photos never really go hand in hand, we all know. 
 
The hardware is great, playing 1080p videos is a breeze. Asphalt 8 and Six-Guns are run without absolutely no lags. There is a bit of heating up with long hours of gameplay. Nothing to worry about though. 
 
The battery easily lasts for over a day with gaming, browsing, calling, and the usual stuff like Whatsapp, FB, Gmail sync on for two accounts. 
 
Also, got the KitKat update a week after purchasing, so no problems there. 
 
It is amazing because I have nothing negative to say about the phone. Or maybe just that the usb cable is not included in the sales package. 
 
No wonder it is the most sought after phone here today, total Value for Money. 
 
Go for it..!!What need i say?.Quad core Snapdragonn 400 CPU 
1 Gig RAM 
Adreno 305 GPU 
Didn't even need to see reviews for this one. 
The speaker is loud, the performance is great, handles games like a pro. 
 
VS Nexus 7? 
I have a nexus 7 but my mom's phone suddenly gave up so i told her to go for Moto G. 
My Nexus 7 (probably due to the large screen and maybe the tegra processor) gives a little less FPS on Full graphics in Asphalt 8, but this thing plays it extremely smooth. 
Snapdragon gives great processing power and Adreno 305 does it for the graphics. No obviously Tegra GPU gives additional graphic details which you wouldnt get in other GPUs but its only for some games and personally i feel it doesn't really make all that of a difference. 
 
Display 
I kinda like the display due to the viewing angles and soothing effect. But it does have its disadvantages. It's bright enough for outdoors and the HD screen works great for videos (HD videos ofcourse :p). For the price tag, its a great display. 
 
Camera 
Probably the only minus point here. It's OK for casual use, not fine but ok. If you are a photographer you're not gonna like this. But then you've got a price point, so there's got to be something bad too :) 
 
Some people compare this to other MMX, KARBONN, XOLO phone in this price range. But then remember, there's quality, SNAPDRAGON vs MTK, Trust and Service Centres that you cant forget. Choose wisely ;)

LOVING ITBest in Class/ Value for Monery.I have been using this phone for a week now. Here is my review 
Good 
1. Display is one of the best in class. High end phones should feel ashamed considering prize. 
2. The phone usage experience is butter smooth. No Lag anywhere. 
3. The connectivity options are the best. 
4. Performance of the phone in games, emails, switching between application, multitasking is best in class. 
4. The overall handling of the phone is great. Feels great in hand. Looks premium when placed on desk at workplace and everyone will take a look at this device. 
5. Viewing video on this phone is awesome experience. 
6. 4.5 Inch screen is the best for single hand operation over all mobility. 
7. The light sensor works very well. 
 
Bad/Average 
1. The In Call quality of the phone is average and could have been better 
2. The Speaker phone call quality is also average 
3. Non Removable battery 
3. The Glass attracts dust and the sides of the phone too. 
4. Screen is prone for fingerprint marks 
5. The power button is not very firm and is the only source to unlock the phone(Unless root and use to tweaks to volume rocker) 
6. The stock android experience is sometimes not very user friendly e.g. there is no notification toggle. You need to install similar app from Google Play. 
7. There is no file manager. Need to download from Google Play 
8. Stock Gallery is average. Download Quick Pick or something 
(All software/application part may not be bad not not in stock experience). 
 
Verdict : 
1. The best phone people. Go for it. 
2. Value for money 
3. Best in Market at the moment 
********** 10 StartsMoto G the best buy of the year.Its been a week since I got this Phone and by far its not disappointing.. 
 
Ran into couple of small troubles on the way but got over it pretty soon.. 
 
1. Camera error: Oh wow this is an ultimate letdown.. 3 days into using this phone and I ran into this camera error right when I was supposed to take some snaps in office.. Eeep.. embarrassing.. 
 Fix: Well there is a fix ;) Menu -&gt; Settings -&gt; Apps -&gt; All -&gt; Camera 
  Here Clear Data and Clear Cache.. (Kitkat) 
  for Jelly Bean users same steps as above but also Uninstall Updates. After this the camera would again auto update and voila !! &quot;All Is Well&quot; 
 
Note: I was using Jellybean when that error popped up.. Upgraded to Kitkat couple of days later 
 
2. Hangouts and Messaging notification for sms: Well here we get alerts from hangouts when the sms arrives (I hate hangouts let alone use it as an sms app) 
 
Open Hangouts -&gt; click the 3 dots -&gt; Settings -&gt; SMS -&gt; disable sms (lucky those who dint integrate sms the first time) 
 
Kitkat upgrade: The default messaging app is there !!! Yay !! 
 
*************************************************************************************************** 
So for those who are reluctant to go for the Kitkat update... Dont worry most of the major issues with that OS is fixed.. More updates from Google coming soon...Best Budget Smartphone . VIDEO REVIEW 
The Motorola Moto G has a 2,070mAh battery, just a tiny bit smaller than the battery of the Nexus 4. As with the camera, packing a large battery into the phone clearly wasn't a massive priority. 
 
This is a phone you'll likely need to charge every day, unless you're a light user. Motorola hasn't packed any of its own particularly invasive power-saving modes into the phone, but there is the standard 'battery saver' mode of Android 4.3. (4.4 kitkat Update Available In India ) 
 
Quite simply, this turns off 3G background data access for apps when your battery is low. This is the most effective way to stretch out the final minute's of a phone's battery. Try turning off mobile data completely for proof - your phone will last much longer. With battery saver engaged you can squeeze about a day and a half out of that phone, which is about standard for an Android phone. 
 
You can't carry around a spare battery here, though, as it's locked into the Moto G. 
 
The Motorola Moto G has pretty unremarkable call quality, lacking both the beefiness and top-end clarity of the best phones. Top volume could also be a little higher. However, calls are still perfectly functional and the phone does have a secondary microphone on its top edge to provide active noise cancellation for calls. 
 
The phone's loudspeaker sits on the back, right up by the camera lens rather than down on the bottom edge as is the fashion with some manufacturers these days. As with the call quality, it's not one of the most impressive elements of the Moto G. 
 
It's a mono speaker with decent volume, but the treble is a little harsh. However, unlike some other budget phones we didn't have any major distortion issues at top volume. 
 
Should You Buy the Motorola Moto G? 
The Motorola Moto G is the finest phone (Under INR 14000) ever made. It&rsquo;s not perfect and it doesn&rsquo;t have everything that a more expensive phone has, but at every turn Motorola seems to have made the right design decisions, while pushing the price down even further than penny-pinchers ZTE and Huawei have done in recent years. 
 
This is a phone that can do almost everything a Nexus 5 can &ndash; or at least everything 90 per cent of the population would want to do with the phone. If you want a sub-&pound;150, or even sub-&pound;200, phone, this is the one to go for. 
 
It's more powerful than more expensive competitors like the HTC Desire 500 and Sony Xperia M, but it's the screen that seals the deal. It's just in a different league to rivals. 
Verdict 
The Motorola Moto G is one of the best phones of the year. This phone deserves to sell by the bucketload.Moto G : best decision I have made in recent times.Though it is early to say , I think this is one of the best decisions I made in a long time regarding product buy outs. 
 
I was surprised to see that a charger and hands free were also included in the package. The phone worked beautifully out of the box and the hardware is robust. The response time of the device is fabulous. I have installed most of the apps I regularly use and on full load , there is another 400MB of free RAM. I am so relieved with the dual sim configuration settings. It is a breeze and I have used a reliance card for data and airtel sim for voice and messaging. With all applications installed , I have 11GB space left for personal use which is adequate for all my music. The camera is mediocre , but will do for me. I did a full charge for the battery and has been using heavily for the last 12 hours including an update to Kitkat :) and still 25% battery left. Quite remarkable for a phone worth 14k. 
 
Standing ovation for the excellent product. Hope that the after sales is handled well ( seriously hope do not have to go there ) 
 
Last but not the least , the flipkart website showed a delivery time of 8 days , but this beauty of a device was delivered to me in flat 48 hours.Signal Problem!!!.I would not recommend this to people who think there calls are precious and they cannot afford a call drop every now and then. I'm facing a complete signal loss problem on both SIMs after upgrading to 4.4 kitkat but not sure whether it's bcoz of upgrading it to 4.4 or could have faced the same issue with the version with which it comes. 
 
This problem has already been raised by many moto g users at motorola moto g community forum. 
 
&quot;It's really disappointing that there is no fix provided for this yet&quot;

it is a fabulous phone... 
PROS (according to me): 
- It has latest Kitkat OS 4.4.2 out of the box 
- 329 ppi display, so super resolution close to Ratina display in iPhone. 
- Brightness and outdoor visibility is better than Nexus 5. 
- Gorilla Glass 3 protection 
- nano coating for water spill resistance which also makes it more smooth on the touch surface. 
- snapdragon processor in comparison of Mediatek processor in most budget phones. 
- Its snappy and no lag at all. 
- Battery lasts full day in moderate phone use + music play + data usage. 
- It does support OTG to connect your pendrives and keyboard/mouse. 
- its speaker has more boost and clarity in comparison to Nexus 5 and some Samsung devices. even output in earphone is great. 
- Never hangs, nor heats up. 
- Better surround noise cancellation. 
- Tightly fitted great rubberized back cover and you have vast choice of colours to explore from. 
- I have noticed that its wi-fi and bluetooth strength is so good that it can make some highend devices to shame. 
 
CONS (which I have noticed): 
- it does not have external storage. I have bought 16 GB variant which is good but not enough if you like to carry stuff with you. 
- it takes more than 2 hours to fully charge. 
- it does not have quick toggle for Auto Rotate, which I miss. you have to go in settings to do so. 
- Screen on my device bleeds a little from the top, which makes me worried. but may be thats in this device only. 
- Dialer and phone book is little bit different in Kitkat but you will be used to it in a day or two. 
- No seperate touch capacitive buttons so the in screen buttons take up little of screen estate, but not a problem in normal use and in video more or some apps in full screen it is hidden. so not an issue. 
 
I am so much in love with MOTO G, that I can see not much flows in it. 
I love the raw Kitkat vanilla OS in the device with not so many unnecessary apps preloaded. 
 
I am one big fan of Moto G, its a great comeback device for Motorola. 
 
I think I should be receiving one of your great colour back cover or flip cover for sharing my honest review. ;)Smartphone for a smartbuyer.I got my MotoG delivered yesterday. Thanks to Flipkart for the amazing delivery time of just 2 days (which indeed was hard for me to wait). 
 
I was using a Nokia X6 Symbian before, (which I hardly consider smart), so this being my first Android phone, I researched a lot before ordering. 
 
You can't get a better phone for 20k. My one came loaded with KitKat 4.4.2 Android. The phone looks and feels real good in the hand. And it's really a value for money any day over Nexus. The power button is indeed a bit wobbly, but once you delve into the stunning display, you seem to forget everything else. KitKat do have OTG support still I would recommend a 16GB version as you never know how heavy future Androids would be. The battery is also great. I had to play all kinds of game, with background app downloading (more games :D ) and live wallpaper and music streaming from 8tracks to bring down the battery from full to 50% in 4 hours! The Android version being pretty close to stock, expect a clean look and fast upgrade availability in the future. 
 
Nothing can get better than this (among phone currently available and those planned to be released by this year). 5 star is an understatement. # Swift multi-tasking. 
# Almost all games run flawlessly. A slight glitch may be encountered when playing HD games on highest graphic settings. That's not a real big problem taking in consideration, the price of the phone. 
# Camera is also good enough. Fools are those who say that it's camera is mediocre. It's a phone, not a DSLR. Being a 5 MP shooter, it's results are pretty good.

# Battery backup is decent and lasts upto 20 hours with mixed usage.
