GOOD LUCK!Moto G Complete Review.First things first, the phone is absolutely a steal for this price. You get the specifications of a 20k+ phone for 14K! It also comes with a promised 4.4 KitKat update. 
 
Build: The phone feels pretty solid and premium when you hold it. The rubberized back makes it comfortable to operate. The Moto G also has the option of replacing the back cover with any other colored case or a flip cover. The volume rocker and the power/unlock button are pretty crisp as well. The touch screen is Gorilla Glass 3 which looks stunning and ensures you don't need a screen guard. 
 
Display: The MOTO G comes with a HD display and boy does that look awesome! Fantastic display to read emails/ebooks watch videos/photos on. 
 
Operating System: The pure android version (without the crapware like touchwiz/Sense UI/Timescape UI) works like a charm and is butter smooth. There is no lag at all and it handles multitasking with ease. 
 
Camera: The camera is a decent one. You can snap good pictures in HDR mode while using it outside. In some shots you can easily tell that it lacks detail and low light imaging could have been better. But I'm not complaining! It also comes with a front cam that can come in handy for video calls. 
 
Processor &amp; RAM: The Moto G uses a 1.2 GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 Quad Core Processor and 1 GB RAM to power the device. Make no mistake, while other manufacturers are giving cheap processors at this price point, Moto G uses a high quality one. Applications work very smoothly and are a breeze on this phone. 
 
Battery Life: The battery is very capable. I was able to get more than 2 days worth battery backup with regular voice calls, being constantly connected to 2G data, syncing(push) multiple email accounts, using Facebook, twitter and Whatsapp periodically and some amount of E-book reading. 
 
VERDICT: A MUST BUY!Outstanding Phone in an Outstanding Price.Everything in this phone is outstanding. No extra apps, just the google apps and latest android i.e Kitkat 4.4.2. The supplied headphone could be better, but the sound quality of this phone is actually excellent. It has a built in equalizer by which one can adjust both the loudspeaker and the earphone sound. Using some other earphones will result excellent sound clarity and bass. 
 
The camera is not at all bad. It is better than the camera of galaxy core. The gallery supports advanced photo editing features like pixlr express. Outdoors it take outstanding photos. Enough memory (16 GB) for me as I am not a gamer at all. Gamers would not face a problem unless they order an 8 GB. 
 
The display quality is also excellent which could never be scratched for its gorilla glass protection. Previously I have used Moto Defy XT535 which also had that and believe me after almost two years of rough handling it's screen looks good as new. What else... Comfortable device shape and size, elegant looks, everything is a pro in this device, no cons... 
 
Google now, google newsstand and google play music I like most. Play Music is the best app in this phone I believe. But I think all this exciting things would be missed if you dont have a data plan or wifi. Because the first kitkat update would take almost 230 MB data and then the apps will be updated. Some extra google apps would be installed after the update. So choose your data plan before buying this phone lest the best part of android is missed.Awesome phone, poor launch, speedy delivery.About Flipkart delivery - 
Lot of people including me had a great deal in booking this phone before it went out of stock. I guess Motorola under-estimated it's own ability in Indian Market by providing very little stock to Flipkart. After saying the phone will be delivered only after 10 days of booking I got mine delivered in just 3 days. Flipkart service is excellent.

About MOTO G 
 
1. The 4.5 inch edge-to-edge display comes with 720p HD resolution and 329 ppi - every pixel is sharp, vivid and crystal clear. 
 
2. The Quad Core Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 Processor is clocked at 1.2 GHz to make the interface fluid to touch. 1 GB RAM to support multitasking and the Adreno Graphics 305 to let you play graphic-heavy games with great detailing. 
 
3. 4.3 OS which is upgradeable to KitKat as well. 2070 mAh Li-Ion battery that is built into the body of the device 
 
4. Corning gorilla 3 protection which is scratch proof even if you try to scratch it with keys

The POSITIVES of the phone are the following ; 
I got the kitkat update after a week. For pure android experince. 
Good built quality. 
Stylish design. 
OTG is working even after kitkat update, but you can only see or listen to music or videos on the pendrive, you cannot transfer to either. For that you need to install software from google store 
Battery backup after the kitkat update is very good. 
High quality screen clarity which is really good on watching videos,pics and for gaming. 
Sound quality, I will give 4 on 5. 
Phone is very good in network signal strength. 
Now NEGATIVES are ; 
Camera is not that good on low lights. 
Keys are held on the screen (back,menu). 
Accessories like headset are not good enough. 
Phone is little bit heavier on grams. 
 
** After kitkat update all your music files wiil be moved to sdcard/music. For changing ringtone put the file in sdcard/ringtones or use total commander application .

I would suggest to go for 16 GB version.Exceeding Expectations!!!.I booked the 16GB model and I am pleasantly surprised with this device. 
 
PROS:- 
Build quality and Design: 
Sufficiently sturdy, the back cover provides for a nice grip and as per my opinion in this price range can't find a better looking phone. 
 
Performance: 
Powered with a 1.2Ghz Quad-core processor, Adreno 305 GPU and 1 GB RAM, this device provides you with a fast performance and handles multiple apps with ease. 
 
Display: 
Nice resolution(720p) and pixel density. Even in direct sunlight you can see the display quite well(better than premium phones eg. Galaxy Note 2, iPhone 4S). 
 
Battery: 
2070 mAh battery, I have had to charge my phone just once in the last 2 days (moderate usage). 
 
Android 4.4 Kitkat update: 
You can update your MotoG to the latest Android 4.4 Kitkat which is faster than Jelly Bean. 
 
Motorola Migrate: 
This app will enable previous Android users to easily transfer their data(including contacts, call logs and messages) wirelessly to this phone. 
 
Motorola Assist: 
It will keep the Moto G quiet while you're in a meeting or sleeping. 
The meeting options are to silence the smartphone and to send auto-replies. 
While the sleeping option lets you configure the time interval, allow calls from a favorite contact or list of contacts and put through calls from the same person if they call twice in the interval of 5 minutes. 
It's a good way to silence all those annoying notifications that come through in the middle of the night when you're trying to get some rest. 
 
CONS:- 
Camera: 
Questionable camera quality. Quality of daylight photos are better than the ones clicked at night-time(with flash) or indoors. 
 
Storage Capacity: 
No external memory card support. Although Google is providing Moto G users with 50GB space on Google Drive for 2 years, having an external memory card is much more efficient than retrieving your data from cloud storage. 
 
Accessories: 
USB data cable is not provided by Motorola. 
 
Conclusion:- 
It's near impossible to match the Moto G's bang for the buck. The screen, the overall performance, the OS updates and with this unbelievable price tag, it's getting ready to walk all over the cheap droids and Windows-powered smartphones.great phone ... but battery life..finally i got enough time to write a small review for this phone.. :P and after using it for more then 5 days i have figured out that this phone really deserve everything... the phone feels premium in it's class and perform like a beast.. which is great , being a gamer i had huge expectation and moto g never dissapointed me, i played asphalt 8 : airborne on high setting and other casual games and all of them run like a boss no problem at all.. 16gb out of which you get 13gb is more then enough. one of the thing that guy's you will love is that it come kitkat out of box when i checked my phone info i found it has already 4.4.2 kitkat and i was happy but this is the matter of concern, kitkat update i causing battery draining very fast google already claimed it and working on it's fix the battery backup of moto g which is known to be great is now not so good ... kitkat has bug which is draining battery of almost every smartphone which is running on kitkat. whether it is htc one , moto g even nexus 5.. but perfomance wise this phone is best and best value for money no other phone can come to near it..

moto g already supressed nexus 4 and come close to samsung galaxy s3.. 
google already said that they will ralease new update soon which will fix this battery draining issue and then this phone will kick everyone like a boss...You get more than the Investment.After so much of waiting I have got my Moto G from my favourite on-line retailer Flipkart. (Though some problems are there with shipping of Moto G, I still prefer Flipkart). First of all, we need to appreciate Motorola for the package that they made. How they have managed such a compact and small packet for a phone, battery and headset. I was amazed by seeing the packet. 
Coming to the phone, it is very good for the money that we spend. IPS display, Gorilla Glass3, Quad core processor, 1 GB RAM all this features are less than 15K (13999 actually). The phone that you are getting is much more worth than the money that you invest, 
 
Positives: 
1. Display: it is having IPS display with 1280X720 resolution. Clarity is top notch. 
2. Gorilla Glass : Provides additional security to display. 
3. Processor and RAM : Quad core snapdragon 400 (1.2 GHz) with 1 GB RAM, we can play some high end games without any problem. 
4. Battery: if you continuously switch to 2G and if we do simple browsing and playing simple games like candy crush we can get upto 24-26 hours. I have not tested with a 3G connection. 
 
Negatives: 
1. Rare Camera: it is 5MP with 720P video recording. Day time you will get images with fine clarity, but night time the clarity of images is not good (though it is in acceptable level). 
2. No support for expandable memory: It is coming with 8GB/16 GB internal memory and there is no scope for extending it. Better go for 16GB (usage memory will be around 12.5 GB). But after Kitkat update, you can directly connect your phone to any pen drive through a OTG cable without any third party app. Therefore, you can put all your additional data in a pen drive and we can carry with a OTG cable. 
 
Some Glitches after Kitkat update: 
 
1. I dont know why sometimes it is not getting connected to your laptop or desktop with a data cable. Before Kitkat update, there was no problem, after update if you want to connect your phone to a Laptop you need to restart your phone. 
2. If you are using 2 sims, there is some problem in incoming calls, sometimes you cannot receive calls though you have proper signal strength (This I have not observed in my phone as I am using one sim only but I observed it in my friend's phone) 
3. Some systems widgets are not working properly after Kitkat update (like auto rotation option on System widget etc.) 
4. When you restart your mobile, auto sync option for gmail is changing to no sync option by default (This I observed some times) 
 
Hope Motorola may release some patch for the above glitches. 
 
Overall, this phone is very good and better go for 16GB version for no regrets.Moto G 16 GB Usage For Three Weeks.I bought the phone from Flipkart &amp; it was delivered within 24 hrs - excellent service. 
1. The phone is designed well &amp; easy to handle. It came with Kitkat out of the box. 
2. Kitkat works seamlessly with no crashes or hangups so far. 
3. Audio &amp; video outputs are good. 
4. Chrome works well. So does Firefox &amp; MX player (installed later). 
5.There is no bloat ware. A bundled file manager would have been an asset. 
5. Wi Fi, internet &amp; bluetooth work well. 
6. The USB OTG works without a hitch. 
7. Battery life is good &amp; recharge time from 0% to 100% is about 2.75 hrs. 
8. The Sim card goes off line at times from either slot. It has to be extracted &amp; inserted again to get the OS to recognize it. This is the only major issue &amp; requires to rectified on priority- appears to be a software issue. 
9. Battery availability % indicator drops to 0 from 30% suddenly at times although the battery continues to have charge in it. 
10. The list in the box does not mention any service centre in Bangalore! 
 The phone is probably the best in its price point &amp; software &amp; hardware are optimised.In one word &quot;AWASOME&quot;.I won't say it is the best phone in the market. Let's discuss the pros and cons. 
 
Pros: 
1. Great battery life. Lasts for more that 24 hours for mixed usage. 
2. 326 ppi elegant display which is sharp as i-phone 5s. 
3. Quad-core 1.2 GHz Cortex-A7 CPU, Adreno 305 GPU and 1 GB ram makes it a great platform for gaming. Though it is not a hardcore gaming phone still you can easily play high graphics games like NFS, Vector without a lag or hanging. 
4. I have opened 17 apps at the same time including Google map but it didn't show any lag in the performance. 
5. Really powerful speaker. 
6. touch screen is just awesome. Here is a suggestion, Please buy an anti-gloss (Mat finished) screen guard and believe me your fingers won't strive to touch the lips of ur girlfriend (If u don't have one then...well...u r lucky!!) :p 
7. little more weighty than other phones at this range, which is, for me,good if you are an Indian. (Not only our own hand gets inside our pockets while travelling in public transport...I hope u understand) 
 
Con's: 
1. Earphone is Awful. to much treble but not having proper bass. not even a little. 
2. No data cable in the kit. 
3. Running 2-3 high graphics game at the same time makes the system slow. 
4. If you lock the screen while playing any game it will lag a little while unlocking. 
5. Camera quality is not that much good. Zooming decreases the quality even more. Still we shouldn't expect it to work as a D-SLR. 
6. inbuilt media player doesn't even support mp4, mp3. You have to download a media player for this. 
7. Error messages will pop-up every time saying &quot;Unsupported format&quot; while downloading songs or videos from ur PC. Even if you are downloading mp3, mp4. Which is a little bit embarrassing. but if u download a good media player it won't be any problem to run them. 
8. Haven't faced any problem with my phone yet. But I'm really tensed that there is a shortage of service centers. I think lenovo should take care of this because they r the new owner of Moto. 
 
That's all folks. I was interested to buy an android phone for last one year. It was really confusing which one is good enough for me. If they r good they are costly, If they are cheap they are not satisfactory. But after using Moto G for last one month I can assure you it won't disappoint you.

External SD card is Point less for a good lag free phone. You can use the external memory only to store pictures and songs. If you thinking you can expand the external memory and have a lag free phone this fact given by many is wrong. This is because many apps use only internal storage and more the internal storage the daily running of the apps will be smooth.

Used the phone for 2 weeks and must say it is awesome. 
 
Pros : 
1) Good Build Quality (Very Good Grip).U can actually feel it is quite sturdy. 
2) Very Smooth (Kitkat is too smooth) , no lags . 
3) Perfect Size for your palm. Not too big not too small. Just Perfect !! 
4) Camera , unlike the reviews , it is good enough. Decent enough for a casual user.Daylight photos and bright outdoor photos are very good. 
5) Battery life is good.Last 2 days.Listening to music 4-5 hours per day. 3G surfing/downloading 2 hours , and the data is enabled all day. Even if ur a hard user it will last 1-1.5 day. 
 
Cons : 
1) Earphones are pretty basic ( the sound is clear , but bass is flat.) Buy a pair of Sony earphones instead , I did. :) 
2) No data cable along with the phone . Unlike most phones where u have a data cable cum charger , the moto g doesn't come with a data cable. If you already have one , it should't bother you. 
3) Phone covers are hardly available in the market and if available are too expensive . You can manage with HTC Covers of the same size. Rs 150-250 /- :) 
 
The cons too aren't the one's that should bother you. For the price , its a very good phone. So go for it.

---------------------------- 
1) Phone have enough slim. You will not feel any thickness. It is slimmer than Samsung Galaxy Grand. 
2) Not much weight, nearly to LG Nexus 4. 
3) Fit to you hand. I am able to handle this phone with my single hand. 
4) Pocketable (You can put in your modern jeans and you can ride a bike with out any uncomfortable).

------------------------------- 
A QUAD CORE processor giving it is best. It is QUALCOMM processor. So, it will never let you down. 
Well responsive. There is no lags till now. I am using most of apps simultaneously, switching between the apps, games. But this one managing for all the times. Internet accessing also working well with both WIFI as well as Mobile Data. 
 
After a while usage, it is getting little bit hot, but nothing too high, and it is getting down very quickly also.

-------------------

DISPLAY &amp; TOUCH : 
------------------------------- 
Screen display is very good. Colorful, good viewing angles. Well brightness. Even i direct sunlight also it will show enough lighting which you can read your messages. 
Touch is well responsive. It is good by this price. But if you compare with high end smartphones like HTC ONE, SGS 4, NEXUS 5 then it may show the little delay between your finger and the layers when you move your fingers rapidly through the layers. 
 
Finally good and decent. enough for every day general usage. 
 
MEMORY : 
------------------- 
It is 16 GB version, but 12 gb will get as a user memory. I had installed a tons of apps, some mp3 files, some photos. But still i have 10gb of free space. I am sure it is enough for me. 
 
1GB of ram, we wil get around 800 for usage. always mostly it is using 64% at max usage. But still there is free memory. all apps are working fine. 
 
GPU also working fine. I had played the TEMPLE RUN 2 for an hour, even though game is working very smooth. there is no lag. 
 
CAMERA : 
------------------- 
It is 5MP camera. So, we cannot expect more. But even though it is good in well light with flash. 
But in low light not as good as SAMSUNG GALAXY S DUOS 2, which i had compared at night time within the street light with flash. 
 
This is good for mobile upload in social network, but if you consider camera as a main aspect, then it will disappoint to you. 
 
BATTERY : 
--------------------- 
This section, where i am highly satisfied with this mobile. 
 
One full charge will last more than a day. Every day i am filling 100% of charge. For one day, i am using 3 hours of wifi, 2 hours of mobile data, 2 hours of net, 2 hours of music, 30 mins download, 3 hours of game, 2 hours of call, 1 hours of screen on, 30 mins camera usage, a full night in standby use, morning 3 ~ 4 times full alarm will rang (due to my lazyness), finally my mobile reach to 18% to next day morning. 
 
What else we required??

We need to buy through online which are bit of cost due to the import.Definetly a product you can't ignore....There are so many reviews written over flipkart as well as video reviews on youtube for Moto G, so i'm gonna share my 10 days experience with this product 
 
Pros: 
 
- Build and design: Moto G is well build and design product, But if u are one of those guys who had childhood dream of buying those stylish looking Moto Razor, u might not fully satisfied with design 
 
- Size and Material: The screen size of 4.5 inch with Gorilla glass 3 makes stunning combination(looks alike Nexus 4). The material used for back pannel is rubberized plastic and feels grippy in hand while playing games. 
 
- Battery: 2070 mAh battery can easily sustain for entire day with active usage like watching videos on youtube for 2hrs, Playing games for 2hrs, Whatsapp intermitently, songs before good night sleep :), and OTG usage for about 15-20 mins. 
 
- OTG: The biggest feature of all is the OTG support. Eventhogh this cell doesn't support external SD Card, bt It has a power of OTG tethering. I have tested it with 1 and 8 Gigs Pendrives. Kudos to MOTO. 
 
- Moto g is dual sim phone. 
 
- Performance 
 
	First of all AnTuTu benchmark is 17486 which superior than nexus 4, 3486 AnTuTu 3d Rating. 
	Games: Played following games 
		GTA san Andreas- Was able to play decently with lower settings. For medium and above setting, There was considerable lag. At d same time played this Game on nexus 4, And gameplay was far superior with similar settings. 
 
		Asphalt 8 - This game works fantastically well with highest settings...again kudos. 
 
		Thor The dark world - The game worked well with default setting without lag. 
 
		 
	Surfing: Honestly i'm not biggg net surfer, so didn't face any problem with general surfing on default Chrome browser. 
 
		 
	UI: Its stock android(officially upgraded to Kitkat 4.4.2) experience, So no need to discuss it. 
 
- Camera: Fair Camera...but Moto could have done little better for low light conditions. 
 
- Price: The best part is, u all get this amazing features in 14K. The feature list is similar to its rival phones like Grand2, Nexus 4, etc(These Phones r quiet expensive as well). 
 
 
Cons:

Smudges on back cover bt this is not a big issue as u can clean it up.

Before buying this phone, I made my mind that its a reliable product coz Google will take care of software upgrades, bt its now lenovo product....So I am little susceptible.

# Punit Soni the man behind this master class challenges directly the so called big Bros in todays smartphone field at the time of its launch at MWC in Brazil..have a look at the video...One of the best.About the Phone: 
well everyone knows about the specs of the phone..so i won't talk about it much... 
all i want is to discuss about the kitkat update. 
The phone comes with Android 4.3 JB, which is currently a more stable version of android as compared to Kitkat. 
Kitkat has a lot of bugs and one the most annoying bugs is the battery calibration/draining bug. 
2070mAh battery isn't supposed to die within 6-7 hrs with little or moderate usage..I guess there isn't a real solution for this problem yet..Many other phones with kitkat are also a victim of the same problem. 
Sometimes the phone randomly shuts down. There's also a problem while making calls. 
 
The most important point: U can't downgrade from kitkat to jelly bean without rooting/reinstalling JB rom in ur phone...which unfortunately cancels ur warranty...

one more thing remove the thought that if price is low for moto g ... it will not be a good mobile!!Moto G: ALL YOU NEED TO KNOW!.Ordered the 16GB version on 10th of March &amp; Got it delivered on 13th March, on my birthday. After using the device for two months, I'm writing this review to give a complete picture of all the Pros &amp; Cons 
 
  Pros: 
Coming from a price range of 14k the phone performs amazingly well &amp; blows all other phones in its category. I have used my friends' &amp; colleagues' Xperia M, Xperia L, Galaxy Core, Galaxy Quattro, Galaxy Grand (the common android competitors in this range) &amp; the phone bets all of them hands down. The only other Quad core phone is the Quattro, but that has a A5 chipset while the Moto G has an A7 which delivers faster performance. Not to mention recording at 720p while Quattro records at 480p. The MotoG can play 1080p videos easily without the need for a separate player. It handled memory hungry games with ease. Games like Minion Rush (which in my test did not run in any of the other devices) ran smmothly in MotoG. Dead Trigger 2 &amp; Modern Combat 4 runs really well. The A7 quad core CPU with 1GB RAM handled anything I threw at it &amp; never hanged till today. 
 
The 720p IPS display exhumes vividness &amp; is totally visible in bright sunlight without the need to place your hand over the screen. 
 
Many people believe that the lack of memory card is a dissapointment. That may be true, but companys like Sony &amp; Samsung sell their handset with 4GB internal(out of which 2GB is usable) with expandable storage. But people forget that apps in them can only be installed on the phone memory. Thus even with a 32GB card you are left with 2Gb to install apps. 
 
The phone has the best battery in this range. A complete charge lasts me 2days with usual calls, whatsapp, navigation &amp; browsing. 
 
  Cons: 
The camera may dissapoint some people. Although the camera isn't as bad as many say it is. Low light shots without flash turned out really good. The phone hardly uses the flash. Anything shot with the subject(s) quite close will give a good shot, but large landscape shots even in daylight seems to be blurry &amp; has loss of detail. Although I won't spend 10k for just a better camera, when a Digital camera of 5k will outperform a 21MP mobile phone camera anyday. 
 
The phone heats up during heavy usage like navigation or high gaming. 
 
Please don't compare it to high end phones around 25k. But such comparisons itself proves that this phone is above other phones in its range.Moto G: Dial G for Genius.Received the phone yesterday at noon. Here is a gist of my experience so far:- 
 
- Great battery life. Charged phone at 2 p.m yesterday. Still has 30% left now, with moderate usage 
 
- It's pleasantly heavy. Provides good grip. Build quality is great, except that the volume rocker and power buttons are slightly wobbly. 
 
- Display is a class apart. Its vibrant and i couldn't see any pixels. The 329 ppi screen resolution is no joke, its brilliant. 
 
- Fast as hell. No visible lag in any game or even in multitasking. Web browsing is a breeze. 
 
- Really loud speakers. Although the sound crackles a bit at maximum volume 
 
- Call quality is okay-ish. A bit hollowness in the sound. 
 
- Camera quality is great. Don't confuse it with the pixel count of the camera. The phone takes great pictures 
 
Overall view. 
It's a slick phone with great styling. Its pleasant to use. Performance-wise, its brilliant and no phone in this range comes even close! FlipKart might take some time to deliver it, but believe me, the wait is worth it.

JayaprakashLook no further.Whatever smartphone we buy we ultimately end up liking, loving and 'can't live without it' given the phone is decently specced and built. 
In a smartphone we essentially interact with the following - 
1. The underlying operating system (Android 4.4.2 here) 
2. Apps of your choice 
Android phones overwhelmingly revolve around Apps. Everything else is standard now - the same Android interface, hardware, features. 
In effect when you switch your phone you hardly notice the difference. All your contacts, apps and settings are right back. You simply carry on from where you left off. 
However, that is not to say all phones are same. 
How does Moto G fare? It's brilliant and here's why - 
A. 14000 is a very very good price. Again, very good. You just can't go wrong. 
B. Corning Gorilla Glass 3. Enjoy using the highly scratch resistant screen without a screen guard. You'll love the smooth glass feel. 
C. 326ppi resolution. This is equal to the Retina Display of the 50000 rupees Apple iPhone 5s. Crisp display. Anyone who says you require a higher resolution is very wrong. 
D. 4.5 inch form factor. The biggest size which is still comfortable with one handed use. Just right. 
E. Near-audiophile quality sound. Plug in a good earphone and you can leave your ipod home. 
F. Adreno 305 graphics. You can play the latest graphic intensive games. 
G. Pure Android - super fast and clean interface. 
H. Excellent Navigation - GPS and GLONASS. Basically more satellites to help pinpoint your location. You'll get an accurate location lock in seconds. Let me reiterate, very very accurate. 
I. Long battery life. Google Motorola has done some wizardry to extract the maximum from the inbuilt battery. Lasts all day long and more. 
J. Great Touch response. 
K. Excellent front camera for Skype 
L. Latest and best Android 4.4.2 out of the box. Fluid, refined and attention to detail easily visible. Everything well thought out. 
M. Great build quality. Feels sturdy. Nice rubberized grippy back cover. 
N. Dual Sim 
O. Great sounding FM 
 
Known issues - 
1. Occasional network drop. A software update will shortly fix this. 2. SIM may not be recognized at times. Again a software issue which will be corrected through an update. 
3. The Camera is great at times and dull sometimes. I can live with this. Quality good enough for social media upload. Tip - Learn to touch up photos with applications like Photoshop and GIMP before uploading. 
 
Final words - Look no furtherAmaaazzzzinggg moto.... Amaaaazzzing flipkart....First of all hats off to flipkart for speed delivery, i got the phone within 48 hours from my order. 
I expect 16gb would be around 16k, but the phone satisfies more than my expectation in all aspects not only price. Amazzing phone under 15k. 1.2ghz processor coupled with 1gb ram made the phone run without any lag.. Regarding screen resolution and color density gives feast to our eyes. Decent images from 5MP camera and front 1.3MP camera too nice for video calling. considering memory, 12.92gb available, it enough for me to store songs and photos.Additionly moto gives 50gb free storage in google drive exclusive from googles 15gb. Phone bill comes with nearest service centers address, so dont worry about motorola service center. 
cons: 
Headset is not upto the mark. 
charger is not like usb type, so if you want to transfer data from your system means you have to go for seperate data cable. 
 These two cons are nothing infront of all above pros. 
 
Its a great value for money. Motorola have a great chance to grow up in indian market. 
 
Thank you so much to flipkart guys and best wishes for your upcoming servicess... :):):)An awesome phone for its price!.In this age of overpriced phones and gadgets, it's great to see a phone that's not shabbily built and loaded with bloatware, at this price point. The build is sturdy and the phone is very responsive and smooth, even when I open multiple apps simultaneously. Goes to show why a lot of people prefer stock Android over TouchWiz, Sense &amp; Co. The screen is simply superb. In fact, I had trouble convincing some people that this is a sub 15K phone. 
 
Most importantly, the battery life is just awesome. It lasts me a day and a half on a single charge with moderate usage. I know that there are phones like Note 3 which offer superior battery life, but I'm not a big fan of humongous phones. 
 
The camera isn't something to write home about. It feels like something that was added just because every smartphone should have a camera. However I can't complain much as I can easily buy myself a decent point and shoot camera with the amount I saved and that would take better pictures than any smartphone any day. That said, the camera is good enough for a quick snap meant to be uploaded to Facebook/Instagram - as long as it's not a low light scene - and let us face it, that is what most of us use our smartphone cameras for anyway. 
 
The camera is not the reason why I'm not giving a 5 star rating. That lies with the lack of a 32 GB or higher memory variant as well as the lack of expandable memory. I can understand that mainstream customers wouldn't like shell out extra money for higher storage variant, but seriously, how difficult could it have been to add MicroSD support? For someone who likes to keep a lot of apps, videos and music on their phone, 16 GB (out of which approx. 12 GB is available) is simply not good enough. 
 
On a side note, there is no USB cable in the box. You'll need to buy your own.great deal for a great product.Possibly the best mobile phone deal available today. 
 
Product: 
- brilliant display and a size that is the perfect balance between screen area and pocketability. The high resolution means everything is sharp and crisp 
- Intuituitive camera interface which is very easy to use. Unfortunately can't change image resolution 
- stock android UI which would be very familiar to nexus users. I. However is devoid of any Facebook integration so you will need to set it up. Standard Google music app is really boring and needs to be replaced as well 
- 50 GB additional Google storage for two years is an awesome plus 
- unexceptional design which is why you will need a case to spruce up the dull looks. Ironically the gorilla glass and rubberised back mean this is a phone which could easily survive without a case

- the only place to buy this currently 
- delivered in 4 days but that was due to a long weekend. As usual flipkart didn't disappoint.

well let me tell you the pros and cons based on my usage... 
 
PROS- 
1. Android KitKat out of the box (those who will be getting it now) 
2. the 4.5&quot; screen is the best in it's class i feel... far better than SAMSHITS GALAXY.... 
3. Battery-- I'm a heavy user, i.e. I don't let my phone go out of my hands. And let me tell you, the battery lasts the whole day! yes! 24 hrs. with WiFi on throughout the day, 1 hr. of calling, internet browsing for more than 3 hrs., both the SIMs active and still the battery lasted one whole day. 
4. Processor and RAM-- the 1.2 GHz quad core Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 is the best in its class, far better than the MediaTek chipsets, and the RAM is good enough for 1GB - no lag or anything... 
5. the sound quality is awesome-- both the speakers and the earpiece. 
6. OTG works perfect for this update, so if there's no SD card slot, so what??we have OTG functionality, we can mount a pen drive :D (which is not supported in Nexus 4 kitkat update, so they are limited to the int. storage) 
7. Dual SIM for Indian version-- which i feel is the best job done coz everyone now a days is not happy with a single SIM 
8. The NanoCoating which is going to protect the phone even if the phone accidentally falls in water and then immediately if it's removed from it, it's not going to be damaged! 
 
CONS- 
1. If the dual SIM would have been dual active, instead of dual standby it would have been better! 
2. CAMERA I feel is nice, but not up to the mark of a 5MP cam. as compared to Sony (I know Sony is the best in cam. dept.) but still it's good enough for a BUDGET PHONE of 14K INR. and I'm Happy with it.

And the battery life is incredible, and I have GPS/3G/WiFi always enabled. Moto G is definitely one of the few phones which offer the value for money experience. 
 
Pros: 
 
1) Bang for buck. 
2) Sturdy build. 
3) Great Battery Life. Make sure you install Snapdragon Battery Guru to maximise your battery life. 
4) Comes with Charger + headphones. 
5) Android 4.4.2 update available. 
6) Superb display, the colours and the resolution are amazing. 
7) Camera is decent, however you may want to use a 3rd party app like Focal or Cameringo or MXCamera for better photos. 
8) Official updates for some Motorola apps via Google Play. 
9) The speaker is also good and loud. 
10) Smooth performance, no lags whatsoever. You can make it perform even better with Greenify. 
11) You can also redeem 50 gb Free storage space on Google Drive, but it is only valid for 2 years 
 
Official Flip Cover. Well you have to buy it separately, but it is worth theprice and offers solid protection for the phone. 
 
Cons: 
1) Needs Micro SIM. 
2) A bit bulky. 
3) No NFC. 
4) No SD Card slot (But you can use OTG cables/flash drives). 
5) White LED for notifications (NO RGB) 
6) Lack of an LCD Display means you won't get Active Notifications like on the Moto X. 
 
I was one of the lucky guys who ordered it the moment it went live on February 6th. I had skipped the Flip Cover, as I did not want to waste time placing my order. But the next day , I received an email from Flipkart, who graciously offered me the Official Moto Flip Cover on a discounted price of 700Rs. 
 
Later they also offered me a discount on ebooks and clothing. Top Notch service.The best budget handset around.On paper the Moto G looks like an excellent handset for the price, and in practice it lives up to the billing. As the Nexus 4 did with the mid-range market, the Moto G has turned the budget end on its head with features found on handsets double its cost. 
 
I liked 
The whole package. Look at what the Moto G offers, look at its price, and then look at the other handsets which cost the same amount. It exceeds its rivals in several key areas, from the well defined 4.5-inch display to its 1.2GHz quad-core processor and Android 4.4 KitKat operating system. There's a lot to love about the Moto G for its price. You could easily be fooled into thinking that the Moto G costs the same as the Galaxy S4 Mini and the HTC One Mini - even web browsing is impressive on the handset. 
 
I disliked 
It's simple. Motorola must have cut some corners to get the price of the Moto G so low, and the camera is one area which has seen the compromise. The 5MP lens is simply not up to the job and my photos either came out blurry, grainy or both, while the camera app itself will be far too basic for some. 
 
The lack of expandable memory will be a real bug bear for some, especially if you end up with the 8GB model. (not for me though) 
 
Verdict 
A stunning phone for very little money - poorer camera aside, it's the perfect phone. The Moto G is a top notch, low cost smartphone and I wholeheartedly recommend this as the best budget mobile currently on the market. I was genuinely impressed with the feature set on the Moto G, so if you're looking for a low cost phone you can stop searching - just go out and grab a Moto G right now. You won't get a better budget blower than the Moto G.

Update: 15 Feb 2014 
Yippeee! Received Android 4.4.2 KitKat update!Awesome Phone! But has issues with USB Tethering &amp; Portable Wi-fi Hotspot.There is no problem in using the internet in the handset. But whenever I connect to the internet via tethering(USB or Wi-fi) in my PC, internet connectivity keeps dropping intermittently. The problem is not with the network connection but the internet connection(a yellow triangle on the network icon the bottom right on the Windows 7 taskbar). After a few moments, it connects again automatically and the cycle keeps repeating. 
 
I've contacted Motorola customer care which did not help. I've also tried other available solutions online which don't work. 
 
After researching online quite a lot about this, I came to know that this problem is Android Kitkat specific(my handset came pre-loaded with Android Kitkat 4.4.2). I also came to know that there is a way to downgrade to Android Jelly Bean 4.3 without rooting the device or unlocking the bootloader. But I don't want to do that as I'm hoping that the next update(4.4.3) should fix this issue. 
 
If you want to buy this I would suggest to go for a Jelly Bean version. 
 
Other than this I have no complaints or regrets. 
 
The phone is simply awesome. The build quality is superb. I installed &quot;Asphalt 8&quot; via Google Play(this racing game has some amazing graphics). Its surprising to see games demanding high graphics are running with such ease on this phone! 
 
To learn more about this phone in detail you can check the in-depth and gaming reviews on YouTube by user Geekyranjit. 
 
I rated 4/5 only because of the issue I mentioned. Otherwise I would have awarded 5/5.3.5 for the mobile.Appearance: 
 
Good looking, handy. The curved edges makes the mobile look classy. The M symbol at the back cover adds beauty to the mobile. 
 
Performance: 
The performance of the mobile is good. Many options are wrapped into some options. So need to dig a lot into the mobile. 
The camera does awesome captures in bright light but its the opposite in dull light(even with flash). 
I upgraded to KITKAT Android 4.4 and faced few issues. Few icons got changed in appearance which is not a big issue. 
The camera faced problem. While opening the camera it stated camera unsupported. I got frustrated and rebooted my mobile to check for the camera which solved the issue. 
There is a bug with the WIFI. I tried to connect the mobile with my firm WIFI which did not allow me to enter the password. I need to connect to the WIFI and when it tried to connect i have to click/hold so i get the option to modify the settings for the WIFI. 
There is some noise while playing the music player which can be changed using the audio settings. 
The worst part is the headset provided with the mobile. It has sharp cut which hurts the ears. and no data cable provided with the mobile. Few apps get crashed for some reason and closes itself reporting the error. 
 
Overall: 
If your budget is less than 15K then its worth to buy MOTO G. It has bugs which can be rectified with some changes in the settings (but not all).Unbelievable Quality in Unbelievable Price.This is an awesome phone from Motorola (A Google Company).

2) The feel of Quadcore processor can be observed very clearly. The touch feeling is beyond my dictionary to express. 
3) 1GB RAM is enough to handle the applications very well. 
4) Using OTG cable for Pen Drive or Hybrid Pendrive (which we can attach directly to the handset) was used and was performing very quick. 
5) Battery backup is good as the battery is only 2070 MAH, which is enough to handle the WiFi, 3G network or calling.

Because I have read some problems facing by some moto g owners and now I have answers to almost every problem asked here. 
 
First My moto g story(motorola connection): 
 
My first multimedia set was motorola moto razr v3i which I bought in 2006 and it still working.That phone was best at that time in his class only facing battery issue in that. 
 
So now a days I was looking for some smart phone with all android features but not able to decide between HTC,Samsung,Sony and apple Those I like was very costly and those in budget are not covering all my features. 
 
But when I heard about moto g I start searching about it,Believe me guys I spend my last whole month on deciding to by it...Almost I watched every single video on youtube with moto g named every forums on moto g and from last 3 days before buy I spent 15 hours continuous on net and decide after complete research that this is what I required. 
 
Now come to all problems faced by users: 
 
1. Signal problem/Call drops/and phone rebooting again and again? 
 
Reason: Guys as this phone requires a micro sim so the any loophole in cutting sim make phone vulnerable if sim not cutted properly it will continuously create problem and even if its cutted so badly it could damage your phone,Also hamper your call quality 
 
Sol: Only go for dealers who already cut sims for moto g,or using laser cutter for precision don't worry if they take even 50 bucks for it. Believe me guys don't go for any dealer who claims for make sim to micro only ask for professional and you will not face any such problem. 
Source: motorolla help US/india and moto g various forums 
 
2.) Guys complaining about problem after 4.4.2 update features create problem? 
 
Solution: During updating ensure your phone have enough battery wifi connection is within reach not a single time wifi disconnect if so it will create problem and if you upgrade you can't downgrade 
*** Must connect to charger if during update phone off so it could damage your phone permanently. 
 
Source : moto help/videos on youtube/ android forums 
 
3.) Guys complaining about battery draining problem?? 
 
Solution:Guys when you opened your moto g box so some of your phone require battery calibration I am adding a link here watch this video don't go with views it really helps those who facing battery drain problem just charge ohone continuous 8 hours and then charge 1 hour by power of then again power on and charge for 1 more hour total 10 hours and your phone and battery calibrated and drain issue must resolved 
Storage problem: 
 
Sol: go for 16 gm and you will got 50 GB google drive space for 2 years after that you can check your data their but can't add new,what else we need? 
 
4.) Some problem which are not real problems: 
a) camera quality : Guys in this budget its best after kitkat update lots of option there HD video 720 p enough we are buying a phone not a DSLR 
b)Touch : Touch is almost same like iphone 
 
I got it by flipkart at 5 PM on 22 April till now I was working with it ,no heatup,total smooth ,awesome touch ,superfast even we can use in developer mode

Hope this review helps you in your buying.+Ve and -Ve of Moto G.I am using 16GB product since last 10 days. All will be aware of most positive sides. So let's start with negative points. 
 
-Ve points of Moto G 
 
1. No native video call option in 3G mode as found in Samsung, HTC, LG, MicroMax etc. You can make video call via Hangout, Skype or other app 
 
2. No 3G only mode. Only 2G and 3G preferred. So if 3G network is weak in your area then it will switch between 2G and 3G 
 
3. Multiple selection is provided in message but not provided in contact. So you can not select more than one contact at a time. 
 
4. You can group apps and make folder on home screen, But it is not done in main menu. 
 
+VE points 
 
1. Superb build quality 
2. Superb screen. Easily readable in sun light 
3. Good sound quality 
4. Supper fast KitKat. No lagging as found in Samsung mid range android. 
5. Camera is Good enough. Good quality in comparison of same price segment. 
6. Superb battery life. Works more than a day with full use of wi-fi, making call, watching video and playing game. 
7. 6, Battery Back up: Minimum 16hrs which is actually 24hrs if you knock off your sleeping time. Sometime it stands for more than 24hrs.( My usage 3G ON all the time, Office Mail, do lot of calling, Little music, games and Maps) 
 
Few Cons: 
1, Music Player is very average. I don't know whether a earphone could change it. 
2, Internet doesn't have a &quot;always 3G&quot; option so even if you have 3G the speed varies. So always look for H+ symbol. It does have a preferred network option but still it changes automatically. 
3, There are no hard keys for Home and Back button this actually creates problem while playing games only. 
4, I feel this phone could have been priced at min 1K lesser than its price cos all mobile comes with a small cushion in price to play with. But since it turned out to be a huge success I don't see a chance for a discount now.

waiting for KK updateIt can't get any better than this for Rs.13,999! Just incredible..I have been using Moto G for over a month now and no issues! 
No app crash. No hang. No lag in NFS Most Wanted, Modern Combat 4, Asphalt 8, GTA Vice City. Very Smooth gaming. 12.5 GB user available memory. 
Battery life is not the best but it is very good. It can last 16-17 hours easily for a heavy user like me (Gaming, Watching Movies and TV Shows, Listening Music and Lot of internet browsing over 3G and WiFi.) So you just need to fully charge it once a day (twice very rarely). 
Camera Quality is decent for regular pics. The detail in the photos is not so good when you zoom them but it is good enough for regular pics for uploading on social networks. And hey just look at the price man. You can't expect the other features that it is giving at this price and that too from a reknown google company like Motorola. The Camera is still better than some cheap indian phones like micromax, lava and spice of this price range.. 
It plays HD (720p) and also Full HD (1080p) videos without lag through MX Player (H/W Decoder). 
No USB Data Cable is provided in the box. So you have to get one 
I also use an OTG Cable to connect a 32GB pendrive to my phone and it works without any issues. I use ES File Explorer. 
Internet connectivity is also decent. It is able to catch 3G network even at those places which my S Duos was not. Though WiFi kept dropping earlier but I changed some settings and now it works fine. 
It is the best buy in market right now. It easily over-powers any other smartphone available for 10,000-20,000 and some even above 20,000 (better than Nexus 4 for me).

Right from the display to the performance the phone always exceeded my expectations. 
Motorola/Google has really done a great job. 
 
This phone (326 ppi) has pixel density equal to that of iphone 4s (332 ppi). 1.2Ghz processor and Adreno 305 GPU really impresses a lot. It doesn't makes us feel to be having only 1GB RAM. No lag or whatsoever is seen. 
 
Some people say, it would be great if there is an external memory slot. But, for me, it doesn't seems to be required. I think, what Google might have thought is, If people who are using expensive iphones are living with their limited storage, we can provide the same in this price range. 
Though google has given 50gb cloud storage (for 2 years, this is addition to 16gb free storage for every google account), I am not sure how useful it will be. Because in India, where internet speed is comparatively low and usage rates are high, we could hardly afford to sync our data to cloud to everytime. Better option would be to use a Wifi network. 
 
Battery backup is kind of ok. It lasts for more than 24 hrs under standby mode. 
 
Only con I could see is below par Camera. Which is not as worst as described in other reviews. It can be very well used for casual photographies and for facebook posts..

Battery : Decent use can take you till 1.5+ days. Bit good over Xperia M 
 
Memory : Now here's the main part, Xperia M has expandable memory but is of very little use. Because the internal memory available is just 4 GB (for user) and we cant install apps on external memory nor can we move apps to SD card (after rooting the case might be different) This is a serious downside of Xperia M. Going for 16 GB Moto G is advisable. 
 
OTG Support : Yes, it has OTG support by default and usb drive up to 16 GB works perfectly fine. 
 
Performance : Quad Core, 1.2 means performance will be decent and it is. Even when running applications like Team Viewer there is no lag what so ever and most high end games too play flawlessly on this one. 
 
Gorilla Glass : Really great add on, you actually don't need scratch guard if you take some care and rest is taken care by the screen itself. Finger nails can never put a scratch on this. 
 
Camera : This is a bit downside, Daylight &amp; outdoor photos come out great but indoor and low light snaps carry noise. However I never had to worry, I leave the job of snapping to my super zoom cam and thus 5MP cam on this is enough for me to click some quick snaps on the go.

Well I was looking for a phone with complete assets that could fit right into my pocket on a considerable budget and since MOTO G was announced back in November last year I had my eyes set on it and was waiting keenly for its launch in India. 
I managed to order the MOTO G on 6th Feb in middle of a mad rush in the first 15 minutes of initial launch(it went out of stock after that)and got it delivered by 8th Feb. 
Coming on to MOTO G ironically its in a league of its own,its a beautiful device that fits right into your hand and offers pretty good one hand opeartion,the built quality is excellent,it feels solid and sturdy a bit heavy though with curve design suit followed by motorola but it gives you all the pleasent comfort that one desires in a smartphone. The screen is one of the major highlights of the phone and it does manages to impress you with the brightness and colour reproduction that it offers with an important addition of Gorilla Glass 3 over it which makes the screen scratch resistant,it is undoubtedly amazing and set standards for other brands. MOTO G has a 5 MP camera at the back and 1.3 MP on the front which I would say is decent,as I am not a cam geek I have very less things to play with the camera feature on any phone but though in overall performance in terms of daylight and low light conditions on a average basis MOTO G does a very good job. Moving on the other aspects of the phone the call quality is very good with noise cancelling capabilities,browsing and surfing is very impressive with easy navigation through pages and texts,sound output from the speakers is very good,music quality is one of the positives of the phone but I would recommend to go for a good pair of IEM other then the default one.In terms of the performance it indeed is exceptional,I have managed to play some of the high end games available on the play store like asphalt 8,fifa14 and did not find any hint of lag at all.I have been using this device for more than 2 weeks now and tried everything with this device,running intensive tasks,several applications at a time,but this device has never shown any signs of getting exhausted but delivered an amazing performance in every aspect without giving a moment to disappoint.The performance in real world is so good that it even match up with some of the high end phones available at present and no other device in the sub Rs.15-20K comes even close to it.However,with all the praise one shortcoming on this device that I feel is its limited storage to 16 GB(real 12 GB) which sometimes is not sufficient when to carry a lot of movies and music but nonetheless it is satisfactory, infact it provides the option to increase the storage alternatively through OTG feature,it allows to mount USB pen drive,SD card with card reader and even hard drives (FAT32 format not NTFS). An important highlight of the phone is its battery which is very impressive,it has managed to give a backup of approx 22-24 hours on medium to slightly heavy usage,on any other day when I have had no other tasks to do in particular except calling,bit of music and browsing,I got around 56 hours of battery backup,on a average basis I am able to charge it once in 24 hours. MOTO G was released with the default stock android 4.3 jelly bean and after being updated to 4.4 kitkat a couple of days back I have noticed significant improvement in performance with display getting immersive which makes the status bar and on screen buttons transparent. 
 
In the end what makes MOTO G stands out among competition is its price,a real bargain at just Rs.13999 for 16 GB makes it an exceptional choice among all major and trader brands which have gone wrong with the poor pricing of their devices before,but motorola has managed to deliver a device which has genetics of pure american engineering with a perfect balance of price and performance.Nice phone at sub 15K range.This is a nice phone at below 15k price point. Don't buy this phone..Well, after reading all the good and bad reviews, I still went for this phone thinking that they might have resolved the problem. But, even after 3 months since launch, I am facing same problems(not all) which I read in negative reviews. 
 
Major problem with this phone is network issue. Basic moto of the cell phone seems to be screwed because of this problem. It looses the signal frequently and temporary solution to get rid of this problem is to reboot your phone. 
 
Same thing happens when you change the packet data from one SIM to other. 
With 2G data, I am unable to download application from Google play which I was able to do with my earlier phone. Even I am unable to download image of nominal size in WhatsApp. So there is much more lag in data speed. 
 
With 3G, Speed is quite ok. But it looses data connection frequently making it difficult to play games online. 
Headset quality is really bad. Even cell phone below 10K price provide better headset quality than this one. 
When I thought that these many problems are enough, I came across one more disappointment. Camera quality is below par. Images are blurry with slightly moving objects. And low light image quality is really bad. 
There are other bugs too as mentioned by others. I did not do R&amp;D for all those.. 
 
Battery: In my case, its perfectly fine. No problem faced yet with battery. 
 
Display quality is good. But you will get same quality in each phone in this price range. 
 
Full marks to Flipkart for delivering it in 27 hours. Hope they will provide same post-sell service

Suggestion: Buy it if you can!!Best phone out there..So my budget was around 25K. So obviously, my choices were limited to these- 
(1) Nexus 4 (2) Nexus 5 (3) iPhone 4 (4) iPhone 4S 
But then came the Moto G. So here are a few things that helped me decide which one out there is the best for me. 
 
Moto G vs Nexus 4/5 
All the specs are pretty much similar between the two except the nexus 5 screen was a bit bigger and had 1080p resolution and after watching the speed tests, Moto G was just as good if not better. And it boiled down to two things- Price vs Camera. If you want 3MP more for 11K more, go for the Nexus. If not Moto G, duh. 
 
iPhone 4/4s vs Moto G 
So these iPhones are around 3 years old, have 3.5 inches screens vs the 4.5 inches screen on the G. Also, the G is brand new, guaranteed upgrade to Android 4.4 whereas the iPhones haven't taken the iOS 7 upgrade too well. The camera is pretty much the same but the iPhone displays richer images. Given the price and specs, Moto G is the clear winner here.

7. Earphones provided are not so good, just okay for calling purpose only.I would recommend using other earphones for music. we are lucky that we got charger and earphones (which are not provide in some other countries) and price is still so low. 
 
8.charging is slow, but i read somewhere that after some recharge cycles it will charge faster or it maybe the 550 mA charger.but its okay..u cant have everything best in this range.. 
 
9.Battery backup - i left at 6 am with 94 percent battery and used the phone for gaming(half an hour), movie(half an hour) internet (3-4 hrs) and clicked about 150 picturs and 4-5 videos recording and next day 5 am, it was 27 percent.So as of now, battery backup is excellent, it can easily last a day with medium to heavy usage.. 
 
10.Benchmarks - Done on jellybean(stock), antutu score is 16933, slightly more than nexus 4

Out of 1 gb ram you can get 500 mb ram free.

I am more than happy to buy and use this one. 
Here are the points I liked in this phone: 
Display- 329 ppi with IPS display equals the retina display. GG3 is bonus feature at this price. 
Battery &ndash;2070 is enough for moderate users to run 2 days and heavy users for 1 day. 
Processor &ndash; quad core processors phones are plenty &ndash; but not much in this range. Benchmark reviews show that it can beat some of the high end phones like nexus 4 or htc one x in most of the competition 
Kitkat &ndash; ok google is another bonus feature to have. It does not work as smooth as Samsung s3 but it does not suck. 
Usb otg &ndash; It was great to use my pen drive with my phone as an external hard drive. Also I was able to use a mouse with this phone &ndash; although it is not necessary. In jellybean copy from pen drive to phone was possible but phone to pendrive was not, it was fixed with the kitkat update. 
Camera &ndash; was much poor in the jellybean, it has improved in the kitkat but still it is an okay camera. 
Waterproof &ndash;I prefer not to drop my phone in water but wish I would not need extra precautions in the rain. 
Music &ndash; not much of a music device. 
Dual SIM &ndash; well, all I can say is that Google has done its research before designing this phone. 
 
Google is solely relying on the software service for the profit of Moto g selling in this price tag. While its big brother Moto X (which has got some aces in the hole) is being sold at 24k the price of little Moto G is fair enough.Very good handset and very good service by WS Retail. Awesome..It is price worthy gadget. Which can compete with High-end devices in speed and response. No hanging or screen freezing if multiple apps run at a time without crossing RAM limit. 
From my point of view. 
Pros when compared to other phones at this range are, HD display, scratch-proof corning gorilla glass 3, extra mic for noise cancellation, processor, better GPU, premium build quality, long lasting battery, reasonable RAM, latest android OS available i.e., KitKat 4.4.2, quick OS updates in future, OTG support which allow us to use pen-drive and memory card using card reader via USB to micro-USB converter, replaceable colorful back shell, last and the best its has NANO-COATING, make it water proof to very good extent. 
 
Cons are 
Call quality is not great, expected clear voice reception but head phone solves that issue, Camera is decent but can be improved by motorola with future updates if they really care about it, no expandable memory card slot but OTG-support can solve that partially, just a decent head phones(we can buy a good head set which is phone independent). 
International version handset is provided only with a data cable but we get all things other than that. Cons are weighed very less when we keep it against the pros and price. 
 
NIZAM SAHARAA Must Have.Bought the Nokia Lumia 620 from Flipkart in August 2013. Hated it from day 1, and it made my life miserable. Felt like flinging it every day so user unfriendly and useless it was slow, sticky, hanging from time to time, display flickering. Tech savvy as I was, I could not get the hang of it even after 8 months. Simple operations like making a call required 3 to 4 touches. Battery has to be charged twice a day. 
 
Bought the Moto G a week ago again from Flipkart. Phone was delivered on day 3. I was not available the first day, so they called and fixed time on the second day, and delivered it at the exact time fixed. Impressive. 
 
Enjoying every minute with the moto-G. The 4.5 inch display fits perfectly in the palm for one hand operation. Any larger and that would not have been possible. Android Kitkat (out of the box) is an amazing software. The phone is fast, fluid and sings when you touch it. Never a dither. It is so user friendly that I had it up and running in 30 secs flat and using it like an expert within an hour. Transferring the contacts from the Lumia to the Moto was just a case of exporting the outlook.com contacts as a csv file and importing them into a separate Gmail account that I had set up for the purpose and which I use as my account for the phone. The camera with HDR enabled takes great photos. The speaker volume is great. Cloudskipper makes an ideal music player (Google player sucks) and the sound is great. The FM Radio adds zing to the music experience. The incoming calls are crystal clear and the phone picks up even the weakest of signals both Mobile network and wifi. Battery with power saving enabled lasts me two full days and that is a relief. The Email app with push mail is amazing and I can access 3 different accounts. Switching to silent mode is as easy as pressing a button, and into aeroplane mode as easy as swiping the notification screen. The factory widgets are useful and the direct call widget is a boon that has enabled me to set up speed dialling to 10 contacts from the home screen. The browsing is good with Opera Browser (not mini or classic) with large font and word wrapping that makes reading webpages easy. Chrome sucks. Moto assist is a fantastic app that leaves you in peace when you are sleeping or in a meeting, yet making sure that your favourites can reach you. Factory loaded quick office makes carrying a tablet redundant. 
 
This piece of techno-art is on par with the much more expensive Samsung Galaxy S 5, and Sony Xperia SP or Z1 and even the iPhone 5. Really value for money. Let's see how it holds up with use.Great performer with good battery life and pleasing display...The display is one of the best thing of this phone.. Even the flagship phones like Samsung note 2 doesn't match its.. Both Samsung Note 2 and Moto G have HD displays (1280x720) , but since Moto g has 4.5inch display as compared to Note's 5.5inch, it has higher PPI and hence, looks very sharp.. Even the build quality is very nice.. 
It has a quad core 1.2 ghz Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 processor which is pretty ridiculous 
considered the price range where most of the tier 1 companies only offer dual core processor.. The only companies offering quad core processor are micromax, karbonn and Xolo which are not tier 1 compainies.. It easy handles multitasking and one will hardly notice any lag.. Moreover the adreno 305 GPU can handle any game which is present in the play store.. 
1GB of RAM will be sufficient for most of the time and since it can be upgraded to kitkat 4.4.2, it requires even less system requirements.. 
As of date, it is running android 4.4.2 kitkat where most of the phones are stilling running 4.1 or 4.2 and motorola is gonna roll out guaranteed updates.. 
Enen if you are a touchwiz, timescape or sense lover, the stock android launcher would be a joy to use.. 
Now camera, 5MP rear and 1.3MP front facing are ok.. Nothing topnotch but does decent job.. 
Battery will easy last you a day with medium usage and even one and a half days with low usage.. No complains.. 
UPSIDE: EVERTHING except camera... it completes with 20k phones of HTC, Samsung and Sony and even beats them in most of the departments 
DOWNSIDE: only downside is its camera.. could hav been better.. 
 
Verdict: If you are looking for a good phones under 20k then must consider it.. Great value for money..&gt;&gt;&gt; BANG FOR THE BUCK..!!...* So, this is my review after exactly 1 month of dedicated use... I got my Moto G delivered by 25th Feb'14... 
* Happy to see that the decade old mobile leader 'Motorola' with the likes of Moto Razr, Moto Yuva, Moto Rokr, L7 re-entering India with a bang. 
* Not mentioning the specs as I guess most of u are aware of it by now. 
*Jumping off 2 the Pros &amp; Cons --- 
 
&gt;&gt; PrOs : 
 
1. DISPLAY - &quot;&quot;Top notch IPS-LCD HD 4.5&quot; screen that too with Corning Gorilla Glass 3 at this price point. Looks like a single piece mirror finished glass. The touch sensitivity is a gem too. A big thumbs up... !!&quot;&quot; (10/10) 
 
2. GOOD QUALITY PROCESSOR AND OK GPU - &quot;&quot;1.2 GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 / Quad Core and Adreno 305 / 450 MHz Single Core. Can perform on anything u throw at it, be the Full HD videos or high octane games like Asphalt 8, Modern Combat...etc&quot;&quot; (9/10) 
 
3. MEMORY/RAM - &quot;&quot;1GB. Nevers slows down your Moto G on multiple app uses. Consider using Clean Master for even more optimisation on RAM usage.&quot;&quot; (9/10) 
 
4. LOUD SPEAKERS - &quot;&quot;The external speaker on Moto G is one of the clearest &amp; loudest speakers seen on branded (not the cheap chinese ones) smartphones&quot;. (10/10) 
 
5. GOOD FRONT CAMERA - &quot;&quot;Sharp and clear 1.3 MP front camera is best at its purpose on Skype and selfies when other brands are providing VGA cams&quot;&quot;.(9/10) 
 
6. USB OTG - &quot;&quot;The USB OTG (USB On-The-Go) function in Moto G lets u connect pendrives and external drives in 'FAT32' format using an OTG cable or direct (in case of OTG pendrives) through the micro-usb port. U can't see this option on most Samsung phones costlier than Moto G. (9.5/10) 
 
7. ANDROID 4.4.2 KIT-KAT - &quot;&quot;Last but not the least, the latest android update on Moto G boasts up some features and improvements over the ongoing Jelly-Bean version on 90% of the android smartphones out in the market&quot;&quot;. (10/10) 
 
8. BATTERY BACKUP - &quot;I get a backup of nearly a day on all tym wifi-on and frequent net browsing with some bit of media. 
 
&gt;&gt; CoNs : 
 
1. CALL QUALITY - &quot;&quot;The biggest fault i felt on Moto G is its very average on the call voice quality. If u have used any Nokia phone before, u can easily recognise the difference. But this should not be a problem, if you are not into too much of voice calling when this is the age of Whatsapp and WeChat. Handsfree is always an option&quot;&quot; (5.5/10) 
 
2. EXTERNAL STORAGE - &quot;&quot;The limited storage capacity in Moto G is an issue for few. 8GB will be little low for a smartphone with good performance specs as u would love to try some hardcore games and full hd movies which take up space. 16GB should be ok for most when there is an option for USTB OTG...&quot;&quot; (7/10) 
 
3. CHEAP IN-THE-BOX ACCESSORIES - &quot;&quot;The charger and earphones provided are of below average quality. The charger heats up a lot while charging the mobile. And about the earphones; i have kept it back in the box... Again u have the option to get a new pair of quality earphones and can use any other nokia/samsung micro-usb charger or get a new one '5V / 750mA-1.3A' .. &quot;&quot; (4/10) 
 
* Conclusion is, u can't get any better than this at this very competitive and affordable price point. 
* Click on 'Buy Now' immediately if u have not bought it yet.... :) .. 
 
&gt;&gt; THANKS....Moto G.Initially I was disappointed by Flipkart.com because of delay in delivery, because of the product being out of the stock, but the moment I received my phone and opened it my disappointment started to shed away like dark clouds after the heavy rain. 
 
Since the usage of my phone began I have never been in trouble regarding the gadget at least. 
A decent battery back up and all the latest features and add to it the option of upgrading my OS Version to Kitkat (though its not much of a difference than Jelly Bean). 
 
I nice camera and sound quality is really good. RAM has never troubled me in any which ways either playing games or watching videos or multiple applications running parallel. 
 
An appropriate size for the pocket and good features overall. 
 
I would give 8/10 if some one asks my opinion.

M loving it ...... :)Moto G - 16 GB - Dual Sim - Excellent Product for an unmatched price!.I had placed an order with Flipkart after the 'Tatkal' rush had depleted their stock for Moto G 16GB. However, Flipkart does do a good job of delivering items in Good condition. As this is a product review, I restrict myself to review of Moto G 16GB Dual Sim, which I received in pristine condition. 
 
OS &amp; Performance 
This handset from Motorola/Google has good build quality as usual and feels solid in hand. 
Within 48 hrs., I got the KitKat update! which went smooth... more on that later. 
 
Memory available is around 12GB for users. RAM is sufficient for all purposes... 
 
The handset has not hung till date, no matter what I try to install. 
 
Phone call clarity is very good. Speaker sound output too is very good. 
 
Video calling apps like Skype work perfectly. The front/secondary cam is very good for video chat. 
 
Display is great. Corning Gorilla Glass 3 is definitely a plus. 
 
Camera functions are good and the video too is smooth. 
But somehow lacks to set the ISO, which my Moto DefyXT can using Apps like Cameral FV-5. 
I feel Motorola could have put an 8MP camera instead of a 5MP one.. could have enhanced the quality of still photos, even if the price went slightly up into the 15000 range. 
 
Though Moto G comes with a bare-bone Anroid device which reduces blotware.. I miss Motorola stock apps like Dashboard. 
 
The Kit Kat Update: Although the Kit Kat update was smooth, after the update, the handset seems to have developed some issue with Bluetooth transfers. Bluetooth transfers fail for sending data above 5/6 mb. could vary from piece to piece... No other glitch has come to my notice yet. 
 
I suggest new users spend more time with the Jelly Bean version and then move on to Kit Kat if and only if all issues are resolved... which Google might eventually/hopefully.

I knew about moto G since it was released in the US and I was eagerly waiting for this product to launch in India. On the very first lot of the first day I booked 16GB version and I was lucky to grab one that soon. Flipkart delivered it on time. 
 
I've bought this phone for my Dad. Since he's upgrading from an old Nokia feature phone I pretty much figured out that 5 inch phablet wasn't going to do well in his hands. It takes some time to get used to large sized products. Also, my dad travels a lot and good battery life was also a requirement. I support Indian brands, but to be honest there is no product offered by Indian manufacturer which satisfied Small Size + Awesome Screen + Good battery life criteria. 
 
Then the Moto G was released. It really does make difference for such a competitive phone to be offered by such a well known brand. Indian brands are good but we keep seeing customers' gripes every day. 
 
Anyways I'll shortlist the Pros. 
1. Very good, sharp display with nice color reproduction and phenomenal viewing angles. 
2. Nice battery life. 
3. Very good screen to size ratio making the overall phone look smaller than other phones with similar screen size. 
4. Acceptable camera quality. 
5. Android 4.4 Kitkat (Yes! it's released) 
6. USB OTG support (Yeah, it works even after KitKat) 
7. Good, smooth buttery performance.Best in its class.I was among the ones who ordered Moto G on flipkart the first day. After using it for a month, I am still very happy with the phone. Here are my takes on some of the performance parameters: 
 
Battery: For medium usage, (2 sims active, browsing on 3G, not a lot of games) I usually get by with 30% charge remaining at the end of the day. Score: 5/5 
 
Display: Pixel density is higher than almost all the phones in the range of 12k to 16k range. Score: 4.5 / 5 
 
Performance: The phone got stuck a couple of times. But this is common to almost every android device. The problem mostly resolved after installing a task manager. Score: 4/5 
 
Camera: Acceptable, but leaves a lot to be desired. Photography indoors, particularly at low light is not great. However, I feel it is still a bargain because of the price. Score: 3/5 
 
Ruggedness: Using the phone without any screenguard / cover. As expected with Gorilla Glass 3, no scratches on the screen. I have dropped the phone a couple of times. No damage except a few scratches on the back cover. Score: 4/5 
 
Speaker: Speaker Volume is pretty good. However, I feel there are better in the category. Score: 4/5 
 
Customer Support: The Motorola customer support via chat is great. However, at times, particularly in the night, I got connected to the US customer support. They decline to help you once they know you bought the phone in India. Score: 4/5 
 
Android 4.4: It seems the version for Moto G is a little stripped down version. Some of the features (like translucent menu buttons, which are available in Moto G only on the home screen) are probably not available 
 
Overall: 4/5Neat and Clean, hats off! Those who are doubtful in choosing this phone read this before you make a decision..Hi all, 
Got a good experience shopping MOTO G from Flipkart, used it a day and here is my review. 
 
Ordering, delivery: 
Ordered MOTO G 16 GB variant on Feb 28 and received on March 1, the very next day!! Amazing delivery!! Thanks Flipkart!! (I live in Pondicherry and phone got shipped from Bangalore through Flipkart's logistics, Cash of Delivery) 
 
Opening the Box: 
Sealed with Motorola tape, Imported : Feb 2014 
The box contains the phone (black) , white color Charger, white color headset, warranty booklet, start up guide. (No USB cable) 
[The international models are shipped with only USB cable but the Indian version ships instead the Charger which is actually better because we tend to use the charger often than the USB cable.] 
 
Feel of the phone, accessories: 
My old phone is HTC One V which has a rock solid aluminium body and comparing to it the build is not bad! 
It is a decent build, and solid than most other phones. 
11.6 mm thick but since it has a nice curved back it gives an illusion as if it is less than 9mm. 
Lengthy charger (nearly1.5 metres) and looks sturdy. Output: 5V , 550mA. 
Light weight headphones with comfy length wires and mic positioning but fails to give good sound quality when listening to music but its not a problem when speaking. 
 
Starting the phone: 
Beautiful Boot animation and the moment you see it you can recognize its superior image quality with 326ppi pixel density spread over 4.5 in screen. Android 4.3 Jelly Bean is the stock OS, automatically asked for upgrading to 4.4 KitKat but as for now I didnt upgrade as the KitKat has few bugs hence I will wait until they are fixed. Though its annoying to snooze the auto reminder to upgrade to KitKat every now and then. 
(If you check the option to automatically download your old apps then all the apps you have installed in your old android will be again download into this too) 
 
Up and going: 
The phone is smooth and I rarely see any lag, Installed moderate graphics game like World of Goo, Ski Safari and worked without any lag. Can clearly see the speed of the processor when compared to my old phone. 
No bloatwares and yet you get apps like Google Books, Google's Play movies etc. inbuilt which cannot be uninstalled. 
12.9 GB usable out of 16 GB. 
Good battery backup, lasted a day with heavy usage -&gt; few loudspeaker music playback, wifi connected over 2 hours. 
Very good quality video, loudspeaker is nice and loud. 
Trust me , you will not like the camera if you have used other brands. The quality is like cheap China make phones when captured indoors but when in outdoor lighting it produces ok images. For 14 K I should have got a better quality but considering the other specs I think its ok to lose Camera quality. If you like to take a lot of pics then this is not a phone for you, choose cheap Lumia 525 instead or wait for Xperia M2. 
 
Bottomline: 
Best deal for 14 K. Premium looks and build, Quadcore processor with 1 GB RAM and a Brilliant Display for just 14 K Rupees!! 
This is what I need!! :DWorth more than the price !!!.I bought the 16GB version of Moto G.

All the specs are truly amazing. 
The features like IPS LCD display, Android KitKat, 1.2 GHz Quad core processor, Corning Gorilla Glass 3 etc. for such an unbelievable price from a highly trusted brand like Motorola tells you what a beast this phone is. 
The 4.5 inch HD screen is something which you would not take your eyes off. 
The gaming graphics and overall performance are stunning ! 
 
Now being human, next up is finding faults ! 
In my opinion, three things which I felt that could have made this phone even better are its battery, a memory card slot and an in-the-box USB data cable. 
A battery of around 2500 mAh would have made it more perfect. 
But considering what else Motorola provides, I believe most of the users can compromise on these things !
