Positives 
1. Screen : 325 ppi - superb display, OK in sunlight, only AMOLED is better than this, which is way too expensive. 
2. Speed : No lag for normal usage. Only while browsing you will see about 0.5 seconds lag. 
3. Flip case : I thought the phone is good to use without the flip case. I used it for a while and then decide not to use the flip case. So you may not want to waste money on the flip case. 
4. Personally i think 8 GB phone is enough, unless you plan to make you phone a juke box. 
5. For a similar specification, i guess the nearest phone is atleast 8-10k more expensive. 
 
Negatives 
1. Camera : Image quality is just OK. Infact i think the real problem is that it is not able to do 'auto-focus' properly. At night the images are grainy. But at 12.5k i didn't have too much of expectation. For me it is primarily a phone and then a camera. If you want a better phone then have a look at lava iris pro. 
2. Battery : Not sure if it is really 2000+ mAH? With normal usage battery lasted a day. So after a few months, i wonder that i might have to recharge twice a day....This is slightly worrying. 
3. I tried hard but could not find any other negative about this yet.

After comparing with leading branded phones (all are mine and my fnds owns); Some of my major findings are mentioned as below :-  
    
 
1. CAMERA :- Some previous reviews in some websites are shown that the camera is not good, but I am experiencing the very good quality in its range (5mp rear and 1.3mp front) and well images in dark areas too and the HD recording quality is not bad. 
 
2. SOUND QUALITY :- The sound quality of the device is amazing and a little bit higher than other branded phones at any circumstances... There is no doubt. 
 
3. PROCESSOR :- The 1.2 GHz Quad Core processor is giving you the wonderful experience with multitasking and no lagging at all. This may be same on other phones in the same configuration, but I am saluting Moto g due to its heart winning price (Rs 12,499/13,999/- on Flipkart only). 
 
4. BATTERY LIFE :- I don't think the users are interested in the type of battery like Lion, phion, removable n non removable etc. They want backup for at least 24 hours because they have no time to charge many times a day in this daytoday's busy environment and Moto g gives it. After completion of full charge, it holding about 20% of battery after continues use 16 hoursof music, browsing (3g), phone calls and WiFi hot spot etc. And this endurance has been checked and done by 2-3 times without sleeping and it is good enough for a entry level smart phone. There is no need to charge within a 48 hours with normal use. 
 
5. STORAGE :- There is two variants available but the selection is depends upon your pocket. The features are same for both. Main feature is that, if you'r not a Google fan just don't mind the offer by Google for 50gb cloud storage free for two years. If you feeling the storage is not enough, You can use any other external storage like pen drive, card reader or a phone too with unlimited storage capability (with the support of OTG data cable, which available in local market or online stores) and you can access any media files. The funny facture is my phone shown charging also while connecting with Moto g....! 
So, the storage options is your own choice. 
 
There may be a requirement of an antivirus software, if you mount the external storage, because any viruse can spread through external storage. 
 
6. KITKAT UPDATE :- Most interesting feature is that the most modern phone with the latest android operating system (4.4.2) with editable office and printing support. No phones available to compare with this price tag. 
 
7. ABOUT FLIPKART, WS RETAIL &amp; DHL :- I am ordered on 29th Mar about 11:00 am and they shipped the same day and it has been reached to me on 01 Apr because 30th was Sunday (I am now in a rural area n there is no COD available). The service provided by Flipkart and Blue Dart DHL was really appreciated, because the original product, international look, standard of packaging, shipping and behavior of customer service centre and web tracking where really 10 star rating for the team Fk, WS&amp; DHL. 
 
8. CONCLUSION :- At the end, I am remembering a whatsapp joke :-

If you are planning to buy a new smart phone earlier, just close your eyes, leave all confusions in your flush and go for Moto g only. &quot;HIGHLY AND STRONGLY RECOMMENDED MOTOROLA G FOR EVERYONE WHO LIKES ANDROID&quot;Awesome phone, but mine is busted.I bought the 8GB variant on Feb 6. In a month, I've totally enjoyed the awesomeness that this phone is. It's a steal at the given price. Amazing responsiveness, wonderful battery life, and all that. 
 
I did get unlucky though; my phone's proximity sensor failed in just one month. I have to now always hit the power button when on call or else it just keeps responding to every touch on the face while on call and I ended up accidentally starting apps, or making other calls, sending random messages on facebook and what not; needless to say a failed proximity sensor gets very annoying very quickly. Everything else still works as expected and pretty damn smooth. I've contacted a Motorola service center near me, and expecting favorable response from them. Will perhaps update my post-sales experience here as well when that story ends. 
 
I would have rated this phone with 5/5 stars within the first 30 days. But here's my star rating for a poor experience. Sorry! I'd perhaps revisit this after I go through their customer service. 
 
Besides the busted proximity sensor, another negative would be the camera - the main one on this phone isn't anything impressive - 5 MP, poor quality images produced. But I didn't expect it to be any better. In fact, it produces good enough pictures in daylight for social sharing. Not good for quick snapshots, for instance, to document some event or for photo-journalists - it really crawls when it comes to grabbing focus and images are very grainy when seen on larger screen at 1:1 size. 
 
-- 
 
PS: I am still trying to figure out if it's just me or a large number of Moto G users have encountered the proximity sensor issue. (Just to figure out how many others have faced this, if you care to help me find out, email me at bustedsensor@morjal.com with subject &quot;My Moto G too&quot; - !only if you're using Moto G).Moto G 8GB 10 days usage feedback.Beyond any doubt, the phone and iys features are exceptional at this price point, its a true value for money. This phone is 3G network compatible only, but seeing as though this country will be years before 4G is sorted and many rural areas still don't have adequate 3G service thats no loss there.Battery is astonishing! -I am getting 10 hours of medium to heavy multimedia use.Gorgeous feel and design.  Camera is a little poor but only by a little, it takes perfectly adequate non-zoom shots.Motto G 8GB 1 month review.First day: While charging the screen was getting hotter. Experienced the same 2-3 days. after that no issue

I just compared it with what i have as other mobile.Would suggest users of the motto g to handle it carefully. yes , motto g very delicate mobile build is not that robust.

1.Power button stopped working. My phone was off for 2-days when it the battery was completely drained out as i had no option switch on the phone. 
2. Battery consumption is another issue with the phone. Have to recharge every day. if u forget, battery will drain completely very quick. 
3. Some how managed to fix the power button issue from the service center. watch a movie online for an hour. Screen was getting hotter again. 
 
Flipcart rejected for replacement as i complained it on 35th day. and Motorola also said get it fixed at the service center as there is physical damage

The touch is extremely smooth, being glass it also scratches less. 
I am keeping the mobile away from my kids a i am scared if they drop it and if it the screen breaks, actually i myself have dropped the phone twice from my work desk, lucklly nothing has happened.

Minus: 
1. No business card can be sent through sms, can be sent only through whatsup. 
2. SMS messages can not be stored in another folder, no option is there for this 
3. 8 GB option is very less, taking one video for 45 min eats up all your storage space 
4. I think 16 gb should be fine, if external storage is there it should be great 
5. Should handle carefully as the screen is glass 
6. Some times the clarity of voice is poor, jarring voice is noticed ocassionally 
7. Data cable is not available in the box as accessories 
8. Battery can not be changed after a few yrs of usage

2. Glass screen increases the life of the screen by reducing scratches 
3. Glass screen is very smooth to feel and touch 
4. Over all good phone that its higher grade of competitors

I do not think there is any other branded product available in the price range.Thanks motorola and flipkart :)Best phone for the money.I bought two phones on the day it released on flipkart and totally happy with the performance. I used a samsung galaxy note for the past 2 years and my expectation was quite high. So, I naturally have to compare the performance of this one with the note (gt-n7000). Following are some of my experiences. 
 
Played Need For Speed MW on both. I found no difference performance-wise but it runs much more cooler on the new moto-g. Battery drain was also lesser on the moto-g. 
Overall battery life is much better than the note. Even with a lot of browsing, videos, 3G, calls etc, it still is giving me more than a day for one charge. With the same usage, my note would drain in half day even when it was new. 
There is not a bit of sluggishness at all when using maps, videos etc. NFS MW was the most CPU/GPU intensive app I have used until now on the moto-g and it ran perfectly well. 
 
I do not miss the big screen of note that much as 4.5 inch is enough in my opinion and also, the resolution almost matches the note. 
 
The only thing which is not as good as the note is the camera. The moto-g has a 5MP front and 1.3MP rear camera. This is nothing like the 8MP/2MP in my old note. Also, I think the sensor/lens (either or both) is not up to mark. No image stabilization.Finally, Motorola is back with a vengeance!!.As the title says, after having to shut down its operations in India due to tremendous losses in the mobile market, Motorola is back with a vengeance to India after missing a year or two. 
Motorola is a company which comes under Google, so be assured to experience vanilla android experience in it. Flagship specs also add the cherry to the cake. In the budget segment(upto 20,000), this probably beats all. It comes with premium build quality and feels like a top notch build. I doubt if people will still go for other companies in this range after the return of Motorola. Not to forget, Moto G, like previous Motorola phones is also dust resistant and water-proof. Motorola was the first company which made water-proof phones available to the consumer market. The only possible downside could be the 5 MP camera, which although is fine, since the phone isn't meant to be used as a digital camera. I don't own this device but have used it vigorously since a friend of mine just bought it. At the price point, the cons can be perfectly neglected (atleast for me)Does this low price come at the cost of performance?.THIS IS TAKEN FROM NDTV GADGETS' REVIEW AND THE CREDIT ENTIRELY GOES TO NTDV. 
 
What makes the Moto G special is the fact that it is one of a very small number of devices running the latest version of Android, and one of the only ones priced this low to be doing so. 
 
The Moto G scores heavily in terms of style and substance, and our only major quibbles are the non-expandable storage and below-par camera performance. The 4.5-inch HD screen is wide, and yet the phone is small enough to hold in one hand and type easily with a thumb. Most of all, praise be, the Moto G is also extremely affordable. 
 
This phone is definitely aimed at price-conscious Indian smartphone buyers, and its array of colourful back shells will attract the style-conscious as well. Yes, it isn't perfect, but it isn't meant to compete against the likes of the Samsung Galaxy S4, HTC One or LG G2. At its price, we're willing to overlook its faults. 
 
The Moto G is available in two variants: 8GB for Rs. 12,499 and 16GB for Rs. 13,999. At this price point, no other phones offer an experience that is as good, so in that sense the Moto G is a game changer. If you have your eyes set on the Moto G, we recommend you spend the extra bucks and get the 16GB version, given the limited user accessible storage available in the 8GB version. Our only other complaint with the Moto G is the average camera, but the only phone that offers a better camera in the same price bracket is the Nokia Lumia 720, so the newest Motorola smartphone is a winner overall.Flipkart is the IDEAL online retailer and MOTO G an ideal phone.I realized I had not arranged for a valentine gift for my wife and it was already 48 hours before valentine's day. I opted for the next day delivery and quite likely so, it came in time before cupid struck. What makes the Moto G special is the fact that it is one of a very small number of devices running the latest version of Android, and one of the only ones priced this low to be doing so. 
 
The Moto G scores heavily in terms of style and substance, and our only major quibbles are the non-expandable storage and below-par camera performance. The 4.5-inch HD screen is wide, and yet the phone is small enough to hold in one hand and type easily with a thumb. Most of all, praise be, the Moto G is also extremely affordable. 
 
At Rs. 12,499/- no other phones offer an experience that is as good, so in that sense the Moto G is a game changer. So, I guess I'll wait for the next update.A Power Packed Device :).I have been using this product for a week now and i must say this is a awesome buy and a great value for money. 
Processor: The device is packed with a 1.2 GHz Quad core Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 processor with 1 GB of RAM which allows lag less multitasking and a great phone experience. 9/10 
 
Camera: The Moto G sports a 5-megapixel rear camera accompanied by an LED flash, and also has a 1.3-megapixel front-facing camera. I found it pretty decent as per my requirement which allows me take nice snaps and 720P video recording. You wont get a better camera than this at 12 K phone i promise :) 8/10 
 
Gaming Review: Powered by a quad-core 1.2GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 processor coupled with an Adreno 305 GPU, the Moto G features 1GB of RAM which allows a great gaming experience. I play Temple Run,Subway Surfers,2048 etc games and i have not witnessed a single lag :) 9/10 
 
Nano Coating: The phone is protected via Nano coating which means an accidental water spill will not effect. No spills Yet so cannot rate but have seen a video where Moto G was kept inside water for 30 mins :) 10/10 
 
Moto Apps: The phone comes with 2 great Motorola Apps which have a great productivity. 8/10 
 
Call Quality: The call quality is OK and not the best still 7/10. 
 
Many users have reported that after update to KitKat they were facing signal issues but i have not updated to KItKat and even wont and would recommend to stick to Jelly Bean and also make sure to use a pure micro sim and not a cut which might cause some issue. 
 
Over all a great buy and a great value for money i would recommend this phone for all :) 9/10 Go for it :)Excellent.I have been using Moto G for about a month now, and I can say that it's by far the best Android phone that I have used so far. If you are looking for a phone in the 10k to 15k range, dont hesitate to buy this phone. And if you are deciding between buying an Indian-made Android and Moto G, you shouldn't be. The reason is because Moto G just excels in everything. I have been trying to find a flaw so far. Its been one month since I bought it, and it has been excellent. I can do everything with it. 
 
People complain about the camera being only 5 megapixels. Here is a bit of advice for those people. Megapixels are a measure of the resolution of a photo, not its quality. And after using Moto G, I saw that the photos are of extremely high quality, and it can be improved by using HDR. The video recording quality is also very good and it consistently outperforms phones with high-res cameras. 
 
For those who feel that there should be external storage, just buy the 16 GB version. Unless people plan to put entire movies and TV series in the phone, 16 gigs is more than enough. 
 
However, one thing that most people don't complain about is the sound. The sound quality lacks a bit. If you play songs at high volumes, the audio breaks. But then again, for the price you are getting, I think quite a few people would be willing to make that compromise. 
 
Just go for it and then you will see for yourself. Coming to the phone: 
PROS 
- First if all we have to keep in mind that it is mid ranger and not a high end droid with them fancy unlimited cores and unimaginable screen resolutions. 
- Once you have this set in your mind, then you will simply love this phone. It performs all the basic tasks with such ease and the interface is very clean and crisp, very Google Nexus like feel on the UI. 
- Runs all the basic apps and day to day tasks smoothly without any lag and has an excellent screen. Videos actually look very nice on the HD display. 
- Is extremely smooth and running on latest Android KitKat 4.4.2 with fast and guaranteed updates from Google in future. 
 
CONS 
- The sound from the speaker is a little mild as compared to other phones out there. But it is manageable if you do not want to blast out songs / music through the loudspeaker in a noisy environment. The sound is actually pretty good when we use headphones. 
- The camera is of mediocre quality and is just about fine for clicking pics in daylight, low light and night time performance is below standard. Reducing one star for this !

It's the first handset launched by Motorola in India since it was taken over by Google; and it costs just less than INR 15 k for an impressive specification. 
 
The 4.4.2 update brings a few changes. The phone dialler has been changed and you can now bring up contacts quickly via the numberpad by simply entering any string of letters or numbers that appear in that contacts name or number. For example, typing 766 will bring up any contact with POO or MON in their names, or any contact whose number contains that string of numbers. You also get intelligent caller ID, with the phone searching for unknown numbers and providing you with information based on that search, so you have some idea who it is before you answer. 
 
Android 4.4 also supports the new version of Hangouts which combines your instant messaging and SMS apps into one, though you still need to switch between these two streams to keep track of all your conversations via both. 
And most of it can be found on the internet using this same phone. 
 
Delivery &ndash; 10 / 10 
Time to deliver 10 / 10 
Customer Delight &ndash; 10 / 10

So I've got some time to use the product before writing the review. Like many reviewers of this product (across the internet) have noted, this phone is indeed great value for money. The &quot;missing&quot; features like NFC, LTE don't mean anything to me since I don't use them. 
 
I like the (relatively) compact size of this phone - it fits into my hands nicely. I suggest buying the Motorola grip cover. There's no fear of dropping the mobile once you have this on. It also makes the buttons for power and volume very accessible. I've been using flagship HTC phones and this &quot;downgrade&quot; has been a pleasant surprise with respect to form. 
 
The other things I liked are the display and the availability of the latest Android (I fiddle with bit of programming so this is very handy. It's much more easier to test Android apps on the device than the so called simulator that freezes my laptop). 
 
Now, the cons. My main concern is the quality of voice when the signal is weak. I don't know how it compares with other phones in the same price-band but I'm talking from a perspective of having used phones that cost 3 times more. I know it is not a fair comparison. However, if you're someone who's used to HTC Ones or Samsung Galaxies and thought &quot;hey, why spend so much money when Moto G seems to be a good deal&quot;, then you may want to check out the voice calls before buying. It is still a Rs.13K phone and I don't expect anything less on the basic features of the device. 
 
Overall, for anyone whose budget is around 13,000 or even less (stretch a little and buy it, you won't regret it), this is a great product.High end phone at surprisngly low prices.I had ordered Moto g 16 GB on the launch day through Flipkart. As always, Flipkart service was excellent. You get a normal headphone, 2 pin charger along with the handset. 
 
Here are some of the summary points: 
Pros: 
1. Build quality: The hardware quality is very good. It is sturdy and looks nice. The android OS is very efficient and impressively smooth. 
2. Audio: Call quality is excellent and speakers are very loud. 
3. Multi tasking: Very easy to do 
4. Processor and RAM: In day to day usage and gaming, I haven't experienced any lag till now. You get 882 MB RAM out of which around 650 MB is utilized by android plus the apps I have downloaded. Still the phone performs very well as the quad core processor is very powerful. 
5. Storage: You get 12.92 GB of storage out of 16 GB, which is more than enough for 1000's of audio files. 
6. HD screen: Watching HD movies, trailers on this phone is a great experience. 
7. Keypad: It is easy to use and comes with swype feature. 
8. Google Now: Give voice commands to your phone for setting alarms, reminders, search for restaurants, movies and lot more with this incredible app. Eagerly waiting for Kitkat update of this app which enables to use this app from homescreen. 
9. Resistant to water and very durable. A youtube video shows it to be still working after being put into water for 30 minutes. Don't try this at home. :P 
10. Battery life: Better than my earlier galaxy phone. It lasts for around 26 hours when you use wifi and apps at frequent intervals. 
11. Dual sim feature is pretty useful. It supports only micro sim cards. 
 
Cons: 
1. Camera and video recording: Camera is average but I think day pics would be of standard quality, and quality of recorded videos is not good. 
2. Motorola was bought by Lenovo recently. So I am a little skeptical of after sale services. 
 
All in all, a great grab for people who want to buy an android smartphone at a low price. Its google BTW (or atleast was).. so i am sure you would agree with me if you also have got your hands on the Moto GWater repellent coating.Motorola's back, and it's kicking off its global smartphone revival with the keenly priced Moto G handset. A mid-range handset with a low-end price. 
                    Well at that price it has the likes of the Samsung Galaxy Fame, Nokia Lumia 520 and LG Optimus L3 2 for company, but dive into the spec list and you'll note the Moto G wipes the floor with them. 
                          The Moto G features a water repellent coating which means you'll be able to whip it out in the rain without fear of a short circuit, but it is not waterproof - so no jumping in the pool with it. 
The 2070mAh non-removable battery housed inside the Moto G is claimed to give you all day battery life,Indeed it has. 
The Moto G comes with a 4.5-inch, 1280 x 720 display and boasts a 329ppi pixel density. To put that in some perspective that's a bigger, higher resolution and more defined display than the iPhone 5S - not bad for a handset which is a third of the price. 
                          Of course a HD display isn't the only key factor in a smartphone, but Motorola has managed to equip the Moto G with a 1.2GHz quad-core Snapdragon 400 processor and 1GB of RAM. 
                             The camera on the rear of the Moto G is only 5MP.Preatty awesome feature of click -hold-collect.Exceptional Phone for sure!!!! Here's a short review after using 8 GB version of Moto G for 3 days. 
 
Pros: 
Amazing scratch resistant display 
Fast &amp; Smooth (Able to play high end 3D games smoothly) 
720p HD slow motion video capture quality is awesome. 
Battery life is way better than any other android handset. 
 
Cons: 
Upgrading to Android Kitkat may bring some problems. (My second sim was getting disabled automatically.) 
Camera quality is average, but not really bad. 
The power button on the right hand side of the handset slightly wobbles. 
Headset &amp; charger provided is of low quality, but again you cannot expect better at this price range. 
 
For people who are having SIM card issue: 
Please try to insert a new sim keeping the phone on. Now take it out and replace by your original sim which was getting disabled. This should resolve your problem &amp; you wouldn't face any further issue. 
 
However for new buyers i suggest, DO NOT UPGRADE to android kitkat version until Motorola launches the ultimate package upgrade.Moto g. Update: Got mail regarding the Offers promised during purchase on launch dayAn amazing buy for an amazing price.I ordered moto g 8 gb variant (as 16gb is out of stock). The phone is the highest end phone in the low end phones. Build quality is excellent. It is sleek and is easy to hold even if your palm size is small. The matte finish on the rear of the phone provides nice grip. The glossy corning gorilla glass 3 adds an nice look to the phone but it attracts smudges and fingerprints. 
Coming to performance, I played pretty graphic intense games like Asphalt 8 with &quot;ultra&quot; setting and there is no lag. Though there is a slight jittering,but it is hardly noticeable. 
Battery backup is also very good when compared to other phones in the price range. With medium usage you can get upto 1.2 - 1.5 day backup. 
Coming to camera, outdoor shots are good but indoor shots with low lighting conditions produce a lot of noise. Anyway don't expect a good camera for this price. If you are looking for a good camera, you can get a nice &quot;point and shoot&quot; camera for this price. 
This doesn't come with an expandable memory card slot but google gives free 50GB space on google drive for 2 years. 
LTE and NFC are not supported by this phone. 
Motorola recently rolled out the Android 4.4.2 Kitkat update. 
Overall if you are looking for a budget smart phone go for it. It is actually more than a budget smart phone.nice phone.. waited for a deal like this for 4 months.phone is good .. perfect for everything

Without taking much of your precious time, I am placing the Pros &amp; Cons straight-way. 
_______________________________________________________ 
Pros: 
1. Awesome Built Quality 
2. Excellent Bright Screen that does not pull the battery to its knees. 
3. Gorilla Glass Protection, retardant to fingerprints. 
4. Good Picture/Camera Quality (Yes, you read it right) 
5. Fast, Fluid UI with Great CPU &amp; GPU performance. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------_______________________________________________________ 
Cons: 
1. Buggy, Ugly &amp; Unfamiliar UI 
2. Low Internal Memory for 8GB version 
3. Disgusting visible search bar (Kitkat it is) 
4. Expensive Acessories 
5. Memory not expandable! 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Mentioned below are some pros and cons- 
 
Pros: 
 
1.Great hardware performance- No lag experienced, works great in multi-tasking of emails, sms, phone calls and social apps like LInkedIn, FB, whatsapp etc along with gaming apps. 
 
2.Excellent battery life: I am an average user with usage of voice calls of around 45-60 mins a day and average use of FB, whatsapp, office email, gmail and texting with lets say 15-20 mins of gaming...the battery last almost 30-35 hours 
 
3.Great Display- Cant ask for more in this price range. Great clarity and viewing angles 
 
4.Call quality - I have seen in some expert reviews that the call quality of MOtoG is not good. But per my personal experience it is above average and I have not experienced any issue with call clarity so far 
 
5.External speaker sound output is good- With decent base and treble. Nothing like a Chinese phone 
 
6.Gaming - Great for gamers...I have played temple run2 and subway surfer without any glitch or lag. Great experience 
 
Now lets discuss some cons- 
 
Cons: 
 
1.Camera: Below average pictures in low light...even with flash on, the noise is pretty evident in the pitures. Average performance in daylight. Can't be used as your primary photography device 
 
2.Notification Led: Very small in size...difficult to pick under outdoor natural light 
 
3.External memory: A lot has been discussed about this in other reviews...will not dwell further. Although OTG is a relief 
 
4.Stock android: The stock version of android is very light, with some basic features of other phones missing...Samsung or HTC users will find it a little uncomfortable to use initially and may have to install a few apps to restore the balance...having said that for pure android experience, MotoG is a great phone with no bloatware... 
 
All in all a great package of software and hardware...If you are not a photography enthusiast and can do with 16Gb of internal memory, look no further than Moto G!!!How can you do this.....Motorolla how can you do this...i thought only non branded phones can be sold cheap...i was going to buy such a non branded one (Micromax A114/A110)...I Almost ordered one just before the moto g launch hearing some rumors that the price will be around 14K range....but something inside me told not to buy the MM and i cancelled that order.... waited for the launch....shocked when heard the price ....amazed to see the response of buyers...ordered an 8GB version on the 12 noon launch session....delivery promised on 13th,got it on 11th...Thank You Flipkart...

(except for the nexus and iphone!)Awesome phone.. complete value for money.Have bought it on the launch day... i have 8 GB model.. 
Motto G is by far the most complete value for money smartphone. The software &amp; hardware are very good. Battery life is decent for light to medium use. My battery lasts for day and half with constant GPRS and 20-40 minutes of calling each day. The kitkat upgrade also happened very smooth. 
Earlier I had used Samsung Galaxy S One which used to hang often but Motto G runs pretty smooth.. haven't restarted it for over 20 days. 
 
One limitation is the camera which sucks in low light however in daylight the camera is capable of capturing very good pictures with sharp colors and details. 
Another drawback is inbuilt battery which caused problem to one of my friend as his battery drained completely and he was not able to get it charged using charger. If battery drains completely, the normal charger is not able to infuse charge in it and it has to be taken to service center to remove battery and charge it. So never let your phone die. 
 
Last but not the least, flipkart delivered the phone within 24 hours after ordering :)Pretty Good.I have already used a Galaxy s3, Nexus 4. 
 
Though I miss the ubiquitous options the touch wiz has, I have to say it does not seriously dent the performance. If anything lack of touch wiz increased the functionality. I have a 8 GB Moto G not the 16 GB. So the firmware takes only 3 GB unlike nearly 5 GB in S3. Next, even though I have downloaded almost all apps it is still nearly 1 GB lower, I am guessing these are the un-uninstallable Samsung Apps. In total that is 3 GB there. 
The battery size being similar, in standby, i.e. when the screen size becomes irrelevant, the Moto G only consumed 3% over 10 hrs vs 10% for S3 over similar settings - Wifi and phone were on, but every other communication channel off. I browsed 6 hrs in two days and without offing in between and after two days there is still 20% charge left on the phone. 
Of course this could be the new 4.4.2 Kitkat, that the phone immediately upgraded itself, working here. 
This is only good, my S3 is still stuck in 4.3 Jelly bean. 
 
The photos are not something I will comment on, because I could not tell any difference. 
However, the rubberized back is something I love in this new phone. Not to mention the how well the smaller screen size fits in the palm of my hand. I still have problems with my S3 regarding size after nearly 2 years. I find it very difficult to hold to the ear. And some goes for my Nexus 4. I found no such problems with Moto G. 
 
The gorilla glass 3 felt extremely smooth under the fingers. 
 
I am giving a 4 even though other reviews have criticized the absent of microSD slot, NFC, and of course poor camera. 
Poor camera seems to be problem for all stock android and moto G is not alone. The micro SD would have been usefull if I don't have a laptop, or usb drive, or an external hard drive, or a data cable. Since I have all those. 
The only complaint I can make is: 
 
Why wouldn't you give a data cable with a smart phone? Its not costly. 
 
I know Google has its reasons to divest, however, if Motorola can consistently deliver such products in future, Lenovo will be one lucky buyer. I probably would have paid a little more for the phone had I had the chance to have a feel of if before I bought it. This is something Lenovo can work in the future, Even with the 30 day return policy I would have been comfortable with a physically handling the phone before the purchase. E-commerce sites already have the cost advantage over brick and mortar shops. With Moto G I have finally migrated successfully and there is no going back. 
 
The important factor in Moto G is that its not the best phone available in the market, but Google has given a phone that is an absolute gem for the price that I paid. All the right things - voice quality, decent battery life, stock Android OS, all of the features is spot on for a guy who spends most time on the phone along with a bluetooth headset. 
 
Battery stays for about a day, mostly because internet always on and I am on the phone for about 7 hours a day. On weekends i get about 32 hours before I have to charge again. 
 
I didnt see any of the issues that others reported with the kitkat OS. I actually bought two phones and it works perfectly fine. 
 
As far as gaming goes, temple run 2 had absolutely zero lag on this phone. Thats as far as I have been able to test.

The above review is from a hardcore &quot;Apple fan-boy&quot; who is using all the models/gadgets (for the last 6 years) - of the world's most valuable company.An Absolute stunner of a phone at these price points..I am an apple legacy product user. Decided, after much deliberation to migrate to android. and lo behold, motorola decided to launch the perfect device suited for me and my requirements at the most perfect time. 
 
I have been using a 8 gb variant for a month and a half now and it has been a great, great experience so far. this phone looks a premium smartphone straight after the unpacking. The first phone after the nexus devices and GPE(play edition) devices to get kitkat, 1 gig of RAM(which seems a tad bit low at times but it is perfectly fine for a casual user like me), Quad core Qualcomm processor at a jaw dropping price point, OTG support out of the box, decent battery life; the list of cons outweighs and outnumbers the list of cons by so much that this is a steal. 
 
However, if you are looking for a stellar camera, lower your expectations, it does perform quite well in natural light and ambient conditions but the same can't be said about it in low light conditions. 
People who have been claiming that the google selling motorola to lenovo and potential lack of customer care options and after sales service should know enough that such deals take years to be finalised and lenovo knows better than to tinker with the design team of motorola. 
 
Also as a side note: 
1) if you are on kitkat/manually update to kitkat, enable DEVELOPER OPTIONS by tapping the android build around 7/10 times and then enable ART instead of DALVIK. although in beta, it still supports almost all apps and makes your phone smoother. 
2) buy an OTG cable if you are worried about low internal storage and then use ES File Explorer. 
3) sideload GOOGLE NOW LAUNCHER(now my default launcher), which is available as an external APK and that will give you voice activation from homescreen and so many nexus features that people have been craving for. 
 
All said and done, this is a game changer as far as smartphone market is concerned and I would without any reservations or hesitations would suggest to buy this.Very Satisfied..Phone was delivered within 2 days - kudos to flipkart.

Go for the Sandisk 16/32gb otg drive with this phone.My respect in the family has gone up - Read the complete review to find out why.It may not have been accompanied by the flash and razzmatazz of a flagship phone launch, but the Motorola Moto G is still a huge deal, in both senses of the phrase. It's the first handset launched by Motorola in India since it was taken over by Google; and it costs just less than INR 15 k for an impressive specification. 
 
The 4.4.2 update brings a few changes. The phone dialler has been changed and you can now bring up contacts quickly via the numberpad by simply entering any string of letters or numbers that appear in that contacts name or number. For example, typing 766 will bring up any contact with POO or MON in their names, or any contact whose number contains that string of numbers. You also get intelligent caller ID, with the phone searching for unknown numbers and providing you with information based on that search, so you have some idea who it is before you answer. 
Android 4.4 also supports the new version of Hangouts which combines your instant messaging and SMS apps into one, though you still need to switch between these two streams to keep track of all your conversations via both. 
 
And most of it can be found on the internet using this same phone. 
 
Delivery &ndash; 10 / 10 
Time to deliver 10 / 10 
Customer Delight &ndash; 10 / 10 
 
I bought 6 pieces of this little monster &amp; it was a gift for my dad, sister, friend, cousins etc. 
 
My respect in the family has gone up &ndash; not because of the phone(no doubt its cool) &ndash; but the timely delivery.Best in mid range segment.Performance 
 
We didn't found any issues or lag while navigating the applications, opening multiple browsers or watching videos on you tube. Moto G is powered with 1.2 GHz quad core Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 processor with Adreno 305 graphics and 1 GB RAM. Moto G comes in two storage capacities 8 GB and 16 GB. We have 8 GB device with us which has only 5 GB memory left for the user. While other specs are more than expected for this price range, low user memory can be a constraint for many potential buyers who want more storage capacity to keep larger applications and games such as Asphault 8. 
 
Moto G is powered by 2070 mAh strong battery, I used Moto G for couple of days with full day internet usage and playing games such as Temple Run and Polar bit racing. Battery backup was good and still 64% of battery was remaining at the end of the day. 
Speaker of phone are loud enough to rock a small room and sound is clear even at highest volume level. 
 
Areas of improvement 
 
1. As we now know there are no capacitive or hard buttons on front panel , still there is a space under display at front panel. Back, home icons are placed at the bottom of the display for which we feel this space could have been utilized. 
2. Less user storage in 8 GB variant. 
3. No option to set custom ringtone from your music library. (you have to move your chosen ringtone to ringtone folder and then you can set custom ringtone). 
4. No USB cable comes with the box. You have to buy one to connect with PC. 
5. Camera of Moto G is just average and lacks that wow factor in it for which we were looking for. 
 
Verdict 
 
As I said in starting Moto G is one of the best phones available in market for this price range. Adding to that it is one of few devices that runs on latest Android KitKat version. 
In terms of User experience, build quality, performance and battery backup Moto G scores high , however lower user memory and average camera performance are only concern for us which is manageable for the price range and other specs. 
 
Moto G is aimed at large number of customers who are willing to spend around 15K for a decent phone which makes a larger chunk for smartphone market. 8 GB version is available on Flipkart for Rs 12599 and 16 GB version for 13999/-. At this price no other phone comes near to Moto G as of now. 
 
Overall Moto G is a value for money device , if you are aiming to buy one go for 16 GB version its worth to spend extra 1500 bucks and even wait for sometime.My son loves it.. me too.I was happy from the moment the phone reached home. BATTERY..... well it lasts about a day with heavy use of internet, calling and also CLASH OF CLANS for around 2-3 hours....A month experience with MOTO G and FLIPKART.Flipkart: Satisfying customer care service, quality service. the best I have experience so far in online shopping. 
 
Hands on Moto G: A month experience with both the 8 and 16GB and I can tell you it is worth of its value, better than any of the brands in its price segment.(PS; Compare the prices and specs always before you buy them, also read the feedback of common consumers to know about the user experience) 
 
Build quality: All plastic but does look premium, feels solid and well build. 
 
Design: The Moto G&rsquo;s frame is built around a 4.5-inch display, so compared to today&rsquo;s 5-inch flagship handsets, the device is relatively compact. It&rsquo;s not the best looking smartphone I&rsquo;ve ever used, nor is it the thinnest or lightest &ndash; the Moto G comes in at 11.6mm thick and 143 grams heavy &ndash; but the edges are curved to make it ergonomic. 
 
Hardware Performance: Inside the Moto G is Qualcomm&rsquo;s Snapdragon 400 SoC, which gives a quality performance while multitasking, Graphics-wise, the MSM8226 comes loaded with an Adreno 305 GPU running at 450 MHz, plus an LPDDR2 memory controller. (The combination of an Adreno 305 GPU and 720p display also seems to be good enough to run most 3D games at an acceptable frame rate. It doesn&rsquo;t deliver the same performance as on high end phones, and some games are unsupported on the Moto G, but the device could be perfect for the casual mobile gamer.) 
 
Camera: Average for outgoing and good for fun, the outdoor shots are far better than low end phones but the indoor results suffer from blur grainy and... The Moto G tops out at 720p video recording at 30 frames per second and 10 Mbps. Video quality is quite good, as good as you&rsquo;ll get from still shots in whatever conditions you&rsquo;re recording in, but the software stabilization option appears quite weak. Luckily, the camera is capable of quick exposure changes and autofocus, plus slow-motion recording sweetens the deal. 
I wouldn&rsquo;t describe the Moto G&rsquo;s camera as terrible, nor would I describe it as fantastic. In good outdoor lighting it&rsquo;s possible to get some half-decent shots, but it struggles most of the time while indoors. Of course, no-one ever expects a fantastic camera experience on an entry-level smartphone, and the Moto G&rsquo;s shooter will likely be fine for those who use their phone for the occasional quick shoot. 
 
Overall experience: 
Pros: Fantastic performance. Excellent value for the money. Great display is complemented by an ergonomic design. Decent battery life. 
Cons: Internal storage tops out at 16 GB, with no microSD card slot option. Camera is unsuitable for indoor or low-light photographyBest Mobile. Period..I ordered the 8 GB version on first day and received the same on next day. Recently I updated the software to Kit Kat 4.4.2.

The Display resolution (I believe 329 ppi) is said to be better than Iphone 5. I have not seen the Iphone 5, but this display resolution is great. Display is smooth and scrolling is great. Due to greathigh display resolution, the 4.5 inch display suffices for reading, writing etc as the clarity of text, image etc is great. I have free RAM remaining of around 200 mb, after installing 50 to 55 apps. Of course it's the mobile where latest android, 4.4.2 Kit Kat can be experienced. I am sure it would be future proof also for any future updates to Android with the given hardware.

Motog review: 
 
1.Dual sim: it's dual sim active not standby..both are micro sims..network signal is very strong for both...

4.Display: very smooth and bright display..the ambient light sensor work very fine when the display mode is in auto...at maximum brightness the battery drains little bit faster..

Don't go for Micromax Magnus or any other phone in this range. They may have better features but Motorola is Motorola... Serving the best since 1928. 4.5 HD display is the PERFECT size, neither big nor small. Battery sometimes lasts more than a day. My advice: buy it blindly !! Some small features such as Face Recognition Lock, Motorola Migrate, Daydream will rock your phone. The camera is also good with panorama, multiple shots and HD Recording. Yes, some high end phones are offering VGA recording and this one has got a HD one. Battery is unremovable. That's a GOOD point. The battery is the main part of the phone. If your phone gets stolen or lost, just go to Motorola website and wipe-off the data of the phone and also find its location or give a ring. You'll never regret, I promise.What a good budget phone should contain.I ordered this phone on 1st day on the release day and I was really excited upon receiving the phone. It was delivered to me on Sunday and I used my entire day exploring my phone. Its a good budget phone from Google though now its a part of Lenovo but this phone was designed by Google. I simply love my phone. Like to give you some pro and cons 
 
Pro's: 
1. Very good phone under this budget. No other phone dare to give you under this price range. I am comparing it good branded phones such as Sony or Samsung 
2. Screen resolution and camera quality is very good. 
3. Got the latest upgrade of Kitkat from Google where other phones are still struggling for the same. Apart from this only Nexus has Kitkat till now 
4. Gorilla glass 3-No need of screen guard. 
5. I didn't notice any lag after using it for almost 20 days and graphics and other good quality games work fine with no delay 
6. Good processor with 1.2 quad core snapdragon processor which processes really fast 
 
Cons: 
1. No SD card support but for normal users 16Gb is sufficient.Still a great phone.I don't think I can add much of my own to the already overwhelmingly positive reviews this device has here. But I'd like to share a few points anyway: 
I switched to the Moto G from my barely 2 year old Samsung Note (the first Note), on paper this didn't seem like much of an upgrade since the Note was already a powerful device which fulfilled most of my mobile needs (video, music, gaming, social). But then, it was not very expensive, so I ditched the Note and got this little gem. 
And I'm glad I did. The interface is butter smooth, next to no bloatware (Bye Bye S apps, you will not be missed), and the phone just feels good in my hand. You can compare all the specifications you want all day long, but you can't argue with the sheer value for money you get with the Moto G. 
The only down-side side is the non-expandable and admittedly limited memory (Go for the 16GB guys, managing 8GB will be tough). I bought a USB stick for that, one of those Verbatim things that has a USB 3.0 port on one end and a micro USB port on the other. Works like a charm. 
One of the best tech purchases I've made this year, cheers to Motorola, welcome back.Moto G is a cool phone!.Folks, I love my phone! I feel it is a cool gadget. Great value for money. Everyone in my circle agreed that it looks like a premium phone and not a 14k phone...and it feels great in hand. 
Now getting to specifics, most of us (not counting the gadget enthusiasts) use a smart phone for a set of common applications that we are all aware of. And all those applications are available on this phone because it is Android KitKat and gives access to awesome Google products. I dont play games on phone so I am not worried about the power of the processor. But for these common applications, the phone runs really smooth! 
I feel I am carrying an evolved gadget! 
 
I dont need a 10mp camera, so I am happy with the shots Moto G cam gives for 5mp. Obviously it cant match upto iPhone or many other premium phones but I don't feel handicapped or I am missing a moment...this camera manages to capture all those moments. 
 
Plus there is water resistance too...its not waterproof, but will not die in a slight drizzle.

However Flipkart was nice enough to announce that the phones will be available again at noon and I waited and refreshed the page non-stop starting at 11:55 to make sure I don't miss out. 
I chose in-a-day delivery and had the phone in my hands next day afternoon. It looks every inch as awesome as the reviews tell it to be. I read somewhere that the phone is not very good to look at (compared to Samsungs and IPhones) .. Not True. I own a samsung and it looks like crap next to this phone. 
Positives : 
a) Battery life is really really good. I have been playing temple run , stick cricket and browsing the internet non-stop on the new phone over the weekend. I have had to charge it once (on Friday night) and the battery was down to 25% on monday morning. Not bad at all. 
b) Display is really crisp and clear. 
c) Android 4.3 is much better than the previous versions and the update to 4.4 will happen very soon. 
 
Cons: 
Camera is not really the best. Display comes out good, but the focus features leaves a lot to be desired. Its simple, sure, but the camera is a bit of a let down. But, for sure, it is good for the price. For a better camera you will have to buy over 20k phone.Awesome... Good value for money....I bought this phone 3 weeks back. Its giving a very good performance. I am highly satisfied with it. Earlier, I was planning to go for Note 3, which costs around 3.5 times higher. Now I am happy with my decision to go with Moto G (16 GB). No need to waste money for high phones like Note 3. I am very much satisfied with it. 
 
There are lots and lots of pros for this product. That's why I will not be writing about it. I just wanted to share some cons. 
 
Cons: 
1) Sometimes screen does not respond while charging. I need to swipe 2-3 times to open the lock screen. But this is also very rare. Once out of every 20-30 swipes. 
 
2) Charger has two PINs making it difficult to hold on any plug points resulting in spark. So better be careful. To overcome this, I bought multi-point plug that holds the charger PINs firmly. So, now no more loose connections. 
 
Other than the above two cons, everything is absolutely fine. 
 
So guys if you are searching for a good smart phone at reasonable price, don't think, just go for it.

the box does not contain the wall mount charger or any headphone. it only has a USB cable which you can use to charge from your laptop or PC. however you can get a wall mount charger easily. there is no dedicated navigation key and you get the navigation key on the screen itself (i personally dont like that unless you use 5 inch screen)

.........................................but the bottom line is this is the best phone under 18k price range...so go for it...n njoy...my rating 4.5/5KitKat tastes really sweet.My Moto G Review &ndash; 1 month on 
1. Design &amp; Build 
- A tough rugged phone. Build quality is amazing which gives a good feel holding. 
2. Display is pretty awesome. 
A 720p display at 4.5-inches works just fine. Moto G has a pixel density (PPI) at 329ppi to 326ppi on the iPhone. Moto G is every bit as impressive as the Retina Display. Browsing the web, looking at photos, watching videos is an excellent experience on it. 
3. KitKat tastes really sweet 
 Pure android experience on a budget phone. It exceptionally smooth and looks professional. 
4. The Camera is not that awesome, however it won&rsquo;t let you down 
a. Outdoors with or without HDR on , pics look great 
b. Slow Motion camera provides great videos with good quality 
5. Battery life &ndash; The best part of the phone	 
1.	With Wi-Fi connected, facebook logged in, synced my goggle account , battery came up to 1Day 18hrs 39mins 29sec and still 2 % battery was left. 
2.	Without Wi-Fi, mobile networks connected, no activity on the device and device screen turned off, battery did not even reduce 1 % even after 8hrs. 
What you won&rsquo;t get 
1.	NFC (near field communication) , believe me you are not going to use it even if you get it. 
2.	Expandable memory option 
3.	It does not give a notification when you connect a Headset 
4.	Always use only a compatible charger as the screen becomes un-responsive while charging 
 
A few recommendations: 
-	With USB OTG option available on Moto G, you won&rsquo;t feel lack of expandable memory 
Finally, 
Googlerola is a good Smartphone with an outrageously low price and is the perfect combination to deliver Android to billions of people worldwide. 
-	As Flipkart says, An Exceptional phone at a exceptional price.Moto G ( Dual SIM ).Hi, i have using moto G since last 2 months and facing problem of call connectivity though i got replacement of moto g with same new handset moto g from flipkart due to issue in call connectivity. I wish that flipkart and vendor will replace the handset of anyother comapnt if they are not interested in refunding the money.Great phone but with some glitches....I wanted to buy this phone on the launching day because of the overwhelmingly positive, pre-launch reviews and feedbacks but could not grab it as it went out of stock in a few minutes. Later, I thought of waiting for sometime to read candid, ground level reviews from the actual buyers. Although I was unhappy with the limitations like lack of memory slot and un-detachable battery yet I was impressed with the positive feedbacks and user reviews spread all over the web and other media after launch. After considerable amount of research, I found that this so called &ldquo;economic yet feature rich&rdquo; phone beats lot of other phones with price equal to Moto-G or 7 to 8K higher price phones e.g. Galaxy Grand Neo. Being a Google device was the cherry on the cake. So finally, I decided to order this highly reputed phone (16 GB version). As usual, Flipkart did what it is best at......delivering at lightning speed i.e. within less than 48 hrs from the order placement. I think Flipkart is unbeatable at this front so far. 
 
Now, coming to my own firsthand experience with Moto-G. I just received it today and haven't explored much of the features but listing some initial observations below:- 
Pros: 
1. Though its just 4.5&quot;, it looks big which means you can flaunt it among your peers who carry Galaxy 
S3/S4 and still remain in the limelight. 
2. Display quality is good and touch is smooth. 
3. Pictures are of superior quality. 
4. Built-in FM app which is not usually available with big phones these days e.g. Galaxy S4. 
5. Most of the high end phones do not support Dual SIM whereas Moto-G does which is value addition. 
6. So far performance looks good. Will post updates, if there are any significant changes. 
 
Cons: 
(These are some disappointing things that I could not find or missed to see in reviews before purchase and can impact your decision of buying this, so read carefully&hellip;) 
1. Though smaller in size but it is heavier than Galaxy S4/Grand Duos etc. 
2. No data cable included in the box for data transfer. 
3. Earphones provided are cheap and hard, you expect a better and softer earphone for a 14K worth phone from Google. 
4. Earphones do not fit fully in the earphone jack, this causes FM app to continuously popping with the message &quot;Insert earphones&quot;. (Looks like a defect) 
5. The phone can not show/use the contacts from SIM phonebooks straight, you need to extract them first (even a Rs. 1500/- phone can do this easily, not sure if there is a legitimate reason behind this) 
6. No in-built app for Facebook. 
7. White coloured earphones and charger do not match with a black coloured phone. 
8. No physical Home key button. 
9. Return key is placed on the left side instead of usual right. 
 
Having said that, I would not say that this is a bad deal as you are enjoying business class seat for an economy ticket but surely there are some glitches that could have been avoided. Will be exploring this highly reputed gadget further and post any future findings. 
 
Thanks,

I bought my Moto G 16 GB on the date of release in the afternoon. I have been using Apple iPhone 4s previously but wanted another secondary phone. Very happy with the reviews and specs I went in for the Moto G with high expectations being a Google Product. I had an awesome experience using this device but recently when i upgraded to Kitkat the phone started misbehaving. Sometimes when on call, it would suddenly disconnect loose connectivity and sometimes even the screen would go blank. Having bot this handset from flipkart I was not worried, asked for a replacement and got it on 3-3-2014 within 2 days of asking for it. The new Moto G runs Kitkat 4.4.2 out of the box, and seems to run smoothly till now (12 hours on this new replaced fone). What disappoints me is that when i saw the launch day offers I was kind of happy to see the 2 offers, 1. Rs. 1000/- off on clothing &amp; 2. Rs. 501/- off on e-books. I was pretty sure that there was no star on the offer/else where on the page. No where did I find any terms and conditions attached and I double checked with that. I was waiting until date for these offers to be available to me so that I could avail them. Surprisingly when I got none I wrote to Flip k a r t. In response I got the following- Clothing Offer 1. Eligible customers shall be notified about the redemption of the offer via email by the 14th of Feb 2014 2. To redeem the offer customers will have to log in to their flipkart.com accounts (using the same email id used while purchasing Moto G)and the discount shall be automatically applied on purchase 3. Offer is valid only on all clothing items listed by WS Retail and can be redeemed between 14th Feb and 31st Mar. 4. Customer has to purchase clothing worth a minimum of Rs. 1001 in order to avail the Rs. 1000 discount. 5. Customers need to redeem the offer in one transaction. 6. A Moto G order that has been cancelled or refunded will not be eligible for this offer. ebooks Offer 1. Eligible customers shall be notified about the redemption of the offer via email by the 14th of Feb 2014 2. To redeem the offer customers will have to log in to their flipkart.com accounts (using the same email id used while purchasing Moto G)and the discount shall be automatically applied on purchase 3. Offer is valid only on all ebooks listed by WS Retail and can be redeemed between 14th Feb and 31st Mar. 4. Customer has to purchase ebooks worth a minimum of Rs. 501 in order to avail the Rs. 500 discount. 5. Customers need to redeem the offer in one transaction. A Moto G order that has been cancelled or refunded will not be eligible for this offer. Now with this I am completely disappointed with these guys. I have been a regular customer since the site was inaugurated and have been very loyal to them also in the past. But now i think its time to look for another good ecommerce site to depend on. PS. In the past so many years Ive been using Flipkart this is the first time I have asked for a replacement and Flipkart gave it without any non-sense. I appreciate this. Thanks...Review after a months use.Let me not list the positives and negatives that has been covered by other buyers. Here a few points that could help make you decide whether you want to buy or not 
 
1. Battery life is surprisingly good compared to Samsung models(I owned one). Comfortably lasts over a day. 
2. Look and feel - Premium and understated - I regret going for the lime yellow flip case. I suggest going for the black one. But the best option is to avoid the flipcase if you are careful with the phone. I don't think it can survive a couple of falls on a hard floor. 
3. Outdoor visibility - Unlike what a few other reviewers said, I think it is poor. Maybe there is a workaround by changing the color theme or whatever, but certainly could have been better 
4. I have seen the &quot;absolutely no lag&quot; comment everywhere. But take this with a pinch of salt - it is not a gaming phone by any means. Definitely the fastest at this price range, maybe. 
5. I have had difficulties with the voice clarity during several calls. Initially I thought this was an issue at the other end. Some forums did suggest changing the sound settings, but I haven't seen much improvement. 
 
Overall I think this is great phone for the price and and ideal choice for someone who is not willing to risk 20k plus on a phone to use for the next 2-3 years. I was planning to buy the Nexus 5, but I am glad I saved some money and even happier that I can walk around with this phone not worrying that I will accidentally drop break a 30k phone. 3 of my friends have ordered this after checking out mine.

There was a time when people wanted phones to be smaller and one brand introduced a smaller phone with tagline ''Small is the new Big&quot;. After that time changed and people wanted Bigger phones almost touching the screen size of netbooks. But there are still people who want their phone to be sized moderately. Network signal reception is quite good and call quality is pretty clear. 
Battery backup is a huge plus point. I am a moderate phone user with moderate amount of call, game, audio and surfing habits and I used to charge my old android everyday. Now I can't recall whether I charge MotoG every alternate day or less frequently. 
 
Now Cons: 1. The supplied headphone with Mic is not which should be supplied with THIS handset even to keep the price low. 
2. It's not a Con as per the price of the phone, but a better camera could be given with this phone. But again the existing camera is not at all bad.

Maxed out features + Amazing built quality + Awesome looks (design) + reliability (Brand) + low price = Moto G 
 
first things first, i never planned on buy this phone... it was more of an impulsive buy. 
 
one fine day i was just surfing flipkart and i saw this offer saying &quot;10% cash back&quot;.... without any second thought i just booked this phone.. the phone arrived at my door steps the very next day. as soon as i had the phone in my hand i fell in love with the phone. 
Design wise this phone looks very similar to iphone, in-fact many of my friends thought that i bought an iphone...... as you can see in the pics the phone has no button or logo in the front.... nowadays most of the smartphones will have couple of buttons and the company name or logo imprinted in the front. But here, button less front makes the phone look very sleek and mirror like. 
 
Also the phone has good weight (heavy)... when you hold the phone the weight of the phone feels very nice, it wont feel like you are holding a cheep lightweight phone. 
 
The phone screen in 4.5''... its perfect size as a 5'' screen phone looks too broad, specially in small hands, having said that i have very big hands and Moto G looks very fitting (perfect) in my hands. 
 
Now most impotent topic &quot;Battery&quot;- 
 
many people are complaining about the battery life of this phone. 
So here are some tips which will improve your Moto G battery life by as much as 26 to 33% (depending on how you use your phone). 
 
Nowadays almost all Social apps use GPS feature of your phone, some popular example are Facebook, instagram, Wechat etc. you have to manually stop this feature from your mobile settings. You might not know this but 1 minute worth of GPS battery use is equal to 6.5 minute of watching movie on you mobile and full volume turned on (mobile speakers). Only turn GPS on when you really require it. stay away from apps like Wechat and near chat which require constant gps positioning. 
Some apps run in the background 24/7 (eg- anti-virus software etc) which can also drain your battery. 
 
After buying a New Moto G you have to discharge the battery completely at-lest 2 times... the second time when you are charging the battery charge it for a minimum of 6 hours.. after 3 1/2 hours the phone will say that the battery is fully charged but let the phone charge for 3 more hours. If you do this, you will see a big improvement in you battery life..... But do not overcharge it every time, this tip is only for first 2 charges (overcharging your battery every time will harm your battery). 
 
Charge your battery as less as possible (charge your battery only once a day).. the lesser you charge your battery the longer the battery will survive. 
 
I charge my battery once every 32 hours. (after full charging my battery it takes on avg 32 hours for my battery to reach 19%) after that i charge it again. 
 
Thanks to these Tips my battery easily gives me 32 to 34 hours of juice. 
On avg i listen 2 to 3 hours of music every day, 2 hours of 3G Browsing, around 40 min of facebooking, constant whats app chatting throughout the day and everyday i have to call my gf for 1 hour minimum ;) Even after all this i get an avg life of 32 hours.NICE MOBILE EVER SEEN......... When you switch on the phone for first time, an awesome view of Moto world is displayed and the brilliant display comes to life. The OS is pretty stock and doesn't come with any bloatwares except Moto's 2 essential apps. If you're a past user of Samsung , Sony phones then you'll definitely miss some features like deleting multiple messages, multiple contacts at same time, removing homescreens or even the Google search bar, but don't worry. This same software is customised by Samsung / Sony like Touchwiz etc which adds some more features like i said above and distinguishes it from other manufacturers. But you can always download apps from android store which can replace the missing features. Coming to screen, its vibrant and brightness is more than enough to read on sunlight (Max brightness is too much). The glass although fingerprint magnet and smudges isn't a big issue. Just swipe a cloth and its gone. Battery backup is decent too, you can easily survive 12 hrs with 75% usage all the time. The Camera takes decent quality pics but nowhere near to Nokia / Sony at that price. Flash provided is letdown and doesn't help much while taking indoor photos as well as night photos. Still it makes up for it by providing near lag free experience ( i wont say ZERO lag ), smooth UI, battery performance, Screen quality, signal reception and call quality, loud speakers, front facing camera, notification led, stock android experience, nearly 200-300 Mb Ram is unused for apps, powerful snapdragon 400 cpu and adreno 305 gpu etc. So guys, it maybe the best phone out there which beats other high end phones at price:performance ratio at 14k right now, so grab it before it gets out of stock again and enjoy near Stock Experience :)GREAT PHONE! No doubt that flipkart delivery is the best so I got the phone within 2 days of placing the order. 
 
Pros : 
The device is beautiful, unlike samsung (where you can feel the cheap plastic it is made up of) this device has a premium look and feel. 
 
The Corning gorilla display is smooth and scratch free, unless you rub sand on it :P 
 
It has one of the best speakers among all the mainstream phones...loud and clear. And the sound it produces is not squeaky. 
 
I won't get into technical information about the processor cuz you can look it up anywhere on the internet or in the specifications. One thing I would like to mention is that there is no lag...no matter what. This phone outperforms all the Sony phones I had (Xperia Ray, X10 , ION and S). 
 
The Battery is good and I have to recharge it once a day...I'm always on 3G network, play games( Candy Crush, Subway Surfer, Little Empire and a few more) at least 3 hours a day...some internet browsing and a lot of calls. 
 
And if you accidentally drop it in water, there are very good chances that the phone would not be damaged. Check this out : www.youtube.com/watch?v=IVaTKG5q4YI 
 
Cons : 
The camera is of 5 Megapixel, but that too is not bad. Many would go for phones looking at the camera quality and the mega pixels...a suggestion, just check out the camera of the device you are planning to buy for the same price and then compare it with Moto G. There would be phones available with 8MP camera for the same price but the performance of those phones will not stand a chance against Moto. 
 
Non-expandable storage is a let down but you can get a 16 GB version and for extra storage you can get a OTG USB. 
 
Also, for those who crib about not being able to set custom ringtones in this phone...just get any file explorer from Google Play and drop any song/ringtone of your choice in the Ringtone folder. Now you will be able to set it as your custom ringtone. 
 
There is a lot more about this phone, and the conclusion will always be that you can't get a better phone for this price.Simply Awesome ///.I tried washing off holi colours and the colours went in... LOOKS 
This phone looks way Better than it does in the photos. It looks much thinner in real than in the photos of Flipkart and it is also very good to feel on hands. Please avoid those colourful back covers that are sold as accessories in Flipkart. 
 
PERFORMANCE 
Within a couple of hours of delivery I installed a few high end games like GT Racing, F&amp;F 6, Asphalt 8 and I was really surprised to see all the above games were running without any lag. Amazing. 
 
BATTERY LIFE 
Even playing lot of games the battery lasted for a full day. With normal usage it is lasting for 1.5 days. Thats great. 
 
LOUDSPEAKER 
It is very loud that you could hear the ringtones from anywhere in the house. But the quality is not upto the mark. But it was way louder than I expected. 
 
But This Phone did not meet the following which I expected 
 
- Camera is poor. In low Lighting it is very poor. 
- There is no custom equalizer in Audio Settings. Only 5 default options available

Moto G is really a star of its kind.. Many of my colleagues are interested in getting one. 
Regarding the review, i don't wanna talk about the specs, pros and cons.. I'm using it for 5 days and i didn't find any issue until now.. I'd like to give some feedback though.. 
 
1) The charger and ear phones suck!! You better buy new ones. To cut costs, Motorola dropped the charger and headset and provided a data cable(For US and Europe). The Indian market won't consider buying a phone if we don't get them. So they removed the data cable and added basic charger and ear phones.. Obviously crappy ones.. 
 
2) I got 4.3 Jelly Bean version (mine is manufactured in Nov 2013). My friend ordered recently and got a 4.4.2 Kitkat version out-of-box(manufactured in February). There were some issues in some phones with Kitkat version. The system version of Kitkat is 171.44.31. Motorola aired an update 174.44.1 to resolve those issues which is out in Europe and US..Yet to air in India.. So i prefer not to upgrade to Kitkat until India gets the 174 update 
 
3) Camera is decent but to get the best out of it, always enable the HDR 
 
4) The Network priority settings is a tricky and crucial one if you are using 2 sims(one for data and one for calls). You'll face call drops and your callers may get busy tone if you select the wrong one. So check that one carefully 
 
5) If you have 2 step protection enabled in your Gmail account, you'll face hard time in setting the device. Your actual Gmail password won't work while synchronizing the device with your gmail account. You have to create a new password for devices 
 
Hope this helps..Moto Great!.Primarily, I want the phone to do what it is intended for i.e. telephony. I use the phone to stay on top of my mails, news and a bit of social networking. I 'm not in to high end gaming on mobile phones. I'll be covering how this phone suits my requirements rather than stressing again on the specs. 
 
What I was looking for in a phone:- 
 
1. Lag free experience- The Moto G delivers a smooth experience, thanks to the minimalist OS, without any bloatware (My earlier phone was Xperia Mini Pro and the bloatware made the OS to lag). 
 
2. Good battery backup- The 2070 mAh easily lasts through the day with continuous data use (2G/ 3G), sufficient calls and a good amount of web surfing. 
 
3. Excellent screen- One of the best in the business. 
 
4. Robust build- I prefer matte textured phones and the rubberised back offers excellent grip. 
 
5. Telephony- The call quality is excellent and it latches on to the networks well. 
 
Cons- 
1. The battery is non removable. 
2. Service network is not reputed, though not verified. 
3. Accessories are of mediocre quality. 
4. Lack of expandable storage. 
 
Overall, this is an excellent device for the price and one of the best buys in this price bracket.

I got this for my Dad who is using a smart phone for the first time. 
 
For him, it was a big upgrade technologically from a simple Nokia C2-01. MOTO G was a very handy for him. Most of the actions can be done with one hand only.. owing to its 4.5&quot; screen size. Nice display and good sound. Can be easily carried unlike huge phones by samsung or a nexus 5. 
 
This phone has got nice specs (except for the 1 GB RAM which could have been a 2 GB). So far, neither my Dad nor me have faced any real issues with this set. The only glitch, if I would say so, is the wi-fi. The websites do not load at times and I need to switch off and then switch on the Wi-Fi from the settings menu of the phone. After toggling wi-fi, the websites work fine. This is not always, but at times. 
 
Apart from the toggling wi-fi thing, there isnt any issues till now. But then my Dad is not exploiting the phone in a way we guys do.... Overall a nice experience for a person who have had not prior exposure to smart phone / touch screen phones. 
 
Also, the &quot;CastScreen&quot; option does not work. This is used to share screen on your Smart TV. But after going through some forums on internet, one can deduce that this feature is not supported by MOTO G, though it has an option of &quot;Cast Screen&quot; available. 
 
Overall bad points - 
1) 1 GB RAM 
2) WiFi gets disconnected and need to be toggled on / off. 
3) Takes 3-4 hrs to get fully charged from 15% battery to 100%. 
4) Cast Screen (Screen sharing with Smart TV) option is not working. 
 
Sound - OK 
Camera - OK. A 5 mp could have been a bit more 
Processing - OK 
Look &amp; Feel - OK

I just hope its not a kind of planned way of extracting money.

2. Look wise its not that great but hey hold on its much better than what Samsung and other companies give out more on that price range. Looks are subjective to time but the what matters is the performance. 
3. I understand that the camera is a big let down in Moto G but hey if you are so much into clicking spend a odd 5 -6 K and get a point and shoot for yourself. 
4. Its good to hold. Battery is good. Performance is good. What else are you thinking. You wont get a better phone in this price range. Go for it.

Coming to the mobile, it has been 20 days since I am using this mobile and it is working smooth and I even find the looks very appealing. I have the 16gb version so no issues with the storage capacity but I do carry my otg (On-The-Go) wire along with a pen drive where i have stored my songs and movies. 
 
 Camera- Well the camera is fine not that bad after all. It will give you decent pictures plus there are many apps on playstore that would enhance your picture quality (I personally use Camera Zoom FX). 
 
Battery Life(18 to 20 hours when completely charged)- I have a 3g connection and I also use my phone to play games (not graphic intensive one's though), listen to music and watch some serials (occasionally). I charge my phone when it's battery drops below 5%. 
 
Now coming to the cons, well the battery is not removable and the kitkat version have some bugs but they will get fixed once they give us new updates( finger crossed). I have experienced only one bug so far, sometimes my dial pad does not appear but for that I don't have to reboot my phone it appears when i click the back button. 
 
Overall, it is a very good phone in it's range and I am satisfied with it's performance till now.COOLEST thing in the under-20K pool.This is my first android phone. did a lot of research before finally coming up with the choice.So far it has been everything i wanted it to be if not more. Pros:-

Updates-Comes now with kitkat already installed and since Motorola was owned by Google when this phone was released i'am sure it will get the OS updates as and when they release. 
 
Speed :-The quad core processor is a beast, and the 1GB ram is more than sufficient for any app developed in the foreseeable future. 
 
Battery-1 day easily even if you're a heavy user. 
 
Cons: 
Camera-Camera is the real downfall of this phone.The back camera being only a 5mp camera,takes decent pics in average to good light conditions but the quality is pathetic in low light conditions. 
 
No NFC,4G LTE:-But hey,did you really expect them when you're looking for a mid range phone.And This being targeted for India and developing countries where 4G isn't really the norm,it won't matter much. 
 
No expandable memory slot:-oh well it would have been nice to see an expandable memory slot but then again 16 gb is ample storage for a light to moderate user.

About the phone: 
&quot;The best budget-phone&quot; - this statement is absolutely right. 
I've been running a lot of tests on my Moto G. 
Just on stock firmware, it has beaten Galaxy Grand 2. 
I got 16942 on AnTuTu running stock Kitkat 4.4.2. 
And after some rooting and tweaking it at advanced level, I'm getting 21000 AnTuTu score. *jawdrop* right? 
 
The camera of the phone is really fine. The image quality is stunning. 
I loved that Moto G has introduced SlowMotion Video Capture and HDR mode in the default camera app which works flawlessly. The flash of the phone is very powerful. Being powerful doesn't make it great but what makes it great is that the images captured using that flash does not get high-contrast-ed(in layman language.) ;) 
 
The sound quality of the phone, I must say, is the best you can get in such price range and I mean it. 
 
The earphones provided with the handset are not in-ear and not quite good-looking also. But they perform really well. I've been using these for 2 hours straight and I'm not feeling achy. 
The sound quality of the earphones is really nice. The highs are OK. The ratio of treble and bass, according to me, is very finely tuned by Motorola. 
 
I can't say anything about battery backup because I've just received it.

Calling &amp; messaging from call logs. In Moto G it involves more navigation 
Even though Crop option for Pic has come with KitKat update, we cant still move pictures across folders 
Agreed, we have apps for all this but i feel all this should come with the stock version 
 
Touch is absolutely great . The phone has a great look. Just a gentle wipe from soft cloth &amp; it will look brand new.
