1. Camera Error 
2. Battery Backup.

2-3 hrs 2G calls.

Overall experience till now is fantastic. It works smoothly, never had any lag or sudden shut downs. However the battery as mentioned, does not perform upto the mark. With 3G data on my phone ends up just a more than 12 hours. However battery performs better with 3G turned off and wifi being used. Talk time is decent. The battery problem may be a general one or it may also be possible that my piece is the only one having some problem.

Moreover, what else you can expect from a 15k phone, it pretty much meets your expectation.A Reasonable Smart Phone - Not Budget Phone.I have purchased the 16 GB variant and Moto G matches its advertisement. I think Samsung, Nokia and iPhone all these big players should learn one or two things from Motorola on how to produce reasonable smart phones within this range especially for a country like India. It is not having the LTE or NFC but in India, do we use them? Camera is where I think it has the big draw back compared to Nokia but comparable to Samsung in that department. Low lighting photography is not strong for any phone except probably few high end Nokia phones. I got full 18 hours battery life with 3G and Bluetooth on and Moderate usage. Another area is the lack of expandable memory but 16 GB might be good enough for most of it. Still it is a drawback. 
Screen is awesome with corning glass 3. Touch buttery smooth. Reading text is pleasure. Lag you may not notice at all. Has stock Jellybean with KitKat updates coming in a week. Now since it is stock Jelly bean no fancy enhancements like Samsung. Bare minimum notifications panel. No multitasking. 
Phone audio good with or without ear phones. You tube videos rendering very good. 
Overall a good buy in that price range. I think Motorola before signing/selling off did a splendid job in producing this phone. 
Don't think it as a budget phone. It is a smart phone in terms of looks, functionality and budget. And most importantly this phone seems to be designed keeping the majority of the Indian consumers who would like to own a smart phone at a reasonable price.All in one pretty good.I am using he phone for a month now.

Hello Moto.......Amazing features and performance at this price range.Flipkart delivered this phone in just three days and two days earlier than the expected date. I did a lot of research about this, read a lot of reviews here on Flipkart. I don't see why people give it a single star rating because of issue with the delivery and other issues not related to phone's performance, it misleads others and affects the overall rating. 
 
My requirements while buying a new phone were: 
1. A snappy phone with atleast 1.2Ghz Processor and can handle the usual social networking apps Fb, twitter, instagram, etc with ease 
2. Ease of access to basic features such as Calls, SMS's 
3. Decent Camera 
4. Good Battery life 
 
I feel Moto G has delivered all of these. The phone is lightening fast to operate. Apps open in blink of an eye. Other features like Assist comes very handy. Although Camera is basic, it was never important for me so I'm more than satisfied with what it has. Also, at a price of 14k this phone delivers performance more than I had expected. Getting good battery life out of this device needs a bit of fiddling around. You cant expect it to last for whole day if you have WiFi, 3G, GPS and full brightness on all the time. I'm used to disabling things which I do not need so I could squeeze around 12hrs. Although I'd like to point out that it takes around 3hrs to charge fully (0% to 100%) which is too much time in my opinion. 
 
For others who say things like &quot;It doesn't have this and that&quot; should rather focus on what the phone has and complain if that feature is not performing as its advertised. It misleads people like me who like to keep no stone unturned before buying something.The Best Mobile.Hey Guys,

2. Camera quality has disappointed me. Picture quality is no doubt good but honestly auto focus doesn't work correctly sometimes specially when you try to focus at any point in very close. It doesn't have any TAP TO FOCUS facility. 
3. You can use the front camera for selfies, video call through Hangout, Skype, etc, etc but you cannot make video calls through 3G network. That means video calls doesn't supported. 
4. Battery is non-removable. 
5. No USB cable is provided.Moto G is a Fantastic Phone!!!.Fantastic price, lovely design, good performance, vibrant display, good camera and sound, Moto Migrate makes set up easy, 50GB free Google Drive storage, great customising options, Android 4.4 
 
In terms of everyday tasks, the Moto G performed without any issues - it was responsive, fast and showed no signs of lag. We experienced a bit of sluggishness when I played Despicable Me and switched between cameras, but it was nothing to be too concerned about and other games such as Candy Crush were responded to with no problems. 
 
If you're looking for a shortcoming, the lack of support for microSD is a disappointment and there's no 4G on offer - not that that will be a huge concern for those looking to save money. 
 
The Moto G's best asset is its price - it is an affordable smartphone and I think it delivers everything it promises - except perhaps the battery life. At no point did I feel I had compromised on style, quality or experience and with the upgrade to Android 4.4 KitKat, I suspect you will be even more than happy to use this device on a daily basis, as I have been.Moto G - Finally Placed the order.Finally the phone delivery shows a timeline of 2-3 Business days and latched the opportunity to quickly order the same.

That's an impressive system indeed.

The only surprise so far was that the phone could not be immediately put To use (no mobile network) since the phone uses a MICRO SIM, hence to put it to use I had to tether it with my other device. 
 
So far the build quality is good, not too many preloaded apps barring few basic ones, if they were it would save alot (time/effort) initially and start having a great experience, to continue on the excitement build till date. 
 
Overall great service by Flipkart, my view on them changed with this delivery and the device has been delivering on the front since so many people have vouched for it and it seems a value for money for the price paid.

just guys dont waste ur money in finding any other mob in these range just blindly go for it.................Value for money.Well, this is the best phone in the price range..used it for almost one month...enjoying the experience....no lag, good camera in day light, good battery life on basic use, good voice clearity, good volume of loudspeakers and best thing is its stunning look and display quality... 
 
However, there are some issues with phone worth mentioning..it takes more than 3 hours to get battery fully charged with the charger provided..this is really annoying....if we use data cable for charging, it may take 4/5 hours....with data cable if we surf net on 3g or play games, battery actually starts discharging despite being connected to data cable. 
 
I havent experienced any network issues...During first week i faced problems of battery being discharged very fast..but i noticed that GPS was on, wifi was on, brightness was set at maximum, syn was always on and my fon was always connected to 3g network. After optimisation of settings, battery now lasts 15-16 hours with 15-20 mins of gaming, 40-60 mins of calls, 1-2 hours of net surfing, chatting on whatsapp intermittantly for whole day, syn and gps being disabled. The default setting prompts phone to back up all photos to google plus automatically which drains the battery fast..we can set it as 'back up only when connected to charger'. Similary some applications which claims to free RAM and make fon faster also drain battery faster (this is my experience, dont know whether this is happening to my fon only or not). With setting optimisation, i think battery lasts fairly longer. 
 
Overall it is a good phone...far better than galaxy grand which i was earlier usingBetter Than expected.When I was planning to buy mobile I was considering Gionee E5, karbon mobile(Forgot the model no, it was having 1gb ram) and moto G.

Overall an excellent choice for those who were able to order(5000 phones sold in under 15 minutes speaks for itself) and for those who couldn't, believe me, it's worth the wait.Best android phone!.Short review: The Moto G is the best phone this much (or even more) money can buy. Almost every single aspect of this phone is perfect. Its a no-brainer if you are looking for a new phone! 
 
Long review: 
A few key aspects of the phone. 
1. Design: Quite unique compared to most other phones, and curved back has a nice feel. Its comparatively small and can be used with a single hand which is a rarity considering the increasing size of phones today. 
2. Display: The display is very sharp and the colours look vivid. Its very bright and can be viewed outdoors in sunlight clearly. The screen uses Gorilla Glass which is smooth and has held up well so far. 
3. Battery: It is lasts for at least a day with lot of usage, and even 2-3 days with light usage. 
4. Performance: Simply amazing. All day to day tasks can be done quickly. Apps open quickly, multitasking is no problem and there is little to no lag as it runs stock android without any skins unlike other phones (Ex: Samsung, HTC..) 
5. Camera: The camera is average. The LED flash is very bright and helps in certain cases. The front camera is also average and is fine for video calling. 
6. Speakers: The loudspeaker is LOUD. The sound quality is just superb even at the maximum volume. The earpiece is clear. 
7. Quality: The overall build quality of the phone is great. It feels solid and well made. The back cover feels good and fits tightly without any gaps. The charger and headphones provided however are not of the same quality. 
 
The Moto G outperforms its competition and is great value for money. It works as well as a high end phone. 
 
Its not perfect, so here are the cons: 
1. The camera: Its very average and not for you if a good camera is important, but its still the best in its class. 
2. No official service centers 
3. No microSD expansion slot 
4. Non-removable battery 
 
Conclusion: 
It basically doesn't make sense for an average person to buy a more expensive phone. 
Highly recommend it. 
 
NOTE: I don't compare/mention the specifications because finally what matters is the user experience and not how many cores/megapixels etc. a phone has.

Already using Moto G since 2 days and the best part about motorola is... 
 
1. Pure android 4.4 kitkat (latest) version. (The Moto G is one of the few devices that has the latest Kitkat 4.4.2 OS which has voice support, an Immersive mode, synced messages, easier sharing, much faster multitasking and more) 
 
2. No user interface running over android (like touchwiz in Samsung). You will experience a pure android experience which was limited to high end mobiles like Google Nexus in India. 
 
3. Buttery smooth touch. 
 
4. Slow motion video recording (The 5 MP rear camera comes with an LED flash and video recording capabilities. It also has nifty features like burst mode, auto HDR, panorama and slow motion video to make capturing pictures and videos easier and more fun. The 1.3 MP front camera makes taking selfies simpler and adds a face to all your video chats.) 
 
5. Responsive screen. No lags. 
 
6. Moto migrate app available on google play (It is simple to transfer all data from your old Android phone, including call and text history, to the Moto G with the Motorola Migrate service that wirelessly updates everything to the device.) 
 
7. Quad core processor (The Quad Core Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 Processor is clocked at 1.2 GHz to make the interface fluid to touch and lag-free to browse through. Moreover, the device has 1 GB RAM to support multitasking) 
 
8. Adreno graphics (Adreno Graphics 305 to let you play graphic-heavy games with great detailing.) 
 
9. Dual Sim. 
 
10. 16 GB of internal storage for music, photos, videos, apps and docs, Moto G also comes with 50 GB of extra space on the Google Drive for two years to back up everything you don't want to lose. 
 
11. The phone has both 3G and Wi-Fi support for fast browsing speeds which will keep you connected. Transfer media or files via Bluetooth or use the microUSB port to link up to your PC. (You can connect your pendrive using an OTG cable) 
 
12. Sensors (The proximity sensor turns off the display when you are on a call to ensure that you don't accidentally hang up, the accelerometer controls the orientation and helps with motion gaming, the ambient light sensor ensures that the screen brightness is optimal for reading and the magnetometer ensures that the maps always show the right directions. The phone also comes with hall effect sensor.) 
 
13. 2070 mAh Li-Ion battery that is built into the body of the device, the Moto G gives you up to 24 hours of mixed usage, ensuring that you stay connected at all times. (Battery not user detachable) 
 
14. Sharp HD display (The 4.5 inch edge-to-edge display comes with 1280*720p HD resolution and 329 ppi - every pixel is sharp, vivid and crystal clear. Day-to-day activities like watching videos, browsing through photos and reading text become a captivating experience.) 
 
15. Corning Gorilla Glass 3. 
 
16. Colouful motorola original flip cover, back cover and grip cover available ( You can give your Moto G a different look altogether everyday). 
 
17. Supports micro SIM. 
 
18. Weight - 140gms. 
 
19. Looks (Moto G may be cheap in price but looks as if you are holding a premium high end mobile)

Thank you very much.My respect in the family has gone up - Read the complete review to find out why.It may not have been accompanied by the flash and razzmatazz of a flagship phone launch, but the Motorola Moto G is still a huge deal, in both senses of the phrase. It's the first handset launched by Motorola in India since it was taken over by Google; and it costs just less than INR 15 k for an impressive specification. 
 
The 4.4.2 update brings a few changes. The phone dialer has been changed and you can now bring up contacts quickly via the number pad by simply entering any string of letters or numbers that appear in that contacts name or number. For example, typing 766 will bring up any contact with POO or MON in their names, or any contact whose number contains that string of numbers. You also get intelligent caller ID, with the phone searching for unknown numbers and providing you with information based on that search, so you have some idea who it is before you answer. 
 
Android 4.4 also supports the new version of Hangouts which combines your instant messaging and SMS apps into one, though you still need to switch between these two streams to keep track of all your conversations via both. 
And most of it can be found on the internet using this same phone. 
 
Delivery &ndash; 10 / 10 
Time to deliver 10 / 10 
Customer Delight &ndash; 10 / 10 
 
I bought 6 pieces of this little monster &amp; it was a gift for my dad, sister, friend, cousin. 
 
My respect in the family has gone up &ndash; not because of the phone (no doubt its cool) &ndash; but the timely delivery.My Moto G review.Reasons why you should buy this phone: 
1) Economical: Phones with this configuration are expensive. This one is not. 
2) Excellent screen resolution: ~326 ppi pixel density (hats off!). I mean it can be compared to big phones like Moto X and Nexus, even iPhone! 
3) Gorilla Glass 3: Trust me, you don't need a scratch guard or a screen guard because of this feature. Smooth yet strong. 
4) Smooth performance: Not single time did I face any issue with performance. It works like charm. I've got 3 HD and several other games and apps, around 200 songs and 4 movies right now in my phone and still no lags! Wow! 
5) Camera: Both main and secondary cameras are quite better... better in daylight or outdoors. Different editing functions allow you to edit or retouch your pics that means no need of photo editing apps. 
6) Storage space: 16 gb is good enough. But stay away from 8 gb variant if you store a lot of stuff in your phone. 
7) Android KitKat: What a system it is! Makes the phone crispier! 
8) Battery life: One week of use and batter life looks good. The phone works well for 12 hours with normal use and 8-10 hours with extensive use. Quite good! 
 
You may want to avoid this phone for these reasons: (They don't matter much though) 
1) Camera: Yeah it's one of the demerits. It works well only in good lighting conditions. Not in the ambient light. 
2) Restricted memory: Memory is restricted only up to 16 gb and no external memory cards slot. 
3) Other accessories: Earphones and charger provided. The charger is okay but earphones are ordinary... They could have provided a better pair. You will need to get your own anyways. No USB cable provided. 
4) Handling: The overall build and extra smooth screen has made the phone a little bit slippery. You will need a bumper case or flip case to protect the phone from falling down. 
 
Despite these Cons above, I'll rate the product 5* for it's performance, the looks and the screen! Good job Motorola and Google!Moto G the best.Now it has been few days using the phone. &quot;But guys i would say you can go for it,because you will not get such an awesome beast at these price&quot;!!!Phenomenal Value For Money.Actually .. I didn't get it right - Its much much more that value for money. 
 
You can go to any website and compare this phone to well know stalwarts of the smart phone industry - this phone will not only give them a run for their money, but beat some of them hands down. 
 
The phone has only two absolutely transparent drawbacks - Expandable Memory &amp; Camera Resolution. However at 16GB built in memory, and 5 Megapixel, I found the specs to be much more than enough for my phone usage. 
 
Other than the above mentioned 2 pointers, in case you are not a hardcore gamer looking for the next fastest processor in a phone, this phone's speed, smoothness and accuracy will definitely impress you - not to mention dual-sim facility and FM radio which is not available in any top end phone. 
 
Finally, the fact that made this phone an absolute winner for me, is the price at which this gem can be acquired. The next better phone will only be a little faster, but will cost you double for that speed.

Here are a few things which are worth mentioning: 
1. The qualcomm snapdragon 400 1.2GHz processor is just right especially for me since I do not game much, there is hardly any lag and multitasking is very smooth. 
2. The 720p 4.5 inch display is really crisp and you will notice that the colors are warmer on the Moto G as compared to theNexus. So sometimes you wont get a natural feel,but in my opinion it is very appealing. 
3. The overall design of the phone is compact and though it is a tad heavier than expected, the back cover gives a firm grip and the replaceable back cover makes it attractive. 
4. The 5MP Camera isnt really great,you can click a few great picture in bright light but in the dark it lets you down. 
5. Batter life is one thing which I was extremely happy about. The 2070mAh battery can easily fetch you a days worth of medium usage. Though I havent played games on it. I did use apps like QuizUp etc. 
6.And finally the pricing. This phone is the best budget phone and frankly I would say like many others have that this one is much better than many other smartphones under the 25k price mark. Pros:

Build quality is good. Feels Strong and sturdy. Screen is scratch and dust resistant. 
It is said to be waterproof but I haven't really tried. 
The phone feels good in the hand. Fits perfectly. Screen size is perfect(4.5 inches). Can be used with one hand unlike most high end Android phones. 
Supports OTG (Can connect a pendrive to it using a separately sold connector). 
User interface is smooth with no lag at all. 
Gaming experience is decent too 
Speakers are very good. With pretty loud and clear sound.

Cons: 
Camera. Average back and front cameras. You can't really expect more at that price. Although it does take slow motion videos.(They are really cool). 
KitKat is still buggy. Phone has restarted thrice since upgrading. Bug Fix should be out soon. 
Limited storage. 13GB of USB storage is enough for most people, but if you need more, Moto G does not provide it. However OTG is an option. 
 
Verdict: 
Buy it. There isn't a better way to use those 14000 bucks. The cheapest phone better than the Moto G is the Nexus 4. And that costs about Rs. 20000. That says a lot.This Device is worth every paisa(penny) / brilliant Flipkart service.So, I bought a google nexus 4 earlier which I gifted to my friend but I had used it and was hoping to get a device which will give me same smooth functioning like that but with less price. 
 
Then came Moto G - The under half an hour sell out, the bombardment of positive reviews and almost half the price of what Nexus 4 costed. I felt overwhelmed. The waiting time of 20 days was just haunting. Then the waiting time dropped to 6-7 days after 20th feb and I crossed my heart and hoped that it will arrive , sooner. 
 
you can not imagine the happiness one gets when even with the wait time of 6-7 days, you get a mail that your item has been shipped on the same day you ordered it. It was like Christmas or Diwali, if you like bursting crackers. 
 
I kept refreshing the tracking page every half an hour and with Fedex's Standard Overnight Delivery, Flipkart brought tears of happiness in my eyes the very next day. Kudos for that !! 
 
Now about the device: 
 
Smooth - This device is as smooth as mustard oil on the palm of your hand - think about it, feel the words. 
 
Design - This device has got acknowledements from my friends the very first day I took it to office (few people who did not already know about Moto G), the others who had read reviews admired the phone and its design. 
 
16 GB - I immediately tranferred all my music and videos from old phone(BB 9650) to this 
one and MX player and Rocket Music player brought oasis views and symphonies to my senses in no time. If you have an android phone already - Motorola app will help you in easily transferring your data. 
 
The 1GB Ram - Its ENOUGH. I won't deny that having 2 GB in nexus 4 was not a relief on the functioning part but I have been playing Minion Rush, Hill Climb Racing, Ingress on this device and the performance is brilliant(please note there is Rocket Music player pumping beats in the background as well). 
 
The 2 cameras: I will admit that 5MP is not the best but its not bad either. you want DPs, you have loads of editors on PLAY store to get the effects you like. I prefer Aviary. The secondary camera meets the purpose of video calls or a jugaadu mirror or a pixelled selfies generator. 
 
The Battery Door material: Please note the stuff used to make back of the phone is not cheap plastic. it looks great and that silver M of the moto adds to the killer looks. 
 
The HD screen: I played HD videos on this device and they worked just fine and looked awesome. I got a matte screen guard for it- which was a mistake as with AUTO brightness it gives a pixelleted version of HD. So you need to increase brightness and that drains battery a little faster. Though the screen is Gorilla glass 3 so no screen guard is needed, only a flip cover will do but as prevention is better than cure, do have something between your sticky fingers and that beauty of a screen. 
 
last but not the least: 
The Battery: As promised the moto battery has lived upto its expectations. I charged it the first day to a 100% and it took around 8 hours of regular app downlads on Wifi and 8 hours standby and then another 4 hours of game play to reach 20% at which point battery doctor turns red, which is pure awesome. 
 
I recommend this phone to those who do not wanna spend too much on a phone which satisfies all your smartphone needs.

Here are some pros and cons I experienced while using this mobile the past few days. 
Pros: 
1. Strong build with rubbery back. Its a pleasure to hold. Since the screen size is 4.5 inches, we can operate this with one hand and do not need both hands as in case of larger mobiles. 
2. Excellent Screen clarity for watching videos, photos, reading ebooks etc. Readability is good even when viewed outdoors under the hot sun 
3. Nice Processing speed, can run heavy apps/games without a glitch

Regarding the product:

Considering the demand and the kind of delivery they gave I give it a 5 star.Good Phone : But Watch Out for a few Problems.1) The charger didn't work out of the box. 
2) Signal reception on this phone is terrible. Calls drop abruptly. You get 3G signals if you are lucky. My earlier XOLO Q700 had no such problems. Forums on the internet say that this is a software problem post Kit Kat 4.4.2 upgrade. Well then I hope they roll out a patch soon. Else using this phone as a main business phone is unthinkable !! 
3) Screen gets garbled sometimes. Artifacts appear randomly. Even this has been reported on forums on the internet and I am keeping my fingers crossed that even this should be a software problem. Else I am doomed. 
4) The original flip-covers are atrociously high priced. I am not expecting a 70% discount like the early birds got. But still, buying a cover ( for a budget phone ) which is about 11% of the phone purchasing cost is something which the rational person in me doesn't quite agree fully !! 
 
However, I did and would still continue to root for this phone. The advanatages of this phone have been well documented in lots of reviews. But point no. 2 and 3 above are serious problems, because it affects the very basic functionality of the device - i.e. phone calls and rich display. However, if this is ironed out in an OTA update, this will no doubt be the best phone in India at that price level. 
 
Only if they solve those problems though....

Dual sim: 
 
People say dual sim phones are built in a poor quality like samsung dualsim android phones...but moto g is a best of alll 
 
i preferred all ma frnds to buy moto G more than 10 are bought that and using in SuccessfullyThe volkswagen beetle of the phone industry.Motorola has a rich legacy when it comes to making phones. It was the company which invented the cellphone and later came up with many revolutionary products which had a deep impact on the cellular industry. 
When Motorola made this phone it had a very clear concept in mind. It was not making just another phone to sell in the market. It was making a phone which would offer the best value for money. A phone which would provide the users a premium android experience at medium price. 
 
THE GOOD 
While making the Moto G, Motorola made the right decisions every time. To power the needs of an average user they packed it with a 1.2 Ghz processor. To make the phone look premium they borrowed some of its designs from the Moto X. They used a 4.5 inch 720p screen and then covered it with corning gorilla glass 3 so that the phone had the best display in its price range. They equipped the phone with a battery which would last you the entire day on moderate usage. They iced the cake with, a water resistant coating to protect the phone from occasional spillages and packed it with kitkat the latest offering from Google. 
 
THE BAD 
To cut costs they equipped the phone with a mediocre camera (5mp) which is good for taking the occasional snap to post on facebook and removed the SD-Card slot thus making the phone memory non-expandable. They also made the battery non-removable. 
 
THE VERDICT 
After using the phone for a month or so I have come to the conclusion that the phone offers the best value for money. It beats its competitors, in the same price range, by a long margin and can even compete with some of the flagships of samsung (s3), apple (iphone 4), and google (nexus 4) which are a generation old (all of them currently priced almost double of moto g). Moto G has a wide user base worldwide, hence you can always expect support for the phone. The back cover can be changed for a color or design of your choice, hence you wont get bored sporting the same color. To sum it all up I would like to say that it is not the best phone around, Motorola never made it with that intention. However, it is undoubtedly the best value for money phone. I am sure most critics and people who have used this phone would agree with that.!!!BEAST UNDER 20000!!!.I am using MOTO G 16 GB for 1 month!!

The Motorola Moto G is a compact phone with a screen-size of 4.5 inches. The phone easily snuggles into my palm and its rounded corners make it comfortable to hold and operate the phone. Its rubbery back with a matte finish not only gives it a handsome look, but also makes it non-slippery and scratch-resistant. The rear of the phone has a slight ergonomic curve. Moto G is a solid, no nonsense handset, it's not fancy but it's not ugly either, but also there was no lag in performing any function. Even 1080p videos played very smoothly on the Moto G. 
 Motorola being owned by Google (now LENOVO) we were hopeful that the handset would ship with the latest version of Android. The handset initially shipped with 4.3, but an update to the latest version, Android 4.4.2, has now been released. You should update your phone immediately if required. Undoubtedly, Motorola has re-entered the Indian market with a device that combines the right mix of features and price. This budget phone is value for money and makes to my recommendation. 1. Battery : WIth 3g on throughout, medium heavy gaming,calls, text etc etc; it comfy lasted for more than 24 hours (this is after i've already worked up its memory)

Smoothness of touch and working : AMAZING ! no lags,no delay...its absolutely real time, i mostly play online gaming, thus i hate any delay/lag in gaming. i felt like kissing the phone for its performance (i'm sure u guys would've read about snapdragon processors). Neither ipods nor even the iphone4s(last phone) could give me this experience. Trust me guys, with the earphones in- u'lll lose track of the time ! 
3. Call/Messaging : crystal clear sounds,excellent call clarity, big enough to fit in hands and smooth transformation of the keys for texting. Superb ! 
4. Camera : Good enough to meet the requirements of clarity,multiple shots,Probably the best choice in this range. No granulation even if you zoom in in ur pc. I can't ask for more than this 4m a fone in this range. Else buy a camera, it would be worth. 
 
I can go on and on, but i'd ask you guys to try ur hands on it 4m some mobile store and then compare it with Nexus4,Iphone4s/5,Samsung(except note3), Don't even think about Micro or any such other phone(they don't stand a chance for a budget phone). 
-Ves = (none till now !) 
1. Its not Note3 or HTC1 or iPhone5 ! cz if they can then they'll charge you even for holding the phone. MOtoG is inexpensive,gives them run for their money and ha 4.4KK android(u'll immediately upgrade it) 
2. Its not 7&quot; (only if size mattered in this case ;) cz that big a phone is for what i dunno-buy a tab people !) but its the best 'phone' that you can hold :) 
 
Additional stuff - waterproof, scratch proof, sturdy body and easy to hold and take pics(click anywhere on the screen, not on a particular area/button) 
 
Good if you guys have been thinking, it was worth the wait :) If your budget isThe best phone you can get..If you are looking for a decent android experience, i.e if you need an android phone that gives the true android experience and good battery life in the best budget range, then this is the phone you need to buy. 
I had a budget restriction of around 15,000 when buying a phone, after a lot of searching and waiting i was able to get my hands on moto g and i am completely satisfied with what i invested my money on. 
I loved the quality of build, the materials used are good, good battery life (any type of use, it lasts from the full charge in morning and around 20% to 30% in the evening), decent processing power and multi tasking for the phone of its price range. 
 
I will summarize it as 
Pros 
Good build quality - (Corning gorilla glass 3) 
Decent display - (although &gt;300ppi we can see some pixel upon really close observation) 
Good battery life - (i use it for games and keep it on mobile data all the time but with a full charge in the morning i get left with around 20-30% in the evening) 
Apps - the apps and games run good on moto g and i rarely get any lag on the phone, at such a price and the experience you have is top notch, 1gb ram does give a good experience. 
 
Cons 
of course they are not actually cons but certain limitations you need to trade off for the price 
5 MP camera, picture quality in daylight is good but i face some problems with focus and the images look too soft sometimes. 
No expendable SD card, you get around 13 GB on the 16 GB version which is quite enough but having a SD card can open you up to easy data transfer and other possibilities 
and Yes, somewhat a harsh ride to link it and use it with your lcd tv 
 
If you want an android phone within 15000 its the best phone you have got in the market.Moto G -Your Pocket-friendly Neighborhood.1. Looks = Sexy

4. Weight = Well well..as u r looking for a sexy one, the weight is proportionate too 
5. Trustworthy = Got the Kitkat after 3 days of purchasing it.. As Motorola promised! 
6. Battery = The 2070 mah battery (which is not removable by the user) is just too good. After using it heavily (net surfing, calling, movie) for 14 hours (almost in a stretch) the battery showed me that he had 24% of life still remains! This is really good! 
5. Camera = I am not even close to my satisfaction with the picture quality of the said 5 MP rear camera (though the front camera is somehow good enough!). There is lack of options in the setting of the camera too 
6. Accessories = Everything is there except an USB cord.. I think it should have been included in the box 
7. Flipkart = Placed my order at 12:06 AM on 6th February (the Moto G launch day in India) and can u believe it! I got my Moto G 16 GB at 6:30 PM on 8th February! Amazing service! 
 
In short = You can not get or even expect to get anything close to Moto G at this price (Do not forget to include the name of Motorola in your budget!)!Good product for it's price.Pros:

I will update this as much as I can with my experience with the phone.Go for it. Read this review to know why..First of all, excellent service from Flipkart. Quick dispatch and swift delivery. They took only two and a half business days to deilver it to my location which is 600 km away from Bangalore. Since I ordered both Moto G and Motorola Flip Cover for Moto G (Black) together, they were put in one single pack and packing was satisfactory. 
 
When I unboxed the phone and took it out and held it up in my hands, I felt I made a good decision in buying it. Excellent build quality and pleasant grip. And when I switched the phone on and began using it, I was relieved to find that the phone had everything that was promised. Great display quality - be it images, video or text, the display quality is simply awesome. Smooth touch response and a host of features. 
 
About the camera: Though the phone has been much criticized for its camera quality, I found that it took good pictures under optimum lighting conditions. Of course, indoor shots suffered a bit, but it performs really well outdoors or where there is good light. You can Google for Moto G's camera samples and believe me, you won't be disappointed. 
 
About the storage: The 16 GB variant gives you about 12.5 GB free space. For me that's more than sufficient because I never stuff my phones with loads of media files. That said, 12.5 GB would be a lot of digital storage space for most of us. So, it hardly makes any difference that Moto G has no expandable storage. 
 
I ordered Motorola's flip cover (cost about Rs. 1200) along with Moto G. The cover is premium quality and complements Moto G really well. Don't go for some cheap flip cover. You are buying a great phone that saves you enough money. It deserves a good quality flip cover. Of course, the phone comes with Corning Gorilla Glass which means you don't have to worry about screen scratches but a good cover will protect the rest of it's body and keep the dust away. 
 
UPDATE (04 May, 2014 - 12 days of use): 
 
Moto G tends to lose Internet connectivity at times. I read somewhere that Motorola is aware of this issue and is working out a fix. But that's no serious issue to me as it has not caused any major inconvenience even though I use Internet a lot. 
 
I found that my phone's touch response suffered when I connected my to wall charger. After a few minutes of charging process and especially when the battery reached 90% to 100% charge level, the phone tends to become rather unresponsive to touch. Upon some research, I realized that this was a common issue with some capacitive touch screen devices including many laptops and that the issue was usually caused by a faulty charger. 
 
I contacted Flipkart about this issue, and they promptly refunded Rs.1000 (the credit appeared in my Flipkart Wallet instantly) and I was asked to purchase a different charger with the help of a Flipkart Sales Executive. So, I am happy. 
 
Great customer service. I don't think you get that everywhere else. 
 
VERDICT: BUY MOTO G WITH ITS PREMIUM COVER. YOU WON'T REGRET. No phone is perfect, but Moto G comes very close to being perfect for the price it offers.U got 2 buy it.I ordered the 16 gig version a week ago and every time i have used it the phone feels much better than 14k. P.S. :- I pity those other users stuck with laggy pieces of shit for which they might have shelled out big bucks....:P:P......It's a Google Baby.I'm using Moto G from almost 1 month. 
 
It's power packed by Snapdragon 400 Quad Core processor 
And having 1GB RAM 
 
The screen is IPS capacitive touch screen having corning gorrila glass 3. 
It's having 720p HD display 
U can't see the pixels on the screen they r very minute 
 
The battery is of 2070 MAH which is non removable but the back cover is changeable with different colours. 
The battery lasts for almost 17 to 18hrs with average usage which includes: surfing(2G), downloading (on 2G), watching videos, etc. 
 
Mine was a16GB model, it give usable memory of 12.91GB 
 
Camera: 
Primary is of 5 mega pixel with LED flash 
Gives great picture quality in well lighted areas and satisfactory in low lighted areas 
Features: HDR, slow motion recording, panorama, geo tagging, etc. 
 
Secondary is of 1.3 mega pixel giving satisfactory quality but I've not used it in video calling. 
 
Extra feature: This device also has a secondary mic for active noise cancellation. 
 
My device came with Android 4.4.2 KitKat in box. It is stock Android with no customization except some Motorola Apps. 
I haven't faced any problems yet with it. 
 
This device runs like butter. There is no lag in opening anything. 
 
Connectivity: 
Bluetooth 4.0 
WiFi 
Micro USB with USB Host and OTG support 
GPS 
 
I've been using this device only on 2G so I don't know how it works on 3G. 
 
There r no capacitive buttons like Samsung Galaxy 
 
It comes with a charger but it don't have detachable usb cable. 
The handsfree are not good but the output of the device is pretty nice. 
 
Moto G is not a delicate piece, it's rock solid with great built quality. 
 
It comes preloaded with Google Apps. 
It has light sensor/proximity sensor. 
 
I've not faced any Cons yet.It's the phone for first time smartphone buyers!!.I was looking for the smartphone for my wife. This was going to be her first smartphone. She has never used either Android or Apple phone. 
 
I work in Information Technology field since 14 years. My wife is completely opposite to me when it comes to tech. I did significant good research on the usage of first time smartphone users and their experiences. I was looking for a phone which is quality product (Minimum 1 GB RAM, Qualcomm snapdragon processor, Good GPU for playing games, gives optimized android experience), reliable, build quality and gets updated(of course android phone and Google OS updates). Reporting on Day 6 of operation: 
 
Pros- 
 
1) Fantastic Screen, just love it. Awesomely crisp and colorful. 
 
2) Blazing fast performance. Absolutely Zero Lag. I have so far tried Heavy Games, Custom Home Screen Launchers and other background service alongwith other standard stuff like emails, facebook, skype etc. 
 
3) The battery lasts a day, having said that, ever since the phone arrived, I have been using it almost all day long :P. I play games in night for 2-3 hours, or watch a movie. In the evening, I am streaming music on 3G date for another 2 hours while I work out, the day passes with me check mails, fb, whatsapp and calls at routine intervals. 
Had I been more conservative, I am sure I would be able to pull it off for another day. :) 
 
4) I love the shells 
 
Cons : 
 
1) The camera, it takes great pictures when the environment is well lit. But otherwise, in low light, it struggles really hard.. Also, I think I need to get more accustomed to it. I guess I can pull of better Images when that happens. 
 
(Use Snapseed for Picture Editing! It compensates for atleast 30% of Image Quality after the edit is done for low light image ;)) 
 
I am so in love with my phone!

The Flip shell is complete in itself. It comes with both front and back. Watch out. :)The perfect 'mobile' phone. so far. (16 GB version).Moto G for me is the mobile I have been waiting for since the smartphone era begun. 
First of all, the size of this smartphone is just as much as required, neither too big nor too small. It fits perfectly in your one hand, and doesn't look ridiculously big on your ears while talking. 
 
It comes with the perfect power, perfect screen size/resolution, dual sim, at a perfect price. I believe a mobile phone shan't cost you more than what Moto G costs, ever. Only iPhones are cool at a price that it sells since it's more like an accessory for girls. For absolutely normal guys like me, this is what you'd need in your phone from a trustworthy maker name, Motorola. 
 
Front camera is good for video calls, only rear camera is lacking with 5MP shooter, but I was always ready to adjust on that front if got everything else at such a price. 
 
One more thing, I bought this phone for my brother and myself at the same time, so you know I was really waiting for this phone. 
 
Some remarks after using Moto G for a while now: 
 
1. Camera error: Camera shows an error and doesn't work sometimes. Motorola guys are already working on it. To counter this for now, close all the open apps that might be using camera app, this works for me. 
 
2. Sometimes the loudspeaker gets on automatically without even showing it on the screen, then you've to turn the speaker on and off to get it back to normal. So beware, it might get embarrassing for a few who talk private stuff in public. Hope they know about it and working on a fix. 
 
*Like this review so that others can read it too.Got Moto G(God of smartphone) b4 it goes out of stock.The chipset is a Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 with quad cores running at 1.2GHz. It uses the older Cortex-A7 architecture and so can't keep up with the flagship Snapdragon 800 but it still keep everything running along smoothly. Android 4.3 felt slick, with no hesitations when switching apps. 
 
Using the Chrome browser it scored 1,410ms in the SunSpider 1.0.2 JavaScript benchmark, it's not a great score, and those who are always browsing the web should look elsewhere. Still, it renders most of the BBC news homepage in a flash, and only take a couple of seconds to get the whole thing displayed. A Geekbench 2 score of 1,303 smashes other budget handsets, though is still a few hundred points short of 
 
Again the Adreno 305 chipset isn't the fastest on offer, but once again it's a great choice for a handset at this price. The 3DMark Ice Storm test ran at fairly smooth 23.8fps for a score of 5,412, it also coped with all the games we threw at it, such as Minion Rush and Real Racing 3. It struggled with Ice Storm Extreme with just 9.6fps, but then it's only &pound;135 and it plays current games, so there's nothing to complain about. It outclasses every handset we've seen at this price, and even surpasses phones at twice the price we've seen over the last year.Exceptional Phone at this price.The phone is powered by a 1.2 GHz Quad Core Snapdragon processor. You will notice the difference when there are many tasks running simultaneously on the phone. Though the processor is not the fastest on the market. 
 
The display is ultra crisp, at 336 ppi, and 1280x720 resolution. 
 
The speaker is loud enough, better than the ones on the Google Nexus 5. 
 
You can upgrade this to KitKat. The user experience is better on KitKat than on the previous version. 
 
There is just 1 GB of RAM, which is on the lower side. But as KitKat is supposed to work well on low memory devices, it seems quite adequate. Also, there are some improvements on KitKat, so your device does not go slow after sometime, which was an issue with older Android versions. 
 
It gives you the stock Android experience. Not that I am a big fan of the stock experience, but then it is well integrated. When vendors add their own experience on top of the stock one, due to the pathetic quality of their implementations, there are bound to be issues. 
 
Storage is fixed, and cannot be expanded. You are better off buying a 16 GB version, as that would give you around 13 GB of usable memory. For some users, 16 GB may also be less. 
 
The battery is fixed one, and with normal usage, it lasts for a couple of days, but the battery drains quite quickly if you are going to watch movies. If you are one of the heavy users, then you could use the portable power banks available quite cheaply nowadays. 
 
Well, the package does not even have a USB cable, so you would have to purchase one if this is your first smartphone. Strange, because nowadays, companies have started giving Cable + portable chargers, where the same wire is used for charging with the plug. Here, its a pure charger, the wire is not detachable. Strange choice by Motorola. 
 
The build quality is exceptional, especially for this price. It does not feel cheap. 
 
The back panel is interchangeable, which allows you to have different colors based on your whims, though the original covers are quite expensive. 
 
This is the Dual SIM version. Most flagship smartphones, do not have Dual SIM options. Google Nexus 5, iPhone etc. Some Samsung mobiles have started offering Dual SIM options. 
 
Overall an exceptional phone, available at this price. Far better than those crappy smartphones, doled out by Samsung. 
 
Pros : 
720 x 1280 pixels, 4.5 inches (336 ppi display) 
Quad Core 1.2 GHz processor 
KitKat 
 
Cons : 
Memory is fixed 
RAM is only 1 GB

      4.5-inch display (1280&times;720 pixels, 329 ppi) | 1.2GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 processor | 1GB RAM | 8GB/16GB storage + no microSD slot | 5MP rear camera, 1.3MP front camera, 720p HD video | 3G, Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, Bluetooth 4.0 | GPS with A-GPS | 2070mAh battery | Android 4.4 KitKat 
 Design: There is a sturdiness and simplicity to the Moto G that is lacking in most handsets: no logos on the front, rounded edges, a rubber-finish matte back that won&rsquo;t attract fingerprints, and a straight line in the middle for the camera, flash, logo and headphone port. The phone also has water-repellant coating, but don&rsquo;t read too much into that&mdash;the ports are open, so it&rsquo;s not like you can use it in the rain. Drops don&rsquo;t affect the phone either. For most people, it&rsquo;s comfortable to hold it in one hand and use. But what bothers me are the large bezels. It&rsquo;s got a smaller screen than most phones at this price, but Motorola still insists on using virtual touchscreen buttons taking up valuable screen space while having a 1.5cm bezel under it that&rsquo;s just wasted space.All U Need.......First flipkart amazing service delivered faster then expected &amp; keeping it up on every single order...... Edit: Excellent support from Flipkart in terms of replacement for Problems on my old Moto G within 30-Days replacement limit.Good Budget Phone.Two of my colleagues happen to have a Moto G. One is from the US and the other ordered from Flipkart. This review is from the perspective of using and not owning the device. 
 
So after all the hype, Motorola finally introduced the G here. I guess they lived up to the hype by getting the price spot on considering you get a bit more in our retail packaging than in the US. Granted, you might save a few hundred rupees if shipped from there, but there are some differences that I noticed. Hope it helps you make a decision. 
 
The Indian version has a very nice soft rubber back, similar to the Moto X. Not of the same grade/quality of course, but it's better than the shiny and slightly cheap feeling US spec model. This helps it differentiate from the sea of other phones at this price. The dimple feels more pronounced and overall it just feels a lot more premium. Also, they bundle a wired headset here, so the package is not as bare bones as the one in US, where you only get a USB cable. Lastly, we get the option of using dual sim cards, which will come in handy if you use different ones for voice, internet or messages or whatever your preferences. Overall, a big shout out to Motorola for getting the price bang on at the time of launch. It's a given that the price will come down in a month or two, but the initial impression has been pretty good. A definite buy over other lesser known brands unless you need a different screen size or doubt Moto's support right now. Here's hoping they get the Moto X soon!Best in class!.Most of the people have already reviewed the phone here. I'll try to highlight some less touched points. 
1. The Moto G comes with a headset and the charger as opposed to many foreign reviews. 
2. The charger cannot double up as a USB cable. Hence you have to purchase a new one or use another phone's USB cable. 
3. The charger supplies only 500 mA current and hence it takes a lot of time to charge. However, if you have 1A or 1.5A chargers for other phones, they can very well be used officially according to the Motorola official site and I use a 5V 1A charger. Just make sure that the voltage specifications are 5V (For information, voltage specifications are more important than ampere specifications). 
4. Sensors present: Acclerometer, Light sensor, Proximity sensor, Sound sensor, Magnetic field sensor. 
5. Sensors absent: Gyroscope, Atmospheric pressure, NFC 
6. The phone is Miracast capable but the feature is disabled by default. For using it, you'd have to root your phone. 
7. Mixed battery life of 24 hours means that you cannot use your phone continuously, else the battery runs out quickly. 
However, at this price, you have all the features that you'll need most frequently. You won't regret buying this phone.Best Phone at this price(Be 100% sure).Before purchasing this phone I compared it with a lot of other phones such as Xperia c, Xperia L and even Xperia SP and Samsung S4 mini, This one is a blast if you consider my experience. one word on this phone: pls buy it.Just Awesome !! And Still The Best in This Price Range..!! (All You Need To Know ).The Motorola Moto G is a revolutionary phone. It isn&rsquo;t because of the features it has to offer, it&rsquo;s because of the price it offers these features at. There&rsquo;s barely any cons you can find in this phone, especially considering the price of the phone. Here are 5 Pros and Cons of the Motorola Moto G. 
CONS 
 
Lack of MicroSD Card slot and limited storage options 
 
The Moto G is available in 8GB and 16GB. There&rsquo;s only a difference of 20$ between the 8GB and 16GB so the obvious choice here should be the 16GB. But actually you&rsquo;ll only have approximately 12.94GB available since the Android OS requires around 3GB. So if you like to store all your music, videos and large games on your phone this could create a problem since there isn&rsquo;t a micro sd card slot available. 
 
Lack of 4G 
 
It&rsquo;s obvious that Motorola chose to exclude 4G functionality as one of the cutbacks to keep the price low. Because the Moto G is aimed for those who have a low-budget, so it&rsquo;s safe to assume that they won&rsquo;t be using 4G as the rates are too expensive. In fact the Moto G was aimed at developing countries where 4G is pretty much non-existent. But for those who are planning to hold onto this phone for 2-3 years should keep this in mind. 
 
Heavy and thick. 
 
Though the Moto G is a 4.5 inch phone it&rsquo;s still 10% heavier than the Moto X (4.7 inch) and the Nexus 5 (4.95 inch). It&rsquo;s thicker too, almost 35% more than the Nexus 4. But The Moto G is still a compact phone which Motorola has designed to fit comfortably in your hand. 
 
Camera 
 
Moto G sports a 5MP rear and a 1.3MP front facing camera. The front facing camera is great! But these days a 5MP rear camera isn&rsquo;t sufficient especially because just like the Nexus line up, Motorola isn&rsquo;t that good either when it comes to the camera. But at the end of the day it does the job and that&rsquo;s all that matters. 
 
Call quality 
 
The call quality on the Moto G isn&rsquo;t all that great compared to the other phones. Though you shouldn&rsquo;t dwell on as it isn&rsquo;t such a big problem. Bottom line is that the call quality is decent at the best. 
 
PROS 
 
Perfect screen size with HD resolution.It has a 4.5 inch screen with 720p resolution and it even has Corning Gorilla Glass 3! Which gives it a ppi of 326 and makes it resistant against scratches. It&rsquo;s the perfect screen size because 4.5&Prime; fits right in the middle, as many find a 5 inch phone too big and a 4 inch phone too small. Even though it has 4.5 inch screen it is almost exactly as tall as the iphone 5s, so the phone is perfect for one hand usage. 
 
Fast processor and plenty of RAM. 
 
The Moto G has a Snapdragon 400 Quad-core clocked at 1.2 GHz, Adreno 305 (GPU) along with 1GB of RAM which means you&rsquo;ll easily be able to high-end play games such as Dead Trigger, Shadowgun and Riptide GP2. This means you have a future proof device which will let you play most of the games for years to come and it won&rsquo;t lag like the other budget phone in it&rsquo;s price range. 
 
Android 4.3 (Upgradable to 4.4.2) 
 
Since Motorola was owned by Google, it is obvious that the Motorola line up will get timely updates. In fact the Moto X got the Android 4.4 Kitkat update before the Nexus 4! The Moto G comes with android 4.3 and in January when it launches in India it will come with Android 4.4 Kitkat. It will get updates as fast as other high-end devices like Galaxy S4, HTC One and etc. 
 
For the colorful 
The Moto G is Google&rsquo;s answer to the iphone 5c. The iphone 5c comes in 5 different colors where as the Moto G comes in 19 different colors! The best part is the shells are changeable to if you get bored with the color that you have, then just buy a new shell and you&rsquo;ll have a completely different colored phone. So not only is it colorful but there&rsquo;s a lot more variety of colors and a lot more freedom to change the color whenever you want. 
 
Price 
 
The last but certainly not the least the Moto G is available in 8GB and 16GB for Rs12500 and Rs 14000 respectively( Dual Sim :) ). That&rsquo;s cheaper than the on contract price of the Iphone 5s! The phone is ridiculously cheap considering the specifications of the phone. The price here is the deal breaker.after 10days review of my MOTO G.I got my 16gb moto g 10days before.... 
pros: 
1. 326 PPI display really awesome.... gives premier look.

3.sound s pretty good.... 
4.In that 16 GB we can use 12.95 available for other usage if u r not a big gamer then its more then enough.... 
5.battery takes 3hrs to charge and 8hrs to work continuously.... if use normally then that's enough for 1day..... so not bad.... also not too good... 
6.gorilla glass 3 works superbly I didn't stick any scratch guards...

3.design wise why they waste bit of space below the home button that is no use of it.... if they utilize that to mean its marvless one pretty disappointment ....awesome!.The 4.5 inch edge-to-edge display comes with 720p HD resolution and 329 ppi - every pixel is sharp, vivid and crystal clear.Available with Jelly bean 4.3 os with upgradable option to kitkat 
Design 
The phone built looks classy and weighs 143gms(as noted on company website). The front panel features a black strip of glass around the screen that visually differentiates the plastic front and rear panels. 
Motorola has also used Corning Gorilla Glass 3 on the Moto G to protect it from scratches.The handset is comfortable to hold.On the whole design is amazingly crafty.Motorola also has accesories for rear shells in different colors. 
Rating- 8/10 
Performance 
With the given specifications the moto g is heavywieght machine.I tried giving a shot at asphalt 8 which is highend graphics game in andorid store.After initial hiccups the game started working normally(the game runs smoothly in 2gb ram versions).Given the 1 gb ram this shows the power. 
Multitasking is also easily done without any hitches.On technical front, the camera on the phone is not the best around.With the same range pricing Micromax knight gives 13 mp front and 5 mp back cam.Unless you are camera freak,one can't aomplain about camera. 
The sound quality is also good though its not loud. 
The really amazing aspect about the phone is battery life.With 2070 mAh battery, the phone lasted for 36 hours with continous data,calls and messaging,though its initial days of usage i can guarantee with proper charging,motog will last long. 
Rating- 8.5/10 
Final Call 
 
The Moto G scores heavily in terms of style and substance, and our only major quibbles are the non-expandable storage and below-par camera performance. The 4.5-inch HD screen is wide, and yet the phone is small enough to hold in one hand and type easily with a thumb. Most of all, praise be, the Moto G is also extremely affordable. 
The downside is the cheap in box accessories with phone.The headset given is a crap and beleive it their is no data cable.But we Indians can be happy with it taking Americans where only Data cable was provided with the phone. 
If you are hardcore gamer or camera freak,Moto g is not your choice. 
With the price of 12,499rs for 8gb and 13,999rs for 16gb,Moto g exclisevly sold in India on Flipkart is high value for your money.

-------------------

---------------------

The only bad point is that it does not include a micro USB cable.(but again the price range) and the Camera is Average.MOTO G ROCK$$$$$$.The Moto G is still the best budget phone money can buy, especially as there have been no big-name budget phones revealed since it came out. 
 
That said I have noticed a few minor issues that are worth considering if you have already bought a Moto G or are on the cusp of doing so. 
 
One hardware niggle is a sensible design choice that can backfire if you&rsquo;re not careful. The plastic screen surround of the Moto G sticks out a tiny bit from the glass front layer. This will stop the screen from shattering when the phone is dropped, but the plastic lip does get dented and scratched quite easily thanks to its vulnerable position. 
 
Just being in the pocket, jangling around with keys and coins, will eventually cause dents and scratches in this surround layer. It's worth checking out Motorola&rsquo;s flip case or a third-party bumper-style case because of this. 
 
Performance is also not quite perfect. The Moto G has a fairly powerful processor, but the limits of its 1GB of RAM are apparent at times. Once you have a lot of apps installed, there will be a slight delay when the phone heads back to the home screen &ndash; as the phone takes a little extra time to render the app icons and any widgets. 
 
General performance is still great for the price, though, and more than enough for anyone who limits themselves to small number of core apps. 
 
One element that my opinion has significantly improved on is battery life. the Moto G's battery life is genuinely quite impressive considering some rivals like the Lumia 620 have pretty poor battery life. 
 
With conservative use one able to squeeze two days' use out of the phone. And even with some game-playing and internet browsing, a day and a half is easily possible. It&rsquo;s an impressive performance for a phone of this price and screen size, even if pricier phones still beat it comfortably here.Awesome Product.Using this phone for 2 weeks now..

The first and only company in 80's which developed a quality measurement technique called 'Six Sigma' where many other company's has failed to meet thequality standards like Motorola! Which Motorola maintains in all of it's products even today. Remember, this is the company which built products for military purposes to survive in extreme tough conditions. 
This one statement alone tells the quality in its products.

So, 100% satisfaction Guarantee!!Best power-packed android at perfect price - Best Steal.The phone has broken all sales record of Motorola in their history. Its the most widely online sold phone in Indian history.. The numbers are sufficient to prove the phone's worth. Still adding in my experience here - 
Pros (almost everything) - 
1. Long battery life (lasts whole day easily with 1 movie of 2 hours + 8 hrs whatsapp + 1 hour calls) 
2. Best display (super crisp display with higher ppi than even iPhone) the only at this price to have a gorilla 3 glass and spill proof screen ! 
3. Pure android kit-kat experience (the only phone below 20K to have kitkat) 
4. Classy looks and good form factor fits in 1 hand 
5. Superb sound output on earphones (not the earphones that come with this phone. but other decent ones) 
 
Cons - 
1. Cheap useless earphones that come with this phone. worse than 50Rs earphones that are available in market 
2. No removable memory card (16 GB should b sufficient) 
3. no removable battery (i hope Motorola service center can replace it if needed after a year) 
4. 1.5 GB Ram would have been perfect, i know its asking too much in 14K 
 
Experience of shopping with flipkart was good. Shipped on-time (though i was eager and expecting it to arrive before time) 
The 10% off offer on axis bank cards was icing on the cake. Thanks FlipkartMoto g on the rise..Was it worth the price(and wait)? Definitely. Been using Moto g for over a month now and have not encountered any problems or glitches. Seems to cope well with all the apps and games( subways surfers, hill climb racing, speedx 3d, daddy was a thief) i'm using up till now. Battery life is good, but it all depends on what you do with the phone. Camera is good enough. It also comes with a decent front camera. Not too heavy in the hand and seems durable. Screen size and resolution is good. 
I have the 16GB version, so those using the 8GB version might feel the memory constraint once apps, files, multimedia start pilling up as the OS(kitkat) itself takes up about 3GB. In this respect the phone should have come with a memory card slot. To make up for this Google Drive is providing free 16 GB( not sure about the amount of storage)space for two years( dont know what will happen after that). It comes with an in built battery, which could put off a few people. 
Its a dual SIM phone, so its handy if you have a mobile for work and one for home. The phone came with a charger and normal headset(not in-ears). Its been compared with a lot other high end phones( nexus 5, iphone 5c etc) and it does not do very badly. 
Overall its the best buy in its category.Brilliant For its Price.Short Review - 
1) Superb screen. Brilliant Sunlight legibility. 
2) Super Fast - for a phone priced at 14000 and looking at its competitors, its as good as most flagships. 
3) Good Battery - I am a power user. I make loads of phone calls, surf the net, listen to podcasts, chat. It lasts me a day. I am not much of a gamer, so that definitely saves battery... 
4) Brilliant Speaker - This phone is loud. No other phone can even compare to the sound that this has. 
5) Looks Beautiful - Besides the HTC One and maybe the iphone, this is the most beautiful phone i have held in my hand. It also feels right and offers tremendous grip. 
6) WaterResistant - Check the videos online. I know of friends who have accidentally dropped it and the phone has worked like a dream. In rains, don't bother if it gets accidentally wet. Just wipe it dry after. 
7) Call Quality - Clear sound from both ends, so no issues on either side. 
8) So So Camera - Not a great camera but a functional one. Moto G rocks.....Buyers Review.I bought the Moto G 16 GB version a month ago and after giving it a month to know the product better i write this review. 
 
The Moto G is a really great phone that one could have for such affordable price. The Design is really sleek and curvy and it feels great in your hands. The back rubber case along with the &quot;M&quot; dimple on the back gives it a great grip and feel of comfort while holding it. Also the company's decision to be secure enough with their product and not print the company full name on the product except for the brand on the back gives it a very elegant look. 
 
It is packed with the latest Android kitkat has pre installed Quick office, email and Play store, face recognition etc which makes it very convenient to work with excel, word, ppt or pdf files. Though one may not find basic useful tools such as Notes or file explorer. 
 
The Display is sharp and clear even under direct sunlight and the phone works great normally. But despite me only using half of the available memory i have encountered problems from time to time, when the phone hangs up on me and the screen icons disappear. 
 
The camera is great for still pictures, whereas with not much of image stabilization. So movements come all blurry. It comes with a 4x zoom capability but due to low image stabilization the zoom too is compromised. Still pictures are very well captured and even low light pics come out better than many phones. 
 
The dual Sim is one of the feature that attracted me to this phone along with many other features. But now i have come to encounter some problems with the sim reading. From time to time the phone stops reading the sim card and there is a little white cross in a red triangle which appears instead of the network sign. 
 
The battery is non removable and lasts not more than a day even with minimum usage. but i guess this is normal with almost all smart phones. The memory is internal and no room for external memory is available. 
 
All in all a good phone that is totally worth the money. Though i hope i can get rid of the few issues i have been facing with the phone. FLIPKART has done a totally awsome job packing and delivering it.moto g awesome phone u will lve it...Hii guy. Here is my experience of using moto g.

The nostalgic thing is my first phone was a moto and then i had razr sometime..now again &quot;Hello Moto&quot;Fully satisfied with Moto G.Well, as usual, best service from flipkart. I received this device a day before the expected date. IMPRESSED AT ITS FIRST LOOKS 
1st thing i liked is its Superb built quality (i've been scratching nails and pins on my display from yesterday &amp; i still can't see a single scratch on it. So no need of any lamination then). Although its water repellent, i haven't dared to immerse it in water yet. 
 
2nd thing is the Snapdragon S4 processor along with Kitkat 4.2.2, (gets the latest updates) so almost no lagging in heavy games. Also Supports OTG, if u lack space. 
 
3rd point is, its a 4.5 inch device i.e i wont have to grab my thump up high on a 5 inch screen for notifications, meant, it fits perfectly on one's hands. Neat &amp; Tidy. 
Speakers are better than my expectations. 
GPS (along with GLONASS) locks within 1 to 2 seconds (A great relief), which was a mess on my Micromax Canvas HD (I had to take it out in the open, hold my hands upwards &amp; had to wait for 4-5 min for GPS lock) which was very inconvenient while travelling. 
 
The only drawbacks are: 
1) Non-removable batteries (which lasts for more than 1 day on average usage) 
2) No slots for SD cards. I would suggest u to go for 16 GB variant then. 
3) Camera quality: Its an average, not recommended for heavy photographers. (There's been an update, which improved its quality a bit). But one thing. When Motorola clams 5.0 MP, they are providing the perfect resolution of 5.0 MP, not like Micromax 8.0 MP and 13.0 MP. Front cam's also great than expected. 
4) Data cable not included in the box. Motorola headsets provided in the box are just average. I would suggest to use Nokia WH-205 headsets which works like a charm (except the mic button) 
 
Overall, my final verdict is GO FOR MOTO G BLINDLY. Afterall its Motorola 'A Google Company'Value for money phone - Happy after 1 months of rigorous usage.I am writing this after almost 1 month of usage.

There are a few things which the MOTO is relly good at 
1. Battery backup (2070mAH vs 1460 mAH) 
2. Bigger screen (4.5&quot; vs 4.03&quot;) 
3. SNAPDRAGON processor, which means dev support in xda ... which means lots of custom roms to try out!!! (INTEL has not released source code for its processor and hence no unlocking bootloader :( )

If you can afford trying something new then definitely go for it. :)??????Surprisingly good for the money, fast enough for most all needs ??????.I purchased this for my brother. I have to say I am very impressed with this little device. Just so you know where I'm coming from, my cell phone history starts with my current Nexus 5 , Nexus 4, Galaxy S3, Galaxy Nexus, micromax canvas 2 galaxy mini s5570.... and it goes on and on and on. I am a smart phone aficionado, and this little thing impresses me. 
 
The screen has great viewing angles, and looks great in general. I dare say I like the color and viewing angles better than on my Nexus 5. The blacks don't become a light grey at the extreme corner angles. Obviously, my 5&quot; 1080p is more of a pleasure to use than the 4.5&quot; 720p overall, but I had to comment on just how rich and beautiful the Moto G display is. The size means that it has a PPI of about 329. The iPhone 5's retina display, for comparison, sits at 326ppi. The vast majority of people will need no more than what this display has to offer. AND... it's wrapped in Gorilla Glass 3. Not that it should really matter that much, I've had Gorilla Glass scratch and seen it shatter so it isn't a super material... but some people will be glad to have it.(better get a screen protector) 
 
The Quad Core 1.2Ghz Snapdragon 400 was fast enough for me. According to some benchmarks I've seen, it supposedly runs about as fast as the Nexus 4. The difference seems to be that this CPU simply sips on the battery. But, I'll get to more on that later. The GPU seemed fast enough for me on the benchmarks I'd run. Not the fastest, but by no means slow. The device doesn't have as much RAM at 1GB as higher end phones which tend to come in at 1.5 or 2GB. However for the average person this will not matter. Android's memory management is pretty good. While a power user might be able to occasionally catch blips associated to the lack of extra ram, the average user will never see it. 
 
For a casual user, the battery life will simply be phenomenal. My brother, with some light-ish use on mostly 3G network access did 21% battery use over 24 hours, and 55% over 3 days before charging. That's just crazy. Simply bananas. As a disclaimer, 1st bug on my phone (that others have reported as well on some units) where a full discharge of the battery was not able to be recharged from fully dead without some serious fiddling. I managed to get that phone charging again and decided to try and run the battery down (testing) and I ran into problems. I couldn't tax the battery. I ran benchmarks, 3D intensive simulations, etc... the thing would not give up it's battery. I'm returning the questionable phone, but given that there are bad eggs in any production batch, I'm not docking any stars. I think this phone is worth the 5 stars, regardless of the occassional bad build. 
 
Cons? There's no &quot;advanced&quot; features. There's no LTE (4G) radio on board. There's no NFC sensor for sharing links or doing financial transactions. There's no wireless charging, nor any 802.11ac support for the WiFi. However the average user might not really care about, or need, those things. LTE would've been nice, and most people have been convinced that they need 4G in their lives. However many are reporting real-life 3-4Mb/s transfer rates on their Moto G's... I get 12Mb/s on my DSL. How much speed do you really need to check the weather? I don't see how NFC didn't make the cut, but I guess at the price I can't complain. I'm not wild that the volume rocker is on the same side as the power button, but that's not a big deal. 
 
Pros? This phone feels great in the hand. It has a good weight. I never liked the ultra-light feel of the samsung flagship phones. The phone feels solid despite having a user removable back plate. Oh, and you can replace the back plate with colorful replacements, or flip covers, or what have you , we get dual sim model in India which is superb. 
 
For most anyone, this will be an absolutely fantastic choice. Don't be afraid, just buy it.

Updated the phone to KitKat, which took agonisingly long, don't know why, coz I was able to download Asphalt 8 at a brisk pace. But the system seems just as responsive. No visible glitches or system freezes. Evaluated its processing power by playing Asphalt 8 for a while, and it ran lag free, although the back did heat up pretty quickly. More testing required on this front, which I shall get to in the weeks to come, and then, perhaps, I'll update this section of the review. 
 
Camera is average at best. Lots of noise, and after the KitKat update, the response time seems to have taken a hit. 
 
Audio is loud enough, but nothing extravagant. It does the job of producing audible and enjoyable sound. 
 
I admit I'm yet to operate and evaluate it comprehensively, but so far, all is well. 
 
Definitely the phone to buy in the current market if you're running on a tight budget. I reckon there are only 2 Android phones worth owning this time.
