Awesome value for money.Unbeatable for this price.Android phones are available in wide price range, from variety of OEMs. Problem is, if your budget is tight, you've to compromise on quality and/or features or go for off-stream brands. 
 
So if your budget is around 15k, you can buy absolutely ridiculous phones from main-stream vendors like Samsung, HTC, LG. Or if you're not too brand sensitive, you can go for brands like Micromax, XOLO and you'll get much decent phones. 
 
Or, you can buy a Motorola phone with (almost) no compromises :) 
 
So here's an honest review : 
 
Pros: 
- Great build quality. The default black back comes with a matte finish and it feels nice. The slight curve and the M dimple at the back makes it fit nicely in hand 
- Unexpectedly loud and clear speaker. 
- Unlike international versions, the box includes charger adapter and a (cheap) headset 
- Superior display. Period. 
- KitKat 4.4.2 - Give me one good phone with this price tag which runs KitKat. Also, since yesterday you can also install Google launcher. Pure Nexus like experience 
- Good sound quality. With a good pair of headphones, you'll get very good sound quality. Equalizer settings are actually useful 
- Choice of covers : They're costly. And they don't have that supreme matte finish that the default black one has (they are matte, but do not feel as premium as the black one) Although I got it for 70% off 
- Battery backup : well it seriously rocks. Smartphones are dumb nowadays only because of their dumb batteries. Motorola knows their batteries. 
- The whole UI is responsive. Not as snappy as Nexus, or HTC One, but good enough. 1.2 Quad core + 1 GB Ram is a decent enough engine that runs everything you throw at it. If you're upgrading from Galaxy duos and other low-end devices, you'll rejoice. 
- 50GB Google Drive space for 2 years. Do you really fall for something like that? I wouldn't. Considering the speed, cost and overall spread of internet connectivity we have in India. 
- Pure android, most likely to get updates. Even after KitKat. 
Cons : 
- Considerable low quality of voice in calls. Sometime or the other you will realize that something is wrong with the voice quality if you have a keen ear. But you can live with it. It is not that bad. 
- Running Pure Android, you miss the quick toggles for Wi-Fi and other settings. There are tiles, but again, clicking on them takes you to the settings page. While long clicks for some work as toggle. 
- It's not a con, more of a joke actually :P There's Motorola care/support app in the phone. So once I happened to ask live chat assistant for something and he/she replied that this live support is US only. 
- No MicroSD card, No NFC, No HDMI out, OK-ish camera. But then do you really expect these in a less than 14k phone??. 8GB or 16GB is good enough for most. 
 
So verdict 
Don't want to touch 20k range, but want a good main stream OEM's smartphone, this is the one. You don't care about the brand but want to stick to budget, still this is the one. 
 
I bought one, and you know what, I could even buy another one :PNo compromises made my Moto to reach this price point..Being a previous HTC user (HTC One V), I was expecting this phone to have some compromises with the build quality, or the color reproduction of screen or something else. The spec provided for price just didnt make sense. 
 
But when this phone arrived and I took it in my hand, it was clear that it didn't feel like a cheap phone at all (I could say the build quality is very similar to my old Dell XCD 35). The Kit-Kat update makes this phone really snappy, I compared it with Nexus 5 in one hand and this one in other, now obviously it couldn't beat it, but it was lets say, just 0.1 or 0.2 seconds late in opening all the applications, now this phone may not appeal for the hardcore Android gamers (Seriously? you play games on android and call yourself a 'hard-core' android gamer? I have a gaming PC and I think its much better to play actual video games on it), but for those who want to have multiple apps open or browsing many tabs of resource heavy pages, this phone is the one. The screen makes web browsing and reading a real pleasure (and seriously, in terms of clarity, you'll only notice Nexus 5 screen to be clearer if you touch your nose to both screens and observe). 
 
Some points I'd like to mention: 
1. Build quality: GREAT but not as good as my HTC phone with aluminum body. 
2. Screen: AMAZING, but still whites and the colors of the Super LCD 2 on my HTC were better 
3. Camera: Back cam: GOOD (obviously cant beat HTC ImageSense), front cam, AWESOME for the price, Sony Xperia SP has 0.3 MP front camera and that really sucks in front of this, and that phone costs Rs. 22,000. Video quality is very poor in low light. Camera doesnt bother me though. 
4. This phone is likely to get a LOT of unofficial support on XDA forums and will get a LOT of custom ROMs as this has become very popular (Theres already automated tools which let you do rooting and other stuff with few clicks) 
5. I think the Charger that came with this phone costs around Rs. 50 (gets the work done though), and the earbuds cost rs. 40 (TERRIBLE quality). But not a problem at all since everyone has chargers and headsets from their previous phones, right? and the Moto G doesnt even come with accessories outside of India. 
6. I also observe some bleeding on the edges of the screen, doesn't give it a rich feel. 
7. Flash is REALLY bright, brighter than my One V, which had brighter flash than iPhone 5

Hope this review helps in making u'r decision about Moto G.&quot;The&quot; Phone For India.Okay, The Short intro:- 
A good phone, vibrant display, power and features with guaranteed updates. All you can ask for a price of 12499 and add 16 gigabytes of internals to boast of for another 1500. butter. 
 
The Detailed review:- 
 
Display:- 
Amazingly vibrant HD display with a very good color reproduction and an extreme delight to watch. Feels just awesome. There may be a dead pixel in the top left corner, just ignore that its a software error. 
 
Touch:- 
Amazingly smooth. Never had to struggle with it for anything. The oleo-phobic coating just makes a good product even better. Add gorilla glass 3 and it just rocks. 
 
Processor:- 
An old snapdragon 400 clocked at 1.2Ghz having a core count of 4. Just remember, it was the top chip when it was launched. So now it still holds its grounds. Blows The Xperia L's dual core s4 straight out of the water. Just dont compare it with the Nvidia's Tegra 3 on Xolo Play. Benchmarks are pretty good. 
 
Graphics:- 
The Adreno 305 Gets the job done reasonably well for a phone in this budget. The Big games Lag and it is a ram issue. 
 
RAM:- 
These guys could have done better. 1GB is what is required for a phone with the os, whatsapp and one single good game. The Ultra high games run smoothly on the Grand 2 but not on this due to lack of RAM. 
 
Camera:- 
The point which according to me was sacrificed in favor of a low price tag. Not So Bad. But still we can expect a better one on this front. it a standaard 5Mpx shooter with AF. 
 
Software:- 
Dont know about the others but i got kitkat out of the box. 
Amazing, pure nexus feel. 
Just get a notification toggle from the playstore and you are good to go. 
 
OTG:- 
Awesome feature. It is not broken for me. Pendrives attatch quite well i have tried a sony hard disk witrh external power source and found it to work. It was a 1TB unit. 
 
Build:- 
Awesome. The weight feels good and not over in the hands. Its not cheap plastic like samsung. Amazing. 
 
Comparable Phones:- 
Lumia 525-Want free games and windows, go for it. 
Xperia L- Awesome camera. 
Xolo q1100- again the camera. 
xolo play- A much better CPU and GPU. 
 
Verdict:- 
The best overall phone in the price range, just go for it.Its Fast very well designed and fits well in the hand..This is my review after the first week of use.

I ma getting almost one and a half day of battery with the regular stuffs going on like whatsapp, FB, twitter, some phone calls, some messaging and a lot of synching for the TOI and the new app. 
 
Maybe its Kit Kat feature, but loving the option to cancel the call and auto send the message. Happy with &quot;Google Now&quot; also. 
 
Camera App is fast and love the fact that you can take photo even when the phone is locked. (You cant browse the Gallery - how sensible is that :-) ) 
 
Love the Motorola Apps - Moto Assist and Moto Migrate (make life easy when planning to shift data from Apple of other Android mobiles).

1) No SD Card support (I am not so much into Songs so I guess that doesnt matter to me, photos will take some time before they bloat the space)

3) Charging takes a LOT of time (it could be an issue with the plug point but I am experiencing this)

About the product-- 
 
Pros 
1. Came with Kitkat 4.4.2 out of the box. 
2. All pre-installed apps were already updated. Hence, ready to use immediately. 
3. Kitkat really works fast...from boot up to mutli-tasking. 
4. UI is pretty smooth but stock android..not much customization. 
5. Will be getting latest android updates..is a big plus. 
6. Good resolution..easy to hold &amp; grip. 
7. Dual SIM... I suppose is need of today..it works well here. 
 
Cons 
1. Battery on the weaker side..non-removable..though it lasts just about one day..with normal usage. 
2. Available storage is 11 GB only with no SD card support. 
3. Camera is average in day light...not so good in low light. 
4. Should have 2 GB RAM especially for gaming. 
5. Screen size is not suitable for gaming or video playback (should have been 5 inches at least). 
6. Heats up slightly while charging. 
 
Overall a good deal at 13,999 /-. I would recommend it for people interested in voice calls (using 2 SIMs) &amp; messaging, checking mails, little bit of browsing..and very less gaming &amp; photography.

Got this phone at the end of February after a long wait of twelve days. 
Had been using this since then continuously, with amazing performance and features without any problem. 
 
My Experience:

Brilliant display with HD resolution, was able to make its primary mark! 
Super fine quality with images and text. Was able to read the possible smallest text without blurs and fog.

Performance: 
Really fast and rapid interaction with the device and access to the applications. 
Powerful Quad core processor and the GPU is more than enough along with 1GB RAM. 
Voice clarity is awesome while talking on phone. 
 
Battery:

Softwares:

Got the Kitkat update which added to smoothness and rich feel. 
 
Camera: 
Main camera quality is quite good( little weak in darkness). 
Front camera is ok when tested with skype. 
 
Appearance: 
Impressive black with easy to carry/grip curvy back. 
Nice usability due to the both volume and power switches on one side. 
Light notification adds a plus to feature and appearance. 
The 'M' mark at the rear really makes an impression. 
 
No Con's: 
Heard lot about the fixed storage but after installing all my necessary applications, games, audio/videos and Kitkat update i still have around 9GB free( I have the 16GB version). 
What would i do with the removed battery ( Motorola ensures safeguards against water ). 
4G? look at the price i am paying! 
Its not that heavy

Yes! its really a value for money. To digest this a lot of reading and comparison is needed.

I am 100% satisfied with Moto G.

Guys go for it, its just awesome!!!Poor man's Nexus, but I'm a happy poor man :).Cons. 
(Yes. I'll start with Cons.) 
 
1. Known issue of android 4.3 on Moto G. Unable to connect to EAP secured wifi networks. 
Usually configured in offices. It's the one where you have to provide username and pwd credentials. Works fine on normal WEP/WPA secured wifi though. 
(Update: Was able to connect to EAP, just needed to add the SSID, i.e. wifi name manually, and put other settings like login username and password manually, with TLS security setting) 
 
2. I didn't update to 4.4, because there is another known issue of USB on the Go incompatible with KitKat. It needs a paid app to unlock it, although it works fine in 4.3 
 
3. Feels a bit heavy.143g is a tad bit more than I'd like. Even heavier than larger Nexus phones and Moto X. Something I'll have to get used to. 
 
Pros 
 
0. Yes, it's worth it. Considering that smartphone specs keep changing so quickly nowadays. I'd rather buy such phones every 2 yrs than getting a flagship every 4yrs. 
 
1. Beats other mid range android phones, hands down. No bloatware, pure google experience. Slick performance. 
 
2. Very ergonomic. I never really could make a switch from my Xperia Arc, because most decent droids nowadays are not very handy, too big for palms and always give me the unease that I'll drop them. But this has a nice matte back cover and well designed bezels, making it very handy. 
 
3. Display is amazing. It's not just the clarity of pixels but also there is no color hue whatsoever, typically seen in Samsung phones. 
 
4. Although camera seems it's weak point on spec sheet, it has a strong flash and takes pretty good night pics. But don't expect it to replace your digicam. The camera app, is one of the best out there. Manual focus is a welcome feature. 
 
5. Battery performance is pretty good so far. Usually when you get a new phone, you tend to fiddle more with it and it drains juice, despite that I drained just 40% throughout the day. I am sure that in normal usage it can last well over 2 days. 
 
P.S. Thanks Flipkart for delivering within 10 days! I was expecting a longer wait, given the unprecedented demand. Salute.The Insanely Priced, Revolutionary Mid-Ranger.The screen of MOTO G isn't huge which makes it easy for one handed use and it is crisp, has good contrast ratio, there isn't much storage options on the 16 model as it is not expandable, However if you are not going to store or watch movies, then is good enough. The camera is nothing to get excited about, but in every other respect this is the best value for money smartphone ever. It's well-built, with a high-quality display, fast enough not to bother even us, and has a good battery life. 
 
It's easily the best budget smartphone we've ever seen, redefining what we mean by that term. It's largely equivalent to the Sony Xperia SP, which is quicker in benchmarks, but not noticeably in day-to-day use, but has less battery life and only Android 4.1. It cost around Rs. 20,000/-. (goes away singling along &quot; MOTO MOTO ... the names so nice you say it twice&quot; )Excellent phone for excellent price.While going for a new phone, very few options were there, as budget was tight for me and principle factor when buying a phone. 15K budget category has some very decent phone options like Moto G, Canvas 4 and Canvas turbo. So I narrowed it down to these 3 after some extensive research. 
 
Following points I considered for making a decision. 
 
- Budget wise Moto G 16 GB variant was working out cheapest, in comparison to other narrowed down models. I strictly did not wanted to go beyond 15K. 
 
- Having used LG Optimus black since lat 3 years, I was quite comfortable with 4 inch screen. And in my opinion 5 inch screen for me would an overkill. As I do not believe in handling a phone with 2 hands. both Canvas models have 5 inch screen, so here as well I leaned more towards Moto G. 
 
- Latest android was big factor. As My previous phone (LGP970) used to receive Latest OS updates in last, I wanted latest Android Out of the box. Both Canvas models were 4.2.1 at the time of purchase, and After March, Moto G models were having 4.4.2 out of the box. 
 
- From various reviews I could notice that, Processor, RAM and graphics chipset are better in above 2 Canvas models than Moto G. And Turbo wins the benchmarks on paper. My phone usage is moderate. I generally play games and do my office related stuff on my iPad when I am on the run. So performance was important for me, but here I could avoid Moto G falling behind in the benchmark race. ONLY because, from reviews, I could see that Moto G has pretty decent capabilities. And it's not at all that much behind from other contestants. Have played PVZ 2 on Moto G, which I suppose is a resource hogger game, and performance is decent, but not the best. But main point to notice here is performance in a phone which is in 15K budget category. For a moderate phone user, Moto G is definitely a speedy device, given it's hardware specs. Thanks to it's quad core processor, and dev support for it from various apps and OS. 
 
- Now comes the camera. 3 devices which I had narrowed it down, Canvas devices had more better camera than Moto G. Having said that, More MP does not necessarily mean better camera. My previous phone used to have 5 MP rear camera and 2MP front cam. It was performing decent. And I never believe in using a phone cam as a principle cam. So This factor also, did not bother me too much. But I would say that I have seen Canvas turbo's camera, and it's functionality, and it's picture quality. And It beats down Moto G's image quality hands down. And both Canvas models mentioned here has capability to record full HD videos (1900 X 1080), if that matters. Moto G does not have. 
 
- From reviews and after seeing both phones in action, Battery life, resolution are also factors where Moto G falls behind Canvas Turbo specially. Canvas Turbo is one phone which falls in 15K budget and has a full HD resolution. This was again a secondary factor, as factors like budget, phone size, and price wise performance were still primary factors for me. Though I would like to mention that, Moto G survives extensively moderate usage for 20-24 hours easily. 
 
- My previous phone (LGP970) had Corning Gorilla Glass 2, and I had never used screen guard with it. So My faith in Corning Gorilla Glass 3 was intact. Still using my phone without screen-guard, and I am not disappointing. Though If usage is rough, I would advise to use the screen guard for sure. 
 
- One major factor against this phone would be it's bulky. And buyer would not be able to check it out before buying it, because it exclusively available here at flipkart only. So if phone ergonomics are not suitable for any user, that will be an issue. 
 
So, at last after considering all this stuff, and after using the Moto G for at-least 3 weeks I am in position to say that I am not at all disappointed with my decision to purchase this phone. This phone is for users who have tight budget and want better but not-best performance specially in resource hogger games and app. But do not worry, it will play big games and big videos without sweat. And will not give any issue even if there are 5-6 tabs are open in browser. This phone is for users who want latest android out of the box (as of now). And it's for users who are not intimidated by big screen and best in class resolution as well as (not-best but good) camera. 
 
This phone is not for peeps who want a slick device with 5 inch full HD display in budget category of 15K. Those will be definitely happy with Canvas turbo. Overall performance wise and Phone design and ergonomics wise Canvas 4 beats Moto G (Not by that much, but still does). So if budget permits, and factors like Camera with 13MP rear cam/5MP front cam, better performance than Moto G, On-paper synthetic benchmarks, device weight, support for an Indian Mobile device company are concern than Canvas Turbo is better choice in that case.

Hope the light from the bang shines much longer.Sudden battery Discharge Issue.Hi, I have purchased Moto G 16GB thru Flipkart which was delivered to me on 5/4/14. I am using this phone from one month and it was working perfectly OK. Performance is Excellent. But today i have faced problem that phone battery got discharged suddenly from 90% to Zero and mobile got Switched OFF itself. After putting on charging it got charged fully from ZERO in just 1/2 hours which normally takes 3 hours at-least. While talking to customer care at 18001022344 , i got information that it happens as its Micro processor got off and re-starting as it takes large power from battery. As per them it will happen only once in life time of mobile that too only between initial 30-45 days of first start. They also told me that many other customers have complained for similar problem. As per Customer care Its Design related problem and Motorola observed this problem after launch only. When talking with customer care to replace my mobile i got answer that even new phone will also have same problem as their is no solution to this problem yet. They just give me verbal assurance that this problem wont repeat again and if repeat i have to again tell them and register the problem and it will be resolved. Its hard to believe that company like Motorola which has achieved 6 sigma level quality level can also have such big design failure in their very newly launched product. Before buying Moto G i was using Nokia E71 from 4 years and i was delighted with performance. I purchased Moto G just to upgrade myself to Android. It took more than 1 year for me choose good android phone. I side line all companies like Samsung, LG, Sony and purchased Motorola G but this problem had completely ruined brand image of Motorola from my mind. 
 
I am very worried if i would face same problem in future.

I will highlight a few points for the potential future buyers of MOTO G:- 
 
1. The phone is lightning fast and excellent in terms of multitasking. You don't see a lag ever.

3. You get the whole google apps package and 50 gb storage for 2 years on google drive.

Coming to the strong and weak points:- 
 
Strong Points: 
1) 1.2 Ghz Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 Quad Core Processor (high end performance with max. battery utilisation) 
2) Stock Android 4.4.2 Kitkat (Google's android best experience in such a low budget) 
3) Gorilla Glass 3 (only phone in this price segment to offer gorilla glass 3) 
4) 4.5&quot; 720p screen (better than 1080p screens of micromax, lava, karbonn, etc. and also it is perfectly &quot;ergonomic&quot; screen which means it just simply fits so easily and feels comfortable in your hands) 
5) 1 GB RAM (more than enough to handle multitasking environment) 
6) Adreno 305 GPU (without any lag it gives you opportunity to play high end games) 
7) Dual Sim (No need to carry 2 different phones) 
8) 50 GB free google drive space for 2 years (cloud is the future!!!) 
9) 2070 MAh battery (with mixed usage it gives you 24 hours of usage) 
10) 5 MP rear, 1.3 MP front camera (i don't know why people are saying that camera of Moto G is bad, but the truth is that its 5 MP is actually &quot;5 MP&quot; not like 8,10,13,15,20 MP of micromax like companies which's camera quality is too bad) 
11) Wifi, Bluetooth, 3G-2G, Micro USB, GPS, proximity, accelerometer, ambient light, hall effect,magnetometer sensors) 
 
Weak Points:- 
1) 16 GB mass storage with no expandable slot (it may sounds low to some people but for a user like me 16 GB is more enough) 
2) Non-removable battery (If you travel a lot and does not have the time to charging your phone, then this may be a pain for you, otherwise no problem a for a customer who resides only at a particular place) 
 
Verdict:- 
Look no further ahead, go and grab moto G. There's no other phone in this price point which can match the user experience on moto GMotorola rocks!!!.The very first manufacturer of portable telecommunication device has proved it again that its engineering is working very well and is set to make a mark once again. Thanks to the new #motog. 
Have been using this phone for 3 days now, my first andriod phone. I have been waiting for a true &quot;smart&quot; phone and this one fits the bill perfectly. There are phones for the classes and there are ones for the masses, this one is for the people who are looking for good andriod experience and make use of the phone for all kinds of purpose without worrying too much about the nice-ifs-and-buts. This one makes sense to me. 
Goods - 
1. Excellent display - have been using iPad and this one is no less than compared to it. 
2. The display size is just right enough to pack all the contents. iPhone 4 was a little short on this space. 
3. Touch experience is same as my iPad. 
4. Sound quality is hmmm .. acceptable, as compared to my iPad. 
5. &quot;Assist&quot; app makes a lot of sense. 
6. Performance - so far so good no sluggishness. 
7. Screen orientation is fast and as expected. 
8. The flip cover itself has a sort of grip so dont go for buying extra grip cover. 
9. The weight of the phone feels just right, chances of slipping off hands of people with short fingers is less. 
10. Batterry - I must say I am impressed. Lasts 1.5 days with buzzing activity (sans gaming). makes sense to me as I am more of a business user. 
11. Google now is a wow. Updates of your interest are pretty handy. 
12. Data usage reporting is very good and handy - per application consumption is a pretty cool feature. 
Not so goods - 
1. The sales package does not include a micro USB cable need to buy it extra :-(. 
2. Copy paste has to be learned and takes a bit of time to do so. 
3. Camera quality is ok for a 5 MP one, but I think moto could have done it a bit better. 
4. Opening the back cover is - ufff ... some task man !!! 
5. Cannot expand the memory - flip side - you have dropbox and 2 yrs free gdrive - will consume ur data plan bandwidth. 
6. A little sluggish when you switch between camera and any other app, but try blinking in between and you wont notice it ;-). 
 
Consluding verdit - 
Thumbs up !!! 
Value for money !!! 
For first-timer-andriods who are not mobile phone obsessed.Moto G orgeous.The more I'm using this device the more I'm falling in love wit.Build quality is next to none and so is the battery back up.I charged the battery for 6 hrs before using it.The screen is bright,has good black levels and Color Reproduction. Touch is great no lag experienced till now.The phones hardware is properly integrated with the software and it shows. 
 
A little bit of customization is required like disabling useless apps ,getting a file manager , a cleaner , the MX player pro etc etc and you are set. 
 
Coming to the sound quality it is on the attacking side slightly (lil less emotional) but without being bright, aggressive or too forward sounding but pretty detailed with reference buds like the Sleek Audio SA6 and Klipsch Custom 3.Testing it on my AKG 701/Sony MDR SA5000 is uncalled for here,since we all will be generally using earbuds.They have a lot of drive and can can drive even Reference Earbuds to its Comfort Zone,lots of current it has and yes it dosnt loose focus or breath.The sound quality is good open and airy and will suit mostly all genres. 
 
Now for gaming, games starting from DD2,MC4 to RR3 are crisp with graphic detail on screen and I didnt experience no lag at all except GTA SA, which is laggy on max settings only.So a Great device for the money. 
 
The Camera is pretty good with low light shots with the flash on,its not at all that bad as it is being made out be by some folks,its not DSLR good but heck why should it be.I would rate the camera very DECENT for the money.I'm yet come across a a 12.6K Android phone doing low light so good apart from the Windows based Lumias. 
 
Why not 5 stars ooh..I would have loved if the screen was 5inch and 1080p,and the camera a bit faster in focussing and lees noisy without flash! Nitpicking? Hell Yes!!! Thats a lot to ask at this price.

An affordable and well built mobile which everyone can rely on.My Experience of Moto G after a Month.First of all, hats off for the motorola and google team. Brilliant Job Done ! There are many reviews which are already available about the quality so wont talk much about it. 
 
I want to keep the review simple and straight forward. 
 
1) It is a phone for those who are tired of using the large screens and two hands. Yes, the reason I assumed this because many of those have shifted from their Galaxy Notes and other Phablets. Needless to say, I am one of them and I am loving it. 
 
2) Its blazing fast. Stock rom works absolutely like a charm. Havent lagged even once till date. If any app is giving you trouble, uninstall it completely (clear the cache too), and reinstall it. It will work perfect. 
 
3) I keep my GPS on battery saving mode as i really like to use the google now functionality to the fullest. And yes, it sails through the day with a single charge. I am left with around 21% by 10:00 PM (I start my day by 08:00 am). This includes gaming, emails and surfing in moderation. 
 
4) The screen is vibrant and due to a smaller size (0.5&quot; less) the pixel density makes it quite readable and easy to keep it handy to search stuff. 
 
Cons: 
 
1) Got a large thumb so yes, typing at times gets tedious. So I have to rely on Google Voice or Swype (Swift flow). However, I have lot of words now stored in the dictionary so for me, its now a bit easy. For typing long emails, I use bluetooth keyboard. 
 
2) Reading something which is not responsive. But That should not be a problem if you use softwares like POCKET. I use it to store something which I want to read. It simply converts it into responsive format for me.Great Product! Total Value for Money..This is my review after using the phone for more than a month. 
 
Why is the Moto G awesome? 
1. The cost (Rs. 13999) 
2. Quad core processor makes multi tasking a breeze. 
3. 1 gb ram is enough for great multimedia viewing, web browsing, office based application uses and almost all other apps except games (though the moto g performs quite awesome when it comes to high performance games, but 2 gb is something which is well suited for games, making loading faster and games are lag free) 
4. The display quality is great! 
5. Battery life is great (you have to set the display to auto, and enable the battery saver option, the phone will last you a day with heavy usage (this does not include video calls) ) 
6. Great Build quality 
7. the loudspeaker is great, crisp, clear and decently loud 
8. the headphones are amazing, the sound quality is great! 
 
What is not so awesome about the Moto G? 
1. Good front and rear camera, a bit disappointing in low light, but manageable. 
2. the charger takes a lot of time it is a 550mA charger if you purchase a 750mA charger, it would work well. 
3. no data cable is provided with the phone. 
 
To sum it up, I loved the phone and I would highly recommend it.Great Phone, Great Service, Lucky Me!.I was amoung the lucky few (sorry to all the unlucky guys out there) who ordered the 16gb 
version on launch day, before it went out of stock again. I ordered at 12.30pm and recieved it the next day (today), before 12.00pm; less than 24hrs from order to delivery, Flipkart hats off to you guys, shocked me this time, i enjoyed the service.:) 
 
I think its important to get the 16gb version, as by the time I installed the necessary apps and imported photos, music and few videos from the old phone (about 4gb), i have only 7gb remaining., so if this was an 8gb model, it'd be full already. but if your gonna use more of the cloud, then this is not a problem for you, but this phone is for my dad, and dads dont like to be on the cloud, so do keep that in mind if your considering the 8gb version. 
 
About the phone: 
As many have mentioned, its a great phone at a great price. Good specs, very fluid, almost a nexus device at this price point, which is amazing. Build quality is really good, feels very premium actually, simple and clean. 
 
Its not suprise this phone will do great, ill explain: 
 
1.Front completly covered in gorilla glass 3, no need for screen gaurds or worry about scratches. 
 
2.Back case is replaceble, so no need of a protective case, when it gets worn out, just replace the case. 
 
3.Screen resolution is really good, HD screen on a 4.5&quot; screen, very rare in this price range. No noticable difference when compared to a Full HD screen either. 
 
4.Good specs, will play most if not all games, for the gamers out there. Will scroll, load, and run smoothly, like any premium android. Thumbs up here too..:) 
 
5.Camera 5mp, is quite good, snappy and clear, wont beat my lumia, but definitely worth the price.:) Front cam is good too. 
 
6.Best part of all is the price. Sure there may be other indian made droids, which are cheaper out there, but I being a person who dosent have the time to do my research and find out if they're really worth it; I would gladly invest my money in a brand that is known for good build quality. 
 
7.The UI is almost stock, other than the exclusive moto apps, it looks just like my nexus7 out of the box. 
 
8.Battery should be good, moto claims a full day, i dint have the time to check it, but im sure itl last atleast 24 hours. 
 
With all these boxes ticked, its already clear, why this phone would sell like crazy in India. 
I cant find any cons as of now.

Well, once you see the specification, you know it is a steal in this price. 1 GB RAM and Gorilla glass!!! 
Here is something that can't be get from spec - 
 - Sturdy Build. You will love it in your hand. Perfect size to hold in hand. 
 - Very very good battery backup. It says 24 hrs mixed use, But I got 48 hrs with 50% time WiFi on, music, call, video, gaming. 
 - Camera is good. From spec you can't understand the quality, but I got fairly good pictures. 
 - Earphone given with the set is average quality. You may want to bye a good one if you are a music lover. 
 - Currently it is shipped with 4.4.2, I got one with Jelly Bean and upgraded. There was some report (or rumor?) that dual SIM is not working with 4.4.2, but I didn't face any such problem. But there is a issue with graphics in the update, sometimes you can not see any test or menu, it all goes black, but it is been generally overcame in few seconds. Wish Motorola will fix this soon. 
 - With the USB OTG feature, which is great, I may have found an issue that when you remove an USB device, it continues to show &quot;media disconnected&quot; in notification, that only goes away with a UI service restart or after restating the phone. 
 - There is very very rare lagging after long gaming. Performance is great.

Built Quality - 9.5/10(Strong and sturdy body coupled with GG3. It doesn't deserve any less) 
Display - 10/10(The best +point about this phone! 720p resolution with 329ppi density in a 4.makes the colours vivid,crisp and good viewing angles even under sunlight)

Battery - 9/10(The 2070mAh battery has some serious juice and gives really long backup when needed the most) 
Gaming - 10/10(Thanks to its powerful Adreno 305 GPU bundled with 1GB RAM, there isn't any game in the playstore which lags in Moto G. CONCLUSION- Ignoring its 16GB limited memory, Moto G eliminates every competition especially in that price range. The only close substitute in this price range is the Xperia M(which has a dual core 1Ghz processor and eventhough it has expandable memory,You can't transfer the apps 2 sd card) and between the two, one would buy the Xperia M if he is a Sony fan and is scared of getting better features in that price range.

MOTO IS COLLABORATED WITH GOOGLE. UI OF MOTO G IS USER FRIENDLY. RESOLUTION AND SOUND QUALITY IS GOOD. BATTERY BACK UP IS ALSO GOOD. THANKS FLIPKART TEAM FOR YOUR SERVICESMilestone Smartphone (3/5 for the average camera, 5/5 for everything else).A review after a month of torturous usage. This is a smartphone that ups the bar for everything that is to come in the future. This does to the smartphone industry what the nexus smartphones did when it got first released. 
Better than Nexus 4 in all respects (except camera). Far better than anything Samsung can build at any price range, even better than Samsung S5. 
The only smartphones better than this in most aspects are: Moto X, Nexus 5, iPhone 5, HTC One. Everyone of these are premium smartphones. Sony lags behind because of it's bloated OS and hence below par user experience. 
 
USER EXP (5/5): Comparable to Nexus 5, Moto X, iphone 5 even. Works like butter. When you use, it works faster than Nexus 5 at times in certain applications (20-30% of times). 
BATTERY (4/5): Bit better than or equal to what you would expect off of a normal smartphone. 4+ hrs of Hi-end gaming with maximum brightness- bluetooth and wifi on- vibration on. 5-6 hrs of gaming with battery saving &amp; low brightness. So expect same or a bit more with movies watching or texting. Normal usage can easily give you min 1 day or even 2 days. No smartphone gets 5/5 in this category. 
BUILD Quality (5/5): Has premium build look to it. Comparable to Nexus, HTC One and even older iPhones. Way better than Samsung. When it comes to Durability, nothing beats Sony, but this performs as much as most phones do may be a bit better. I hate the way it attracts fingerprints, just like iphone. Has Corning Gorilla glass hence no scratches and is also Spill proof- i.e small amount or short span water proof. The advantage is you can wash the phone extend :D 
TIPS: Buy magnetic flip-case, preferably the one supplied by moto even if they are a bit costly. Most phones break when dropped face down on their displays. With magnetic flips, the fall won't damage the glass, mostly even if the flip if open as the flip rotates and slows the phone on fall like a parachute. For extra protection use screen guard (not for scratch) as it prevents glass shatter and reduces it to glass crack and prevents fingerprint and glare to an extend if you have matte finish. 
SOFTWARE (5/5): You run the best Android software Kitkat and it runs like it is running in Nexus 5. Doesn't seem to slow with time. Very rarely, like once a month if you are a person who meddle a lot with the phone, never if you are not, you might get a bug of having boxy fonts. Next update will surely fix that I guess, even if not, it is nothing to worry about. 
HARDWARE (4/5): Awesome configs (1 GB ram and quadcore Snapdragon 400) all around, for any phone less than 20,000 Rs. Indian version offers dual sim, not many phones has that. The signal strength, wifi, bluetooth, etc has no issues ever. Speaker on the back is loud than most phones and clearer than even most phones. Dual sim is a necessary feature which this phone has. No micro SD card slot, so spend extra and buy 16 GB version. Obviously, there is no micro-hdmi port :P (no phones has). Can plug-in bulky headphone jacks (some phones can't coz of bad port placement). Uses only micro-sim (not a problem). 
DISPLAY (5/5): HD. 326 pixels per inch. Better than Nexus 4, Iphone 4s. Beautiful looking, bright enough in maximum brightness, crisp, vivid, etc etc. 
CAMERA (3/5): Usable 1.3mp front camera and 5 mp back camera with flash, HD video recording. Has some nice features like HDR, panorama, Slo mo video. I liked slo mo better than anything else. Performance is on par with anything in this price range. Camera is NOT at all comparable with any phones over 20000 Rs (be it Samsung, Sony, Nexus). There MIGHT be some phones which has better camera under 20,000 Rs. 
PRICE (6/5!!): Every single thing is far better for the price it is being offered in, including the camera. 
 
OTHER mentions: No miracast, i.e can't connect to TV hdmi. Most phones can't, still if you are looking for that feature, this phone too doesn't have it. It does have wifi Hotspot (Yes it has). No 'tell -ok google- to google search' feature in 'Google Now'. I have connected bluetooth HID controller/ gamepad/ joystick and played games with it. 
 
BOTTOMLINE: Buy it blindfolded if you are NOT a 'mobile-phone photographer'. 
If camera is more important than anything else, search, try, and you might find other phones with better camera for less than 20,000 Rs.Great phone.Hi, 
 
I selected Moto G after a lot of comparisons with other models. 
The device is of 16GB memory with dual SIM and came diretcly with 4.4.2 KitKat version. 
Got it delivered by Flipkart the day after it was ordered. Very fast delivery indeed. 
 
The phone is good to use performing as expected, and you may select an 8GB or a 16GB based on your budget and need (read below). There was one issue though that the play store crashed unexpectedly while using for the first few days. 
 
About the combo offers, it is better to read the reviews thoroughly and see how it looks on the device. They may be overpriced and you may find a cheaper one outside. And there are hardly any good quality data cables at Rs.100-200 on Flipkart. 
 
Advantages over other phones: 
 
1. There are local models of Micromax, Xolo, as well as Samsung (S3 mini, Galaxy Core and Quattro) and those of LG (L9 Optimus) available at same price range. 
However, the specifications are better in Moto G at the same price. 
 
2. No heating while talking or charging for a long time or any voice clarity issues. 
 
3. Good battery life at the price range. Easily lasts for 2 days at average usage. 
 
4. Excellent display quality due to higher no.of pixels at 720 x 1280 pixels, 4.5 inches (~326 ppi pixel density). 
 
5. Good 5MP camera quality with 2592 ?? 1944 pixels at this price. 
 
About the cons I heard: 
 
1. No memory card available. This is one big drawback. The makers of this device wanted the user to compensate it with 8GB/16GB memory. Out of the 16GB, 12.92 GB is usable. Hence, we have more app install ability. Unless you do not install big apps of 1GB+ or 500MB, or have lots of data (say around 10GB songs), the 8GB will suffice @Rs.12,500. 
They also give 50GB storage for 2 years on Google Drive. 
 
2. No proper device accessories provided: 
No data cable available. Better try to buy from stores as they would provide better quality ones at less price. The ones on flipkart are not good and I had to apply for return of a Callmate cable at Rs.125 (now Rs. 99). 
The headphones and the charger may be of average build but it is fine to go with it. 
 
3. No 3G Video calling. 
 
4. Camera performance is not as expected in less lightning, but this does not bother much. 
 
5. Gmail required to sync with google account and without this you cannot have all the good features. They provide tips for better usage base on your usage statistics, they have a feature to locate the phone via GPS, and other google features like Google Drive. 
It will also sync contacts with Gmail and will create a Google+ account. 
Contacts not having birthdays and anniversaries entries facility. I read about these in other reviews. 
Using the calendar is also not possible without syncing with some account. Hope there is an update to this soon. 
 
I would rate it 5 stars because of its good deliver-ability and the device matching my expectations.Awesome handset. Awesome UI.. Unparalleled..A little late i am to review but ALL IS WELL :P :D. After 3 weeks of use, my verdict 
 
Pros: Well at this price you cant ask for anything more. The quad core is amazing. Super smooth and the stock Kitkat is just another sign of its purity. It runs games like Asphalt or any high graphics game pretty well. All other processes run really smooth and KitKat's optimization doesnt consume more than 80% of RAM. 
Battery performance is just impeccable. At optimum usage it can last for 1 day 15hrs easily. At full brightness with internet and gaming it runs for 8 hours almost. You cant get any better than this. The memory may not be expandable but for the 16GB you get around 11.9 GB user usable. 
4.5 inch 720P is just a treat to the eyes. 
Also the back panel is changeable so try on ur favourite colour 
 
Cons : Don't like mentioning but for those who have doubts 
Ok this maybe 1 in a million chance, but i got a defective model. The problem was the battery didnt charge to a full 100% rather stopped at 97%. So do check when u buy a new one. 
Camera is not so good but common yaar 14000 mein bacche ki jaan loge kyaa. Memory cant be expanded and you cant add more than 5 screens on the display( launchers can be used for this). Its a tad heavy and sometimes gets heat up easily but when you misuse it.

1.)The receiver will hear our voice somewhat low during call. 
2.)Camera is ok in daylight. Pictures are blur in the night sometimes. 
3.)The Motorola charger is becoming very hot if we charge. 
4.)I can&rsquo;t answer the incoming call by Samsung headphones using the call answer button on the headphone (I have to manually swipe the screen for answering the call and use the headphones.).It works fine with Motorola headphones. 
5.)You can&rsquo;t delete single message. But you can delete the whole message conversation.

7.)There is no NFC and no external memory card (12.9GB inbuilt for 16GB version) .You can&rsquo;t connect it to an TV via HDMI cable.It's a little miracle!.What this nice and solid piece of technology tells you is that perception without knowledge is useless in this era. When you hear people saying that a Motorola's phone can't be good and that they must be cheating or doing something wrong to offer this remarkably able phone at the price that they are offering, you can't help but to imagine how wrong people's perception can be. When they mindlessly buy every piece of crap a mass duplicator and soulless Samsung produces, it baffles me how easily in fact Samsung or any other android powered phone makers cheat us. 
 
If a company, as supposedly outdated as Motorola, can come up with the absolute benchmark of a phone at a price point so lower than what these companies are selling for years, it begs a simple question : why would you buy anything else? 
 
I won't get into specs as you can, in your right mind, read them here without prejudice. I'll say two things though: 
1. If you want to click pictures and share via Whatsapp or Facebook (very few know that all the pictures are anyway going to be miserably downsized in both of them) Moto G won't disappoint you one bit as in regular lighting it'll take really crisp pictures. If you want to click even better pictures you might as well simply buy a point and shoot camera which will come at half the price of Moto G. My point, you don't judge phones on how they capture photos. There are way more important tasks. 
 
2. The most outstanding feature of this phone is its display. Crisp, beautiful and saturated. With PPI close to iPhone 4/4s's retina display, you can't expect anything better at this price point. It's just superb and I think laymen just don't give the required importance to displays on phones, which effectively affects everything you do on phones. 
 
Lastly the only blemish I have is that with such a powerful heart inside, Moto should've done something in the widgets department. Would've been even more sweet.

Sunil NairBest Phone in the Price Basket of less than 20000.I have been now using this phone for nearly a month. I have downloaded and installed more than 140+ apps. I have also played &quot;high end graphic requirement&quot; games. For most of these games it plays and navigates through it with ease. For the price basket of less than 20000, it is a beast. Excellent touch response, zero or negligible lag even when you run as many as 7 to 8 applications at a time. Great call quality. Supports upto HSPA network(which is greater than 3G). Excellent browsing experience. My phone also fell couple of times also got considerably wet in rain, still delivered like a beast. No complaints except that it has no support for 4G LTE(which you should not be worried if you are in India, as most cities dont have it yet) and that you have to reduce the graphic quality to medium when playing games like Asphalt 8 and other really very heavy system consuming games. Other wise, hands down, the best mobile in the price basket. Definitely not a Nexus flagship, but comes pretty close(actually close enough). Also Motorola and Google have promise consistent updates. So no worries there either. 
I am going with a 4 out of 5, knowing that Nexus 5 is still a better phone, but it comes at more than double the price.Moto G - Best phone in the Price Range - 'Moto Migrate' is a deal clincher.To even think that Google did not give the Moto G and Moto X enough to breathe before yanking them off their product range, makes me think if Google was even committed to making a good product. But trust me when I say this, the Moto G even though is a slightly toned down version of the Moto X is not meerkat amongst wolves. It is in fact the other way around, it is the wolf amongst the meerkats. 
Take any other device in its price range and stack it up against the Moto G and you'd be happy to see that the brand that invented the cellular phone is back with a bang and here to stay. The Moto G (16GB variant) has no frills attached and comes with the bare minimum accessories - Charger adaptor (no USB data cable), Headphones (sad one to be honest) and the papers. 
One of the biggest hurdles in front of someone looking to move from an older Android phone to a new one is being able to port over all content onto the new device. There have been several cheezy attempts at this process and some companies have tried slipping in their own branded suites for the same. They have failed miserably until now. I have used and helped others use a good dozen odd android devices in the past few years. This used to be a huge problem. 
Enter 'Moto Migrate', a magical app that needs to be installed on the other device too and with a simple enough process of scanning a QR code on the new device (or older) you are smiling away to mobile data migration NIRVANA. Moto Migrate should be the default app for all android-android data migration. It is pure magic! Overall I have no regrets in having bought this decvice for my wife and the best part is, I sold an expensive older device and now have some cash lying around for us to spend after buying this one. Tell me fairy tales don't happen... 
 
Regards,

I guess they saved that bit for the Moto G 2.

The call quality &amp; touch screen sensitivity could have been better. 
 
If you aren't going to take a lot of photographs from this device, or you have another device to do that job for you (in my case my 808 stands in), then by all means, get the Moto G. 
 
I'm going with 4 out of 5 for the Motorola Moto G, would have given it 5, but took out one star because of issues with the first 2 handsets received, and also because of the camera.

Miracast is preinstalled (Cast Screen under display settings)

All in all this phone is amazing nad for the price and I seriously doubt that you could do better (check out the drop tests, underwater test, and driven over by a car test on youtube. You'll see what I mean)

- Battery performance also the same and I found little improvements.Best Android Experience but weird battery issue.Moto G is the definitely the best phone at the price point. 720p screen is great and performance is decent. 
 
Btw, one of the reason to write this review was the battery issue. Moto G does not have reserved battery power to ensure that the phone charges when the phone ran out of the juice. Typically, when the phone battery dies, it still has enough juice to recognize the phone is being charged. However, Moto G does not have that because of which the phone does not turn on if the phone ran out of juice. Not matter how many hours you charge your phone, it will not turn on. Motorola is aware of the issue and here is the troubleshoot if you guys face similar issue: 
 
1. Hold the VOL DOWN key 
2. While still holding the VOL DOWN key, press and hold the POWER key 
Hold both keys down for over 120 seconds. This is more than two minutes and will seem like a long time. You might want to time yourself to make sure you hold it longer than two minutes. 
3.After holding the keys down for more than two minutes, release them. 
 
The Flash Boot screen will display, and the Normal Reboot option will be highlighted 
Press the VOL UP key and the device will start a normal reboot.SO FAR... SO GOOOD...!!!!!.I read many reviews on FLIPKART before buying this phone. I would want to return the compliment by giving my own review to help others to make a decision like i did.

All new phones with new hardware and software perform well at first but the real thing is how it does after a year or so. This i think is a bang for the buck. Really good phone to buy if you are looking for a performing phone with low cost. 
 
Only problem which i'm facing right now is the call quality/slight network issues like signal detection sometimes very low. It is not really good but not bad either. Kinda normal/above average call quality. If you residing in an area where tower/signal strength is low then i would recommend you should go for service provider like Airtel.

The limitations are : no external storage, no NFC and no 4G. 
 
I believe the prices you see on back covers and flip covers are already 70% discounted, try checking the prices on the US websites. 
 
Benefits we are getting from buying in India - charger, headphones, dual sim. In the US version you dont even get these. 
 
I did see other Indian brand cell phones with better specs for the same price range in website smartprix but you have the see the benchmark results in the website fonearena to know what you are really paying for and where this phone stands among its higher priced international competitors.

Here's my test: 
I was on a phone call, was typing a conversation on skype, was receiving pings over whatsapp, while a game was being installed through the App Store, and I had Gmail, Chrome and Hangouts running in background. I minimize, switch to Gmail, archive mails, switch to whatsapp, respond to friends, switch to browser and browse through the tabs, and literally no waiting time while doing any of it!

Verdict: If you're waiting to buy it, do not wait anymore.Great phone.Using the phone for slightly over a month. Overall very satisfied. 
 
Pros: 
1. Great display. Very sharp and quite bright. 720p is probably ideal resolution for phones. No point in 1080p which will drain battery faster and require faster GPU to run games. Sharpness wise I can't notice the difference (compared with friend's nexus 5). 
2. Very fast - almost zero lag. This is probably the biggest difference I noticed coming from Lg optimus 2X. 
3. Never crashes or hangs. 
4. Camera is good for taking photos in daylight. The HDR option makes the colors look great. 
5. USB OTG works out of the box even with KitKat update without any rooting or installing third party apps. 
6. Great built quality. Feels nice to hold. 
7. Good enough battery life. I am not a very heavy user so the phone lasts almost two days with WIFI on and few apps like gmail, facebook, whatsapp, and another mail running in background all the time. This is a big improvement from my old LG optimus 2X that used to last just half a day with wifi on and the same apps running. 
8. Gorilla Glass 3. No need to put any screen guard and no worry about scratches. Have been using the LG optimus 2X (which had gorilla glass 1) for about 3 years without any screen gaurd and there is not a single scratch - which means gorilla glass really works. It also means I handle my phone with care :-). This is the biggest advantage over local brand phones (like XOLO and Micromax). 
 
Cons: 
1. No micro SD slot. I don't use dual SIM so it would have been great if they had a micro-SD slot instead of the second SIM. 
2. Non-removable battery. Not sure what will happen when the battery dies and need to be replaced. My another concern was what to do if the phone hangs (I am coming from LG optimus 2X which frequently hangs), but so far it has never hanged even once so that is not really a problem. 
3. Display is almost perfect but has a slight bluish tinge. This is not a major issue - many online reviews have also pointed out this problem. 
4. Camera performance in low light is poor. Worse than my old phone (Lg Optimus 2X). 
5. Average battery life with WIFI turned off. Turning wifi off doesn't seem to improve battery life much. Still lasts for only two days. My LG optimus 2X (with rooted ROM/kernel) used to last for almost 4 days. 
 
Despite all cons, I would still rate this phone 5/5 as it's priced at half of what high end phones cost and the differences are very minor. 
 
People would compare with local brand phones which have similar specs and priced about the same (or even slightly cheaper), but in my opinion the screen quality and gorilla glass protection easily makes the moto g the best phone in this price range.Not bad as well as not good :).Received the device today.

The earphones provided with the box are below average ( Its better not to use them) 
There is no data cable as well. 
All in all its slightly better than Samsung galaxy S Duos 2. Display - Puts my sony zr to shame 
 
Camera - Outdoor and Indoor (with lighting) is really good. Only if you zoom the pictures do you realise that sony has a better camera but in regular viewing this wins hands down 
 
Responsiveness - Awesome ...butter smooth 
 
Memory ...got around 12.75 Gb out of 16GB so not bad(dont even think of buying 8GB) 
Would have preffered a external memory slot (mainr eason i bought sony over htc) but for wifeys usage it is enough and now lot of CLOUD storage is there...Dropbox is the best app...period 
 
Moto Migrate - The Best ...software to transfer all your existing andriod data from another fone.... Just download the software in your old phone and scan the QR code...Viola ....everything is transffered within minutes...This feature is awesome...Butter Smooth...Take a break...kit kat break :) in the meanwhile 
 
Rest am awaiting for a micro sim and hence cant say but at nearly half the price of Xperia ZR and smiliar models it is toooo good to resistA Great Moto After A Long Time.I am writing my review after using this brand new Moto G after a week. I am a tech and this is an accurate review. 
 
Display 
Wonderful display that produsupe thrb colors. The display is very bright eed. The touch is super responsive. It packs a nice Corning Gorilla Glass which really works. I dropped it waist high by accident and not even a scratch. Amusing display. The images are razor sharp with an excellent PPI. 
 
Processor and performance 
The phone breezes on android KitKat which came out of the box for me. The phone is very responsive though the multitasking between gravy apps is a little sluggish. Web browsing is speedy using Chrome and pinching and refreshing is smooth. The 1Gb ram is sufficient for the daily functioning. 
 
Camera 
The camera is 5 MP but don't go by megapixels as the camera is fast with a great interface and decent quality. It did excellent in day light shots and is okay in night shots. Slow motion video is a cool feature. 
 
Battery 
A 2070MaH battery is amazing. It can't be removebeaindeed do you even want to? It has a large battery backup that is the best in class. No regrets about the battery as the phone lasted me for the whole day on 2G and little Wi-Fi. The phone still had 10% to go. 
 
Android KitKat 
The phone looks beautiful indeed thanks to the stock KitKat experience. The phone will mostly get the fastest updates. Even though Lenovo bought Moto, this phone is still A Made By Google amazing phone. 
 
Must buy. Don't fall for Canvas Magnus or any other phone for the same price. This phone packs the right punch of amazing specs. Buy it with confidence!

had problems in all these make with the memory card slotDelightful &amp; Must have Mobile.First of All to all waiting &amp; worried buyers. I've booked 16 GB model on 08.02.14 and got the delivery on 18.02.14 i.e. exactly after 10 days. So Flipkart delivered as promised 
 
Now about phone. There are lots of reviews available on net &amp; FK parsing this phone and it does live up to the expectations and price. By now everyone knows the plus points of this phone. 
Display and hardware are excellent and handset look is also premium. Anyone will be proud owner of this handset. 
 
Now some cons of this phone. 
Though it has 4.4 (Kitkat update). Still the Touch flow and customized OS 4.3 on Samsung mobiles is much better compared to MOTO G. 
There are some minor features and widget customization missing on this phone. e.g. one has to link all the contacts manually for multiple accounts like Google, Facebook, Microsoft exchange. Each contact needs to be edited in order to join them. One plus point though it doesn't have the limitation of 5 or less contacts for joining. 
The small but popular widgets on Samsung mobiles like calender/ weather/ speed dial are missing. (Though they are available on Play store). 
 
 Overall a best phone @ Rs. 14K and worth the waiting period of 10-20 days.Best budget phone,and it really packs a punch!.First of all thank you Flipkart for speedy delivery and good packaging even amidst such demand for this product. 
I fell in love with the phone as soon as i placed it on my hand. It felt so comfortable and felt much like a premium product than a budget phone. 
 
Pro's 
&gt;Very high quality processor and GPU which can multitask and render high end games without any lag whatsoever. 
&gt;1GB RAM 
&gt;Awesome build quality 
&gt;Corning Gorilla Glass 3 protection 
&gt;Very good HD display 
&gt; Awesome battery life 
&gt;Android 4.4.2 Kitkat update 
&gt;Motorola assist app which transfers all the data from your old phone to the new one. 
&gt;I live in a region where the network coverage is low,but after buying Moto G there seems to be no such problem. 
&gt;50GB Google Drive storage space for 2 years. 
 
Cons 
&gt;Camera is decent but not exceptional( PS:It is just a budget phones,they had to sacrifice something) 
&gt;Default camera app is not that good,you can find plenty of third party apps from the play Store. 
&gt;Non-removable battery (Battery life is exceptional but if you are a sort of guy who keeps 2 batteries with you for emergencies it is not possible with this product) 
 
All in all Moto G is the BEST Smartphone in this price range,and it can be compared to Nexus 4 and Galaxy S3 in terms of performance,both of which are priced much higher.Moving from Blackberry to this was the best decision.Influenced by a lot of users who own a Samsung Galaxy series phone, dad had his eyes on the Grand 2, after finally seeing that people are moving away from Blackberrys and moving on to Android. It was just in time when the Moto G was launched and reading on all the reviews posted on the internet, I was sure that this is THE phone to buy him. The phone is just about the right size and the screen is pretty good. Sure, using the iPhone 4S myself, I was expecting the camera to be not as good as the 4S, but the camera quality seemed to be OK with dad, but definitely not with me. The Touch screen experience was not new to him (He used a BB 9700, which was a touch-and-type phone), but did take a while to get used to. He was amazed at the number of useful apps on Google Play and his contacts, etc did not take too long to be sync'd with Google and magically appearing the moment he finished setting up the phone 
 
I am sure this has been said hundreds of times earlier, and even I think that this is the best VFM phone with the specs 'that matter' as opposed to other manufacturers who want to play the numbers game.

Moto's website says there is a service center in Vashi, but Moto after sales service has never been triedBest phone in this range.First of all this review is about the phone only ,as far as flipkart services are concerned the product was delivered with in 5 days of purchase in good packing and logistics services were just fine 
Now the product: 
1) Build: The build is firm and smooth the screen has corning gorilla glass 3 making it scratch proof and shiny ,but beware the screen can get broken if directly falls on hard material otherwise the responsiveness and display is excellent,the back has hard plastic cover of motorola design which feels premium and a bit hard to take out 
 
2)Display; 720p HD display is excellent and works almost at all viewing angles,the 4.5 screen is big enough for a hard core user like me in this price range from a trusted brand. 
 
3)Hardware: 1.2 GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 Quad Core Processor and 1 GB RAM work together to make this product perform very well,in fact I did not expect such a smooth performance from this budget phone ,multitasking,gaming ,working on apps is better ,though at times some lags do occur and pinch to zoom in browsing does give a bit of glitch but that's ignorable considering overall price tag and specs. 
 
4) Software: perhaps the best thing about being an ex-Google company ,motorola moto g has got software's updates at first place with the likes of nexus 5,android 4.4.2 kitkat has lower requirements thus making the phone operations smooth and just,along with that the battery performance is very good lasting a full day for a hardcore user with lots of gaming ,3g internet and calls. 
 
5) Camera: 5 MP Primary Camera and 1.3 MP Secondary Camera,if you are expecting performance of camera similar to the performance of phone get ready to get disappointed,very poor camera it doesn't behave like a 5 mp shooter,the interface is OK but picture quality is below average specially those of indoor pictures, and video recording is almost average

Finally Moto G scores 7.7 out of 10.Reasons to buy this and not.The phone indeed is the most rated by professionals... 
The most appealing in this phone is what you get out of the box at this price... 
 
Really, Although this phone really looks appealing in the specs sheet, I found this phone more appealing in some other ways. 
- Slow motion video recording, a feature in IOS7 camera OS 
- Moto assist and Migrate. The migrate helped me in transferring the whole data from my old phone, including account details, contacts, etc etc within seconds. 
- The Kitkat OS, fluid, no need install any other Launchers.The quick launching of camera, Lockscreen widgets, Battery saving Navigation and Location are just awesome! 
- The sturdy body of this phone is really impressive. Unlike the plastics used by other brands, Moto uses plastic with some quality... 
-Nano coating over hardware components which makes this chap resistant from Splash 
- Corning Gorilla glass 3 makes it smash + scratch resistant..(saves you some bucks from Screenguard) 
-Auto brightness controller, which lacks in most of the other phones in this price range.. 
- 328 PPI display ~ Iphone 5S 329 PPI, even with larger screen! Impressive 
 
Reasons for not buying: 
These are really minor reasons (the unexpandable memory is not really an issue) but 
- does not support 4G LTE (for us in India, even 3G is not available in most of the areas) 
- The camera is 5mp, though takes impressive images in daylight. 
- Sound quality when on loudspeaker is not so good, but okay...( is really loud) but on headset, the speaker is the best in class.. 
 
 Verdict: 
- Moto G is a device often compared with high end models in terms specs...even it fails with flagship phones, when it comes in usage, specs don't really matter...(eg: 1gb in Moto G does its job beautifully)...It smooth, flawless, swift for daily use to HD gaming..I swear. It runs Asphalt 8, Fifa 14 without any lag.Go for it! A bang for the buck...Expectional Phone.First of all, Thanks for Flipkart for delivering in less than 2 days of ordering. Now coming to phone, one of the awesome phone ever to come with that prize bracket. Nice build design along with Gorilla glass which is very rugged and smooth sharp display. The Power and Volume button are little bumped, but that's ok. Sound clarity is good. Music plays pretty smooth. 
 
I know that there has been many talking about the camera in this phone. But when i first took pics from this phone i was suprised by the quality of the pics taken in well lit conditions. The pics came very good. The only problem is that the pics doesnt come good when taken in moderately lit condition or at night. 
 
My Phone came with Kitkat pre-installed. Kit kat runs buttery smooth. No lag and no delays. I have some problem now and then with the default caller app.Other than that everything runs smooth. 
 
Another important drawback with this phone is the restriction of only 16GB memory. 
 
When you consider what you get against what you lose, then phone is definitely a steal for the money that you are paying. 
 
My first phone was Motorola and now my 3rd one is Motorola again. Hope to see few more great motorola phone in the market when they work alongside Lenovo.The best budget phone I've ever used..So, I bought this phone on the 19th of april and flipkart delivered it by the 21st, for which I love them. 
I opened the box and registered the product and all, but soon came to realize that it had a screen problem, the phone was tending to have GHOST touches which really bugged me. i contacted motorola support who suggested that I give the phone to a service center, but instead I contacted flipkart for a replacement. They did a hand to hand replacement within the next few days and till now I have not had a single problem with the phone. 
Coming to the pros and cons:- 
Pros- 
1. A quad core processor, ensures a smooth response. 
2. 1gb ram adds to the flow. 
3. 4.4 KitKat update that provides better battery life and a smoother phone. 
4. 5MP cam which is enough for good photographs. 
5. A minimalistic notification light, helps to know unread and pending notifs. 
Cons- 
1. Does not have and special features like the MOTO X. 
2. A bit heavier. 
3. Not a very good battery life. 
4. some of the products suffer from bugs. 
In the end I would suggest all those looking for a budget phone to go for this, and do not hesitate to contact flipkart if you have a problem. they are very kind and patient people and will help you out as much as they can. I have not found such exceptional service from any other online or offline stores.Light, Fast and Awesome.Bought this after a lot of people recommended it to be the best android phone on the market at that price range. Although was put under the waiting list, was surprised to receive it in 5 days. The phone is very smooth yet handy, very light weight when compared to other phones, and meets all expectations upon a smart phone. 
 
The experience is quite fast though scrolling is slow at times. Limited with only 16gigs of storage (actually around 13 gigs usable), I am pretty choosy on the apps I install. Though the reviews keep your expectations low for the camera, it is not that bad at all. The audio is quite good though am yet to try out the headphones. 
 
Overall, if you are looking at the 15k price range, will not need to carry a lot of stuffs on the mobile or use hundreds of apps, this is the best smart phone you could ever buy. 
 
Update: After using it for nearly a month, the main problem with this phone is the battery/charging. I have to charge it twice a day, though i usually end up charging ~80% every time. At 14k, this is pretty much the best phone that you can buy, considering that the other phones that fall within this range are Xolo, Micromax, and the really bad Samsungs and HTCs. 
 
The packaging is ultra-minimalist. The Indian box comes with the wall charger and a cheap headset. But who's looking at all that, it's the phone that matters. And it is S.L.E.E.K. The matte back cover is a nice touch. Takes a bit of wrestling to get it off the first time. Then you'll figure out that it becomes much easier if you press down on the Moto Dimple. 
 
The phone feel a tiny bit heavy in the hand, and the cam is not all that great, in-fact it's very limited. And the phone doesn't really respond to &quot;Ok Google&quot; because of the limited processor. But at again, at 14k, I'm totally cool with it. Moto have wisely stayed away from customizing the Android experience, too much. In fact, it almost feels like a Nexus. The customizations stay pretty much out of sight. And with the KitKat upgrades that are now rolling out, this awesome phone becomes even more awesome. Oh, forgot to mention the REALLY loud speakers. 
 
Best thing I like about the MotoG: The display. Colours just pop out, and the black is really Black. And that's the first thing that everyone notices about my phone when they try it out. &quot;Wow, the display is really nice.&quot; is something I've heard a lot in the past few weeks. 
 
Motorola Migrate makes it super easy to move from your old phone to the Moto G. It comes pre installed in this. Just get it from your app store, and follow the instructions. It connects both the phones over an adhoc WiFi connection and transfers whatever it is that you want to transfer.

It have 4.5 inch HD Display with 329ppi resolution. So you can see the screen clearly even in the direct sunlight. It can play 720p videos and even 1080p videos can be played in MX player. 
 
With hangout you can message or you can make video call using hangout or skype. But you don't have 3g video calling option using mobile network. 
 
All high graphics games will be supported in this phone. Even high graphics games are being played without any lag at all. 
 
Adreno 305 gpu, 1.2Ghz snapdragon 400 Quad core processor makes the phone butter smooth. 
 
It has 5mp rear camera and 1.3mp front camera. It has HDR mode. Camera is decent but not as perfect as Samsung's 5mp camera clarity. 
 
It has 2070mAh battery which will last long up to 24 hours. So no problem to charging the phone often. 
 
Short key for restarting the phone: 
1.Power button + Volume up key 
Short key for Screenshot of the mobile's present screen: 
2.Power button + volume down key. 
 
If you want flipcover or backcover you can buy that also But Flipcover and back covers are costly and it is made up of plastic not looks like the black back cover provided with the mobile. 
 
It has coring gorilla glass 3 so you don't have to worry about the scratches. But Extra protection will be recommended. If you want a bubble free premium screen guard then go for gadgetshieldz website and 
 Select Screen Protection option in it. The Screen guard price is Rs.399 but use this coupon code &quot;adw20&quot; to get this at a reduced price of Rs.319. 
 
But I have some Network and Connectivity issue. 
So I asked for a Replacement from Flipkart they provided me the replacement. I'm really happy with that. Thanks to Flipkart.

But other than this the mobile is worth buying.Absolutely Amazing Phone!.At the outset, this phone is simply stunning. I have had it for the past 4 days now, and the experience has been truly satisfying. As far as the phone performance goes, it exceeds expectations on all fronts. The phone is sleek, fits snugly in the hand. The matt finish on the back ensures the phone doesnt slip away suddenly when held. Its light weight body doesnt heave down on your pockets when slipped in. Next comes the screen. What should I say? Simply stunning IPS display. The touch is exceedingly smooth, sliding screens across feels like cutting through butter. It hardly takes a touch and is really responsive. 326PPI pixel density ensures that videos are crystal clear, not to mention the 720P HD screen which really delivers a amazing screen viewing experience. The screen is Corning Gorilla Glass, though I would advise going for a screen guard as it can get scratched over time ( surprising, isnt it?). Andriod Version Kitkat makes the system really intuitive and it gives a mind blowing experience. This coupled with 1.2Ghz processor and 1GB ram makes the phone really fast. There is absolutely zero lag when running multiple apps or games. The best part about Kitkat is when you are turning the data connection on. Unlike Jelly bean where there was a lag time between clicking the data conection on and the data actually turning on, in Kitkat, the process is instantaneous. Click on Mobile data on and voila, it turns on that moment. That is a real boon! The real bummer is the fact that there is no battery %age display in Kitkat. you have to manually check it everytime by navigating to battery details. This is being fixed as I have heard or you could download any app ( batter doctor is one of them) to display battery %age. Snapdragon processor gives a power packed performance when it comes to playing games or running apps. I have tried running some heavy games and running multiple apps and I have not experienced any lag at all! So that is so,e good news for app hungry people or hard core gamers. Camera is excellent. 5Mp may not be sufficient for photograpy enthusiasts, but for normal users like me, it is more than what could be expected. I captured a lot of photos using my cam and photos are of excellent clarity. I havent tried my hands on low light photography using this cam, but since it comes with a really bright LED flash, I am not expecting it to be too bad either. 
 
Finally, the battery performance. 2050 mA battery is more than sufficient for daily use. For example, I recharged my battery to 100% yesterday morning at 7AM and have been using it since, without recharging in between. My mobile internet has been continuously on since yesterday and I have used moderate amount of internet.After a day's use of calling, light gaming and internet usage, it dropped to 35% by End of day and it currently stands at 15% (11.15 am next day). I am expecting the battery to go out in the next few minutes. This was a test run to calibrate how long battery lasts and based on my experience, it lasts for about 25 -30 hours with moderate data usage, calling and gaming. ( 3G usage may suck battery faster than expected). The real disappointment is lack of USB laptop connector to transfer data. That has to be bought sepearately ( I havent had time to get my hands on one and it is really pissing me off ). 
 
In a nutsheel, a must buy phone which delivers more than what other phones can offer at about 75% of the price. Considering brand motorola google, this phone is a best takeaway at a price of 14K. DO buy it and dont look any further.

3. Battery is enough for a day and if you are not using internet you can stretch to 3-4 days.
