About Moto-G: 
PROS :it is a spectacular phone with a smooth and responsive touch screen. 
Unlike may reviews here, the music quality is appreciable. 
The colours reproduced on screen are lively and rich. 
At 1.5Ghz the quad core gives a appreciably faster experience with no lag or hang-ups. 
Many reviews state that the non-removable battery and no memory card support is limitation with this phone. But with 16 GDBs of internal storage and an option for UTG I do not see this limiting in any way; Do not know, how non-removable battery can pose a problem (there is a way to do hard-reset in case of phone hangs, if people know). 
 
CONS: Camera could have been better. In low-light the pictures are pathetic. I hope Motorola releases some better app to enhance the camera features in future that can go well with this phone. 
 
To sum it up, I am happy with the phone and at the stated price it is best phone in this class.My First Smartphone!.I like a frugal design and prefer function over form. This is what the G delivers. It is simple, comes with stock Android and does not carry any of the fancy (often unnecessary) apps that the competition offer. 
 
My requirements at the time of purchase : 
1. All phone features 
2. Mail 
3. WhatsApp 
4. GPS 
Everything else is a bonus. 
App support allured me towards Android over Windows. 
 
I have used this phone for about 3 weeks now. 
 
Positives: 
The battery lasts more than 5 days, however it is worth mentioning that this is because my usage is less. I do not use an internet pack (yes yes I ought to get one soon) and only browse on Wi-Fi. I talk for about 20 minutes and send about 30-50 SMS per day. I listen to about 2 hours of music and browse for about 1 hour per charge cycle. Plus about 2 hours on whatsapp and checking mails. 
I sincerely do believe that getting two days under medium to heavy usage is achievable. 
 
The sound quality took me be surprise. The music quality on the stock earphones is above average and I would rate it 5/10 where 10 is music quality on a Sony Walkman phone with MegaBass enabled and using the larger K750 type earphones (Guys who have heard it will know what i mean). 
The phone has potential though. My in-ear headphones bring the bass to life and music feels brilliant, taking my rating to 8.5/10. I have used these headphones with a number of devices and hence can say that the improvement observed is not solely due to change in earphones. The phone does produce good music which is unfortunately let down by the stock earphones it shared the box with. 
The speaker volume is loud enough, about 130% of my erstwhile SE Naite - above average for a smartphone. 
 
FM radio, a simple feature that several SM's are deviod of, is a blessing. I love listening to tunes on the waves. 
 
I have a soft silicone phone case on it and this makes it chunky. Its easy to hold and grip. This coupled with its weight (and probably its price) makes its presence felt in the pocket. 
 
Negatives : 
The camera is mediocre compared to todays standards. I am fine with it though. 
I would be nitpicking if I were to list any more. 
 
Concern: 
I have seen my friends, more expensive, phones hang. The phones do not respond to any button presses, long or short, in such situations. They fix this by removing the battery. Well I could do the same too....wait I cannot. The battery is not user removable. Oops! 
Fortunately I have not faced such problems and I have not found anyone, in person or on the web, who has had to deal with their G getting stuck. 
 
Problems others could face: 
The phone has 16GB storage and is not expandable via SD card. This may be a deal breaker for those who like to carry a ton of pics/music/movies. 
Its not a high end device. The game freaks among you may find it slow with multiple/heavy games/apps running. 
 
Summary: 
This is a great phone for those who are looking to capitalize on the advantages of a smart phone without being too concerned about the fancy stuff. If you want a good brand in your pocket for less price and would be happy with the basic android offering, then Moto is for you.The best budget smartphone.After using this phone for nearly 2 weeks I can certainly say that spending less money on your smartphone doesn't mean that you have to make do with crippled functionality and Motorola has proved it. 
 
1. Build quality 
The phone is worth 14k but it doesn't look like one. Rather it looks like a much costlier phone. Unlike those Samsung phones which look the same whether you spend 12k or 50k. It has a solid feel and has a strong body which doesn't make even a single creak sound even after falling two times from my hand in the past week. 
 
2. Display and Screen 
The display is an IPS LCD of HD resolution. It has great viewing angles and has good brightness levels. Since the screen size is 4.5 inches (which is smaller than the usual smart phones but is large enough for easy regular use) it doesn't put much load on the battery. But it could've been better if it was an LED (for longer battery life). For protection it has Gorilla Glass 3 which is said to be more stronger and bacteria resistant as compared to its previous versions. 
 
3. Battery 
The battery is a 2070 mAh unit and easily works throughout a whole day. It is a Li-ion battery but would've been better if it was a Li-Po battery. But for a phone worth 14k, I don't mind. 
 
4. Processor 
The processor is a Snapdragon 400 clocked at 1.2 GHz which is the best processor you would get in any smartphone at this price range. Good for gaming and browsing. But the 1 GB RAM sometimes lets it down but you get how much you spend for ;-) 
 
5. Camera 
The camera is 5 MP and gives decent shots. It has better image quality than many of the 'Lumias' out there. The front camera is 1.3 MP which is good enough for selfies or video calling/chatting. 
 
6. Call quality 
The in-call quality is much superior to many of the smart phones out in the market and I can say that with my own experience. 
 
And also you can buy a few colourful back covers to give your smartphone a new and refreshed look. 
 
A few negative points: 
1. Only 1 GB RAM 
2. No SD card support 
 
Flipkart's service is really good. They shipped my phone the same day I ordered it. But please Flipkart take care of the description you people upload for a particular product like you have given the pictures of the single sim Moto G rather than the dual sim version in this web page. 
 
From my view this has been the best budget smartphone I've ever used and will be the best for a long time. So take care everyone and spend your hard earned money wisely on functionality and not just on a 'Beast on paper'.superb phone . the one and only one should buy.I have been planning to buy an android phone since 3-4 years, but due to some reasons such as the price of them and the obviously for this specifications only above 25,000 cost should be made are good, so I purchased an Nokia asha311 one year ago.

I think 13GB is sufficient as long as you're not a avid video downloader who doesn't remove the old contents. No need no need to talk about the merits of Corning's Gorilla Glass. The touch sensitivity is good and responds well. 
 
You'll get 5 desktops which can't be deleted but they can certainly be customized. The best of this handset is that the Stock ROM comes with Android's latest masterpiece called Kitkat (4.4.2). I have used all the flavors of Android before. Compared to them this one seems to have hit the milestone in terms of memory/processor utilization. Simply saying that the phone doesn't lag when doing multitasking. Not yet atleast. 
 
This is a dual-SIM (MicroSIM) phone. At any point only one SIM will be able to use 3G. The other will fallback to 2G. Who uses data connection on both SIM at the sametime anyway :)

Nathan. AVery very happy till now.The service from Flipkart has always been amazing. The booking period was 10 days I ordered the phone but it arrived within a week itself. 
 
The phone is nothing short of awesome. I was using a gingerbread phone earlier and kitkat is on another level in terms of the OS. 
 
Pros. 
1) Response is top class. Zero delay on any app or stock features preinstalled with the OS. 
2) The phone grip is ver very good with the curved design greatly assisting the grip. 
3) The stock mat finished backpanel is great as well not attracting any dust and the Moto symbol at the back offers added grip when held .. There is absolutely no need for a screen guard as the gorilla glass is more than enough for daily use. Screen size is just perfect for me as any bigger would make it difficult to hold. 
4) The camera is very good in outdoor and well lit conditions. 
5) The best part is the price, you will not get such specs and the reliability offered by big companies for 14k rest assured.. 
6) The battery life is spectacular with 2 days, a given for moderate/everyday use involving everything from being on 2g network all the time, random wifi usage, music for a good 2-3 hours a day with calls, watsapp and the usual apps.. It reduces to a day if heavy gaming comes into picture. But all in all the 2070 mAh battery is more than enough for regular use. 
 
Cons : I must point out that I am listing even the minute things 
1) Moto G is slightly heavier and will take some time to adjust if you're used to phones closer to the 100g mark.. You will adjust to it eventually. 
2) Camera in indoor low light conditions is not great so if that is your priority check with friends before buying. 
3) Attaching and sending files using Watsapp and other apps is not as straight forward as it used to be. You will need to install a file explorer to set ringtones from memory and send files in messengers .. Again this is a kitkat limitation rather than moto g 
 
All in all I give this phone a 5 star rating as the cons are negligible when compared to the features and cost..THIS IS IT..VALUE FOR UR MONEY..Go for it.Dont think much.Let me tell you, it deserves my 5 star for this. Let me give some more points of review.

  This is my first review on this site, I ordered moto g on 12th march and got it on 14th.after one week of experience I found following things in my phone. 
  Well Motorola was gobbled up by Google and recently it was handed over to lenovo which s sad thing for me.while all this was confusing , we saw Motorola getting back in to the smartphone game with Moto G. The smartphone has created a lot of buzz as it carries an amazing spec sheet along with a small nd affordable price tag. 
    So what does the Moto G offer? Well it comes with a 1ghz quad core snapdragon 400 processor along with an Adreno 305 GPU and 1GB of RAM and it comes with16GB(8gb is also der) which can be a deal-breaker for some. 
   The touchscreen is a crisp and sharp 4.5 inch, 720p 
IPS display which offers a great 326ppi and is protected with Gorilla Glass 3. The smartphone also has a 5MP rear camera with an LED flash and a front 1.3MP camera for making video calls. Other include 3G, Wi-Fi , Dual SIM and a 2070mAh battery to juice up the smartphone. 
   Surprisingly my Moto G runs on Android 4.4.2 KitKat, which is the latest offering by Google. Motorola has graciously not added any UI layers on top which means that the UI experience is actually very smooth and lag free and apart from the wallpapers section, it's very similar to the Nexus phones. 
     Now that Motorola was a Google company, we expect that upcoming updates will arrive without any delays. 
   Jumping onto performance, the Moto G is quite a cracker if compared to smartphones available in a similar price range. Real-time performance and day-to-day usage proved to be very good and the smartphone doesnt have any hiccups with multitasking. High end games like Asphalt 8, Real Racing 3 and then FIFA 14 worked like a charm thanks to the way Adreno 305 GPU. 
   In my opinion the Moto G is a very good option if you are looking for great performance in a budget smartphone and especially if you don't like fancy brands Micromax, Xolo or Karbonn. With an added brand value from Motorola, the Moto G is worth every penny. 
   Motorola and Google have proved that making a great phone at a low price is not a rocket science and other than the somewhat iffy camera, this is among the smartphones available in the market today.

The Only budget handset you should buy for premium smartphone experience.Best bang for my 14k.Its been a few hours since I started using the device and I am grinning from ear to ear. 
 
My usage revolves around using social media like Twitter, Facebook, Vimeo,Youtube, Tumblr to productivity apps like Evernote, Feedly etc and listening to a ton of podcasts and audiobooks. So far the processor and ram haven't let me down. There are hardly any heating issues or performance lags. 
 
The display is really nice although I noticed the blacks have a bluish hue to them. 
 
The interface is quite simple and toned down compared to the Samsung ecosystem that tries to force useless Samsung apps onto you. My only gripe with the interface is that it doesn't let you reduce or increase the number of homescreens. It is fixed at 5 screens. 
 
The build quality and the weight of the phone is very nice as I prefer phones that are slightly on the heavier side. It provides a nice balance when you hold the device in your palm. The back of the phone is matte but it tends to be a little slippery so I would recommend buying a backplate that has a rough texture to enable better grip. 
 
The camera is a bit of a let down because it switches to 3.8 megapixels when shooting in widescreen mode. The default mode of 4:3 aspect ratio is kinda outdated by now so I would have loved the 16:9 mode to use the default resolution of 5 mp but personally that is a compromise I can live with. 
 
The battery life seems really good but I can't make a definitive statement on it since I have had the device for half a day only. The phone does come with a battery saver mode once the battery hits 10%. 
 
The phone comes with Android 4.4.2 loaded so that was a pleasant surprise considering a lot of flagship devices of other big brands are yet to receive that update.

- Latest android

-Personalization options-Excellent, Lot of accessories including back covers, flip covers etc. available.An Exceptional Phone.The Moto G is an exceptional piece of hardware, right from its concept to the execution of that idea. For it's price, it punches way above its weight. I'm not sure even phone double it's price will be as much of a joy to use as this is. Just goes to show what happens when two giants come together, bent on creating something radical. 
 
My favourite has to be the entire camera app plus editing capabilities of the Moto G. They perform so seamlessly, it feels built right into the hardware! It takes very decent pictures for normal use and the editing is very intuitive offering limitless possibilities. It out distances even instagram with its range of filters and frames. Which is saying something. You can create truly spectacular stuff, get real creative with it. 
 
Videos is another great thing. It is able to combines photos and videos and create well edited videos, again with a range of effects and music available that will create beautiful memories. Editing happens without user interaction and produces surprisingly good results. You would not think it, but it handles rendering of 720p videos well. 
 
There might be those who will compare the hardware specs with a Nexus 5 or a Galaxy S4 and find the stats on this wanting. But I tell you in actual usage, it is so responsive, those stats are garbage. Forget them, focus on the experience of using the phone. 
 
The fact that Google gives you 50GB free on drive is great. With auto backup this means everything is available to you on your machine, ready for sharing without having to do a single thing! With a lot of people having wifi around now, this works really well. However the 50GB is free for two years only mind! This is less of a issue when you realize drive by default is 15GB. Now unless you intent to jam pack it with videos that much space is going to be hard to fill with just photos. More so when you realize that photos below 2048 x 2048 pixels and videos less than 15 mintues don't even count toward the limit. 
 
The phone never seems slow or sluggish. The touch response is fantastic. The screen is great with vibrant colours. It feels reassuringly solid, with nothing cheap about its build. The power and volume rockers don't feel rickety and have just the right feedback. 
 
Sound quality is exceptional. Videos calls through Skype, Viber, Hangouts all perform well. 
 
The voice recognition works like a charm. Now I know this perhaps doesn't work for everyone but for me, it hardly ever gets it wrong. I would say about 95 in a 100 times it gets it right. Which means I can simply say, call so and so and it does. Open Gmail and it does. or Show me Delhi and it shows me a map. I know this is an android thing but it doesn't work half so well on other sets. 
 
I really have nothing bad to say about this phone. It is exceptional in every way. If I had a wish it would be that the camera could capture more detail. But hey I knew I wasn't buying a DSLR. For Facebook sharing and the occasional video for capturing those crazy moments it more than does the job. It does the job, allows you to unleash your creative potential and then uploads it ready for you to share. With the least effort imaginable involved. 
 
So many reviews of this phone, I didn't really know what to add, so I just shared what I enjoyed most about it. There was also that one video where the phone spent 30 minutes under water while switched on and came back out just fine! Apparently it has a nano coating of something that makes it very resistant to water. It just slides off! Yes I did try it.....without actually dipping it in ofcourse. 
 
A phone this good has not come around in a long while. Not at this price point certainly. This is path breaking stuff. Kudos to Google and Motorola. To think there was a time I would not buy a Motorola phone for the world! 
 
Really it's a shame Google sold the manufacturing part to Lenovo. It would have been something to see what else they could have come up with. With Microsoft acquiring Nokia, that would have been a battle for the ages. 
 
If you are looking to buy a phone, this is the one to go for, for at-least the next year, especially, if like me, you are going to be a first time android user. 
 
In defense of me, I am not usually given to such fan-boyish praise of anything, its just that the phone is that good. iPhone? Bah just over priced, over hyped piece of tech that does the same thing.Value for money.If you are looking to buy a feature android phone for under Rs. 15000, then Moto G is the phone for you. It is probably the cheapest phone in the market at the moment which is offering the pure android experience with no launchers on top. 
Indian and Chinese brands like Micromax, Xolo, Lava, Karbonn etc do provide phones with better specs in the same price range, but none of them offer good after sale service which Motorola will, hopefully and most probably none of them has Android KitKat out-of-the box or upgradeable. Also, Moto G has better benchmark scores than almost all of them. 
So far, the performance has been good and it plays most heavy games like Real Racing and NFS seamlessly with no lag at all. Multitasking is easy and seamless too. 
There are a few downsides to this phone though, like no memory expansion slot and no removable battery. Another thing is that the bezel buttons (lock and volume) seem a little flimsy but thats pretty much it. 
So if you want a good Android phone under 15k for general use, and also from a good brand, MotoG is the phone for you.On every aspect it's an perfect phone..Best in this price bracket. I am an avid moto fan, there seems to have been something extra in their product line up all the time. Have an defy plus(remember all rugged waterproof phone back in 2011). It worked like an charm and still going strong. 
Now back to moto g, processor same as sub 20K phones with a gig of RAM a good GPU what else do you need on 14K phone. Anyways on performance wise I found it extremely competitive with bigger rivals(Note 3 , S4). There were no frame drops while playing games, but lil noticable playing experience while comparing with sub 30K phones. Web browsing suffered a bit because of its a bit old processor, in note 3 using same wifi connection you will find a great deal of difference while loading a webpage, note 3 on occasions outperformed Moto G by more than couple of seconds. 
I know it's not a fair bit of competition but just for comparision sake did that. Moto G in way a weak performer, it is just perfect. Even with same hardware Sony T2 Ultra is launched (Having bigger screen and better camera) which is selling at 24K (see the huge difference now). 
 
If you want a phone that fits your pocket and want to have a feel of a phone rather than a phablet don't think just buy it.The Best Budget Phone Ever!!!!!.I bought this phone 3-4 weeks ago and now after 1 month of usage, I am giving my review about this phone. This phone is actually awesome. Most of the mobile companies try to maximize their profits and give out phone, calling them budget phones in which actually cheat parts are used. However, I am really happy with Motorola that it has used all the best quality products that they could integrate in the device within the budget. Motorola has returned in India with a bang. 
 
Many people are complaining that it doesn't have NFC, an expandable storage and some other features. To them I would like to say that this is a &quot;BUDGET&quot; phone. So don't expect those luxuries. And there is complaint when one buys an iPhone and Nexus which also don't have an expandable memory. Also, some people are rating the calling quality very bad around 6/10. But, according to me it is not that bad. I would rate it 8.5/10 (according to my usage). So, those who are worried after reading the bad reviews of the call quality, don't worry it is not bad. And also people don't compare it with Moto X and other high-end phones. There is a huge price difference between them and Moto G. 
 
Now I am going to mention the PROS AND CONS of the device. 
 
PROS- 
 
1. Corning Gorilla Glass 3 - This type of glass is scratch proof. It will not get scratched even if yout try to scratch with the help of a key. 
2. Water Resistant - Motorola gurantees Moto G to be water resistant to an extent as it has some Nano coating 
3. Adreno 305 GPU - It has an Adreno 305 GPU clocked at 450 MHz. It can play graphic-heavy games with great detailing. I tried Asphalt 8 on the phone. The experience was god, I didn't experience any lag or any missing of frames. 
4. Snapdragon 400 1.2 GHz Quad-Core Processor - The Quad Core Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 Processor is clocked at 1.2 GHz makes the phone work like fluid. The speed is flawless. 
5. Guranteed Android Upgrades - Motorola has guaranteed Android updates though Motorola has been recently purchased by Lenovo. 
6. Exceptional Price - Such a phone cannot be even thought of, at such a low price. 
 
CONS 
1. Power and Volume Buttons - The power and volume buttons are a little wobbly. Though they are not creating any problem in usage, I thought of mentioning them in the review as a good review should present both the negative and the positive facts. 
2. Camera - The rear camera is a mere 5 MP which could be better 
3. Accessories - If we consider the accessories, the ear plugs not proved to be that good. However we cannot reject a phone just for the accessories. 
 
My overall experience with this phone has been amazing. No second thoughts if you are thinking to get a phone around 14k go get it friend...Suggestions for make it more Good and User friendly.Moto G is amazingly good in almost all in its features especially its camera both still and video. Video clarity is superb. In appearance wise as well as its user-friendliness makes its more attractive. However I found some minor lacking in its some facilities: 
Messaging &amp; Contact:- 
No option for group SMS. I have to select each contact every time for sending sms to a group of people which I have frequently contacted. When I contacted Moto G CC they advised me to download application which I have done also not working properly otherwise I have to go for a paid application. No option for selecting multiple sms&rsquo; for deleting inside a particular conversation (For eg: there may be tens of sms&rsquo; in a conversation and when I want to remove a few, there is no option for selecting more than one at a time. I have to delete it one by one). No option for selecting/marking multiple contacts at a time for a particular action-deleting/sms. No option for creating folders for moving/personalising our sms&rsquo;. 
 
Call : There is no option for call connecting alert. i.e., (There is a facility now available in almost all Phones, even in cost/technology, that there is an option for a vibration alert when call is answered and that facility enables us not to hold the phone near our ear until the call is answered). There is no such facility seen in Moto G. 
 
Gallery: There is no option seen for creating a folder for personalizing our files in gallery. Folders are system generated categorized folders based on the type or source of the files. Option for creating folders are available when connect it to PC. But that folders cannot be operated with phone directly unless we connected to PC.Definitely worth it!.Not gonna delve into technical specs , i'm just going to provide a few practical pros and cons I encountered after using the phone for one week , just to keep the prospective buyers informed. 
(no hardware issues with phone till now , but saw a lot of people reporting issues with the phone in the comments section.) 
 
Pros: 
 
Interface : this is the best OS interface IMO ( incl. iOS n WP8) . I'm in love with the stock Android UI. It has a subtle but aesthetic style... After using Samsung's UI which is ugly , bloated and laggy, this is very refreshing. Sony and HTC 's UI come really close though. 
 
Speed: It's really snappy... very rare and minor lags , mostly while using camera and while multitasking , which is negligible. 
 
It's even got a notification LED (a pleasant surprise) 
 
Design: Not the best of designs out there , but isn't something that you'd complain about. Minimalist design , some may even like it. 
 
Cons: 
 
The pull down notification drawer is underutilized. There's no one tap on/off for Wifi, Bluetooth, Screen Lock like Samsung or Sony's UI. You have to dig deep inside the Settings to change these . There are toggle widgets but they're clunky and buttons in the notification drawer is a better solution.This is very irritating. 
 
Camera takes &quot;okay&quot; photos , but the interface is a bit laggy , and the snapper is slow . 
 
The battery percentage is not shown in the status bar. Cant enable it in settings... there's a few apps in the Store for that. 
 
Notification LED didn't work at first. This is a common complaint , and it occurs when you already owned an Android phone that doesn't have a notification LED , and you are using the same Google account in this phone. There's a simple solution. Download the Motorola Notification LED widget in the Store , install it , enable the Notification LED , and uninstall it if you want. That would fix it. 
 
Apps can't be arranged the way we want in the app drawer (only alphabetical order is supported). A very minor annoyance. 
 
Lack of service centres. The service centres Flipkart provided were atleast 5 hrs away from my town... It would be a huge headache if I would need to get something repaired. Hope Motorola opens more service centers in the country. 
 
There are a few cons , but the pros outweigh the cons easily and the phone is definitely worth it !!!One of the best but has flaws...!!!.Firstly about the Flipkart Delivery,One word &quot;Excellent&quot;,place order on 27th march &amp; gets delivered to me on 28th march. 
 
Design: 
The Moto G is one of the thickest handset to be launched recently,but Motorola has wisely made the phone user friendly.The back panel has rubberised finish which gives an excellent grip.It could have made a bit lighter.The three usual Android keys - Return, Menu, and Recent tab - are located in the display itself. 
 
Display: 
The Motorola Moto G comes with a 4.5 inch display. This IPS LCD panel has high definition resolution, which means it has very good 326 ppi pixel density.On top of that the display has Corning Gorilla Glass 3 protective coating which safeguards the display from daily wear and tear. The touch response of the display is also top notch. 
 
Battery and Performance: 
The Motorola Moto G comes with Qualcomm MSM8226 Snapdragon 400 quad core processor which has a clockspeed of 1.2 GHz. Its Cortex A7 chip has Adreno 305 graphics processor unit and 1 GB RAM. 
During multi-tasking the phone performs well and did not face any lag.Its 2070 mAh battery comfortably provides back up for over 24 hours on light to medium usage. Even if you are a heavy user, you would able to get 12 hours of back up. 
 
Camera: 
It has a 5MP rear with LED flash &amp; slow motion recording capability.Its camera is the best in this price range.It also has 1.3MP front camera which is nice. 
 
Conclusion: 
The Motorola Moto G is definitely attractive and offers fluid performance. It is one of the best camera phones under Rs 20,000. It also comes with the latest Android operating system and offer good battery back up. But the biggest drawback is that it has very low storage facility. If you have no issues with its internal storage, then you can consider the Moto G 
 
Pros: 
It comes with the latest Android KitKat OS 
Offers a snappy performance 
It is perhaps the best camera phone in its segment 
 
Cons: 
Little storage space 
Its a bit heavy 
It has a non-removable batteryDamn good.In short.. A damn good phone for the price, the display is better than Iphone 4s in terms of pixel density, color reproduction and viewing angles. Even the black levels are very good. If your are looking for a phone under 25K's can't ignore this at any cost. 
Only downside maybe the weak camera, I think the camera by itself is okay but too much noise reduction has been applied to the pictures in software. You can very clearly notice noise reduction artefacts. Other than that no real deal breakers. 
By the way the battery life is really good, I managed 2 days with wi-fi switched on the whole time updating and installing tons of applications. I even played asphalt 8 for around 30 mins or so. 
 
There is a known issue with Moto-g reporting 1% battery all of a sudden if you plug it into usb and take it out all of a sudden, this is cured only if you follow a full discharge - recharge routine once. supposedly re-calibrates the micro controller in the battery. 
 
Make sure you charge the battery properly to 100% before use and then let it discharge completely. 1. Dual sim phone with display of 326 ppi. Vivid and crisp picture quality. Very good for games and movies. Corning Gorilla Glass 3 gives it scratch resistant screen. 
2. 2070 mah battery enough to last 1 and half day with heavy use. 
3. Produce very good still pictures in daylight. Auto focus and flash enabled camera. 
 720 p video output produce HD movies but not full HD. 
4. Phone does not hang or show any lag what so ever. 
5. Optimal performance and true value for money phone. 
 
There are following drawbacks that can be easily ignored compared to price and features 
1. No USB cable supplied with the accessories so need to buy a separate one. 
2. Headphone sound quality is so-so though speaker performs super. I tried different headphones e.g. sony, dell bluetooth headset, Nokia, htc but no help. So if you are a music lover, this is not the phone to go after. 
3. Definitely not good if you receive/make lot of calls. No option for selective delete or delete all contacts at once, you cannot copy contacts to and from the sim card, all the contact default save to Gmail account, no option to save them on the phone or sim card. 
4. Sometime camera show error and won't open till you reboot the phone.

will review in detail after one month ...My Experience and Issues.Delivery: 
Got it earlier than promised so thank you flipkart for that. 
Moto G - 16GB: 
Its an awesome phone when you compare it with 1GB RAM phones but dont compare it with 2GB RAM ones, you will be disappointed if you expect that kind of performance. 
Best thing about this phone is the Battery life, no need to carry the data-cable to office(but it takes long time to charge). Camera quality is above average. 
Build quality is great and reliable, phone doesn't feel plasticky in your hand. 
Issues: 
After using headset the phone became mute(no audio from both sides during call), problem solved after rebooting. 
Sometimes Application icons goes invisible when u moves across apps screen and only black screen shows up. problem solved after rebooting. 
Sometimes apps take long time to open, no resolution found. 
I try to Power Off but instead it restarts, no resolution found. 
 
I would strongly recommend this phone if you can't afford(or don't want to spend on) 2GB RAM, Quadcore phones.Totally Awesome.This is my first Android smartphone, actually it's my first smartphone ever. This phone is awesome. Don't think much. 
 
The Moto G delivers premium stock Android experience at an extremely low price for it's specs. I simply love it. Motorola hasn't overshadowed the Android experience like Samsung or HTC, but it has simply complemented the stock Android experience. Assist and Migrate(although I haven't tried it) are awesome concepts. For people who have problems with storage, don't worry. 50 GB of drive space is offered with this device and people who complaint that this device doesn't have expandable memory, Android was never supposed to have memory cards. The Android community decided this years ago. And for me at least, 8 GB is enough along with Drive. 
 
One problem is that there's no native Google Drive for linux, so linux users may have problems, although you can still use the online interface, or use it through Windows like I do.Works as Advertised. Delightfully.This phone was purchased for office use where the conservative cumulative call duration each day is in excess of 4hrs and this phone doesn't bat and eyelid. Once charged fully, it easily breezes through a full days worth of calls without needing to be recharged. 
 
As promised, the phone got an OTA (over the air) update from Google the same day it was released. Call clarity and quality is on par with any of phone of any other established brand. Absolutely no complaints. 
 
This review is after 2 months of everyday battering so, any niggles would have come out by now (which they haven't). 
 
I had a few reservations about the velvety-matte black back the phone came with, but it has taken the rough and tumble of being used by over 6 people each day pretty well and has nothing to show for if except a couple of minor scratches. 
 
Definitely worth a buy for those who are looking at a capable everyday phone that could replace their old phones which needed charging once every two days.Must Buy Phone.I have buyed This phone On Flipkart obviously It Is Available on flipkart so.....Let go ahead I Am Using This Phone From About 24 days .. Upgraded to kitkat.Where the Moto G fell short was in its camera, battery life and inability to access faster, 4G LTE cellular networks. For everything else I tested, the Moto G stood up well. 
Motorola doesn't skimp in equipping the Moto G with a speedy processor. Apps launch almost as quickly as they do on the phone's pricier rivals. The Moto G runs a fairly recent version of Google's Android system, with a promised upgrade to the latest, KitKat. 
The Moto G also has a decent screen. It's about as sharp as the Moto X's and the iPhone's, enough for 720p video, though the Nexus and various Samsung phones do better by offering full, 1080p high definition. The Moto G's screen measures 4.5 inches diagonally, which is larger than the iPhone's but small for Android. Colours aren't as rich as on the Moto X's display, but if I want a superb visual experience, I'd turn to a tablet, a TV or even a movie theater. For a phone, the Moto G's screen delivers video quite well.Moto G Buying Experience.Guys after reading too many reviews and waiting for my Moto G to get delivered I could come to the following conclusions: 
 
1. The delivery is being made randomly. I think they are dispatching the products nearer to their warehouses to complete the deliveries and reduce their pending orders. I know it can be really frustration for some as still many haven't got their Moto and its been 10 days while some have already got in 2. 
2. COD orders are given preference (Just my Observation). May be just to confirm more no of orders as in other mode of payment in case of cancellation, you may get return money in flipkart wallet only. 
3. Customers Care people are trying their best to calm down furious customers. Kudos to them as they are doing their job and I think people should understand that somethings are out of their control too. 
 
Just wait and relax, I hope they would be getting the stock up soon.

The battery can last for two days with moderate usage. GreatDon't waste your money on Moto G.Hi people, 
Moto G is supposed to be a 'value for money' phone until u handle it with utmost care. One small drop and the glass breaks like egg shell. The cost of the glass is Rs.5500 which will make its effective cost Rs.18000. Still you have the risk of breaking the glass again. 
Don't get fooled by their claim that it is Gorilla glass. 
Whats worse ??? You need to keep it out of reach of children. When the glass breaks, it breaks in tiny pieces that prick you badly and can even get under the skin. Don't let it happen to little ones. 
Apart from this the camera is of very low quality. You tend to lose a lot of special moments. 
Please don't buy this phone.Moto G , After 15 days of use , a un biased Review and Comparison.first off all very perfect service and packing by flipkart , it has been 3 years since i first ordered from flipkart and still it is always my first preference for online shopping

My Usage - 
1. Phone Calls using SIM 
2. Video Calls over Skype/Hangout 
3. Blogging 
4. Internet Usage 
5. Reading News 
 
Pros - 
1. Very compactly packaged with bare essentials. 
2. Great battery life. With constant data usage and moderate phone calls, and calls over wifi it lasts more than a day after charging to full. 
3. Crystal clear display, contrasts are sharp. 
4. Photo quality is good. 
5. Amazingly fast! Applications load fast, and handles multitasking brilliantly without a glitch. 
6. Comes with Jellybean, you can upgrade to KitKat immediately. 
7. Dual sim support. 
8. Charges quickly. 
9. 50 GB free space on Google Drive. [Yes, this is an advantage!] 
 
Cons - 
1. USB charging is too slow. 
2. Does not come with a USB cable so you would need a different USB cable for data transfer. 
3. Micro SIM supported. It can only be matched by the quad core processor within this phone.An amazing phone for the price!.I was one of the 1st day buyers and I'll give a one month (almost) analysis. 
 
1. The screen is gorgeous, to die for. Amazing sharpness, colors, detail, everything. I still get amazed when it turns on. 
2. The battery is very good. I use 24x7 3G data, as well as dual sim, and I get 22 hours of battery life before it goes to 5%. 
3. The UI is very fast. I experience hardly any delays. The Android 4.4 Kitkat update has made things so much smoother. 
4. The call quality is good, but the receiver grill is a bit harsh and not of top quality. Wish that was a bit better. 
5. The loudspeaker is excellent. Loud and punchy, great sound overall. 
6. Last, the build quality. It feels so good to hold! Solid and durable, feels like it will last a long long time. It fits perfectly in the hand too. And your finger finds a home in the Motorola logo indent in the back cover. 
 
I would recommend this phone over any other in this price range. You will not regret it. Over All a value for Money i will say.Hello Moto!!.I am using moto G 8 GB for 1 week now. Flipkart delivery was on time as usual. Got a handset, a charger and a headset inside the package - no USB cable. It's not worth the hype it got from most of the previous reviews, but it's a value for money mobile. I want to touch upon some of the important points in my review. 
 
Pros: 
1. Being a 4.5&quot; phone, Moto G is appropriate for single hand use. you can put in this mobile in your pant pocket along with a cigarette packet. Display quality is very good. If you adjust the brightness, you will be able to read messages under sunlight. 
 
2. Gorilla glass screen. no scratch on my mobile screen till date. 
 
4. No lag experienced while playing games or using multiple apps. Believe me, I have experienced lag or phone hang using same games on samsung Mega and Grand. At least for this phone android is no more lagroid. 
 
5. Battery backup is better than that of the samsung phones within it's range and works for 15-16 hrs on heave use. Battery backup of nokia mobiles are better. 
 
6. 5.5 GB internal memory (almost 3 GB for users) is enough if you have laptop or computer to watch movies. 
 
Cons: 
1. Camera is a big disappointment. 5 MP cameras of other mobiles are much better than it's camera. Pictures are grainy and poor quality (like a 1.3MP camera of earlier mobiles). Use of HDR mode increases the photo quality a little bit. Front camera is ok. 
 
2. Inbuilt battery. If your phone hangs, you have to wait till it discharges completely. Lets hope it doesn't hang. 
 
3. Charger and earplug are very cheap quality. 
 
4. No USB cable. Though you can use your samsung accessories (charger, earplug and data cable) with this phone. 
 
 5. You wont be able to assign a mp3 file as your ringtone or share your musics, books unless you download a file manager app into your mobile. 
 
6. Sound is loud but sound quality is not so good, it cracks on high volume. Samsung mega or grand has better sound quality. Front speaker is also loud but call clarity is very bad. Even a 5K mobile has better call clarity. 
 
Overall, it is a value for money phone. But if you are looking for a no lag samsung grand, this phone doesn't fit the bill.mixed review.the phone is as usual and expected brilliant , and i am happy with it too . Coming to the phone, 
Moto G is pretty good phone in this price bracket. 
The screen size is 4.5 inches, but you get about 4 inch usage space because of the presence of the home, back and task buttons on the touchscreen itself. 
The processor lived upto the expectations, the google drive 50 gb storage was a great perk of buying this device. 
Also, I got the 4.4.2 OTA update within 4 days of getting the phone. 
That's when the problems started. 
The camera refuses to work, displaying a 'camera error' message whenever I try to open it. Restarting the phone does the trick, but only for once. Also the boot up time for the phone has increased. 
It's a good phone, lived up to the hype.

Pros: 
1) The screen is just awesome and smooth.. Gorilla Glass 3 is just outstanding 
2) Display is just out of the park.. Man i put the Grand 2 and Moto g to play the same video.. Grand was ashamed!!! The display is far too clear in the Moto g.. 
3) Daylight pics are just as good as a mid-range point and shoot. 
4) Handling the phone is very easy.. perfect fit for single handed use.. 
 
Cons: 
1) Battery drains pretty fast.(Max 1 day use ) Well not so much but it would have been good if Motorola had included a 3000 mah battery. 
2) Another demerit will be the selection of 3g network.. The problem is that in low 3g reception area the phone doesn't catch the network properly. 
3) The video recording is at 720p and it is not adjustable.. With the limited space, 8 minute video is sized about 600 MB. 
4) Photos in Night are not that good. 
 
I have given this phone a 4 star just for the non inclusion of external memory card. Well if you are planning to buy this phone just go for it coz the display is worth the money!!!Not great phone. But almost worth for price range of rs.12k (if any discount).I have been using this phone frm past 3 weeks and below are the observations: 
 
Cons: 
1. No memory expansion and we need to depend on cloud storage. 
2. FM radio can not be played on loud speaker. (After connecting earphone). 
3. Battery backup and 12.9GB memory is not at all good for power users. Drains 90% of battery if you play games continuously for 2 hours. 
4. Charger over heats in most of the pieces. 
5. Little image noise seen in photos taken in camera, but can be ignored. 
6. Worst service from flipkart to be considered, as this phone is still not made avaialble in shops. 
7. Poor SMS app and contact app. No 3rd party apps for these in market supporting dual sim. All contacts are gmail contacts. No option of local contacts. In this feature, LG phones are very good. 
8. Auto recovery of network signal is not seen. 
 
Pros: 
1. HD display, quadcore CPU, water resistant coating inside, superb audio play on loud speaker, no lags at all when playing highend games and any app runs without issues are the impressive points. 
2. Nice build quality resists accidental falls atleast few times. 
3. Excellent standby battery backup. 
 
Hence, deserves 3 star rating if you pay full amount 13.9k and 4 star rating if you get it for around rs.12k by discounts. 
Finally, it does not look worth if you are going to buy @13.9k. 
Instead go for LG L90, as it is also having the same hardware and with good after sales service (as per my experience).Google Moto G 16GB.I ordered this Mobile &amp; got the same in about 10days time. Good service as always from Flipkart. Now about the phone. I been using a Nokia Lumia 820 &amp; my wife uses a Lumia 720. After going through the reviews here, i ordered the phone. Phone looks good, light weight. The touch is not as crispy &amp; responsive as a Lumia phone. The camera also is not as good as Lumia 720 but front camera is good. Apps maybe high but all the important apps are available on Lumia 720. Also i found that some apps just dont work &amp; has to be restarted again which has never happened in Lumia 720. The worst irritating thing is about Wi-Fi. While Lumia 720 works well with almost any Wi-fi connection, Moto g disconnects the same connection as &quot;poor connection&quot;. I would say this phone did not make that big impact with its performance or apps. But still the hardware is amazing, phone feels sturdy. Does not heat up like Lumia 720. Also it got updated to kitkat automatically. This phone is at best for entry level smart phone.Silky Smooth like an iPhone &amp; Phenomenal Battery backup!.I'm someone who's too lazy to review products after purchase on flipkart. You would be knowing everything about the phone after all the rave reviews online and here on flipkart. But I'm just writing it to highlight two things - 
 
1. I don't know if it's because of KitKat or because of being a stock android phone, but this phone is just slick and silky smooth. I'm experiencing 0 lag. And I'm shocked! I've used all previous versions of android including the previous two ICS &amp; Jellybean and I've hated it all (Except Jelly bean on Note 3 which runs smooth), but the OS on this phone is just brilliant. I've loaded more apps than an average user would but still it isn't experiencing any lag at all which is remarkable for a budget phone. 
 
And more importantly.. 
 
2. The latest batter backup I got after a full charge ? 5Days, 15 Minutes! Holy S**T! 
I'm blown away! This is what you call a proper phone. 
Okay let me explain in details, I've not done a data recharge as I use my tab for browsing, but I did use Wifi for around 1 hour during this time, then I saw 40 minutes of video and screen on time was approx, 4 hours. I purely use this as a phone. But still I was shocked to see 5+ days of backup after a full recharge! OMG! 
In this era when smartphone can no longer be considered a phone thanks to it's ridiculously low back up, MotoG truly stands out. 
 
If you are looking to buy a phone below 20k or even 25k, look no further than this phone! 
I just don't get people complaining about camera and all. It's camera is decent but how much do you want from a 13k device? I use my pro DSLR to take pics anyway and as I stated before I was looking for solid phone with sleek looks, but Moto G truly blew me away on the above two mentioned fronts. 
 
Congrats Motorola! I know people would have brand preferences and bull but I highly recommend this phone to ANYONE! The money surely won't go a waste. 
 
Regards,

RamMOTO G . Awesome pice in smartphone range of 10k - 20 k.HI I have bought this mobile recently . This is my 3 rd smart phone and I have reviewed wide range of devices physically . 
Basically this device looks like a copy to nexus series. 
Firstly I would like to mention positives 
 
1) Screen touch is superb. Its very smooth and very responsive. It feels very good. I can bet on that. 
 
2) Performance is very good even with high graphics apps. 
 
3) skin 
 
4) comes with latest version of android 
 
5) Battery backup is good and screen HD quality is good. 
 
6) camera Front and Back both are awesome. You can't expect more front camera quality than this from any mobile in its competitors. 
 
7) Flash is also good . You you be shocked with that much of flash 
 
Drawbacks 
 
1) You will not get USB cable 
 
2) headset quality is not good. 
 
3) No expandable memory . (But for 16 GB would be suffice) . Don't go for 8 Gb . As from 8 GB it would take 3.* Gb for OS. And remaining would be only 4.* GB available .Good phone. But tread cautiously.If you have made up your mind on buying the phone, or just leaning towards it; you should know the following things about it 
 
1) Screen size is 4.5 inches. However there are no physical buttons for menu and back. They are on the screen itself. This means a small portion of the screen is always occupied by the back and menu on screen buttons which reduces the effective screen size. However some games and videos are able to use the entire screen. 
 
2) No micro sd card. You are stuck with what you buy 8GB or 16 GB. I got 16 GB model, actual usable memory was around 11 GB. Not sure what 8GB one has, but I would advice to go with 16 GB. 
 
3) Non removable battery - Battery does not come off. This means we cannot do hard reset by removing battery and inserting again. Also a big ? on whether a dead battery can be replaced. If not then life of this phone is limited to the life of the battery which could be between 2 to 3 years. Long term users beware. 
 
4) Only available to flipkart -No competition for this phone in Indian market. But the price of the phone here is at par for now. 
 
5) Stock earphones suck. You would need to buy better ones. 
 
6) Uses dual micro sims in case you didnt know 
 
7) only 5 MP camera.So far the best.I have purchased it through the exchange offer ( in exchange of my 2 year old Galaxy Y). The screen and resolution is superb. The camera is also good, do not know why some people complained. I have 4Mbps wifi in my home, so the browsing speed is really superb. In the 4 cores of the CPU, only I could be able to run upto 2 cores even with the graphics intensive game like Soul Caliber. So it is also future ready. Sound is decent ( with my philips headphone). Very very fast GPS locking, very good for real time driving even with google map. Now, Kit-Kat is out of the box, so no worry about the compatibility issue faced by earlier users after up-gradation. The gorilla glass eliminates the necessity of screen guard (simply wipe with a tissue or soft cotton cloth, it is scratch proof,so do not worry). The only problem I feel is the RAM. if it has been 1.5-2.0 GB, it will be very nice ( always around 70% of RAM is occupied). However you cannot get everything in this price ( Already Samsung is fumbling in justifying the price of Galaxy Grand, against this product). Overall, a great product to go for.

     i hope you liked my rewiewNeighbors Envy Owners Pride !! Updated to Android 4.4.2 !!.This review is based on 5 days of usage, hence you can treat this as an almost-first-hand review, if you'd like... 
 
&quot;A real killer in this segment or has it just created one! ?&quot; :) 
 
+ve's: 
 - Stock Android, no nonsense stuff. 
 - Quad-Core processor - it is fast! 
 - Absolute stunning display for the price (Adreno + IPS HD) 
 - Solid built 
 - Strong battery. I am getting more than 32hrs on it on full charge with full Wi-Fi and calls, WhatsApp, YouTube, Music, Camera, etc. 
 - Motorola Migrate - absolute charm of an app which copied my existing android (Samsung Galaxy Y) stuff over to this one in like 30 mins or so. 
 - Clarity in calls 
 - The Gorilla Glass is almost smudge-free 
 - Front camera 
 - Grip, it won't slip! 
 - Water proof!! 
 
-ve's: 
 - Average headphones 
 - I expected some decent documentation about the phone, but it was like minimal. 
 
As you can see, it's definitely a steal. The 16GB has about 12GB usable out-of-box. 
The phone's Motorola Migrate helps in transferring stuff over from any android over to this one without you needing to do stuff. It cannot transfer SIM contacts, which is fine. It helped me a lot as the wireless settings got passed on which made life so easy, as if I had literally upgraded my existing phone. 
The back is really tough to open, but that shows how tough the phone is and for the water-proofing that it has to offer, I bet they had to lock it tight !! 
 
The camera functions are great, with touch anywhere to shoot, my 3 year old can take some cool pics too !! The front cam is also great. At 1.3 MP it is the same that you get in most of the laptops and hence performs beautifully in Skype video calls. 
 
Adreno GPU makes this phone a stunner when it comes to display. The colors are rich and crisp and watching movies or YouTube videos is a charm! 
 
AnTuTu benchmarking app rates it above Nexus 4, so I guess I don't have to comment on its performance :) 
 
Its an absolute worth each penny, so go for it !!!! 
 
Just got it updated to KitKat on 16-febThe best budget phone available at the present!.The Moto G is a great phone.I'll state my opinion as PROS and CONS. 
 
PROS: 
*DISPLAY: Gorgeous display, as good as claimed.The screen is really pixel rich, colors are great! Even though it's not as bright under direct sunlight as the AMOLED on Galaxy S3/S4, it's just a minor thing, and full brightness suffices to deliver good viewing. Just love the display. 
*OS: Pure Nexus like Android. No bloatware, which allows the phone to be nifty. I got my Kit Kat update on the same day of delivery! 
*BUILD QUALITY: Excellent and sturdy design. Feels even more solid than Galaxy S3. Only qualm is the lock/power button which I feel could have had returned better tactility (Feels loose) . The phone is also said to be Water Resistant. 
*SPEED: Blazing fast. Zero lag experienced. My iPhone 4 on iOS 7 feels significantly slower in comparision, thanks to the quad core proc and 1 gigs of RAM under the hood, and the pure Android. 
 
CONS: 
*Lock/Power button feels loose. 
*Bundled accessories are very poor in quality. 
*Camera is average, comparable to the 5 meg shooter on iPhone 4. Nothing to brag about. 
 
Verdict: 
If your budget is 15K, buy it. DONT BUY THE 8 GIGS, go for the 16 one. 
It's an amazing deal at a fair price, and finally makes you feel that justice has been done to this segment!

Now, about the phone this phone is really superb as much as I know I researched a lot about it coz i want value for my money. I will be writing a full review after using it (delivery date is 03rd march) 
I was looking for the phone that will suit my needed specifications. for more than 2 months I was looking and wasn't satisfied with any of the phone in the market. good phones are too costly and I was unable to decide which phone to choose 
 
What i needed - 
1.A tough rugged phone. I am careless I usually carry keys in pocket with phone and scratches makes me feel that my phone is getting old 
2. good battery life. I am tired of charging my old phone 2-3 times a day 
3. fast processor I am not that much into mobile gaming coz I prefer my PC for gaming purpose still I need a good response when I order my phone to open an app it should do it in blink of eye else its dead mister. 
4.I also needed a good display and good sound quality I love music and a little show off among friends, 
5 a camera good enough for casual use mostly for instagram and facebook. 
 
What I am getting is - 
 
1. Corning gorilla 3 protection which is scratch proof even if you try to scratch it with keys 
2. water resistant (oops I accidentally put my phone with my clothes to wash good lord its alive). 
3. snapdragon 400 1.2 gh (I saw reviews on youtube and its almost as fast as nexus 4 that is 25k sometimes it was faster than samsung s4 ) 
4.display is awesome 326pixels per inch on a 4.5 inch screen and that on an apple iphone 4s its 329ppi on a 4 inch screen Impressive!!! moto g 
5.According to one of the reviews in youtube the call clarity in other phones is better but the noise cancellation in moto g is better so I guess it is for me coz i mostly work in noisy surrounding. 
6. the camera is not the best but in good light it will give you decent images with bright colors and it records 720p hd so nothing to question. 
7. customizable colored covers which will never let you feel bored the color options are really good bright and lively 
8.Dual sim - avail the best std and local offers by two service providers 
9. the phone gives 50 gb google drive space for 2 years 
10 the phone is usb otis compatible you can connect a 32 gb pendrive if extra space is needed(although i dont need it I already spent 50k on my laptop and 5k on an external drive for storage. 13 gig that is available is decent for me ) 
I think in India we are getting charger and headphones i hope so 
 
what I didn't get 
1. NFC(near field communication) only yesterday i came to know what nfc means and believe me you are not going to use it even if you get it so dont waste ur hard earned money unless ur dad is having an audi or a mercedes. 
2.expandable memory (boy that really feels but grrr why didnt they just add an expandable slot -_- 
3.A 5.5 inch screen well, I am buying a phone not a tab 
rest everything is there as far as my requirements are concerned

Unfortunately, there was no Data Cable and the Headsets are below average. Handset is black in colour whereas the charger supplied is white. 
 
You all might have seen several pros and cons, so I am not getting into those but I would like to share the following facts in its comparison with iPhone 5S (in brackets): 
1. Screen Size: 4.5 (4) inch 
2. Dimensions: 5.11 x 2.59 x 0.46 (4.87 x 2.31 x 0.30) inches 
3. Resolution: 720x1280 (640x1136) 
4. Pixel Density: 329 (326) ppi 
5. FF Camera: 1.3 (1.2) MP 
6. Battery: 2070 (1570) mAh 
(Some readers might be thinking that I am a fool to compare a Tata Nano Car with a Bugatti Veyron Grandsport Car. But, please remember, iPhone 5S costs 4 times more than Moto G. So, if Moto G has comparatively higher specs, it certainly deserves to be observed.)

I would give this phone 3 Stars overall.Good but not excellent.This phone is overrated. While it is fast &amp; display is crisp, I think the previous canvas 2 &amp; other 5 inch phones was a better buy with a bigger screen. Also the phone comes with only one variant: black (only back panels are interchangeable) and the front looks like a chinese phone without any Motorola branding (The M logo comes on the back cover) It is fast while playing the games but a little more RAM wouldn't have hurt the phone. 
 
Also KitKat has some functional flaws. One is that there is only missed calls section in the phone log (one has to install a 3rd party app for viewing dialled, received calls) making it difficult to view calls. Also there is no external SD card which is silly. The battery isn't removable (is that so difficult when cheap chinese cos can do it?) Overall for this price I'd consider other phones with more RAM, bigger screen etc. Infact the onscreen soft buttons are not personally my favourite. The reason why this phone sells is that no other international branded phone has got a piece in the same price range with great build quality. But brands aside, this phone is good, but isn't fully upto my expectations. Probably because it's all hyped up in here.

Battery not removable 
on screen soft buttons eat up screen real estateGood Phone . Could have been better...I have given it four stars because human expectations don't end.. Having said this I feel that this phone is a best buy If you are looking for Brand, Quality, Performance (in the given price range), display, and last but most importantly modern OS with latest updates by Google. 
 
I have used this phone for over a month now and this is my first review for any gadget I have bought till date. This phone fulfils all my requirements I had in a smartphone but the only thing it lacks is more ruggedness. I was a proud owner of Moto Defy Plus and was a fan of its build quality and ruggedness. I had dropped my phone accidently on concrete 4 to 5 times and it survived without a scratch. I do not use any cases or screen guards on my phones. I wish this phone was as rugged as that. I have not dropped the phone till now and do not wish to do it on purpose.. 
 
Defy Plus lacked performance as it had the Motorola skin which had slowed down the phone. This phone on the other hand is fast but not as rugged as defy plus. 
 
Also I wish Flipkart gives some offers or discounts on moto shells and accessories for people like me who have bought a phone but cannot afford its accessories. 
 
If you have a budget of 12 - 15 K go for this phone. If 10 - 12 K go for Nokia 620 if less than 10 K go for Nokia 520. If no budget then wait and go for Nexus 6 when launched. 
 
We Indians look for quality at bargain prices and hence I can ask for more than what I get. :)Wrong Choice with Moto G,but great Support From Flipkart..I have been suffering with this Poor Moto G for the last 2 weeks. I'll list 
out all the issues faced by me. 
 
1) *Issue* : Moto G Heating up automatically and battery showing ' ? ' during 
charging instead of the actual charging percentage like 85%. 
 
*Resolution* : Flipkart replaced my phone with another one [Seems a defective one]. 
 
2)* Issue* : After inserting the Micro SIM, getting a message in every 4-5 
seconds as 'SIM Card Memory Full' and asking to delete Messages and no messages to delete while choosing this option. The same notification will popup again 
even after clearing the notification. 
 
*Resolution* : Kept my friend's two Micro Sims in my Moto G's SIM slot and 
used for 30 minutes. Then kept my actual Sims back in the Slot and there 
after no such issues. 
 
3)* Issue* : Either one of the Sims getting disabled automatically (Started 
by disabling SIM1 alone first time and as there was no other option, I 
restarted the phone and it is working fine). Next time SIM2 got disabled 
automatically and no option other than restart. This is happening randomly 
now-a- days. 
 
*Resolution* : Restart the phone each time and this is not a possible 
solution always.Quick list of pros &amp; cons(buyers' guide):.Pros: 
 HD 720P 4.5 inch display with wide viewing angles. 
 Very fast Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 1.2Ghz Quadcore processor with Adreno 305 GPU for lag-free HD gaming. 
 Latest version of Android - 4.4.2 KitKat right out of the box - supports all the latest apps. 
 Loud &amp; good quality speaker. 
 Excellent call voice clarity &amp; loudness. 
 Good quality front cam (1.3 MP). 
 Manual focus mode &amp; HDR shot modes in camera. 
 Good video recording quality(720p). 
 Perfect size for single-handed use. 
 Dual-Sim. 
 Extremely smooth, lag-free experience(so far...). 
 Able to play 1080p videos smoothly. 
 Scrach-Resistant Gorilla glass 3. 
 Water-resistant back panel. 
 Able to run whatever app thrown at it without any lag (even HD games like Asphalt 8(1.78GB), Modern Combat 4(1.98GB) 
 Good WiFi speed. 
 Official Google phone so will receive all the latest software updates before others. 
 
Cons: 
-Average camera quality(5MP). 
-Average battery life(2070mh - 1 day usage) 
-Heavy compared to other phones like Nexus 5. 
-Non-removable battery. 
-Both SIMs should be micro-SIMs 
-No USB data cable included. 
-No OTG cable included. 
-Old-style normal earphones(but good audio quality). 
-Volume rocker on the right side along with power/lock button(accidental mistakes may happen). 
-Only 12.9GB non-expandable storage available(No microSD card support). 
 
Verdict: 
 
Overall, I found this phone to be the best buy south of Rs.15k in India - The pros outweigh the cons - Extremely lag-free performance and able to run any game.. Supports all apps in the play store. and on top of all, its Google's..! If you're willing to sacrifice camera quality and storage space, then buying the Motorola Moto G will be the best decision you'll make this year(no regrets..). ^_^

HD videos are as enjoyable as they are on iphone or galaxy. screen size is just optimum at 4.5&quot;. not big but not small either and sits comfortably in hands. single handed operation is possible even for my small hands!

Nice packaging as usual. Flipkart rocks. 
Coming to the phone itself 
Price of this phone many believe is less but we must remember this is a google product, unlike Apple they make their money through software. So the specs of this phone are at par with products of 20k . 
Display is just awesome. Cannot compare with superamoled , but put it aside any phone by samsung , sony, htc below 20k and see the difference. 
Very good quality speakers, however same cannot be said about ear phones which are just about average 
Battery is extremly good for medium duty usage like browsing, multimedia, does not last whole day if u play heavy duty games 
The most important reason for buying this phone is near pure android experience and it does thejob quite nicely. Can u imagine the feeling , you start the phone ,connect it to wifi there it is , the latest android 4.4.2 awaiting for download. Its almost like out of the box. 
User interface is really smooth, no lags 
Camera does a great job for what a phone cam is supposed to be , to share pictures over net and u if want to print photos there are plenty of other devices which does this job. 
Storage space is more than sufficient , think about it, android doesnt support app storage in ext sd card, the galaxy grand 2 has got just 8 gigs of internal memory , it costs 23500. Yes u may not carry hundreds of videos , photos , songs with u and there are connectivity issues for using cloud storage but that&rsquo;s about it.

This phone has many reasons to get picked and very little or minor not to. Let's see pros and cons 
pros: 
1. Good build, design, scratch resistant and anti-finger print screen. 
2. Display is best, really human eye cannot see clearer images than this. I think display deserves the no. 3 also 
4. Processor capacity is enough to play heavy games on medium settings. I've played asphalt 8: Airborne and observed no lag. 
5. RAM is OK, you cannot get more than this upto the range of 20k. 
6. No SD card is not the big issue. due to only internal memory, data transfer and booting work fast, and OTG functionality overcomes this con. Also nowadays apps are not movable to SD card. 
7. Battery backup is good in point of view of display clearity. Battery lasts for single full day of more than average use. 
8. Design of phone is awesome, one can't feel it that it is there in his pocket, though the weight is little more but it adds to the sturdiness 
9. Call-voice is good, not an issue. 
10. Benchmarking scores are even more than Grand 2 and far more than Grand duos. 
11. Supports MKV format 
12. Front facing camera quality is good. 
13. Pure android (don't know where to put this) 
 
cons 
1. Camera quality is bad in artificial light. but good in sunlight. But camera quality is not that bad. It serves purpose. Flash works fine for close-ups even in the dark. 
2. Sound is good but bass is missing. 
3. Stock head phones are out-of-date, no data cable and otg cable in package (minor, you can buy them). why don't they provide the flap or any kind of cover (may be to keep price low) 
4. The biggest con: non-removable battery. But many say that that life of battery exceeds that of phone (don't know) 
5. And the second biggest (but as I've said not big) : no SD card 
6. User interface is not as good as Xperia due to pure Android but not as bad as Samsung. Look wise, it is average.Pure awesome!.My first Android experience, and what a way to start off with! 
Every time I look onto the screen, I am mind blown by the exquisite display clarity (the 326 ppi density which is the same as that of iphone 5s, says it all). 
The 1.2 GHz Snapdragon may be a bit outdated, but up until now, it has provided me with pure smooth experience after having used intensive apps, including graphics-rich games. 
The camera is decent, though not good enough under low light. 
The battery is also pretty decent (24 hours in moderate usage). 
 
But few bugs in software started to appear after the upgrade to KitKat. I am hearing that many users are experiencing the same. Still I'm happy to know that Motorola has acknowledged those issues, and they''' be releasing a fix in the coming days. 
 
Overall, brilliant work done by Motorola. Though having cons like no expandable storage, lack of 4G, etc, this one simply outclasses all the rest in this budget price range. The device handles like a dream, great touch, good sensitivity, good display, decent camera, not too bad, and lag-less for the most part (even heavy games run smoothly). 
 
The only downside I can think off are that the device has no sd card slot, and that the battery is non removable. You get 5.5 gb of usable space in the 8 gb version, and almost 13 gb of usable space in the 16 gb version 
 
This is definitely a must buy for android newbies, as it is also one of the few devices in the market offering a Kitkat update...

1) Google benefits from the number of Android users they getand not from the number of phones sold. So they'll typically sell phones at a relatively low profit margin. Remember that although Lenovo is in charge now, Moto X and Moto G are Google's brainchild - they decided the pricing too. 
 
2) 4.5&quot; is the optimum screen size for a phone. Fits in your pocket and screen is big enough for games, videos etc. 
 
3) At this price point you won't get Gorilla Glass 3 anywhere else. 
 
4) Internal memory is the best performing memory of a phone. Even class 10 SD cards are not as fast. 
 
5) Pure Android and no bloatware. 
 
I think the only downside is the camera. The pictures are not very good in the night.Amazing Phone, Amazing Price..This is definitely the best phone in this range +/- 5 K. Like simply blows you mind.

The touch screen of this phone has left permanent scratches on the screen surface.It gives the first impression of a smudgy fingerprint. To my greatest dismay, upon closer observation was found to be an elliptical permanent patch developed out of regular touch screen touch interactions. 
 
I am completely discouraged that the capacitive touch screen advertised as &quot;Gorilla Screen&quot; developed scratches from a casual usage pattern. Remember it was only casual finger interactions that caused this and NOT negligent usage or grinding the phone on a brick wall !!! 
 
I would therefore NOT recommend this product to anyone. The touch surface is definitely cheap and extremely vulnerable to scratches just by touch interactions.

The Motorola Moto G is a mid-range priced dual-SIM Android smartphone by Motorola 
The phone supports dual-SIM (GSM GSM) capability 
It features a 4.5&quot; IPS LCD capacitive touch screen with Gorilla Glass 3 protection 
The screen has HD (720 x 1280 pixels) resolution with ~326 PPI pixel density 
It has 5 MP primary camera with LED flash and a 1.3 MP secondary camera 
The phone is powered with a 1.2 GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 processor 
It has 1 GB of RAM and comes in 2 storage variants - an 8 GB &amp; a 16 GB version 
The device runs on Android v4.3 JellyBean operating system 
Connectivity options includes 3G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth (LE) &amp; Micro USB 
The phone has a 2070 mAh battery on boardExcellent Phone.I never bought an Android phone all along and stuck to Nokia since I could not find any medium priced Android phone of a decent build. Most medium priced phone in the marked have a plastic feel and lack finesse. This phone I could not resist buying since it was from Google owned Motorola. This phone has amazing build quality. Feels good in the hand. Just the right size. Crystal clear display. Doesn't seem to heat too much. At this price point, no other phone beats it. No wonder it got sold out in minutes on the website. 
I did have some moments of trouble. After about 3 weeks of using the phone, it started randomly rebooting every other day. I called up Motocare and they suggested that it could be hardware issue to take the repair center. Thanks to Flipkart's customer-friendly policy, they readily agreed to replace the piece and sent me a fresh piece. Its been a week now with the new piece and so far no troubles.Premium product from moto.....I've been using moto g 16gb from 7 days..i m happy with the device, what i found best in this ...

Guys, it's not supposed to get you great pictures like 30-40k+ phones. If you are so conscious about camera, go and buy a decent point and shoot somewhere around 10k. 
 
And about the phone, it's complete madness. So much in so little price, it's incredible. I have been using since past 3-4 days and no issues till now. No lag, No hiccups, great game play, loud music (again don't compare with HTC One), ok camera, stock android and always 300+ MBs of RAM Free. What else do you want from a sub 15k phone. 
 
For all those who are comparing this to Xolo, Karbonn, Micromax etc., Moto G's built beats them all to ground. Forget about performance (in which it is a beast in it's own right).Very impressive.It's been more than two weeks since I've started using this phone, and I must say, I'm hugely impressed. 
 
I had some initial concerns over the battery backup, after the KitKat update, but I contacted Motorola for that, and they gave me a simple solution (involving charing the phone upto 8 hours, while on, and then twice for an hour each, while switched off - to reset the microprocessor of the battery) Now it happily chugs on for a day. 
 
Now, regarding the quality of the phone, it's top notch. For starters, check this underwater submersion test - www.androidpit.com/motorola-submersion-test - and you'll realise how well built this phone is. 
 
On the performance front, I have no issues at all, even for heavy gaming. Asphalt 8 for example, runs pretty smoothly, without an iota of lag. To be honest, I haven't found any performance related differences between the Moto G and my 2013 Nexus 7 tab.

Positives 
+ Excellent battery - for low usage may last for 2 days; this is very difficult to get in any smartphone now-a-days. 
+ Stock android - no shitty apps. 
+ Motorola Assist - one of the most useful apps around. 
+ Smooth as silk - I still have not had a lag at any point. 
+ Stable - I did not have to restarted it till now. 
+ GPS - Excellent. 
+ Display - 329 ppi, need I say more? 
+ Dual SIM - another plus given that it is difficult to find it in most mainstream mobiles. 
 
Negatives 
- Camera - though I won't say it is bad, but it's not great either. If you're looking for a phone with a great cam, this one is definitely not for you. 
- Speaker sound quality - again, not bad, but not great either. 
 
In conclusion, I am very happy with this handset. The voice quality is quite excellent, and it's an extreme value-for-money worth phone. Go for it!!!Nothing gets better than this!.Alright! - Guaranteed android update promise.

so what would like to conclude that the first day my phone give me some amount of tension regarding battery %. but after initial charging the phone is a most compatible and budget type phone that could buy....Not good for making calls.This phone sucks when it comes to its main use: calling

excellent ---------Moto G - A delight with a tinge of glitch.So it's been over a month since I bought Moto G, on the launch day. Shifting from Blackberry was saddening but this one didn't disappoint me. The KitKat version update after a week was cherry on the cake! The interface and screen resolution makes it great for viewing pictures. Camera pictures can get blurry and shaky if not held strong. There have been a few instances when the camera error occurs, the reason for it is unknown to me till now but I have to restart it to rectify it. The front camera is reasonably fine. The shape is good, easy to hold and type with one hand. Back covers are matte and has a good feel to hold. Battery is just about ok to last for a day with 3G, otherwise, without internet, it can last upto 2 days. Sound is not that good, maybe a 2.5 outta 5. Overall a great smart/touch phone, a perfect alternative for 15-30k phones. Has all the stuff you need.Amazing phone at a amazing price!!!.After using it for over a month I am really satisfied with the phone. 
Apart from its specification here I will tell you the amazing features of this phone and why should you buy it?!! 
 
*Games like Asphalt,real racing, blood brothers and many more high graphics oriented games run very smooth. 
 
*Battery life is very good, its far better than any other brands.Last for the whole day with above average usage.

Played a few graphics-intensive games like Dead Trigger 2 on it, and it doesn't lag. 
 
CONS: 
1. Battery drops heavily when playing games. 
2. Call quality a bit low, not as loud as Samsung phones of the same price range (Galaxy Grand I9082) 
3. Heats up when charging (that may be an issue with my particular handset, will get it checked) 
4. Lack of USB OTG. Would have been a boon, given the lack of external memory. 
5. Camera is highly disappointing, has no idea where to focus, and ends up with blurry shots half of the time.

Thank you Flipkart.Moto G Review.Performance and configuration is good for the price. I just want to explain the issue I faced and the solution. 
 
I faced an issue with BSNL WiFi modem, but resolved myself after some research. which I have explained below. 
 
Problem: 
 
For some reason, my Moto G was not connecting to my WiFi modem, while my other 2 old Samsung devices where able to connect without any issues. Moto G never able to connect either it would say &quot;Obtaining IP address...&quot; or &quot;Connecting...&quot; 
 
Solution: 
 
What I did is in Modem DHCP Server Settings, I have given Existing DHCP fixed IP /MAC mappings. 
 
Ie. for each of the 3 mobile devices I have given fixed IP and mac address mapping. 
 
Ensure the IP address is within the pooling range in DHCP settings. 
 
Now all my 3 devices are able to connect without any issues with the respective IP I have given in the modem settings.Best phone within 10-15K ... :).Hi,
