CHEERS !!The Moto G is a solid, no nonsense handset, it's not fancy but it's not ugly either.Still the best budget smartphone, the Moto G is an incredible bargain that punches well above its weight. Google has long had its Nexus-branded handsets, but these were made by other manufacturers and at just one high-end handset a year, mainly sold SIM free, they weren't exactly mass market. In comparison Samsung released 20 handsets worldwide in 2013 alone. 
Motorola has left Google's OS, largely untouched, just adding a couple of useful features and tweaking the camera app. The Assist app makes your phone more intelligent, for example you can set the hours you usually sleep for and the phone will automatically go silent, or only allow favorite callers, or those who call twice in succession through. It will also go on vibrate if you have a meeting in your diary. Both could be useful, though they're still a little inflexible for our liking.Worth for 14K Rs. Sleek super fast Phone with very issues to report..Here is my review on Moto G in one sentence. Sleek super fast phone with pure google android with very few issues to report. 
 
Pros 
------- 
Gaming on the phone is excellent. Tried Asphalt 8 (which is very GPU and CPU intensive game), and it works great. Here is the video http://youtu.be/47ROCcn7_aU 
Great Display 
Fast navigation across menus. 
Browsing is very quick. 
Applications launch real quick. 
GPS works great. 
Speaker volume is adequate. 
Phone voice clarity is good. 
Great looks. 
 
Cons 
------- 
Camera is ok when lighting is good. Else average. 
Battery is life average (one day) with 3.5 hours screen on time. 
When you use it with 2 sims, on the primary sim if you try to enable 3g it goes to 2g always. Work around is, disable 2nd sim. On primary sim enable 3g and then enable 2nd sim back. 
Charging time is more. May take 2 hours to full charge.Highest end-budget Phone..Ignoring the initial fiasco, it has been a very good purchase so far. 
 
Regarding Phone: It has killer specifications, available at a jaw dropping price. 
Pros: Brilliant display, excellent battery backup, smooth UI, KITKAT upgrade runs very smooth, speaker volume and quality is superb. 
Cons: Slightly sluggish call quality. 
 
Overall this is a brilliant phone to own, and Motorola has made no compromise on quality (clearing any speculations on the quality v/s price). This could just turn out to be Motorola's game changing deal (for the Indian Market). 
 
Regarding Flipkart: I got my phone after 10 days of pre-booking it the 7th of February. It was shipped brilliantly. Sadly one of the bundle cords was not working, but thumbs up to Flipkart as they resolved the issue with 24 hours.

For this Product i will give 5 Star Rating...Excellent Phone!!Very Good Product From Motorola.Its a nice phone, 
Excellent build quality, Superb Screen Quality, Awesome Speaker and inbuilt sound(Buy a Samsung or Sony Earphone). 
 
Overall I am highly satisfied with it but I gave it 4 Stars because of its low 2G internet speed. If you are using 3G then its ok but if you will use 2G net on this device, speed is below average. You can't open Play Store. Most of the time it will show connection timeout. 
 
It is not a problem of my network provider, because when I use same sim with my Galaxy Grand Quattro, the browsing speed is much better then MOTO G. Even I can easily open the play store and can download any application. 
 
So this is the major issue with this phone. It need a very good signal strength for net browsing. 
 
If you leave this issue, all other features are excellent. I am highly satisfied, more then my Grand Quattro.Moto G 16 GB user review.Value for money dual SIM smartphone. The interface is very user friendly and quite fast. Opening and running multiple applications does not cause the phone to dither. 
The phone has got a fair bit of heft to it - this can be a boon or a bane whichever way you look at it, but personally, i feel psychologically satisfied with a slightly heftier unit compared to the feather-weight stuff that you get otherwise. 
Google Maps functions particularly well and this phone can easily double up as your GPS device when driving. Camera is pretty decent too. 
Downsides are a one day battery life on a full charge (if you are usage is continuous) and no SD card slot for storage expansion. 
 
For the asking price you get a very nice smartphone with all the essentials that you require for daily usage at one third the price of some famous competitors.A value for money phone!.Just got my Moto G delivered 2 days back. But couldn't get the flip cover as it it out of stock.Very good phone for the price..I got this phone on 8th Feb and thought of writing about it after a few days of use. First thing to mention is its build quality, after two weeks of normal use there is nothing, not even a spot on the phone, neither on glass nor the cover. Being a lay user this phone has everything I look for: processing speed, good looks, dual sim, clear calls, decent camera with LED flash (front camera is a bonus) and loads of apps. Despite all the good things said, I have a few complaints too :). No memory card slot, out of 8GB about 6 GB is available. If you are a photo and video crazy person, then life is going to be tough with this phone. Next is the earphone, it is not pink or a canal phone for that matter, as shown in the promotional picture in Flipkart. So dont fall for it. Not so good earphone spoils a bit otherwise excellent package.Battery is not as good as claimed / advertised, not suitable for outdoor usage..I got the 8GB version 2 weeks ago. Some websites falsely advertised that the phone has 24 hours of talktime ( which is not true ). The actual claim as per motorola's website is that the battery lasts 24 hours on mixed usage &amp; this is true. Since i like to play games, I installed Temple Run OZ. The battery drains very quickly while playing. I played for 30 minutes &amp; the battery was drained by 15%. The back of the phone ( battery ) was also noticeably heated up (warm not hot) after 30 minutes of playing. This was the only disappointment from this phone. If you are thinking of outdoor usage, then this phone would not be suitable because in India the phone is not supplied with USB charger / data cable in the box (only the wall charger). Is it a good option to buy any electronic item online? Will update my review as and when I get updates.Good Phone at an amazing price..I got the 16GB version on 3rd March. It took about 10 days. But i am quite happy. So sharing with you the experience in these few days of usage. 
PROS- 
1. Very good display. I tried high resolution videos and all are playing OK without any lags or freezes. 
2. Feels great in the hand. The design is such that you'll feel its the right size of a device in your palms. The rubbery coating is also good on the back cover althogh it tends to become dirty if you have wet or oily hands. 
3. A lot has been said about the quality of the camera. Sorry, but i found it to be a quite decent one. The flash is also Good for low light photo clicks. 
4. I've read somewhere that Aircel SIM is not working with Moto G. I am here to prove it wrong. I am using Aircel and Idea Micro Sims(cut from normal Sims). They seem to be working fine. The cutting of the sims with the puncher should be right and precise. 
5. Games like temple run, Subway surfers are tested to be running fine on my phone. 
6. Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot is working fine on this phone. 
7. Coming to OS- I don't know why in the description put up by Flipkart says that the phone comes with Jelly Bean installed and up-gradable to KitKat, coz when i unboxed the device and turned it On, i first checked the Android version. To my amazement its KITKAT Pre-installed. So i didn't have to upgrade it. 
8. I have read several comments of the phone comes in an unsealed pack. Sorry, but when it reached here, i found the box to be sealed with a Motorola labelled tape. 
 
CONS- 
1. Not impressed with voice clarity..I mean i don't really know, if its got to do something with the network i am using, it may be bad here etc. 
2. Sometimes the screen doesn't seem to respond to tough jut for a second. I haven't removed the original screen lamination till now. I think it could also be the reason. 
3. The headphones really are not that good. No Bass, cheap...could be better...but with other 3rd party headphones, sound seems to be O.K. 
4. Comes with a Stock Android with very minor customization. Pre-installed apps are less. Samsung devices are costly because their OS is customized to the maximum and comes with maximum usable apps like swipe keyboard etc. 
5. Battery not user removable. I don't know what will happen if something is wrong or how much will it cost to replace the battery at an authorized service centers later. 
6. Removing the back cover is a tough work..it sometimes make you feel that it broke while opening the back cover, 
7. Although loud speaker is good but FM cannot be made to play on the loud speaker. You've got to plug in the headphones to turn on the radio and to listen to. 
 
Still a recommendable device, for those who wants the taste of Kit Kat at a low price.pros n cons of moto g.friends, this is the best budget mobile in indian market with all needful features...some of the cons i m finding are avg. camera and avg phone speaker...headphone provided with set is not good but i am using samsung headphone with same jack that is working good...charger provided is not usb data cable charger which are provided by most of mobile manufacturer now a days...also u will struggle to find screen guard, body cover and flipcover in market and if u wil find that in market they would b of poor quality and price of these gadgets are very high on flipkart...also there is issue of very less service center when would b needed...but inspite of that i think, its better than most of indian and chinese mobile set which are selling mobile set at higher prices now a days with good specs. on paper but poor in hardware...so its better to go with brand with some flaws.MotoG Awesome phone, iphone 5s seems overrated but still read this one b4 BUYING.I am in love with this phone though i have used it for 4 days now. 1) HD IPS Display, 720 x 1280 pixels, 4.5 inches, 326ppi.(Grand2 old TFT Display, 5.25 inches ~280ppi.) 
2) Corning Gorilla Glass 3 protection.(Grand2 normal glass) 
3) 8/16 GB internal memory, No memory cards slot but Can use microUSB v2.0 PenDrive, 1 GB RAM-Sufficient for gaming (Grand2 8GB Internal memory, microSD slot, 1.5GB ram) 
4) HSPA+ 21 Mbps Download speed. 
5) Better benchmark than Grand2 (As per fonearena - Moto G won 7 out of 11 benchmarks tests against Grand2) 
6) High speed Bluetooth v4.0 with A2DP 
7) 5MP main camera with HDR, LED flash, panorama, 720p Video recording@30fps, stereo sound rec., 1.3MP Secondary camera.(Grand2 8MP main camera but no HDR, 1.9MP Secondary Cam) 
8) Android latest OS v4.4.2 KitKat (Grand2 old Jelly Bean v4.3) 
9) Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 Quad-core 1.2 GHz Cortex-A7 CPU (quite faster than Grand2) 
10) Best Graphics Card Adreno 305 GPU 
11) HTML5, A-GPS support and GLONASS, FM radio, Java support etc. 
12) Li-Ion 2070 mAh battery(best for 4.5in display) 
13) Dual sim option

Quick Review: 
Pros: 
Performance : A quad-core snapdragon along with 1 GB RAM gets you through all tasks easily. 
Looks : Nice curvy design that fits well into the palm. The overall built is solid. 
Screen : An beautiful HD 720p screen with amazing contrasts. Would give any AMOLED a run for its money. 
No Bloatware: No music hubs or social hubs or chatOn , that kind of gimmicks. Clean, quick, slick interface. 
 
Cons: 
Non-expendable memory i.e no place for a storage expansion via a micro-SD card. Choose your variant: 8 GB or 16 GB carefully. 
Camera : Its ok for casual goofing around with WhatsApp,Instagram but if you are looking for a very nice snapper that gives you sharp,focused images with details, please walk away. This isn't for camera lovers.

Gr8 deal !! go for it without pile of thinkin..Great phone, good value for money.For day to day usage, the price-performance ratio is unbeatable. You get a Quad core chip, very good (IPS) screen, the phone itself isn't too large, but is pocketable, which was one of my main criteria, unlike the hefty Grand or Note types of phones which have progressively larger screens. 
 
The phone is very responsive, while it is a slower SOC, it is snappy for normal usage. Gaming is also good, but the GPU isn't as good as the current lot of high end phones (understandable, given that they cost 2X as much). 
 
You will not notice lag or sluggishness with this phone, unless there are a ton of applications trying to get CPU attention. Battery life is excellent, and you can get by with a day (or more) of usage depending on your usage pattern. Build quality is great, it appears sturdy enough, no creaks or flex anywhere.Moto G Rocks...!! So does flipkart too...!!!.Moto G...exceptional..way beyond imagination at this price tag....!! So anyone looking at getting the Moto G will be better off investing in the larger 16GB version.

You can see which phones get this upgrade. The screen resolution and colour rendering is stunning. Looks much better in hand than on screen, feels well put together. Battery is non removable but still delivers a good days use. The camera is good in daylight but struggles in low light. It has a superb build quality, powerful software and a more than average hardware configuration. 
 
Its perfect for an average user who has a balanced usage pattern. Its also apt for a user transitioning into touch phone for the first time. 
 
Screen is sharp, touch is very responsive and all top applications run without any lag or glitch. Camera is capable of capturing reasonably good quality images. 
 
Managing memory might become tricky and problematic as time passes since you don't have an option to expand it. 
 
As of today you wont find a much better phone at that price. There isn't much any other sub 20,000 INR phone can do that Moto G can't!

Since Motorola is a google company now therefore one can simply expect the best out of the software and the user interface. The UI is smooth and user friendly. Motorola has got some of its own additional features such as security and assist softwares which are quite thoughtful. 
The body is way more superior with polished and matte finish, compared to other cellphones at this budget. The battery runs a full day without any problem and with continuous usage. 
Truly I always wanted Motorola to be back in the market and take their deserving place as they were the pioneer of mobile tech. I thank google to have revived the company and get it back in business. I also thank flipkart to partner and market such a great product.What we really should know about this product. :).First of all i would like to appreciate Flipkart for their quick delivery. I recently bought the 16GB variant of this phone which came with an Android updated KitKat 4.4.2 version. Phone is rich in looks and has got perfect handling. I would recommend this phone to each and everyone looking for a Smart phone under 20K. 
 
Pro's 
------ 
- Smooth 1.2 GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 400, Quad Core working in 1 GB RAM which run's applications with an ease. 
- 4.7&quot; IPS LCD with 16 M Display color 
- Adreno 305, 450 MHz Single Core For smooth game play 
- Amazing Secondary Camera for high quality video conferencing 
- Touch response 
 
Con's 
-------- 
- Poor quality Headset 
- Software Issues after Android KitKat 4.4.2 update (Usb OTG feature missing, Wifi and Data connectivity issues) 
- Primary Camera 
- WeightHiii MOTO.I ordered the phone on 7th and was delivered on 12th. It was an excellent service by flipkart. 
The downside is that I had to change the shipping address due unavailability of courier service. I would request flipkart to expand the logistic support throughout India.

Thats amazing from Motorola. Performance is on par with many high end phones like S4, LG G2(though not that fast). Battery life is not that good, as I expected a little more. But thats ok as MOTO G is the first phone to get KITKAT update in India other than Nexus line. 
Camera is good in day light but bit worse in night or low light condition. 
Speaker volume is high but sound quality and earpiece quality could be little more better.

The phone feels well built, of quality materials and it handles well (can almost be use one-handed). I would have preferred the volume button on left. 
 
Pros 
- good quadcore processor handles tasks easily given the 1GB of RAM 
- not much fluff on top of Android4.3 and guaranteed update to 4.4 
- good looking screen with vibrant colors and great resolution/DPI 
- built-in FM radio (yes, I'm old-fashioned but it was a must for me) 
- camera is decent for a phone 
- LED is powerful enough and makes a good spot for using as flashlight 
- dual sim 
 
Cons 
 
- no SD card (this is more of a fault to me since I like to put loads of music on my phone and thus only 4 star rating. There&#8217;s nothing I can do with this phone.The iPhone 4S is a really great device to have and play around. I started this review just to give the Apple iPhone a fair shake and to truly understand what exactly I hate about the iPhone and why I talk down to it so much. I have been an Android fan since the first day Google announced their first phone the G1, after that day I loved Android. However this review is not what I hate about the iPhone rather the features between the two platforms. HARDWARE:The iPhone 4S is Apple's current phone and the physical hardware of the phone makes it look elegant and professional. The Phone comes in two different colors, White and Black. I love how the phone has a mute/unmute rocker switch on the left side of the phone, although I can turn on the phone and turn the volume down this little yet helpful feature made my life so much more easier. The phone is made out of a 3.5 inch edge-to-edge glass front and back with an aluminum band all around the side of the phone. Everything about this phone feels premium and sturdy however knowing this is made out of glass also made me worry more. If I were ever to drop this phone on any hard surface above 4 feet or higher will shatter the glass. At the bottom of the phone lives the speakers, this is a BONUS for me because I often lay my phone either face down or have the phone lay on its back and on most phones the speaker is on the back. Having the speaker on the bottom of the phone helps prevent any noise muffling or reduce the quality of sound. The back is where the camera and flash is located. This phone carries an 8 megapixel lens that is capable of capturing full 1080p videos and pictures. The photos on this camera is pretty decent and the video play back is also amazing however I expected more after hearing from everyone how great the camera quality was. SOFTWARE: The iPhone 4S is currently running IOS 5.1.1 however I manage to install IOS 6 BETA 2 on the phone to see what feature I will have if I do decide to stick with this phone. IOS6 won't be release until Fall. IOS 6 is really plain and simple any child, grandparents, or even parents could pick up the device and know how to navigate there way. The apps in the Apple Store are very useful to manage my daily life and also help me manage my finance like the app MINT. Texting on this phone took me a while to get used too and after two weeks I am still not that perfectly comfortable texting. I don't like the fact I have to long press on a word and move the magnification glass to the exact letter I want to fix because of auto spell. Also the dictionary on this phone really irritates me, if I want to add a word to my dictionary I would have to go to Settings/ General/ Keyboard/ Add New Shortcut and add the word soooooo annoying. I want it where I can tap on the word and just add it to my dictionary right when i'm texting. However the keys are perfectly spaced out, i'm just not used to texting with a small screen I am used to 4.5inch screens and above. I travel a lot so a navigational app is a MUST app for me. The IOS 5.1.1 currently does not have a turn-by-turn navigation system built in the OS (operating system) and after testing the GPS (global positioning system) out it provided the long route and sometimes they were wrong. The new IOS6 does have turn-by-turn navigation and after testing this GPS out I only had one issue with it, it sometimes take me to the longer route (but no biggy I guess). Siri is sometimes helpful and can minimize time depending what you ask it. I noticed asking Siri to remind me to call someone or remind me to do something was the best feature for me because sometimes typing it out would take too long. The Geo-Location on this phone works perfectly, for those who doesn't know what that is. If you need to remember something you can ask Siri to remind you to call or do something once you leave or get to a place and when you get there Siri will remind you through a popup notification without any time input. The Note and Reminder app will sync to any Apple computer, unfortunately unable to sync with PC (SAD LIFE FOR DAYS). Adding music, photos, movies, or anything else on this phone is pretty simple. Just plug in your iPhone and connect it to iTunes (Apples way to manage your apps and stuff) and select what you want to import. The WIFi (wireless fidelity also known for wireless networking) on this phone is really slow and downloading apps could sometimes take some time depending how many apps you are trying to download. The phone app is crystal clear but I did notice the volume was a little low and even though my hearing is not that great, compared to other devices you can definitely notice the difference. I never once got a drop call and being on the Sprint Network I always had phone signal everywhere I go however once I go through heavy walls in a building like the Best Buy staff lounge my signals was very weak. The New notification is very useful and being able to still get into my notification center while in a game or other full screen apps is a BIG plus for me. CONCLUSION: I do recommend this phone to those who want something simple, easy, and have something reliable at all times. However if you want a phone that has up-to-date GPS and travels a lot then consider Android. This phone is really great and don't have much complains other than those I mentioned above. Let me know what you think and if I left anything out I do apologize this is just several feature I noticed while using this phone for two weeks. iPhones suckYou are misguiding people not I(Reply to Sundeep).Dear Sundeep. Your argument are very flawed and inaccurate. Let me correct each one of them, 
 
Your fact no 1: You cannot transfer songs: You can transfer whatever songs you have. You can download MP3's from anywhere you want and transfer them to your iphone. Pretty much like any other phone. All you need is itunes installed in your PC. 
 
 Your fact no 2: Cannot transfer anything but photos and vedios: Of course you can. You can transfer whatever file imaginable which can be used on a phone. PDF, Movies, word. xls even Zip files from you PC. 
 
Your fact no. 3: No wifi Hotspot: Yes there is. Go to settings&gt;personal hotspot. You can share you cellular data with up to 5 devices. 
 
Your fact no. 4. Only one hour battery life. My iphone goes a day very easily; easily 5 hours when I do continuous intense gaming on it. By intense gaming i mean really intense games like NOVA 3, Real Racing 3. 
 
Your Fact no. 5. No Bluetooth. Of course there is bluetooth on iphone. Its just you can't tranfer files and that will never happen. I have explained why. 
 
Your fact no. 6. No dedicated camera sensor. Do you really think iphone 4 does not have a CMOS sensor/ Do you really thing a camera can work without a cmos sensor? Do you even know what these sensor means? FYI. BSI CMOS or CCD sensors are like a photographic reel for a digital camera. No digital camera works without them. 
 
For you next reply. Please google anything you say on a public portal. Incomplete information is always dangerous.

Now to the phone. 
 
Am an Apple user for a while now, so buying this phone was a no-brainer. But, buying it for my elderly mum made even more sense. Purely because (unlike Android), iOS 'just works' for those who're not tech fidgety. Its reliable, performs wonderfully, and gets updated each year (although I realise iPhone 4 may never get updated to iOS 8 and beyond). 
 
But, seriously, for a premium phone from the Apple stable, this phone makes the best sense under Rs 20K. While it may not have the bells and whistles of 5C and 5S, it still runs ALL the 20 or so most used 3rd party apps flawlessly. 
 
And, my mum couldn't really care about ppi, retina display, 4&quot; screen etc... As for 8GB, she's just thrilled to use a premium device at a non-premium price. 
 
My last word is that whilst its true that iPhone is now a 4 year old device, its still a brilliant workhorse under 20K for those keen to enter the Apple ecosystem. 
 
So, although it may not give bragging rights, the iPhone 4 will definitely give you a fantastic user experience and sense of satisfaction of using a premium quality device!

Its best-known hardware products are the Mac line of computers, the iPod music player, the iPhone smartphone, and the iPad tablet computer. Apple it world wide Number 1 .... with its quality and product ....!1Very Good deal in this price range!!.First of all, those who compare iphones with other android phones, like Nexus 4, should not think that iphone are worst just because they do not have spec sheet of android. Iphones and androids are part of entirely different business models which makes them incomparable with each other. It is like comparing apples with oranges. Nexus 4 in the same price range is a great smartphone, but there are still a lot of reasons to choose iphone 4 over nexus 4: 
 
1) Performance: Iphones are known for their performance. To know what that means, you'll have to use an iphone. Web browsing, photo editing, office, email etc. is just so snappy and fast in iphone. Although with Jelly Bean, android is catching up with ios, but it is still not there yet. Once you have used iphone it is do difficult to go back to android. 
 
2) Looks: Iphone is certainly one of the best, if not the best looking smartphone, ever sold. Those who say that iphone is just for show off, should understand great looks is also a feature. You would never buy a car which has great specs but bad looks, would you? 
 
3)Ecosystem: This is the strongest reason to buy an apple product in general. The apple's app ecosystem is richest of all competetive app markets, both in quantity and quality. Android's google play is good enough, no doubt, but they cannot match quality of apps avilable in appstore. Apps like garage band,pages, phoster,paper by 52, repix and others are amazing apps which are exclusive to iOS. Even the apps which are available in both the platforms are usually better on iOS. Just see the default apps for Twitter, IMDb, facebook on both the platform if you don't believe me. 
 
4) Security: 70 percent of all malware which are created are for Android. This is the data by Norton. You can check their official website for details. Iphones also get infected by malwares but chances are fairly less. Because of having a closed ecosytem, it is difficult to hack an ios device. You'll never get an app from appstore which can compromise your security because unlike google, apple scrutinizes every app which is posted in appstore; plus any security breaches are closed watched by apple and quickly fixed by their quick updates. And it is so easy to update an iphone. Those who have tried updating an android would know the pain. 
 
Their are still some reasons, you would not want to buy an iphone. 
 
1) Lack of customization: In iphone you can change your wallpaper, move your icons, make some folders; that is pretty much it you can do on an iphone in the name of customization. If you are somebody who gets bore with something very easily and customization is your thing, iphone is not for you. 
 
2) Closed ecosytem: You cannot use bluetooth to tranfer any data. You'll always need itunes to tranfer anything to your phone. Android users have luxury of using their phones as portable storage devices. Iphone just cannot do that. 
 
3)Small screen: There was time when 3.5&quot; screen was considered as 'huge'. Today they look tiny. I myself is a fan of 4.7&quot; and 5&quot; screens in android devices. I wish iphone came in larger screens. 
 
If you should buy an iphone 4 or not, depends on the kind of person you are and what do you intend to do with it. If you don't care about customization and all you need is a device which is fast, snappy, secure and has a lot of quality apps you definitely should buy iphone 4 even though it is a 3 year old device. If you are somebody who needs a lot of freedom, need larger screens, watch a lot of movies on a phone, buy nexus 4. If you want to play a lot of games, buy iphone as it has much better collection of games than android.If you want a great camera, iphone is the way to go. In this price range iphone 4's camera is the best, much better than a mediocre camera in Nexus 4. 
 
Basically if you are a geek and intend to do a lot more than just usual stuff, android is the way to go. If you are somebody who does a lot of productivity work iphone the phone for you. 
 
And please stop talking about 'spec sheet' in android devices. As a costumer what matters to me is how fast my phone performs than how many cores it has. Iphone 4 has a single core 1 GHz processor and only 512 Mb of RAM, no way it means that it is slower than other devices. Anybody who has played graphic intense games like infinity blade, Mordern Combat, NOVA2 on iphone would know how fast these little iphones are. It is one of the fastest phone in market today, ofcourse it is slower than iphone 4s and iphone 5. I have used Galaxy S4 a bit which has a heck of a CPU; it still lags at many places. 
 
Please use an iphone before commenting against it. Android has some great devices and it is perfectly okay to love them. You need not hate an iphone to love an android. I personally love both. Android is just a very different kind of device so is iphone but by no means it is a piece of 'shit'. You are just fooling yourself by saying that. XPERIA Z1 oR IPHONE 5s ARE THE PHONES TO OWN-BUY BOTH IF U CAN:)DISGUSTING!.Before I start this review,I'd just like to say that I'm writing it from a basic users perspective. 
Previously I had used a Samsung Wave Y,a pretty good budget smartphone.Man was I looking forward to getting my first iPhone. I wanted to see what the craze was all about.I'll sum up the pros and cons in simple,understandable terms: 
Pros: 
Keyboard:I quite liked the keyboard.It was decently spaced and allowed me to easily handle WhatsApp and text messaging at a decent pace and accurately. 
Ease of use:iOS is extremely easy to use,making it a good choice for a first smartphone.Creating folders is very easy.Double click on the home button to display the apps in use,long tap for voice controls/Siri for updated versions of iOS,and you're ready to go. 
Visuals:I bought this phone after the price cut to 26500.The graphics are pretty good for that price bracket(25-30k).I've played games like Dead trigger and Temple Run 2. 
App support:Probably the only thing which I REALLY like about this phone.U get various titles,from adventure to shooting. 
Medium: 
Processor-1 ghz dual core.Well,it isn't a quad core.It just isn't.However,it's average for surfing the web and using apps like YouTube and Facebook. 
Cons: 
Bluetooth?More like bluetooth for the heck of it:I'm a HARDCORE music freak.First of all,No music downloader in the app store(like there is gTunes for android.).Then I tried getting songs through bluetooth from my sisters s3.Didnt happen.Apple products only recognize Apple products.Everyone uses bluetooth. 
Music problem:This is by far the worst.Syncing from PC to iTunes is an experience which brings tears to my eyes.I dont use a Mac(I use Dell Alienware m14x).So I had to connect the phone to the laptop.U have to download iTunes(15 mins),convert windows media songs to iTunes format,connect your phone,configure it,checkif its configured in iTunes,and then go through 3 sync steps,BEFORE EVEN STARTING THE SYNC. 
WhatsApp problem:Im pretty sure 95% of the people use whatapp.However,its 55 bucks in the app store!!Unbelievable!Its free on most other operating systems. 
Summary:The phone has 4 teenie meenie pros,and 3 HUGE cons. 
Suggestion:Go for Nexus 4(25900) or 1x+ from HTC(29990),but don't take this.Apple is only for Fanboys.If you are looking for a value-for-money product, STOP ! ! ! 
 
Apple is an over-priced n over-rated Company, though it does have a few good points - 
 
Pros - 
 
It's easy to use (because you can't customise or change anything) and 
It's meant for 'non-tech' people, who just need a basic phone, which works easily. 
 
Having said that, it's now time for the Cons : 
 
Extremely expensive (considering it's relatively low tech specs) 
 
Extremely irritating for enthusiasts who like to constantly tweak their phones 
 
'Locked-down' feature blocks even simple operations like transferring data / need to go through iTunes, which is irritating in daily use 
 
Cannot open most standard formats of files / incompatible with MS Office, so not for those wanting to use this for work

Have some self esteem... LETS SHUN THIS Cheapster Version.!Avoid iPhone if you are not hell bite to bite the Adam's Apple!!!.Well, I bought iPhone from a neighborhood mobile store a few days ago. Well, I do have a few things to share about this phone. 
 
Issues 
1. The camera isn't upto the mark. I have seen better camera and resolution in blackberries that I owned before this. In fact, my galaxy tab 2 has a much better camera sans the flash. 
2. There's nothing really great about this phone apart from the Apple brand name 
3. The battery dies out in less than 12hours from full charging even on moderate usage 
4.Not really suitable for those who get loads of emails every day. I am still struggling with this iPhone since I am used to blackberry and Samsung tab2 which are far more email friendly phones 
5. Messaging is a big pain if you don't use whatsapp or other messaging services 
6. The volume of the in built speakers is way too low to be heard with window ACs on. 
 
Pros 
1. While the sound volume is quite low, I'd definitely vouch for the quality of the output. And, yes, it is definitely great if you can hang around with earphones locked into your ears all day long. 
2. The screen resolution is pretty good and much better than the cheaper imitations out there in the market. 
3. Of course, lots of apps around for Apple!!! 
 
Overall 
NOT RECOMMENDED for a those looking to mix business and pleasure in a phone.... This a strictly pleasure phone for those who will have the time to charge it twice daily and spend more time playing with the apps or sharing photos. If you talk for more than 4 hours a day on phone and use it for sending or receiving anything above 30-40odd emails a day, you'll probably either shoot yourself or this phone within days of buying it. 
 
Definitely not recommended for business users. And yeah, even for the rest of your guys, please use your money wisely on another phone. This Apple just doesn't have the flavour or the taste or the texture or the feel of the real deal....

Well i have used both Android and Iphone (i am using one iphone 4 and samsung galaxy S3) and i am happy with both. 
 
The basic deference in Android and Iphone is Quality. In android you will get tons of feature and everything will be acceptable quality. 
Consider GPS navigation, 
 :In android you can say it works 9 out of 10 times, only in rare cases you will find its not locking with satellite. it will lock by 30/40 secs most of the time. 
 :In iphone it will work 10/10 times. you will never find a case when it doesn't get locked to sattelite in 20secs. 
 
Consider Music quality: 
 : Take any damn music phone which you think is best in quality, whether HTC beat or samsung or Nokia, take any phone. Now connect it to Bose headphone and listen. Done? Take iphone and connect to Bose headphone and listen, you will know the answer, iphone sound quality is anytime better. 
 
Stability: 
Imagine an andorid phone you are using since last 6 months and you have never restarted, it will become so slow that it will stop working because of memory leak, in iphone u will never face any issue. No hang at all. 
 
Smoothness: Every single touch is responded. Take any android phone doesn't matter how fast it is, u will still end up in situations like you have to press 2/3 times to open an Application, in iphone u will not face this. 
 
Well enough of praising the iphone now lets go to andorid: 
consider u went to a friends house and taken few photos, ur friends mom ask you to share those photo to her cellphone, Boom, man u cannot even share a photo using bluetooth and u call this a smartphone? u cannot share a mp3 song or copy a mp3 song. u have to either mail it or have to use itune, what kind of smarphone is this? 
 
U upgraded to ios7? u will realize how slow this iphone 4 is. 
 
I hope u guys understood by now, if you want tons of feature and okay with acceptable quality (90%) well go with android let the iphone guys keep on shouting. 
 
But if you are someone who need everything perfect and not ready to compromize and 1% in quality, iphone is the one. Dont worry about the price it worth for that extra quality. 
 
I have been using iphone 4 and galaxy s3 since more than a year now and i am happy with both. I use iphone as primary and S3 as secondary as for me i cannot compromise on quality. 
 
Choice is yours: 
 
Happy with 90% quality, dont want to spend much go with Android.

major cons: no siri(so rather nothing extraordinary) can hardly feel the difference from a 15k mobile other then the bodyApple fans are not stupid..Mr Sundeep, I am really sad that you own an iphone and do not love it. I never said an iphone never lags. I said, it 'USUALLY' performs better than android phones in the same price range. I have seen subway surfer on 'iphone'. Yes it lags, and it lags like hell; much worse than it does on android device(Galaxy SII). Thats the reason why I never played that game on my iphone. Their are hundreds of games appstore, which lag. 
 
Now lets come to other game. You own an iphone right? Please download Real Racing 3 on both the platforms; Its a free game and see the difference. Download Batman-Dark Knight Rises or asphalt 7 Heat or Modern Combat 4. See the load times, graphic performance and graphic details on both the platforms. I won't give a judgment here, i would request you to see for yourself. Their is another game called Infinity Blade. It is free on iOS; sadly it is not available on android. See the graphic performance; I am sure you'd love it. 
 
If all the above graphic intense games perform better on an ios device and a game like subway surfer performs bad, it explains the only thing. Subway Surfer is a badly ported app on iOS; like hundred others. And believe me their are so many games on iOS, you'll never miss subway surfer. I would like say a few things here: 
 
1) Performance does not entirely depend on the clock speed or amount of RAM. If it did, phones like galaxy y and Xperia Tipo would have been performing better than iphone 4. We all know the truth, don't we. 
 
2) Their is no multitasking on iphone is a myth. It has the best multitasking management in place. The way iOS does multi-tasking is very different. It gives preference to the app which is currently running on the screen, giving the best possible performance to the app you are using. It is smart enough to know which app to suspend which not. FYI Google with jelly bean and Key Lime Pie is trying to do the same thing. 
 
3) Battery issues. Probably you need an update if your battery runs only 4 hours. If it still does not solve your problem, please get it checked by Apple. Mine goes easily for a day and I do a lot of browsing on 3G. 
 
4) Blue-tooth transfer, NFC transfer or any kind of transfer is not possible on iphone. Not because it does not have blue-tooth or apple is so incapable of providing it; it is because Apple takes security very seriously. Bluetooth is the easiest way to hack your device. Thats why they ask you to switch off your bluetooth when not in use. You never have worry about that in an iphone. And excuse me, did you say iphone's bluetooth can only connect with apple devices. It can connects with all kind of bluetooth enabled devices, headphone etc. If blue-tooth transfer is so importannt for you, iphone is not a device for you. 
 
5) Performance. I would stick to what I said in my last review. iPhone are beasts on performance front. I own both iphone and galaxy sII. I do all my browsing on iphone because once you have got used to the snappy performance on iphone, it is so difficult to browse on galaxy sII. 
 
6) Please tell me on which scale Nexus 4 is '100 times better' than iphone 4. I would be happy to see some benchmarking, something, anything which proves that. Nexus 4 is no doubt a great great device. I am personally a fan. Bit then these two devices are not entirely comparable for they are very different devices. My opinion- both are pretty good devices. 
 
I say it again, If you need a lot of freedom. You should buy an android device. On an android device, you can transfer data via bluetooth, NFC and wifi. You can download torrentz. You can install various skins and launchers. You can install widgets.You can open an app from the lock screen. These things are not and probably would never be possible on an apple device. 
 
If you need performance and lot of quality games. You do a lot of productivity work. Iphone is a must have. (Ease to use does not go in favour of iphone as both android and iphone are pretty easy to use.) 
 
In the end. Yes I am an apple fan. Apple has given me a lot of reasons to be that way. But I am an android fan as well. I love the freedom of android and performance of apple. Both have their pros and cons. I would recommend to have both kind of devices. If you want only one, decide on the basis of what you intend to do with it. If you choose Android; its a great choice not because you are rejecting Apple, because you are accepting android. 
 
PS. I don't know why I end up offending android fans while giving my honest opinion. I am an android fan too.Apple is all about fineness!.@Vijay Sisodia

BACK TO THE POINT 
 
Considering SPECIFICATION iPhone 4 (24+ k device) to my XOLO q800 (11.5k device) ON FLIPKART 
 
CPU :- Apple 1 GHz Cortex-A8 Processor ::: XOLO q800 :- 1.2 GHz, Quad Core Cortex-A9 Processor( Cortex a9 &gt;&gt;&gt; Cortex A8, it beats even with single core to iPhone 4) 
 
GPU : iPhone 4 : PowerVR SGX535::: XOLO 800 : PowerVR SGX544 ( XOLO's GPU is MUCH MUCH more superior to the one in iPhone 4) 
 
Ram : iPhone 4 : 512 MB::: XOLO Q800 : 1 GB 
 
XOLO q800 : BSI Sensor, CMOS Sensor for CAMERA ::: iPhone 4 : no dedicated sensors for camera 
 
Xolo can generate WIFI HOTSPOT , iPhone 4 cant 
 
Xolo's 2100 mAH Battery VS iPhone 4 1420 mAH battery 
 
Size : 4.5 inch vs 3.5 inch 
 
XOLO :Micro SD support, you can transfer the downloaded files on your computer, whereas in iPhone 4 you can only transfer your pics and videos, nothing else.

Apple EXTREMELY OVERPRICEDIt was listed as &#34;Unlocked&#34; iphone5, but it was locked, my friend took the phone back to China, couldn't use it and needed to send back.Product received before informed meeting all my expectations. Indicate to everyone. iPhone 5 is light, beautiful and elegant. Recomend it.In deciding to go with blazing fast LTE capability in the iPhone 5, Apple was forced to release three different devices to meet compatibility with different LTE network standards worldwide. The A1428 model iPhone 5 is the Canadian and US AT&T network GSM iPhone, including broad support for UMTS/HSPA+DC-HSDPA (frequencies 850, 900, 1900, 2100 MHz), GSM/EDGE (frequencies 850, 900, 1800, 1900 MHz), and LTE bands 4 and 17. The A1429 iPhone comes in two different flavors, one CDMA and one GSM. The GSM model is designed to support LTE in Asia (including Hong Kong, Japan, Singapore, and South Korea). This GSM iPhone will also work on LTE in Australia, Germany, and the UK on bands 1, 3, and 5. The CDMA version of model A1429 works on Sprint's and Verizon's LTE networks in the US, along with the KDDI network in Japan on bands 1, 3, 5, 13, and 25. The CDMA version also supports GSM bands, making the CDMA iPhone 5 compatible with GSM networks. However, the CDMA A1429 will not support LTE on GSM networks in the US. Full specs from Apple: GSM model A1428: UMTS/HSPA+/DC-HSDPA (850, 900, 1900, 2100 MHz); GSM/EDGE (850, 900, 1800, 1900 MHz); LTE (Bands 4 and 17) CDMA model A1429: CDMA EV-DO Rev. A and Rev. B (800, 1900, 2100 MHz); UMTS/HSPA+/DC-HSDPA (850, 900, 1900, 2100 MHz); GSM/EDGE (850, 900, 1800, 1900 MHz); LTE (Bands 1, 3, 5, 13, 25) GSM model A1429: UMTS/HSPA+/DC-HSDPA (850, 900, 1900, 2100 MHz); GSM/EDGE (850, 900, 1800, 1900 MHz); LTE (Bands 1, 3, 5)The iphone came quickly, but after inserting the nano-simcard, we realize the iphone is locked and attached to At&T network, it means that works only with AT&T network. What can I do to unlock it? the Iphone is now in colombia because it was supposed to be a gift.I've owned iPhones since their first incarnation, and have until now almost always been pleased with the developments made to the next generation over the last, with the exception of the iphone 4 and the design fault that resulted in a complete drop of signal when held in your hand without a case on it (I still own 2 of them, don't believe the spin, they really do drop signal). The 4s is a great phone, quicker than the 4 and without the signal / aerial debacle. The iPhone 5 however is a disappointment. It's thinner apparently, not that you'd notice, especially as due to it's design you have to have it in a case to prevent it from being destroyed by everyday careful usage. But in order to make it thinner they had (so they say) to change the sync lead / charger lead connector to a new smaller design. If like me you have owned and continue to own previous versions of iPhones, iPods and iPads, and have several chargers, Docks, car connectors and car chargers etc then this new design is really frustrating. The real reason that Apple changed the design is surely so that everybody has to go out and buy outrageously overpriced adaptors or new leads. I have read that Apple pays less than $0.6 for these leads, yet charges it's customers 25. Apple have also put a microchip in their leads that the iPhone is set to recognise, without which they are rejected by the iPhone in order to prevent third party manufacturers from producing leads that work properly, hence all the terrible reviews for these 3rd party products. It's just another of Apple's underhand money making exercises at the customers considerable inconvenience and expense. It's taller than the iPhone 4s. Some may like this, but I don't. The 4s sits comfortably in your hand and my thumb can reach the top of the screen on the 4s without having to change the position in my hand. I have bigger than average hands too. It is faster than the 4s, only a little, but it is faster. But this is the only improvement in my eyes. Battery life is poor, another sacrifice made to the god of (pointless) thinness. It feels cheaper and flimsier than the 4s too. Maps are a mess. Google maps was so much better on the 4 and 4s. Instead of this ridiculous connector fiasco, why couldn't we have kept the old and perfectly good connector and had wireless charging too? The technology is there, and would be a great improvement over the current system. A more robust design would be nice so that they didn't have to live in cases, and a dust and moisture resistant design would be very welcome. iCloud is fantastic, and so I can't imagine changing phones to another manufacturer until someone else comes out with something at least as good as iCloud. But when they do, I'll be more than happy to switch allegiance, despite twenty years as a loyal Apple customer. Apple can only push their customers so far, and I'm becoming more and more fed up with the way Apple is treating it's customers with regard to their infuriating thinness campaign with their phones, iPads, MacBook Pros and iMacs, at the expense of functionality and in a blatant attempt to corner the market and limit customers buying choices in terms of leads, adaptors, connections, music purchasing, app purchasing etc, as are many many other people. Apple is a great brand and has produced many fantastic products, but the iPhone 5 is not the leap ahead from the 4s that customers had hoped for, and this coupled with frustration and expense incurred by the connector design and the thinness over battery life and durability make it for me a 2 star product. If you own the 4s I'd suggest hanging on to it and waiting until Autumn for the next hopefully much improved iPhone, or Samsung, or whoever the Apple slayer will be.I bought an UNLOCKED iPhone 5 and Amazon sent me a locked one. The iPhone 5 is longer, sleeker, has a turn-by-turn navigation, and is faster then the old iPhones. This product is supposed to be an all around better quality product that zips through the market with its speed and overall appearance. Most users think that Apple has outdone themselves this time. The quality of the retina display makes watching videos more superior then before. From the alarm application, to sending e-mails, playing games, and checking your bank account. There are however some flaws to this product, for some of the devices the lock button begins to stop working. There have also been complaints with the IOS7 about the apps looking like toys, as well as the phone restarting. However, If you take the iPhone into Apple with any of these complaints they will gladly replace your iPhone, or do everything they can to fix the problem. Compared to the Android and the Samsung the screen is a little smaller, but with these phones side-by-side users say that the iPhone 5 is clearer, easier to zoom in and read text, and overall a good size to hold in one hand. Overall the iPhone 5 solves all the problems users had about old iPhones and other phones on the market. It has the perfect combination of stealth, light weight, user friendly applications, and overall a good product. The only downside seems to be the poor battery life, and the occasional device disfunction. It's just faster than the 4.I'm giving the iPhone 5 three stars for putting real glass as the screen cover (the part you touch to navigate.) Using real glass shows a lack of thought in the design. I've dropped my Droid Razer on the floor without the cover without any problems. Dropped the iPhone once and spider web cracks. Fortunately, the screen behind the glass works and there is no pixel damage. So it should be a quick easy fix for the folks at ihospital.com If you buy, purchase an Otterbox or Lifeproof case at the same time and put it on as soon as possible.This might be the last iPhone I ever buy. The 5 seems to solve almost all the problems that the previous iPhones had. I have been an iPhone customer ever since the first one was announce. All the old iPhones were plague with problems such as limited App support, slow browser, poor camera, laggy Apps, weight, low resolution, etc. The 5 have none of these problems. The only problem the iPhone 5 have is poor battery life. I mostly use this phone for lightweight computer stuff like browsing, YouTube, movies, music, word processing, email, camera, and phone stuff. It does everything better than most devices out there while staying very portable. Smoothness and stability have always been the hallmark of iOS which is the main reasons I never switched to other phones. Of all the years that I owned the iPhone, and of all the Apps that I've gone though, only a screen or two worth of Apps is useful. That said, not even useful most of the time. The Apps that I use most often are the ones that came with the phone with the exception of the Chrome browser. Everything is butter smooth especially with iOS 7. There are no Apps right now that lags on this phone. The size is perfect for watching movies, but not so big that it will feel bulky in your pocket. The speakers are decent enough to listen in a small room or watching from a distance. I do still prefer the headphones jack on the top like the older iPhones since it doesn't get in the way with my palm. The edgy shape of the phone does not feel nice when holding, but the phone is small and light enough so that you can put a more comfortable case on it. The camera shoots fast and is very clear and colorful, but focusing is still too slow. While the camcorder doesn't come close to the real thing, it is still far better than many mobile devices especially with stabilization. The display sharpness is still standard retina quality, which is optimal as suggested by Apple. It was good the first time I saw it on the iPhone 4, and if they made the pixel any more dense, I doubt there will be any noticeable difference. Otherwise, the screen is bright enough for sunlight and colorful as usual. I have seen better colors on other phones though, but the iPhone 5 screen is still spectacular. The iPhone 5 is much lighter than the older iPhones and it is also slimmer too, this will let you put on many cases without adding too much bulk. The larger screen is welcoming. The only thing bad about the large is that it is harder to reach the home button. I often have to tilt my phone to reach it. However, I watch a lot of movies on my phone so the larger screen is a great addition. The screen does feel significantly bigger with more viewing space, but most importantly, the phone itself doesn't feel bigger. It will still fit well in jean pockets. I know changing the screen size is a risky design change, I hope they don't make the phone any bigger, but I'm glad they did. The lighting connector is great too. It is slimmer, you can connect it any way you want and it feels quite durable for its size. However, I get a lot of disconnects with the lighting connector during sync, especially when I'm transferring large files. This is probably an issue with the lighting connector since I get the same problem with the iPad Mini which also uses the lighting connector. However, I have not notice this problem anymore, or at all, after the iOS 7 update. The battery life have always been a big problem with the iPhone. You can always buy a battery case, external battery, or carry the charger everywhere since there are outlets pretty much everywhere and the charger is no bigger than two ice cubes. The phone charges fairly fast, almost 50% per hour. I also want to add that iOS 7 have reduced the battery life slightly, but noticeably. Now that the 5S is out, I feel that it is not worth the upgrade from the 5. Practically speaking, the only major difference is the fingerprint reader since entering the pass-code have always been annoying. As for the camera, I don't see much difference in the outdoor picture quality, and the flash on the 5S is just an improvement from what was already bad. Low-light photos and slow-motion camera is something I can live without. A7 and 64-bit Apps are still far from the horizon. Remember, last year's iPad Mini is running on the A5, two generations behind yet still a fairly new product compared to the iPhone 5 which is running on the A6. You will only benefit if you are doing major video, photo, and sound editing on your iPhone, which I hope you are not. The iPhone is an excellent phone, but my next phone will probably be an Android. The old Android phones were beyond horrible, but they have improved so much that I must give them a try. PROS: Performance Weight and size Longevity support Hardware/Software design Larger screen Apps Apps Apps! CONS: Battery (Worst with iOS 7) Wish the camera focus fasterI'm a long-time Droid user, but opted to advance to I-phone 5 after Verizon pitched me a good deal (Phone = $225 if I sign up for two more years; since I'm not changing plans, I thought, why not). Phone was not of use with no sim cardDesign and Specifications Apple iPhone 5 has a 4.0&#8243; LED backlit IPS TFT capacitive touch screen with pixel density of 326ppi. The phone runs iOS 6 operating system with a 1.2 Ghz A6 processor and PowerVR SGX543MP4 GPU with 1GB RAM. The phone has dimensions of 123.8 x 58.6 x 7.6 mm making it 18% thinner than iPhone 4S because of its in-cell touch screen technology. The phone also weighs just 112grams, making it 20% lighter than the iPhone 4S. Camera and Multimedia The phone has an 8MP camera with a backlit CMOS image sensor. The camera has great features such as geo tagging, auto focus, touch focus, Panorama LED flash and face detection. There is a 1MP front facing camera with HD Facetime support for both Wifi and 3G/4G networks. Connectivity and Features Apple iPhone 5 is runs on quad core 2G and 3G networks as well as 4G LTE networks through Nano SIM. The phone supports internet access through GPRS, EDGE, 3G, Wifi and 4G LTE. The phone also has Bluetooth 4.0 , NFC and a 19 pin dock connector for connectivity and power. The iPhone 5 features an updated Siri voice assistant service that follows natural language commands and dictation. This is because iOS 7 was created specifically for the iPhone 5S, therefore, all other iPhones use their battery life to keep up with this software. I would recommend the iPhone 5 to anyone who likes to stay connected with the world through social media. If you are a business person, I would recommend choosing something more along the lines of a personal assistant that would have better battery life. After drying it off there was still water seeping out from inside the phone. I did the old rice in-a-bag trick, which often works. My iPhone is back online, with absolutely no side effects from the submersion. This demonstration of quality compelled me to write a review for once. On top of the many minor drops, sweaty runs, overuse, and general carelessness - the fact that it can recover from water submersion, to me, is a sign of a basic level of quality I need in a phone. Apple could probably manufacture these to fail under that level of mistreatment, so that we have to buy another, but they care about the performance of their product (in this case). So 5 stars for the iPhone 5. Oh, by the way, the rest of the device is great too. Camera's nice, lighter than older models, quick LTE speeds, blah blah. Battery life is just acceptable, but not enough for me to dislike it.Nice phone, i like it..Phone came in good condition and working good. Its nice and slim.I switched from Sprint with an unlimited everything plan with an htc evo 4g and I switched to a shared 4gb plan on verizon with a black iPhone 5 16gb. Off the bat, the verizon plan is cheaper, and the coverage and speed is better and more reliable. The iPhone itself is a wonderful piece of technology. I have never owned an iPhone before, so I cannot comment on it's worth compared to a previous model. However, the processor and RAM is very fast, making transitions between apps and videos/pictures smooth and fast. The screen is amazing to look at, and I like it has a larger size, thus being able to fit another row of apps on the home screens. The speakers sound great, and so do the new headphones included. They are no longer the standard white earbud headphones, the new ones are a different shape and have a more full sound. I have owned an iPod 4th generation previously, and I am glad that they have finally moved the headphones input to the bottom of the phone--finally it matches all other devices I have ever had. Siri is amazing to have. I love the intuitiveness of responding to and answering my commands and questions. One of the cons compared to an android phone is the lack of a quick shortcut to be able to turn off 4G and 3G when out of wifi range. You have to go into settings and then into a couple other areas to turn the 3G, 4G off. However, I have found that if you double-click the home button it will bring up recent apps or the settings panel, and if you press settings, and the last settings you looked at was the toggle for 3G 4G then it will bring you directly to that page. Battery life is competitive compared to other phones I have used. Lastly, consider buying the AppleCare Protection instead of the Verizon monthtly warranty. The AppleCare is only 99$ compared to the Verizon $11/month. The AppleCare lasts two years and the deductible for a replacement phone is around 49$. The only con to the AppleCare is that it does not cover lost/stolen phones. However, with the 'Find my iPhone' app and all the other options of finding or retrieving a lost phone, I do not see it as a major problem when combined with the major savings money-wise compared to the higher cost of the Verizon monthly warranty and their higher deductible.Excelente producto el vendedor tambi&eacute;n es muy responsable la entrega se realizo en el tiempo acordado, lo recomiendo muy confiableRealize mi compra desde venezuela, el producto me llego excelente, sellado de caja y desbloqueado de fabrica, osea todo un exito.el mejor celular del mercado mejor que el s3 segun mi opinion . la faricacion es mas lujosa y es mas rapidoExcelente el tiempo de entrega que esta pautado en el perfil, comprado desde Venezuela. Just as I guessed it, someone was paid to bad mouth the iPhone 5. The issue my iPhone was having was an issue that is addressed at the Apple Store but not at my carrier. Apple told me the iPhone 5 out of the box has all of its functions turned on to be seen and appreciated. However, no one utilizes all these tools at the same time. Take for example cell phone networks: the iPhone comes out of the box searching for 1/2 dozen networks. But since it only needs to find your network, all other searches are a waste of power. So you need to turn them off. This goes for WiFi as well. Out of the box and its hunting for WiFi, Bluetooth, everything. Turn everything you are not using off and your phone will last all day. And that goes for apps and other noticeable tools. Then you can set your screen display brightness, for office, sunlight, etc... The brighter the screen has to be the more power it uses. This goes for any phone.Viene completamente liberado de fabrica lo estoy utilizando con movistar y funciona excelente. My wife and I have excellent cell phone service with Consumer Cellular (CC), a no contract provider. I had bought her a Motorola Bravo from them and they sent a regular size sim card which works perfectly. My wife's Chrysler 300C was starting to require many repairs and she was wanting to replace it with a Jeep. I bought her a 2014 Jeep Grand Cherokee Limited but her Motorola Bravo is not compatible with the Jeep Voice Command System. I decided to go all out and bought her an unlocked iphone 5 which I expected to be compatible with both the Jeep Voice Command System and with our carrier, Consumer Cellular. My only concern was how to get the regular sim card in my wife's Motorola Bravo cell phone down to nano size to fit the Apple. However, I figured that CC would have a solution such as sending a nano sim card and deactivating the Motorola Bravo sim card. As I wrote, I just took it for granted that this allegedly latest and greatest engineering wonder (according to the ads) would be compatible with both the Jeep and CC. So I ordered the outrageously priced unlocked iphone 5. As usual, Amazon quickly processed my order and notified me that the phone had been shipped. I called CC to request a nano sim and was told by two different reps that the iphone 5 is not compatible with their service. I decided that I would keep CC as my server but when the iphone 5 arrived I would take it down to Walmart and sign my wife up for StraightTalk which is also a no contract server and which advertises the iphone 5 in their ads. The phone arrived in a small box, the kind that has a tear-off strip along one edge. There was no packing in the box. One end of the box was open and the cellophane wrapping was torn and disheveled. I had no way of testing the phone to check for internal damage and I had enough drama so I sent it back and bought my wife a Samsung Focus 2 for about one fourth the price of the iphone 5. I called CC and they shipped a micro sim which should arrive in a few days. Obviously CC must believe that this phone is compatible with them but as for the jeep it is anyones guess. This is where my soap opera ends as far as this review is concerned. The moral of the story is that it would behoove anyone who is in the market for a 2014 vehicle with Voice Command features or is considering a new cell phone which would be used with your existing carrier or would be paired with your vehicle to do a thorough amount of research to avoid duplicating my experiences. One final note. My cell phone is a Sony Xperia P which I bought from Amazon. It works perfectly with CC and pairs and connects perfectly with my wife's Jeep. PROS: 
1)	LOOKS: It looks classy..premium construction&hellip;premium looks&hellip;only htc one is any close to this..but den it&rsquo;s a lil bulky in front of the iphone 5. 
2)	SCREEN: Excellent 4 inch screen&hellip;great contrast n brightness..ok its ppi of 326 is less dan htc one/s4/htc butterly&hellip;bt if ur eyes cant differentiate between pixels in 326 ppi den wots da use of 441 ppi(Samsung galaxy s4) or 468 ppi(htc one)&hellip;..extra pixels wud only cause battery drain&hellip;excellent viewing under sun also&hellip;beats s4 and htc one hands down&hellip; 
3)	CAMERA: Its 8mp&hellip;bt its excellent in any kind of situations..under bright light it produces photo wid great detail without any oversaturation of colours&hellip;navigation to camera app from lock screen is very fast&hellip;.in low light condition also it produces some amazing snaps&hellip;s4 is a real bummer in dis aspect&hellip;it matches lumia 920 n htc one on dis aspect&hellip;iphone 4s also has a great camera&hellip;iphone 5 is only an improved version of 4s with better low light photography&hellip;I have downloaded an app called as &ldquo;Kitcam&rdquo; dat helps u increase da shutter speed/exposure time till 1 second&hellip;dis makes u click sm amazing photos in night w/o flash&hellip;in general da shutter speed is also amazing..u click n u hv da pic..Even da back camera(1.3 mp) is great for self portraits n video chatting.. 
4)	VIDEO: Excellent image stabilization produces better video footages as compared wid s4 and htc one&hellip;only lumia 920 produces a lil better video under shaky circumstances 
5)	BATTERY: With 3G on all da tme&hellip;..4 mail accounts synced&hellip;calls..safari web browsing&hellip;whatsapp&hellip;camera&hellip;switching between apps like facebook, flipboard,ndtv, tumblr etc..it gives me a solid 12-15 hrs&hellip;its better dan any android phone.. 
6)	MUSIC: An ipod is always in an iphone&hellip;music quality is decent wid da apple earpods supplied..its bass heavy n a lot better dan its previous iteration&hellip;but if u upgrade ur cans den u can listen to sm serious audio&hellip;I have bose ie2 earphone and Beats Studio headphones n da music quality is full of detail even in da top volume settings..As far as da speaker goes.. its also loud enough wid great detail wen not increased to the max volume(for some songs)&hellip;otherwise its great.. 
7)	APPS: Don&rsquo;t have much to say here&hellip;its known to da world dat da appstore has more n better apps dan any other platform&hellip; 
8)	IOS: The software running under da hood i.e IOS 6.1.4(latest) is excellent without any lags&hellip;u multi task..open any number of apps..it wont lag..i have 105 apps installed wid 30-40 apps open always on an average&hellip; 
9)	ACCESSORIES: One of da biggest advantages of having an iphone is da friendliness with accessories..u have 100s of great accessories available(not everything available in India..but u have eBay) available dat can even enhance n exploit da already gud features of iphone..recently I bought Ollocip dat is a camera enhancer..its has 3 lenses dat can be very easily connected to iphone 5 n help u take excellent pics&hellip;.  
10)	SOFTWARE UPGRADATION: One thing in which android sucks is the software upgradation&hellip;an apple device gets to njoy 4 upgraded versions wid timely updates..iphone 4 was launched in 2010 with ios4&hellip;its been upgraded to ios6..n ios 7 wud be its last upgrade&hellip;whereas android devices don&rsquo;t get more dan 2 upgrades and time is also a big factor&hellip;Sony xperis S(last year&rsquo;s sonys&rsquo; flagship) hasn&rsquo;t received jelly Bean till now&hellip;Nexus devices r an exception though.. 
 
CONS: 
1)	SCREEN SIZE: If big screen size is ur cup of tea den u will hv to look at other platforms viz Andriod, Microsoft ..For me its da adequate size dat can be operated wid single hand.. 
2)	CUSTOMIZATION: If u want to customize ur phone n give it a new look everyday den android would serve ur purpose better&hellip;.apple has everything basic..u can jailbreak though but den also da customization wont be of da same degree as android would provide u&hellip;. 
 
APPLE vs ANDRIOD fight: Apple&rsquo;s software and hardware are made for each other(i.e their software IOS and hardware viz A4/A5/A6 processors is made in house 
) which makes them perform better dan da android counterparts&hellip;android has quad/octa cores but 99% of apps don&rsquo;t require dat kind of processing power&hellip;iphone 3GS has 256 mb of RAM and 600 Mhz single core processor&hellip;but den also it is able to play games such as NFS hot pursuit dat even a 1 Ghz android phone would hv problem playing it&hellip;.so apple must never be compared on pure specs because its an optimized device unlike any android device(except nexus devices)&hellip;&hellip;.

I grew up with Nokia, then moved to the Galaxy bandwagon before finally taking the plunge and bought iPhone 5. It takes a little while to get used to, if you are used to some other platform. There are some common features that are missing, but then its merits overshadow whatever failings that it may have. 
 
The best thing about it is its touch. Its literally featherlike! Rest of the touchphones actually feel like tap devices after you've used this sleek-n-sexy phone! Then its speed! I have been using it for the last 6 months, and I have not noticed anything slowing down despite the numerous apps that I have installed on it. That brings me to its next good thing - Apps! The same apps are indeed much better on iPhone (barring Whatsapp, which is paid too :/) 
I need not say anything about the camera/picture and sound quality of Apple - its been talked about worldover! :-) 
Solid build, feel nice in the hand, it is one phone I don't regret buying at all!

The Design: 
 
The engineers at apple have jolted down the design form more than 6 months to have things fitted to such a slim bezel . 
 
The processor:

And the designers at apple had come up with the best possible dual core beast for the iOS possible. Yes it is not standing with S4 or One in processor. But all should also see that it was launched earlier to these phones and with time technology fades and we should give the benefit of doubt. 
 
Battery: 
 
It is not as good as comparable products with 1440 Mah power, but its just fine and takes you to a days work. Worst thing is that it has different charger and one needs to carry its charger every time as you wont find the lightening connector everywhere. 
 
Screen:

Music:

The camera lags a lot of features that the other products have with less amount. However low light visibility is a bit better.

When the first iPhone came out in 2007, it started off a legacy. Even if you tell someone that you have the latest and greatest Galaxy S4, they aren't going to be so surprised. Show them your iPhone, you get that status of being super-cool. And it's not just that, the iPhone has come a long way from being just a smartphone. it's now an essential part of people's lives. 
 
As far as specifications are concerned, the iPhone packs in a Apple A6 chip ( dual core ) at ~1.3 Ghz and 1GB of RAM. It may not sound like much, but iOS is so advanced that you never notice any lag whatsoever, unlike the Android phones. 
 
The USP of this product is the apps available. Apple has done a great job with the apps.

You've got to experience it to believe it!What makes the iPhone 5 one of the best Smartphones...Processor : Though the A6 is a dual-core processor, its architecture is designed in such a way that the 1.3 GHz processor is actually faster than Samsung Galaxy S3's Quad Core 1.4GHz processor. In fact the A6 is one of the fastest processors on the planet. Head over to www.anandtech.com for more information on this. 
 
Camera : Yes..it is an 8MP camera. But this camera beats many other 13MP smartphone cameras. The reason being the quality of optics used and the quality of the sensor is much more superior than the other smartphones. Besides, the software reduces the noise in the image and so on... 
 
Security : Unlike Android, iOS devices do not get infected by malwares/viruses because every app which is submitted on the App Store is first inspected by Apple. 
 
Apps : The App Store has more than 750,000 quality apps, where the developers have to pay 99$/Year to submit apps to the App Store. This ensures,to a great extent, that the developers make quality apps which do not get rejected on the App Store, instead of making crappy apps which have a high probability of getting rejected. 
 
Hardware/Materials/Design : The lens cover of the iPhone is made by Sapphire Crystal (second-hardest trasparent substance on the planet). The edges have been cut by Diamonds. Do I need to say anything further ?! 
 
iOS : No viruses. No malwares. Regular Yearly updates. Smooth UI. Great new features in the new iOS 7. iTunes. App Store. Great animations for UI Transitions.

Its not about gigantic processors and all. 
its about how you design something to perform and being loved. 
Iphone 5 has a a6 chipsset. 
A6 chipset means processor + gfx processor all are put together in a single chip. 
processor is dual core. but people try to compare it with quad core of androids. 
 
listen guys, its not about cores. but how an operating system uses cores to work efficiently by producing lesser heat and using less power. A6 is designed in such a way that, apple's IOS uses it upto its potential,still producing no heat and providing an awesome battery life. remember, you could design a program with 1000 lines and same program with 50 lines. the program with 50 instructions will run better by consuming lesser resources. thats what IOS is all about. 
it is a closed system. viruses will never infect iphone, reason people trust it more than any other os in market. 
 
camera. 
Iphones 8 MP isight camera still beats any other 13 MP cameras. 
Same reason again, its not about MP's and HD's 
whats the use of a high resolution photo if there is blurr, or colour contrast is low. dont believe me? try usin a DSLR 8mp, and a simple 8 mp camera, you'll know the difference. 
8 MP designed at its best, using almost negligible battery its provides awesome pictures with stable video recording, pictures are taken as soon as u press shutter switch, no lag, nothing. just awesome crispy photos.
